jobs.title: Visual Designer
jobs.content:
CFR Digital is seeking a Visual Designer to assist the Design Director various projects within the digital function of CFR. In this role, the Visual Designer will be collaborating and working alongside product and technology stakeholders to define the user experience across CFR.org.

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

  • Develop the visual design for CFR products such as infographics, data visualizations, interactives, and microsites across a responsive platform
  • Participate in product ideation and conceptual development
  • Maintain and assist in the evolution of the style guide
  • Keep abreast of industry trends and seek ways to apply new principles
  • Facilitate design communication across a multidisciplinary team throughout each phase of a project, including design rationale
  • Deep understanding of interaction design concepts, practices, and procedures
  • Possess a solid working understanding of user-experience design principles
  • Ability to prioritize and manage work, adhering to critical project timelines in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Professional-level knowledge of industry standard Web design software (Adobe CS, Sketch, etc.)
  • Familiarity with print design principles a plus
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS a plus
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in design, photography, or related field

Qualifications

  • Five years of related design experience, working on cross-functional teams
  • Interest in current events and foreign policy a plus

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.

CFR offers a benefits package that is among the best offered by nonprofit institutions today, including generous leave policies and health insurance programs, an award-winning health and wellness initiative including an on-site fitness center, and professional development training.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer Checkout
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT the team and the job


Our Checkout team creates the whole order and payment process in backend and frontend - from logging in to filling a wishlist up to placing orders. The team is „…just awesome“: Process oriented, handling different APIs and stakeholders, highly intercultural. In a concentrated work environment they focus on security in all data transaction processes and always have the goal to create a quick and easy checkout experience for our customers. You like to work in a multi-product-team with a very  close connection to the customer? You want to contribute your ideas and constantly improve the products and your skills through intense code reviews and feedback? Then you are the perfect support for our Check Out team who is searching for a Frontend Developer Check Out (m/f) at the moment. 


:: ABOUT what to expect



  • Development and maintenance of a frontend platform in JavaScript, HTML and CSS(SASS)

  • Applied SCRUM processes that are continuously improved by and for the team

  • Emphasis on client-side rendering and interaction with the server via REST APIs

  • Lots of space for your own ideas and creations, flat hierarchies and very short decision making process

  • A highly motivated and supportive team

  • Active internal knowledge sharing

  • What not to expect is a finished product that just needs a maintainer

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer IT Backbone
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT THE TEAM AND THE JOB


Our Backbone team is our latest project. As our API for all shop data-flows they renew our core IT with the goal to condition incoming and outgoing data-flow and ensure quick and correct data outputs. They are our „data-inspectors“: manage high volume of data, love complexity, detect errors. You want to code mvp-focused with great impact on our core system. You like to contribute your ideas to a new project with lots of challenges? Then you are the perfect support for our Backbone team who is searching for a (Senior) PHP Developer (m/f) at the moment.


:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Development of a brand new backend platform in PHP

  • Agile processes, that are adapted to the team’s and project’s needs

  • A modern and high-performance technical setup

  • Great software architecture with many opportunities to learn and gain knowledge

  • Fast team, flat hierarchies and very short decision making process

  • A highly motivated and experienced team

  • Actively internal knowledge sharing

jobs.title: Director ABOUT YOU Shop Development
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT THE JOB


Our Shop team develops our high traffic fashion shop ABOUT YOU on desktop and tablet. In 2-week-sprints they implement new features with the target to steadily improve our shop. They are our „regatta-sailors“: fast sprints, proficient, mvp-focused, multicultural. You want to code state-of-the-art in an output-driven, structured work environment? You like fast implementation of ideas? Then you are the perfect fit for our Shop team who is searching for a Director ABOUT YOU Shop Development (m/f) at the moment.



:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Responsibility, planning and further development of all technical projects and requirements

  • Management of touching points and cross projects with other technical leads and teams

  • Responsibility and further development of all technical and architectural decisions regarding our shop in coordination with our CTO

  • Controlling of our shop development team

  • Management and prioritizing of relevant stakeholder's requirements

  • Flat hierarchies, lean processes and very short decision making processes

jobs.title: Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT THE TEAM AND THE JOB


Our operations team takes a great responsibility for our high traffic platform. They operate all the different services that are needed for a uninterrupted 24/7 business - even when one of our famous special promotions take place and we have to deal with ten times or even more concurrent users. The team is our “Power-Shipyard”: always keen on new ideas, constantly working on improving our diversified infrastructure. Shipping secure and reliable services to all the other teams, automating the whole harbor, working closely with developers, trying exciting stuff with containers and other ways to ship products are just a few of their responsibilities. You want to contribute your ideas and see how they work at our great project to build an awesome fashion shop? You want to work in a professional and multicultural work environment? Then you are the perfect support for our Ops team who is searching for a Operations Engineer (m/f) at the moment. 


:: ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT



  • Responsibility to maintain, run and continuously improve our highly available and scalable infrastructure

  • Possibility to contribute your ideas and know-how

  • Supporting our Developers with build and deployment processes

  • Supervising and monitoring our software in integration, staging and live environments

  • Working with an ecommerce infrastructure that is completely developed in-house from scratch

jobs.title: Lead Software Architect/Designer Autonomous Driving
jobs.content:
ELECTRONICS GETS THINGS MOVING. AND NOT JUST THE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR INNOVATIVE SYSTEM FUNCTIONS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Lead Software Architect/Designer in Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105078


We are offering an interesting opportunity to work as a Lead Software Architect/Designer (m/f) for Embedded Systems. Your tasks will include leading a team of excellent specialists to develop software solutions and for the design and implementation of highly networked, innovative automotive software functions for driver assistance and autonomous driving. You and your team will design a comprehensive, future-proof software architecture for driving strategy, trajectory planning, the environmental or driver model and the interfaces with the sensor system and actuators. Modern development methods and technologies such as continuous integration, agile, test-driven development or domain-specific languages will play a major role in this. Within the area of autonomous driving, you will work along the entire development chain, from requirements analysis to the writing of algorithms and development of software, through to integration of the software into the control devices, based on AUTOSAR.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer Tooling Autonomous Driving
jobs.content:
ELECTRONICS GETS THINGS MOVING. AND NOT JUST THE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Software Developer of Tooling for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105080


A thrilling range of tasks awaits you as Senior Software Developer of Tooling (m/f) in the futuristic field of autonomous driving. In a team of internal and external partners, your task will be to develop software with state-of-the-art tools for highly interconnected functions, thus forming the basis for the industrialisation of driver assistance and highly automated functions. Your tasks will include requirements analyses and definition for systems, developing appropriate solutions and their testing. You will work on virtual integration environments and open-loop/closed-loop simulations of complete highly automated driver assistance functions. Additionally you will manage implementation of your solutions, including the rollout of function and software development. You will ensure content, schedule and quality targets up to rollout within your projects, and you will represent them in various project meetings. Your exciting range of responsibilities will be rounded off by coordination with function developers, test engineers and suppliers as well as with specification definition.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Senior Architect for Vehicle Wiring System
jobs.content:
GREAT WHEN AN APP RUNS, AWESOME WHEN IT DRIVES.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Architect for Vehicle Wiring System (m/f))
Job reference: 105396


We are offering an interesting position as Senior Architect (m/f) for Vehicle Wiring where you will be responsible for the architecture of highly networked and innovative functions of autonomous driving. Your tasks will include working in an interdisciplinary team to structure interfaces on highly diverse vehicle wiring system topologies (e.g. CAN, Ethernet) across product lines. Use your expertise and comprehensive system understanding of networked functions to create robust and harmonious signal structures and ensure the stability of the electric/electronic vehicle wiring system. You will partition the modules and building blocks onto the individual electric/electronic components, based on a coordinated function network. A central task will be to take both architectural criteria such as runtime, resources and availability and aspects of industrialisation and business management into account and to guide requirements. To achieve optimal results you will work in close cooperation with the vehicle projects, specialist departments, function development, industrialisation and system integration teams. An important task will be to contribute to the quick and high-quality translation of new functions from functional ideas into solutions that can be experienced in the products.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

Job reference: 104417


BMW Car IT in Ulm is developing innovative software for driver assistance systems for the cars of the BMW Group. In an international environment, we are closely cooperating with departments of the BMW Group to design software for electronic control units (ECUs).
As a software developer in our Team you will contribute to the development of the driver assistance functions for the next generation of BMW vehicles. You are going to be responsible for the entire software development process. Defining the architecture and the design of our software components, implementing new functionality, testing the function in simulation environments and on the real vehicle will be your area of responsibility. You are supported by a professional development environment (Continuous Integration, automated testing environment …) and a great team.
If you are thinking beyond borders and if you share our passion for developing the next generation of driver assistance systems, then we look forward to having you on board to shape our vision for the individual mobility of the future.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

Your key tasks will comprise root cause analysis for system problems found in R&D phase testing, software performance optimization and software trace data analysis. Review changes in code and the environment to determine impacts on system performance and reliability will be an essential part of your job. As debugging specialist (m/f) you are responsible for software analysis tool development and will be very close with system architects, software developers and test engineers.

Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. Continuous Integration Engineer (m/f)
Job reference: 100994


BMW Car IT in Ulm is developing innovative software for driver assistance systems for the cars of the BMW Group. In an international environment, we are closely cooperating with departments of the BMW Group to design software for electronic control units (ECUs). You are responsible for the further development and conceptual design of a continuous software integration (CI) system. Together with the CI project team, you are adapting the CI system to meet the changing requirements of the Driver Assistance software team. You are collecting, prioritizing and discussing the requirements together with the users of the system and coordinate and implement these requirements with the development team and the CI project team. Furthermore, your area of responsibility includes the planning and design of new quality measures, as well as the analysis of CI system related error reports, the training of users and the communication between the CI project team and the development team.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Innovative Software Technology Developer
jobs.content:
NEW SOLUTIONS EMERGE WHEN THINKING ISN’T HARD-WIRED.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Innovative Software Technology Developer (m/f)
Job reference: 102901


BMW Car IT GmbH Munich are seeking a software engineer (m/f) to develop innovative solutions for future BMW Group automobiles. In this role, you will handle issues related to embedded systems, architecture, distributed systems, middleware, service-oriented systems, infrastructure for intelligent mobility and human-machine interaction. Using modern software engineering methods and technologies for conception, specification and development of forward-looking and also unconventional solutions is an essential part of your role. You will work in a team to create prototypes that can be realized in production development to demonstrate the sustainability of the solutions, and also work closely with other BMW departments.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

Software Test Engineer (m/f)
Job-reference: 107201


We are offering you an interesting position as a Software Test Engineer (m/f) in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. You will work together with your scrum team to understand the features and their technical implications. You will identify use cases and create automated test cases on different levels (module, subsystem, system) with focus on system integration testing. Your work will take you through test planning, designing and developing test cases and test automation frameworks like xUnit and GoogleTest. Furthermore you will be responsible for making automated tests run. You will also analyze test failure causes and support development teams debugging the problems. In your role as a Software Test Engineer (m/f) you will support development teams in designing their software components for testability. Additionally you will work together with those development teams in creating tests, providing mocks and failure analysis tools which requires both your technical as well as communicational skills. Special attention is given to test automation, where you are responsible for test design, test execution, analysis of test results, defect analysis and reporting. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the continuous improvement and optimization of test tools and processes.

jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. Senior Architect for Functional Safety (m/f)
Job reference: 105398


The BMW Group is taking the lead in highly automated and fully automated driving.


We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Architect (m/f) for Functional Safety (FuSi) in the area of autonomous driving. Your activities will range from the design of interdepartmental safety concepts to FuSi-compliant partitioning of the electric/electronic (E/E) architecture and validation concepts across process chains.In close collaboration with specialist departments, you will develop future-oriented E/E architecture concepts for fulfilling Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL) requirements for functions that constitute the cutting edge of autonomous driving at the BMW Group. Your tasks will include the analysis of the optimum ASIL utilisation of available hardware platforms and strategically orientating future integration platforms for quick integration of automated driving functions. A further responsibility will be to assess technical safety concepts of suppliers together with the internal FuSi specialist departments. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the coordination and implementation of FuSi-relevant aspects in terms of deadlines and maturity levels, the monitoring of project progress and reporting on project status.

As a specialist, you will lead the environmental model feature teams to develop new, innovative algorithms, architectures and validation methodologies to meet new requirements for autonomous driving. You will design and implement comprehensive functional concepts from situation interpretation to multi-sensor data fusion, to sensor systems. Additionally, you will ensure scalability across various vehicle derivatives and various equipment variants. An example of your responsibilities is prototype development across all environmental model development teams for assessing and testing new technologies and algorithms. In the tackling of issues, you will ensure close collaboration with BMW Research and initiate and support cooperation ventures with external partners, such as universities and research institutes.  A broad array of modern mathematical methods and stochastic procedures in the area of multi-sensor data fusion and classification will form your basis for design. Finally, you will systematically develop your detailed understanding of software development methods and technologies, such as continuous integration, agile development and test-driven development.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
*This position is located in Baltimore, MD.  


Medical device has become one of the fastest growing industries... but obtaining patient care is becoming a prolonged or inconvenient process. Philips has increased the investment to bring in new minds with outside ideas which has in turn opened a position. You will be able to drive initiatives for the TeleHeath applications by building expansive web based services that allow people to experience technology as a medical provisionary tool.


The heart of a TeleHealth engineer allow you to work from end to end;  bring your experience and strengthen the development team of what has been coined a line of "forward thinking products". You would be building out applications starting with the Clinical UI utilizing (or learning) AngularJS and working back into the SQL database with C#  or Java. 


You will be openly impacting patients who need to take advantage of TeleHealth technology. The results you produce supplement the existing development knowledge, you will help guide the improvement of the “Hospital to Home” programs.  We would be highly interested in your thoughts, if not your interest in joining the Philips Healthcare team to learn more about the Fullstack SWE positon


An Engineer's painted perspective of TeleHealth at Philips:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVAPS0Fi12E

jobs.title: (Senior) JavaScript Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for a (Senior) JavaScript Developer to currently maintain and later on rebuild the current FRIDA user interface. As a JavaScript Developer at Risk.Ident, you will be responsible for maintaining and extending existing products, and developing the UI technology for new products. The ideal candidate would be a highly motivated self starter with a passion for current and up-coming browser technologies, fluent in CSS and JavaScript and at least one MV* framework for building Single Page Applications (SPA). Additionally, he or she would have a good eye for design and an understanding of „Information Architecture“, being able to apply his or her knowledge to making UX improvements and suggestions.

jobs.title: (Senior) Scala Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for well experienced Scala Developers to support our Development Teams. All three of these cross-functional and international teams have many interesting challenges waiting for you: One team is developing a large scale cloud service for fraud prevention, building distributed responsive and resilient solutions which evaluate transactions in real-time. The second team is building on-premise solutions for business customers, ingesting wide varieties of data for automatic classification of events, as well as providing a presentation layer for manual review/classification. The third team is developing a scalable platform for real-time data processing, analysis and prediction, turning insights and models supplied by our Data Science Team into the production code that forms the backbone of our fraud prevention solutions.


Your Tasks:



  • Development and maintenance of our main software components

  • Continuous refactoring of our codebase

  • Bringing in your ideas of how to improve our software by new technologies

  • Code reviews of your fellow developers

  • Supporting the release and deployment process

  • Working together with our Data Science Team to develop and integrate new approaches for fraud detection

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
DIAKRIT has always been driven by the desire to revolutionize the way people conduct real estate business - to make the online search easier, more secure and more engaging.


We help people see the potential of their future living space with 3D functions and premium rich media that enables them to plan, furnish and decorate the home of their dreams. Our success has grown from a true entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly strive to challenge industry norms and surpass our customers’ expectations.


Our employees are our greatest assets. Their individual skills, tech-savviness, strong work ethic and service-mindedness are the main driving forces behind our long-lasting customer relationships with several of the biggest real estate players globally. We will continue to revolutionize the real estate market with innovative products and software by utilizing emerging technologies and platforms. Because we see the future and we believe in it – and we are fully convinced that the future looks even better than anyone can imagine.


DIAKRIT currently has customers in the United States, Canada, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Germany, Spain, Thailand, the Philippines, Malaysia, Hong Kong, and Australia, has over 450 employees globally and more than 250 freelance photographers throughout Scandinavia.


We need to strengthen our Development Team in Bangkok, Thailand and are now looking for a Front-end Developer to be part of our team to further develop our web products and systems.
The work tasks include development of existing products as well as managing your own development projects. You will also act as a 2nd line support for all front-end related issues in our Service Desk and you will report to our IT Manager & System Dev. Manager.


To fit into this role, you need to have a genuine interest and experience in working with front-end development. You enjoy working as a part of a team in an international environment and get challenged by developing the impossible. You are used to work toward tight deadlines, can manage several projects in different phases simultaneously.


You have a logical mindset and you see possibilities and solutions where other see problems. You are used to take own initiatives and work to improve things all the times. You will be part of a team of 10 employees as well as part of the entire IT/R&D department of approximately 20 staff.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
CATENA MEDIA IS AN ONLINE MARKETING COMPANY DRIVING THE WAY FORWARD, FOR LEAD GENERATION. WE DO THIS BY CREATING HIGH TRAFFIC WEBSITES, THAT HELP BUILD HIGH-VALUE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OUR CUSTOMERS AND PARTNERS. OUR CLIENTS, SEEK OUT OUR METHODS TO ENHANCE THEIR ONLINE PRESENCE AND GAIN EXPOSURE. TO HELP US DO THIS, WE ARE SEEKING AN EXPERIENCED FULL STACK DEVELOPER TO JOIN OUR AWESOME TEAM!



SCOPE OF THE JOB: 


As a Full Stack Developer, your responsibility is to, from User stories created by Product owners, create business value through developing software that fulfils those stories. Catena development teams are highly agile, self organising and  self sufficient and excel at understanding how to solve business problems through clever implementations of code. Being a excellent developer is more important than having experience with all technologies listed



YOUR CHALLENGE:


Your day to day work will center around work in the team you belong to everyone in the team is expected to drive together to reach the sprint goals and deliver high quality features. Typical things developer in the team does are:



  • Understand business requirements and convert them to a solution design

  • Code the design together with other developers from the team

  • Do code reviews

  • Work with QA’s to verify functionality

  • Fix bugs and retest

  • Write tests and documentation

  • Deploy your code to live environments

jobs.title: Senior Cloud Engineer - enabling AWS for global academic research platforms
jobs.content:
Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation and technology is simultaneously at the forefront and the driving force.  Our innovative technology platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe.


Based from the AlphaBeta Building the role will take responsibility for supporting the Elsevier portfolio and at time will provide direct support to ScienceDirect which is the world's leading collection of science information on the web and Elsevier's flagship product.  


The technology transformation that is taking place across Elsevier is being delivered by newly formed agile teams across the globe.  The Senior Cloud Engineer will be part of the Central Infrastructure Operations team who extensively use AWS, Puppet and Ansible to provide development operations support to the Elsevier products and platforms (ScienceDirect, Mendeley, Scopus to name a few).  The role will be part of and support new and fast-growing cross-functional development groups from the early stages with a remit to help shape the technology platforms which the development team utilise.


The role


We are seeking a talented and self-motivated Senior Cloud Engineer who will assist in the design of a functional and maintainable network who will help build AWS production and development environments and keep systems working at an optimal level within the larger global infrastructure of Elsevier.  You will be joining a new and fast-growing agile team in our Central London offices to help deliver high volume, high availability and high performance web sites.  This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in changing the way that web products are delivered within the company, devising and implementing a modern approach to software engineering that enables continuous delivery and releases features on-demand.


The role holder will have excellent stakeholder management skills as you’ll be part of the Central Infrastructure team whilst supporting cross-functional product development groups who use agile management and engineering practices.


Key Tasks



  • Build and maintain the right cloud infrastructure architecture, balancing performance and resilience with cost.

  • Work on projects as wide ranging as:

    • Migration of infrastructure to AWS from on premise servers

    • Building and maintaining a monitoring estate

    • Building and maintaining a set of tools that enable developers to self-serve for most operational tasks

    • Defining, and maintaining a configuration management system

    • Managing a CI/CD pipeline

    • Building and maintaining an auditing and reporting estate that provides all relevant information on current and historic working state of infrastructure.

    • Helping build out process and define structure round a new and growing team that will change as it grows



  • Monitoring live services and responding quickly and effectively to any problems

  • Managing Core services such as JIRA, GIT, Jenkins, etc.

  • Ability to deliver TIO strategy in partnership with the business platforms needs

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer - build a next generation Open Science plaform
jobs.content:
Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation. Technology is simultaneously at the forefront and the driving force. Our innovative platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster and more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe. 


Our goal is to organize knowledge sharing amongst researchers in order to speed up discoveries through better access to Scientific Content and Research. We’re enabling researchers to share their experimental data in real-time and in a secure manner and so promoting collaboration between scientists globally.


This innovative service is based on a new acquisition to the Elsevier portfolio in Hivebench the powerful Laboratory Assistant within a cloud computing platform which ensures protection, ownership and controlled distribution of results.   Our ambition is to become a major player in the “Open Science” (Open Source for Science) and to provide tools with very high added value for our customers.


About us:



  • We are committed to building cohesive teams where communication, support and innovation thrive. Instead of taking a top-down approach to new ideas, all members of the team are empowered to contribute. Great ideas can come from anywhere!

  • We’re a truly global company. We are expanding our capabilities and offer a stimulating environment, enabling bright, passionate people to do their best work.

  • You will be working in a modern and spacious new building, constructed with the sole purpose of encouraging creativity and collaboration.

  • Computer Science degree

  • Extensive experience developing with Javascript

  • Experience building dynamic web-apps

  • Demonstrable experience designing and developing web applications including experience using Full Stack JavaScript

  • Experience working with both backend (Node.JS, Express.JS, MongoDB, etc.) and frontend (Angular.JS, Ember.JS, React.JS, etc.) or Meteor.JS

  • Broad industry knowledge - comfortable with concepts like REST, Behavior Driven Development (BDD) and tools like Heroku, and Amazon Web Services

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, especially the ability to explain complex technical subjects to a non-technical audience

  • Demonstrable experience to provide direction and leadership for a team of engineers

  • Preference to have experience with in-house app deployment (Docker, vagrant, virtual machine environment...)

  • Be an active contributor to Open Source projects on GitHub and/or Stackoverflow


About you:


You’re an expert and passionate about what you do!  You’ll use your extraordinary attention to detail to drive your projects to succeed at the highest level of quality and always look at improving your knowledge.  Things move quickly so you’ll be able to work under pressure and be comfortable with a fast-paced technical environment with changing priorities. You can deliver on short term objectives in an agile environment (Scrumban) without forgetting the bigger longer term goal.   


You will be joining a new Agile team in London where you will support the growth and development of a small and dedicated team and there is the potential in time for this role to take on lead responsibilities for this group to enable the evolution of Hivebench within the Elsevier portfolio.

jobs.title: Cloud / DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a talented and self-motivated Infrastructure Developer/Ops Engineer.  You will be joining a fast-growing agile team in Central London to help design and build global infrastructure for a high volume, highly available and high performance web application.  This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in defining the way that web products are delivered within the company, devising; implementing; and optimising a modern approach to software engineering that enables continuous delivery and releasing features on-demand.  As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be as comfortable with strategic thinking as you are with rolling up your sleeves and scripting cloud infrastructure configuration or developing infrastructure in code.


Key Tasks



  • Establish the right infrastructure architecture, balancing performance and resilience with cost

  • Advocate a devops approach to product development and demonstrate best practice by example

  • Automate provisioning, deployment, configuration management, monitoring and all other infrastructure and ops activities

  • Set up, configure and monitor all environments including production using cloud computing platforms and local resources

  • Help to grow the London teams by recruiting additional Infrastructure Developer/Ops engineers and supporting development hiring processes

  • Monitor live services and respond quickly and effectively to any problems

  • Establish disaster recovery, service outage, and risk mitigation processes for the production environments

jobs.title: Software Developers and Engineers
jobs.content:
Are you a software developer or engineer looking for an exciting opportunity?

Working at EMBL-EBI allows you to explore new ideas and technologies, and to put your energy into solving important problems. You will work collaboratively with scientists and engineers to find solutions for healthcare, agriculture and the environment by maximising the value of life-science research data.

Based on the Wellcome Genome Campus in the Cambridge biotech cluster, we offer outstanding technical infrastructure and a supportive, family-friendly working environment. We are a medium-sized organisation of small collegial teams working together in a vibrant, international environment. The campus offers a free commuter bus service, on-site nursery, and subsidised gym and restaurants.

Our staff are very diverse, from patient, detail-oriented coders to experimental early adopters, and work at the interface of biology and computer science. One quality they all share is a natural ability to collaborate and bring out the best in one another.

What are we looking for?

Have you worked in software development, software design, database design and automation? Have you processed large datasets in a production environment? We look at experience first. Most of our technology jobs also require a bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or another relevant field, or equivalent experience.

Skills in demand include:

  • Programming languages: compiled language (Java/C/C++/C#) and/or scripting language (Perl/Python/Ruby);
  • API design (programmatic and HTTP/RPC based);
  • Databases: RDBMS (Oracle/MySQL/PostgreSQL) or NoSQL (MongoDB/ElasticSearch/Neo4j/Virtuoso/Solr); writing queries (SQL or domain-specific languages) and designing new schemas;
  • Unix/Linux command line, shell scripting and common command-line tools;
  • Development tools: Git, issue tracking software;JavaScript/Html/CSS/NodeJS.

You will need to be familiar with best practices in software design, and 'traditional' compute-farm processing (LSF/SGE) or next-generation processing frameworks (Hadoop/Luigi) will be an advantage.

Good communication is crucial to the success of our projects, so you need to be able to maintain good working relationships and build new ones. The ability to work independently, efficiently and within defined deadlines is expected, but what we are really looking for is commitment to delivering high-quality public services for the advancement of science.

What can I expect?

EMBL-EBI offers a highly competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous holiday allowance, comprehensive health insurance and pension, educational and other family-related benefits where applicable, as well as financial support for relocation. For more information about pay and benefits click here.

Applications are welcome from all nationalities - visa information will be discussed in more depth with applicants selected for interview.

Interviews will take place at EMBL-EBI during the week beginning 28 November 2016. Find out more about application and selection.

Applications will close on 30 October 2016.

jobs.title: Unix Systems Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking to recruit an enthusiastic, highly motivated software engineer to work at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will be working in the Software Infrastructure Services team maintaining and improving in-house software systems. Work will include:



  • Maintenance and development of our existing user account management system

  • Maintenance and development of a petabyte-scale file archiving solution

  • Development of new systems infrastructure software tools as required.


Software Infrastructure Services is part of the Systems Infrastructure team, whose responsibilities include HPC, storage, datacentre infrastructure and networking. You will work alongside systems administrators and software engineers providing services to internal and external users.

jobs.title: Backend Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a talented python software engineer to join the the Open Targets Core team. You will be involved in running large-scale biological data analysis and integration and developing the REST API powering the targetvalidation.org platform.

The main responsibilities will involve design and implementation of backend micro-services and data processing pipelines in Python on Unix-based systems, and maintenance of those services in a cloud environment.



In addition the post will involve extensive interaction with web developers and UX team to refine and test the interface to the services.

You will join a startup-like environment, where we use a range of modern technologies and we continuously look for improvement. We work following Agile practices and you are encouraged to take ownership of what you work on.

The Centre for Therapeutic Target Validation (CTTV) is a recently established public-private initiative between EMBL-EBI, GlaxoSmithKline and the Sanger Institute, to generate and integrate evidence on the validity of biological targets for drug development. The core CTTV operations are based at the EMBL-EBI.

jobs.title: Clojurian
jobs.content:
What’s the deal?


Web software creation! As a member of our engineering team, you can get involved in brainstorming, architecture, development, testing, integration, delivery, operations, and project leadership. What you end up doing depends as much on you as on us. We want you to be free to develop your skills precisely where your passions lie.


What are our methods, languages, technologies, etc?


You’re not going to find a lot of dogma at DEEP IMPACT: we use agile and waterfall concepts as needed – no project is the same. We write in statically and dynamically typed as well as compiled and interpreted languages. We run quite a few databases (SQL or No), and don’t limit ourselves to a single framework. We do however strike a balance between the introduction rate of new tech vs. the need to maintain a stable and productive ecosystem. Here’s a couple of keywords to give you an idea of what we currently use: VanillaJS, AngularJS, React / Flux(Alt), SCSS, Less, Apache, nginx, PHP, Java, Play Framework, Jetty, Clojure, Yada, Ring, SQL, Cassandra, MongoDB, TitanDB, Datomic, DynamoDB, Docker, AWS, CircleCI, Github, CQRS, DDD, Design Sprint.

jobs.title: UX Fanatic
jobs.content:
What’s the deal? Web software creation! We are currently looking for a User Interface and Interaction Designer to go totally caremad over how beautiful, simple and fun applications can be made to work with.


What you'll do:



  • Make your mark as a designer by creating intuitive workflows and simple but highly recognisable user interfaces for our projects as well as our products.

  • Constantly share your expertise and learn from other designers. Help grow the entire team!

  • Collaborate with developers, other designers and project/product managers to build inspiring user interfaces. Be a crucial contributor, from the design stage right up to the finishing release touches of a UI.

jobs.title: DevOps / Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
What’s the deal?


Web software creation! We are currently looking for a highly talented engineer who will play a foundational role in building the next generation of infrastructure automation at our rapidly growing company.


What are our methods, languages, tools, etc?


You’re not going to find a lot of dogma at DEEP IMPACT: we use agile and waterfall as needed – no project is the same. We write in statically and dynamically typed as well as compiled and interpreted languages. We run quite a few databases (SQL or No), and don’t limit ourselves to a single framework. We operate classic LAMP VPS instances as well as every AWS Service we can put our hands on. We do however strike a balance between the introduction rate of new tech vs. the need to maintain a stable and productive ecosystem. Here’s a couple of keywords to give you an idea of what we currently enjoy: JavaScript, Node.js, nginx, PHP, Java, Jetty, Clojure, Yada, MySQL, Cassandra, MongoDB, TitanDB, Datomic, DynamoDB, Docker, OpsWorks, Opscode Chef, Ubuntu Linux, bash, zsh, CQRS, DDD, Design Sprint. Two cloud topics we are currently looking at are AWS Kinesis and AWS Lambda.

jobs.title: Software Engineer C++ / JS
jobs.content:
At Tanker, we do security in a user-friendly way.


We’re looking for simple solutions to solve complex issues others have given up on.  


You will work with our CTO and R&D director and be part of a talented team of 10+ passionate developers, all experts in software engineering, cryptography and security.


You will be in charge of the conception, proof-of-concept and development of new features for our core product. We have a modern software stack using a mix of C++14, ES6, Boost, Qt, React, CMake, webpack.


You will:



  • brainstorm with the Product and Tech teams to solve complex issues

  • work on developing core features of the product

  • mentor other engineers and review code

  • have a direct and real-world impact on the product

  • enjoy a fast-moving and dynamic environment with a bunch of very passionate geeks

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are
With millions of regular users and more than 9,000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. Now, we’re about to embark on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages.


How we work


The engineering department is organized in full-stack feature teams. That means that the teams do everything from concept, UX/UI to analytics and DB, and of course Backend development. e create our product in an agile manner and we are continuously trying to identify problems and to optimize our agile engineering and management practices.
Our flexible cloud-based backend infrastructure consists of multiple high-performance Ruby on Rails and Sinatra services serving more than 80.000 requests per minute to users worldwide via different clients (Android, iOS, Web).


Who are we looking for


You are a passionate Full-Stack Software Engineer with deep and t-shaped technological know-how who loves to develop great products. You have an eye for details, and believe in quality is a must. You enjoy working in a fast-moving and diverse company and strive to make your environment one where everyone shares the goal of delivering outstanding product increments to customers – as quickly as possible.


Responsibilities for the role:



  • Code hands-on yourself to deliver high quality solutions

  • Work in a cross-functional Scrum team and build the next generation of language learning app

  • Deliver shippable and quality assured features in two week sprint cycles

  • Takeover code ownership and operational responsibility

  • Collaborate with other disciplines, in and across teams, to ensure a seamless user experience and an efficient overall architecture

  • Ensure innovative technical design and architecture with a strong focus on long-term stability and maintainability of the code base

  • Focus on innovative technical design and architecture for long-term stability and maintainability

  • Ensure code quality and actively participate in code reviews

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Front-end Engineer (full-time) for our Internal Tools Team to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms.


How we work


Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. Due to the growth our multi-team environment is scaling fast while we are adopting agile values, management and engineering practices.


We are looking for


A passionate Front-end Engineer who is very well versed with modern Javascript development paradigms, including familiarity with modern frameworks like Angular and React/Redux, and experience with writing tests for their code.



What you will be doing



  • Building & maintaining software modules & services

  • Working in close collaboration with designers, UX specialists and our internal customers

  • Ensuring that our existing and future content is syntactically correct

  • Writing different types of tests (unit, service, UI, performance)

  • Setting up complex development, test and production environments

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
For our Marketing Tech team we are looking for a Senior Front-end Software Engineer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. We're on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages. Our diverse team is at the forefront of the user journey, supporting the marketing department to promote our product. Using innovative marketing technologies, iterative development methods, and empirical data, we work to continuously optimise our product and processes.


How we work


Our team is organized in full-stack features teams. That means that our teams do everything from concept, UX/UI to analytics and DB, and of course web development. We create our product in an agile manner, and have dynamic and a fast growing team. We are continuously trying to identify problems and optimizing our agile engineering and management practices.


Whom we looking for


You are a passionate Front-end developer with deep technological know how that loves to develop great products. You have an eye for details, and think that quality is a must. You enjoy working in a fast moving and diverse company. You strive to make your environment one where everyone shares the goal of delivering outstanding product increments to our customers, as quickly as possible.


Responsibilities for the role:

jobs.title: Senior Polyglot Software Engineer(Ruby/JavaScript)
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Polyglot Software Engineer(Ruby/JavaScript) (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are


With millions of regular users and more than 9,000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. Now, we’re about to embark on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages.


How we work


You’ll be working in a small team that is focused on building new products and offerings for our learners. This involves creating both quick prototypes to assess ideas as well as building new products from scratch and supporting their growth throughout their lifecycle.


Who are we looking for


You are a passionate Senior Full-Stack (Polyglot) Software Engineer with a broad technology expertise who loves to develop great products. You are a generalist who knows what architecture, language or framework is the right one to use.  You have an eye for details and enjoy working in a fast-moving and diverse company. You make your environment one where everyone shares the goal of delivering outstanding product increments to customers – as quickly as possible.


Responsibilities for the role:



  • Build prototypes as well as bring them to production

  • Takeover code ownership and operational responsibility

  • Collaborate with other disciplines, in and across teams, to ensure a seamless user experience


Requirements:



  • Gets things done

  • 3+ years experience building web applications with Ruby

  • Good understanding of Javascript as a language and best practices

  • Experience in at least one Frontend and one Backend technology/framework

  • Good knowledge in both SQL and NoSQL databases, data modeling, data representation and API design

  • Experience in implementing user interfaces working across device capabilities & screen sizes

  • Experience with product development in an agile environment from concept to maintenance

  • Plus: Experience with Ruby web frameworks (Ruby on Rails or Sinatra)

  • Plus: Experience with Python, Erlang or Go

  • Plus: Experience with AWS services (Dynamodb, API Gateway, Lambda, IAM, Opsworks, …)

  • Plus: DevOps and automatization knowledge, e.g. Chef, Puppet, Vagrant or Docker

  • Plus: Eye for design and usability details


Benefits:



  • Be an essential part of building an exciting product and take important architectural and technological decisions

  • The potential to change how millions of users worldwide learn languages

  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth

  • A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities

  • Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags

  • A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours

  • Long-term prospects

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene

  • Great company benefits (high-end company bike, free fresh fruits & drinks, etc.)

jobs.title: Software Engineer - New Tech

As leaders in retail gaming with over 130 clubs nationwide, we're continually innovating and using the latest technology to stay ahead of the competition.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Apply on the Bucks website

The Full-time Front End Web Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the front ends of various web presences. He or she should be well versed in the web front-end suite of tools and languages (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript), with particular strength in the area of JavaScript front-end frameworks. Bucks County Community College offers an exceptional benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, prescription, 403B retirement plan, life insurance, short & long-term disability, generous paid time off, tuition waivers, tuition assistance, summer hours, wellness center, full service cafeteria and free parking on a beautiful Bucks County campus.
