  • Ability to code fluently using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Apply on the Bucks website

jobs.title: API Solutions Engineer
jobs.content:
At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary

Red Hat is looking for an API Solutions Engineer to help us ensure the success of our customers as they deploy their APIs with the help of the 3scale platform. In this role, you will proactively guide implementation projects covering a wide variety of API architectures for high-profile launches and operate on many levels, including high level architecture conceptualization, coding implementation, project management, training, and product support. The work location for this position is flexible; Red Hat has offices across the United States, and well-qualified, home-based engineers will also be considered.

Primary job responsibilities

  • Be the expert on how to apply 3scale’s product to enable customers to open, secure, distribute, and monetize their APIs
  • Understand customer pain points and requirements, then design, recommend, and implement solutions
  • Communicate effectively with a diverse customer audience, including CTOs, developers, designers, project managers, and documentation specialists
  • Create solutions based on a wide variety of building blocks, like 3scale’s REST API, Nginx reverse proxy running on AWS with a custom config file, migrations scripts written in Ruby, dynamic developer portals using Liquid markup, CSS styles, JQuery, etc.
  • Help build a strong community of passionate customers
  • Deliver reactive technical support
  • Contribute to the knowledge base of technical support resources

Required skills

  • 3+ years of experience in a software engineering or similar role
  • Deep understanding of web and API architecture
  • Conversant in common internet technologies and protocols like HTTP, SSL, OAuth, REST, JSON, XML, etc.
  • Experience in application coding, use of APIs, web services, and associated tools
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or technology-related discipline
  • 2+ years of experience in a customer support or implementation consultant role is a plus
  • Experience deploying, troubleshooting, and running applications on Amazon AWS infrastructure is preferred
  • Understanding of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), multi-tenant solutions as compared to on-premise software is desirable
  • Practical experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is preferred
  • Familiarity with NGINX, Varnish for caching and as reverse proxies is a plus

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Technical Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary

The Red Hat Storage product team is seeking a Technical Marketing Manager to join us. In this role, you will focus on Red Hat Ceph and Gluster software defined storage (SDS) technologies, and how they are optimally deployed on bare metal, Red Hat OpenStack Platform, OpenShift, container, and public cloud platforms to support popular workloads. You’ll be a member of the Storage Solutions Architecture team, continuously marketing and teaching the marketplace how to obtain optimal value from Ceph and Gluster solution architectures. You’ll also be a virtual member of the Storage Product Marketing team, serving as a key technical subject matter expert with various content authoring, editing, speaking, and blogging responsibilities. You will need basic hands-on technical skills with Linux, Ceph, and Gluster.

Primary job responsibilities

  • Create technical content to convey solution value to data center architect audiences worldwide
  • Promote and teach solution value through blogs, webinars, and conference talks
  • Provide content editing and technical advice to Storage Product Marketing team
  • Design and jointly build Ceph and Gluster on-demand test drives, giving the world’s architects and cloud administrators their first successful hands-on experience building SDS clusters

Required skills

  • Solution architecture skills, including 2+ years experience architecting Linux-based solutions in data center environments
  • Technical authoring skills with published examples of technical market content for data center audiences
  • Storage skills, including 2+ years technical experience working with storage solutions (preferably distributed storage)
  • Linux skills; Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) or equivalent hands-on Linux experience (system admin skills a plus)
  • Technical architecture skills with experience combining distributed software, servers, and network elements into well functioning solution architectures
  • Technical marketing content creation skills, including experience authoring technical market content for technical audiences in the general data center marketplace
  • Technical communication skills and experience presenting technical sessions at industry conferences and online forums
  • Teamwork skills; 10+ years of experience working on a technical team
  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or equivalent experience
  • Passion for open source and community-based development models

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Demand Generation Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary

Red Hat is seeking a Demand Generation Marketing Manager to join us. In this role, you will help to ensure Red Hat Mobile’s demand generation go-to-market strategy is well defined and executed. You’ll work closely with the Field Sales and Marketing teams globally, including marketing operations, product marketing, and other teams, to guide accountable increases in revenue. This role requires a unique blend of technical, creative, analytic, and project management expertise, as well as extensive interaction with the Sales team.

Primary job responsibilities

  • Work closely with the Director, Red Hat Mobile Marketing, regional demand center managers, and field marketing teams to develop online and offline lead generation strategies that meet or exceed sales and revenue targets
  • Assist in the management and reporting of on and off line demand generation activities including campaign metrics; measure and monitor sales funnel activity to ensure predictable pipeline building
  • Use existing systems within focused demand generation programs (Salesforce.com and Eloqua)
  • Work with the globally-based Lead Nurture and and Lead Management teams to design tests and execute progressive nurturing campaigns supported by Eloqua to ensure prospects move through the sales funnel
  • Help to manage third party data vendors who are assisting us in building our marketing contact database across all regions
  • Work with internal (content development and product management) and external resources to ensure the delivery and distribution of compelling content that meets the needs of our target audience
  • Ensure flawless execution of prospect, customer, and Red Hat Mobile-sponsored industry events
  • Help to manage the integrity of the Red Hat Mobile marketing contact databases
  • Assist in the development and execution of joint partner marketing activity across EMEA

Required skills

  • Multiple years of experience guiding multichannel B2B lead generation and nurturing programs targeted at large complex enterprises at high velocity
  • Experience guiding the design and development of inspiring brand awareness and content syndication programs that educate, build awareness, and drive conversions
  • Experience managing SEO/SEM programs, video advertising, geo-targeted, and social media advertising
  • Hands-on experience with marketing and sales intelligence and automation tools, such as Eloqua, RainKing, or Salesforce.com
  • Passion for making data-driven decisions and ensuring broad awareness of critical web and lead metrics that make a difference to revenue
  • Understanding of our target market and product messaging
  • Exceptional organizational and multitasking abilities
  • Ability to remain energetic and positive in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
At GE Digital, we are creating technology and solutions to enable social, mobile, and analytical and cloud capabilities for the Industrial Internet. The Industrial Internet is an open, global network that connects people, data and machines. It’s about making infrastructure more intelligent and advancing the industries critical to the world we live in. At GE, we believe it’s about the future of industry—energy, healthcare, transportation, manufacturing. It’s about making the world work better. GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Role Summary/Purpose:

Works on multiple projects as a project leader or internal consultant. Works on highly complex projects that require in-depth domain knowledge or two or more specialized architecture areas.

Essential Responsibilities:

In this role you will:

  • Lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction across the product portfolio or product line.
  • Analyze design and develop a roadmap and implementation plan based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint.
  • Review and/or analyze and develop architectural requirements at domain level within product portfolio or team.
  • Participate in the EA domain governance model.
  • Contribute to the development of software and data delivery platforms that are service-oriented with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods for different businesses.
  • Lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support actives.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • A minimum of 12 years of technical experience along with established leadership credentials across disciplines and functions within a product OR Master’s degree with 8 years of experience OR PhD with 5 years of experience.Eligibility Requirements:
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen
  • Must be willing to travel roughly 15% of the time
  • Can work out of a remote location

Desired Characteristics:

  • Use Dockers for containers. Expertise in using containers in app build and deployment
  • Experience with automating continuous deployment solutions and working in conjunction with CI tools such as Teamcity and Jenkins.
  • Familiarity with Vagrant, Mesos, Kubernetes, PaaS, Cloud infrastructure (preferred AWS)
  • Familiarity with Log Management solutions (ELK, Splunk, Sumologic, etc)
  • Working knowledge of build systems like Ant, Gradle and Maven.
  • Experience coding software using object-oriented techniques (in order of preference, Java, .Net, C++, Python, other)
  • Hands-on coding/scripting experience with bash, Groovy, python or similar
  • Exposure to leading projects with track record of successful delivery
  • 4 to 6 years of related DevOps experience. Experience with Configuration Automation tools (Ansbile, Chef, Puppet, etc)
  • Experience working in Kanban or Scrum
  • Participates in domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction aligning with business goals.
  • Gathers and analyzes data and develops architectural requirements at project level, aligning architectural requirements with software development strategy.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of business’ structure (P&Ls) and the interplay of functions to support business goals; demonstrate knowledge of the business products, key processes, suppliers, customers and market/competitors.
  • Develops, motivates and directs staff to create a team environment.
  • Recommends expenditures based on the size, scope, and cost of hardware and software components. Assists in developing business cases.
  • Applies values, business strategy, policies, precedent, and experience to make complex decisions with uncertain consequences.
  • Challenges conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating and invites stakeholders to identify issues and opportunities.

jobs.title: Program Manager
jobs.content:
At GE Digital, we are creating technology and solutions to enable social, mobile, analytical and cloud capabilities for the Industrial Internet. The Industrial Internet is an open, global network that connects people, data and machines. It’s about making infrastructure more intelligent and advancing the industries critical to the world we live in. At GE, we believe it’s about the future of industry—energy, healthcare, transportation, manufacturing. It’s about making the world work better. GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Commercial Integration Program Manager will be responsible for working with the Commercial Integration Leader to design, build and implement a commercial due diligence (DD) and integration process for GED. This individual will collaborate with the Commercial Integration Leader, the GED Integration leader, the Digital Commercial Integration Functional Leaders and the GED Commercial team to manage all aspects of the integrations.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Develop comprehensive and effective tools, templates and processes to plan and execute integrations
  • Design and implement the overall DD/integration process
  • Create a checklist for commercial functions to execute on throughout the DD/integration
  • Align the commercial resources within GED to support the integration and supporting the day to day integration activities both internally and externally
  • Design a commercial due diligence and integration checklist for the commercial functions to execute
  • Engage in deals according to agreed priorities and ensure integration activities are planned, resourced and budgeted in the deal process
  • Create a process to assess the existing capabilities and processes within an acquired entity
  • Identify process variations across GE Digital and determine a way to integrate into the acquired entity
  • Develop tools to determine gaps and improvement opportunities between GE Digital and the targets processes.
  • Define processes and drive implementation of sustainable operating rhythms
  • Work with the extended business development team and business teams on the analysis, validation, execution, and tracking of synergies
  • Continually review the entire deal process from DD to integration close for integration implications and best practices
  • Provide training to integration teams on integration planning and tools
  • Lead workshops and provide project management for integration post-close activities including cultural analysis, diligence validation, and synergy cross business collaboration
  • Support in the development of integration updates and summaries to update BD and Business leaders on integration progress
  • Assist in preparation of the integration budget in cooperation with the catching P&L leadership team, the GE Digital Central integration team and Business development team.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Basic Qualifications

  • Minimum 3+ years’ work experience in Finance, IT, Marketing, Sales, Services or Commercial Operations
  • Minimum of 3 years of GE experience
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree preferably in Marketing or Business
  • Experience with project management is preferred
  • ECLP, CLP, CAS graduates preferredEligibility Requirements:
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job
  • Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen
  • Must be willing to travel 30%
  • Must be willing to work out of an office located in New York City, San Ramon, Boston or Remote

Desired Characteristics:

  • Demonstrated ability to excel in a global matrix organization
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including creativity and curiosity with ability to effectively communicate and influence strategic direction across all levels of the organizational matrix
  • Analytic, creative and business focused problem solver
  • Excellent organization skills; capacity to manage multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously
  • Ability to perform in a high-pressure environment juggling and executing on multiple priorities
  • Ability to hit tight deadlines and work under pressure
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity, strategic agility, manage diversity and drive for results
  • Ability to learn and define business processes and operationalize via supporting technology
  • Adaptable/Flexible: Being open to change in response to new information, different or unexpected circumstances
  • Clear thinking: Simplifying strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information, and communicating priorities clearly and concisely
  • Highly self-motivated contributor who works well as an individual and within a team environment
  • Ability to establish credibility and rapport with Senior Executives and technical and non-technical team members.
  • Experience with planning, leading, and performing change management, communications, and training activities.
  • Demonstrated business acumen and the ability to apply technology solutions to solve business problems.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At GE Digital, we are creating technology and solutions to enable social, mobile, analytical and cloud capabilities for the Industrial Internet. The Industrial Internet is an open, global network that connects people, data and machines. It’s about making infrastructure more intelligent and advancing the industries critical to the world we live in. At GE, we believe it’s about the future of industry—energy, healthcare, transportation, manufacturing. It’s about making the world work better.GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Role Summary/Purpose:

She/he will be responsible for designing and programming a small module or a large component and designing a feature, set of features, or whole feature area. She/he will work independently and contribute to the immediate team and to other teams across business. She/he will Lead design discussion in a limited manner.

Essential Responsibilities:

As a Staff Software Engineer, you will be works on multiple projects as a project leader or internal consultant. Works on highly complex projects that require in-depth domain knowledge.In this role, you will:

  • Capture system level requirements by brainstorming with Sr. Architects, Data Scientists, Businesses & Product Managers
  • Identify the scope of the work, provide initial estimate and justify the estimate with facts
  • Demonstrate the understanding of Agile software development life cycle and able to distinguish the core inputs and outputs in each cycle.
  • Engage in technical discussions; participate in technical designs and present technical ideas through white boarding
  • Work closely with your peers and keep engaging in a fast pace technical design and development team
  • Execute in a fast pace delivery mode and focus in delivering tasks to meet the product release goal
  • Maintain code quality through best practices, unit testing and code quality automation
  • Seek and provide feedback on design and development
  • Demonstrate the ability to make informed technology choices after due diligence and impact assessment
  • Understand whole product, its modules and the interrelationship between them while being an expert in the assigned component or module
  • Help in designing interfaces and information exchange between modules
  • Possess advanced domain knowledge and show great customer focus. Expert in processes / methodologies and Skilled in build, release & deployment processes
  • Articulate the need for scalability and understand the importance of improving quality through testing.
  • Be an expert in writing code that meets standards and delivers the desired functionality using the technology selected for the project
  • Drive design reviews, define interfaces between code modules, and applies existing technology to designs
  • Be an expert in assessing application performance and optimizing/improving it through design and best coding practices
  • Be an expert in core data structures as well as algorithms and has the ability to implement them using language of choice
  • Be responsible for providing technical leadership and defining, developing, and evolving software in a fast paced and agile development environment using the latest software development technologies and infrastructure

Qualifications/Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • A minimum of 5 years of system engineering experience or 10 years of system engineering experience.

Eligibility Requirements:

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen
  • Must be willing to travel less than 15% of the time
  • Can work out of a remote location or an office located in San Ramon, CA

Desired Characteristics:

  • Use Dockers for containers. Expertise in using containers in app build and deployment
  • Experience with automating continuous deployment solutions and working in conjunction with CI tools such as Team city and Jenkins.
  • Familiarity with Vagrant, Mesas, Kubernetes, PaaS, Cloud infrastructure (preferred AWS)
  • Familiarity with Log Management solutions (ELK, Spelunk, Serologic, etc.)Working knowledge of build systems like Ant, Grade and Maven.
  • Experience coding software using object-oriented techniques (in order of preference, Java, .Net, C++, Python, other)
  • Hands-on coding/scripting experience with bash, Groovy, python or similar
  • Exposure to leading projects with track record of successful delivery
  • Experience with Configuration Automation tools (Ensile, Chef, Puppet, etc.)
  • Experience working in Kanban or Scrum
  • Strong problem solving abilities and capable of articulating specific technical topics or assignments
  • Experience in building scalable and highly available distributed systems
  • Demonstrates clarity of thinking to work through limited information and vague problem definitions
  • Influences through others; builds direct and “behind the scenes” support for ideas
  • Able to work under minimal supervision
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface with senior leadership with confidence and clarity

jobs.title: Customer Success Team Member
jobs.content:
We have openings on our customer success team to work with Knack customers to translate their business needs into awesome apps.

Your job will not only be to handle incoming support requests but to also proactively look for ways to make our customers happy and to empower and educate them to build better businesses.

For many business owners building an app can be overwhelming, so your job will be to help them both understand and use the tools better, while answering questions along the way.

You’ll also need to be able to build apps for customers using the Knack software.

What You’ll Do

  • Email, live chat and social support
  • Proactive outreach to existing customers
  • Building out our help docs
  • Creating how-to’s, tutorials, and blog entries for using our product
  • Gaining insights into how businesses on Knack use (and want to use) our service

What We’re Looking For

  • Love interacting with people
  • Enjoy writing and are able to do it in a clear and concise manner
  • Enjoy talking about technical concepts, and would be comfortable explaining how Knack works
  • Empathize with users and can see through their questions to quickly grasp the issues they’re facing
  • Enjoy solving open-ended problems
  • Familiarity with databases and apps in general
  • JavaScript, CSS, and API familiarity (or a desire to learn) is a major bonus!
  • A desire to be a part of a long-term, profitable business that makes a great product loved by thousands of customers.

The Whole Package

Location: USA. Work remotely from the place where you are happiest and find your inspiration.

Compensation: competitive salary, flexible hours, loose vacation policy, paid corporate retreats.

jobs.title: Junior Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a junior full-stack JavaScript programmer to help expand the feature set for our database application builder product. Knack is a huge product that touches on all things data: you’ll have a huge developer playground to dive right in and make a major impact.

What You’ll Do

  • Contribute! We want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you’re not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand how we can best leverage those to constantly improve the product.
  • Engage your passion! We have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you’re excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.
  • Program every day and publish many times every week.
  • Evaluate existing code and redesign for increased performance and reliability.
  • Help develop features missing from the current app to make Knack the go-to place for building online databases.

Our Stack

  • JavaScript
  • MongoDB
  • Solr
  • jQuery, Backbone
  • AWS
  • Github

What We’re Looking For

  • Efficiency and productivity, i.e. the ability to get sh!# done.
  • Great communication. If you like to go off to your bunker and only pop up on occasion this won’t work.
  • An independent and versatile hacker, with the ability to pick up different languages, frameworks and techniques with relative ease.
  • A practical understanding of what programming is for. Hint: it’s our customers.
  • A very strong foundation of client-side Javascript and Node.js.
  • A desire to be givin big responsibilites and to make the most of those opportunities to jump start your career

The Whole Package

Location: USA. Work remotely from the place where you are happiest and find your inspiration.

Compensation: competitive salary (50k – 80k), 100% remote team, flexible hours, loose vacation policy.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Solaforce is a young, agile company relying on modern technologies and methods.  We'll throw you as many challenges as you can handle and let you be creative in how you solve them.  We're not going to stand over your shoulder and check your work meets a standard, because we expect you to do that yourself.  Above all we're passionate about delivering a great customer experience and want every team member to share this passion.


We are now looking for senior developers for our back end and front end teams. In general you need to be fluent in Finnish and at home writing and speaking English. Scrum experience desirable. Full-stack experience is a plus, but we prefer you have deep knowledge on either the server or client side. In particular: 


On the back end:



  • You have developed server applications with Scala, or with Java or C#, and you've worked with Python, Ruby or Swift.

  • You know your way around relational databases, including being able to set one up, optimize a schema, and write complex queries.

  • You have developed and deployed on cloud platforms, either IaaS or PaaS.

  • You are at home on Unix/Linux systems, and have working knowledge of networking, shell scripting, and basic internet security.


On the front end:



  • You are passionate about usability and professional consistent UI design throughout a site.

  • You have experience with modern Javascript technologies as well as automated UI testing.

  • You are experienced in building fast and responsive single-page web applications.

  • In technology-wise jQuery is a must; experience with other major frameworks is a good asset.


We know how to make a profitable software business – we need you to join us and bring the expertise on efficient, agile, quality software development.


Send your CV and application, including salary expectation, using link in our www-pages (www.solaforce.com).


For additional information contact olli.hyppanen@solaforce.com, 040-7255816

jobs.title: Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Hi there!

We’re looking for a Product Engineer to join the engineering team at Zapier. Want to help engineer a simple product that allows anyone to do complex, incredible things with the world’s APIs? Then keep reading!

We know applying for and taking on a new a job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier, here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. Hopefully you’ll take the leap of faith and apply.

  • Our Commitment to Applicants
  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work
  • Zapier Code of Conduct
  • Working on Diversity and Inclusivity

Even though our job description may seem like we’re looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if:

You care deeply about building products that simplify the lives of millions of people through automation.

About You

You love building new things. Most of what you’ll do each day is guiding, building and maintaining Zapier’s core workflow engine. This is a full-stack position, so you’ll work in the Zapier codebase, backend and frontend tech, our developer platform and more. Zapier is built on Python, Django, React, node.js and AWS. We use modern tools, which means you’ll have the opportunity to work with software like Memcache, RabbitMQ, Zookeeper, Docker, Redis, Jenkins, Puppet, Ansible and much more.

You have worked with teams before on large Python projects. You’re also familiar with frameworks for several languages like React/Backbone.js and/or Django/Flask. You also understand how to design systems in a distributed manner across hundreds (and even thousands) of servers – we deal with 100s of millions of API calls every week and growing fast.

You love shipping to customers. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers’ needs and translating those needs from product specs into functional, production ready code. You’ll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by millions of people.

You love doing things efficiently. At Zapier, the work you do will have a disproportionate impact on the business. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet.

You love to set your own course. You will have a team meeting and a one-on-one meeting every week where you can help direct the course of your projects. You’ll have a direct impact on what we work on next.

Things You’ll Do

Zapier is a startup, so you’ll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you’ll probably do:

  • Help scale a fast growing and unique system – our workflow engine connects with hundreds of APIs across thousands of servers
  • Plan and build product features – directly impact how our customers can be more productive
  • Ship to millions of users every day
  • Work with hundreds of different API integrations
  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
  • Help customers via support to ensure they have the best experience possible

The Whole Package

Location: Planet Earth

If you want to work remote, that’s cool. If you want to work near others, that’s cool too. The Zapier Product Engineering team has members across the United States, Canada, and UK.

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary (we don’t use remote as an excuse to pay less)
  • Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage
  • 401k retirement plan with 4% company match
  • Profit sharing
  • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents
  • 2-3 annual company retreats to awesome places

Pick your own equipment. We’ll set you up with whatever laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.

Unlimited vacation policy (plus we insist you take at least 2 weeks off each year—this isn’t a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation).

Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with the best software makers in the world and you’ll constantly get to interact with people from great companies.

Set your own destiny. Grow as an individual and professional.

How to Apply

Applying is fairly straightforward, but a bit unique. Creativity is certainly encouraged. To jump start the process, we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out the gate. Make sure to answer each question, and include all requested resources in order for your application to be considered. Have fun with them.

Complete this form with answers to the below questions.

  1. Tell us about your qualifications for this role.
  2. Tell us about the most difficult API/library/software bug you’ve squashed (we love troubleshooting stories).
  3. Tell us about an engineering solution you’ve built that you’re proud of.
  4. Tell us about the largest deployment you’ve worked on.
  5. Tell us about your favorite technology to work with and why.
  6. Tell us about an industry trend you’re excited about.
  7. Include links to your portfolio/Github profile or provide us with 500+ LOC to help us get a feel for how you write code.
  8. Zapier operates at scale and does some pretty interesting things, rank the following in order from what you’d do best, the first being the best. Disregard priority or importance considerations and focus on your skillset and excitement:
  9. build a distributed service that executes 30k untrusted node.js scripts every minute
    b. build a persisted cron-like tool to handle dispatching 100k jobs per minute
    c. create a real-time system to alert us of subtle or unexpected API misbehavior
    d. write a user facing tool that can categorize & diagnose common API issues across 500+ APIs
    e. implement a new feature that spans both frontend/backend code
    f. build a custom database to help aggregate and analyze hundreds of millions of events per day

Optional: Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.

Finally, wait for us to reply. We reply to everyone, even if we’re not a good fit.

jobs.title: Sports Copy Editor
jobs.content:
Vox Media’s SB Nation is the fastest-growing online sports media brand and the largest network of more than 300 individual fan-centric sports communities, including SBNation.com, our national flagship property. Our network is powered by the most respected web-native sports journalists.

We’re looking for a part-time copy editor to join our news desk team at SBNation.com. This person should possess an eye for detail, a strong knowledge of grammar, a sports background, and a drive for perfection. The SB Nation copy editing team ensures a consistent look in style and layout on every story while also making sure the facts, spellings, and grammar are right 100 percent of the time.

Minimum requirements

  • An eye for editing
  • Fanatical about proper grammar and consistent style
  • An interest in sports

More qualities an ideal candidate might have

  • Prior editing experience strongly preferred
  • Experience working in digital media
  • Ability to do self-directed work without strict supervision
  • A flexible schedule
  • Wide-ranging sports knowledge
  • Sports writing background
  • A love of Oxford commas

This is a part-time, hourly position that requires work on nights and weekends in a fast-paced environment. The position will entail working anywhere from two to five four-hour shifts each week.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply.  Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As .Net Senior Software Engineer and member of our Development scrum team, you are responsible for our innovative solutions. You help to outline new enterprise applications and think actively, in collaboration with the team, about software design and technical solutions. Furthermore, you have your own ideas about architecture and are not afraid to share your knowledge.


A fullstack Developer at FRISS is eager to grow, not afraid to take chances and thinks out-of-the-box. You combine this with excellent knowledge of C# and JavaScript, our main languages, through which you create new possibilities and advantages.


The function


By keeping an eye on the latest insights and trends, you have your own say in how products of FRISS can be optimized and used at our clients. You apply quality improvement processes like unit testing, code reviews and continuous delivery and are familiar with design patterns and architecture principles as dependency injection and Service Oriented Architecture. Moreover, you apply problem solving patterns such as reliable messaging and improve the scalability and reliability of the FRISS platform.

jobs.title: ASSISTANT DESIGNER - TRAVEL BAGS & LUGGAGE
jobs.content:
Description:
This position will work with the design and merchandising teams to help design and bring products to market for Randa Luggage and it's brand partners.
This individual should have a passion for travel and a deep interest in learning more about soft goods product, materials and manufacturing technology. A great candidate should have amazing design skills coupled with strong presentation skills and the ability to excel in a fast paced and dynamic design environment. S/he should be a team player with a great attitude and an ability to influence others. They should possess an extremely high taste level, keen eye for product, and phenomenal attention to detail.

Primary Responsibilities:
Design and develop Travel bag and casual bag collections from concept through pre-production samples
Creation of stellar visual presentations capable of selling product design to internal and external stakeholders Regularly scour the digital and physical marketplace to analyze, identify and document product, material and color trend
Creation of detailed and accurate specification packages for communication and sampling with suppliers

Experience and Skillset:
An astounding portfolio of inspired design work
Knowledge of manufacturing process and material
Experience, passion and interest in designing soft goods product
Adobe Creative Suite expert level proficiency
Proficiency with all MS office applications with an emphasis on Excel
High level digital presentation skills
Solidworks proficiency not required but helpful

jobs.title: Android Developer - OMNI channel E-commerce apps
jobs.content:
Are you the Android developer, who is all about continuous delivery, quality and building high traffic software? Do you want to build applications that connect our E-commerce users with our retail stores, while being part of a strong and international tech team?


The department and the position
BESTSELLER E-commerce is all about fashion and technology. As our new Android developer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the center of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 100 colleagues from all over the world in a young and agile environment. In the technology team you will, together with your colleagues, ensure that we maintain and improve our mobile apps for Android.


Your tasks will include:



  • Building new features into our Android apps, features that connect mobile users with our retail stores 

  • Writing automated tests and improve our code quality, using tools such as JUnit, Espresso, Spoon and SonarQube 

  • Participating in code reviews and sharing knowledge with your team mates 

  • Using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices

  • Fixing bugs and analyzing errors using all available information and tools


Your Profile
You will be working in an environment with a genuine start up culture, making it important that you are pro-active and a real team player. You possess great analytical and problem solving skills enabling you to interpret business needs and implement those needs in the best way possible. You are an outgoing person who values an open and relaxed atmosphere, where quality and automation are of the highest importance.

Why work for us?
Sound interesting? Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a good work atmosphere and equally offer good benefits. To this extent, you can think off an excellent daily lunch made by a professional cook, a ‘fit for less’ plan, employee discount in all our online shops and regular Friday events with colleagues. Last but not least, we have employees from all over the world and encourage international candidates to apply. If applicable, we will assist you in relocation formalities, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.

We look forward to hearing from you
If you have any questions about the position, please contact Elin Akerstrom (Recruitment Specialist) via +31 657459894. Otherwise, please apply directly on this site.

jobs.title: Application Engineer, E-commerce
jobs.content:
Our Platform Operations Team at BESTSELLER E-commerce is looking for a technically savvy Application Engineer. With more than 100 colleagues from all over the world our E-commerce business is constantly growing.


The department and the position


As an Application Engineer you will be part of our Platform Operations team, consisting of 5 dedicated and passionate colleagues, based in our Ecommerce headquarters in the center of Amsterdam.


The Platform Operations team at Bestseller E-commerce is strategically positioned as both a technical service provider for customer-facing departments and acts as a bridge between BESTSELLER brands and internal development teams. As an Application Engineer you will, together with your colleagues, ensure quality across all our systems and work improve and maintain the overall capacity of test, pre-production and production application environments. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, making it important that you are able to structure and prioritize your tasks.


Specific Job Responsibilities:


Your main responsibility will be to respond to a variety of operational challenges, including:



  • Identify, troubleshoot, coordinate and resolve technical issues on our production systems

  • Support our business users being successful

  • Help transition new features and changes successfully to our production environments

  • Continuously improve system & process monitoring and reporting


Moreover your tasks will also include:



  • Refine and analyze end user reports and turn them into solid technical debriefings for specialists and developers

  • Creating and coordinating impact analysis and present them to management and stakeholders

  • Create and distribute technical and non-technical information to teams and other internal departments

jobs.title: Test Engineer, E-commerce
jobs.content:
Technology is everything in e-commerce and as a Test Engineer it’s your job to assure quality and scalable automation across our business. We are currently looking for a proactive Engineer who wants to be part of strong, international team!


The team and the position


As a QA Engineer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the center of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 120 colleagues from all over the world in an innovative, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push for quality and high converting websites in 12 countries and for more than 17 different brands. 


You will be part of one of our 7 dev teams, consisting of dedicated and passionate developers, who are take pride in assuring quality code while building scalable solutions.


Specific tasks and responsibilities:



  • Develop and set up test cases, test plans and test execution

  • Develop automation frameworks and libraries

  • Be part of the development team and work in an agile environment (Scrum) to design new tests and find and resolve issues

  • Constantly push the team to focus on quality by improving stories, acceptance criteria and adding additional information

  • Work with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices

  • In the team, you are responsible for how the QA Engineers can automate and make processes more efficient

jobs.content:
Want to help build tomorrow’s digital landscape today? Got a knack for visualizing and coding effective UI? Then Sclable is the right workplace for you. We are looking for someone to take ownership of frontend development for digital business projects and products. jobs.title: Software Developers and Engineers
jobs.content:
Are you a software developer or engineer looking for an exciting opportunity?


Working at EMBL-EBI allows you to explore new ideas and technologies, and to put your energy into solving important problems. You will work collaboratively with scientists and engineers to find solutions for healthcare, agriculture and the environment by maximising the value of life-science research data.

Based on the Wellcome Genome Campus in the Cambridge biotech cluster, we offer outstanding technical infrastructure and a supportive, family-friendly working environment. We are a medium-sized organisation of small collegial teams working together in a vibrant, international environment. The campus offers a free commuter bus service, on-site nursery, and subsidised gym and restaurants.

Our staff are very diverse, from patient, detail-oriented coders to experimental early adopters, and work at the interface of biology and computer science. One quality they all share is a natural ability to collaborate and bring out the best in one another.


We have a number of staff member vacancies opening now and are looking for talented developers and engineers for opportunities arising in the near future, including positions such as these:

Software Developer in Protein Families team
Software Engineer in Uniprot Development team
Software Developer in Genomics Technology Infrastructure team

jobs.title: Project Leader - Database & Software
jobs.content:
We are seeking to recruit an experience and motivated software engineer to join the Protein Function Development team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI).

You will take on a Project Leader role working in a highly dynamic software engineering team with responsibility for the development and dissemination of robust and reliable services and data from widely used resources including UniProt and the Gene Ontology annotation. You will play a critical role in setting goals and priorities with the Team Leader and the other Project Leaders for this large team. A key part of the role will be managing the team members to ensure that developments are understood and completed on time. You will actively contribute to the code base and set the standards for the rest of the team. Another aspect of this role is the overseeing of software development with our diverse collaborators and their teams in international Consortia.

Drawing on your experience of the development and maintenance of biomolecular databases, services and tools, you will lead the team in the use of modern software development technologies and best practices. In particular, you should have experience in managing and developing frequent and robust database production and release systems including both the relational database back-end and the software application lifecycle.

Reporting to Maria Martin (Team Leader of the Protein Function Development team), you will take an important role in building and developing the team. In addition, you will encourage the team members to keep up to date with current developments and also to present the work of the team by attending relevant meetings and conferences.


For more information about pay and benefits click here

jobs.title: Cloud Architect, Germany
jobs.content:
Since 2011, Nordcloud has been on a mission to help people embrace the cloud. To do that we're looking for more Cloud Architects to join our world class team and help our customers gain the maximum benefits of the cloud.


At Nordcloud you'll get the chance to work with leading technologies as we partner with the premier global cloud platform infrastructure providers, including Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure.


With a great set of colleagues across our offices in London, Stockholm, Malmö, Munich, Oslo, Amsterdam and Helsinki, together we will tackle a wide range of challenging customer projects to drive and support Europe's leading cloud consultancy expansion. 


Currently we're looking for Cloud Architects to join our growing Germany team in Munich, but you have possibility to work from wherever you are in Germany.  


Have you got an appetite for technology?


Our motivation stems from technology and the persistent need to be constantly better and know more. Education and learning is a visible part of our daily life and growth takes place outside the comfort zone. Because of this, we’ve earned the place as the trusted advisors to our customers and community when escorting them on their journey in or to the cloud.


As a Cloud Architect you’ll find yourself participating in various projects, from new builds and migrations, to audits and big data. There are also varying opportunities to work internationally if you have the travel bug!


Your expertise will be appreciated by our sales team who you will assist to create new products and offerings. All in all, you’ll have a selection of different ‘hats’ and have the luxury of following customer projects from start to release.


There is great variety for everyone. Our friendly culture and our strong values make for a great place to work. We are young and vibrant and hope you will be attracted by the hands-on opportunity to be part of shaping our future. You should feel empowered to work in a forward thinking, problem-solving environment, where people get a lot of freedom to make decisions, are trusted with passion, and always go the extra mile to deliver high quality.  


Willingness to go the extra mile and other things we are looking for in you


If you have an appetite and a deep understanding for cloud infrastructure and its various relations, you catch yourself speaking cloud fluently sometimes in your spare time, and you have several years of industry expertise, we would love to hear from you!


Your daily serving includes Linux, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Python, Ruby, Bash, Powershell, AWS, Azure, Jenkins, Docker, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB to name but a few tasty bites. We don’t expect you to be a cloud guru when you join us, but you must be eager to learn, have the smarts, and develop your skills at pace with the industry. What this means is that within your first six months at Nordcloud, we expect you to be AWS certified, work independently on customer projects, and deliver results meeting the bar. As you work directly with customers, social skills and a customer service attitude are a must.


All applicants must have the right to work in the EU.  


About Nordcloud


Nordcloud is a global leader of cloud services and we deliver cloud strategy, migration, automation, management, capacity, and training. Since 2011 we've completed over 200 projects to help our customers gain the maximum benefits of the cloud including scalability, cost-savings, security, agility, and efficiency. Nordcloud is an AWS Premier Consulting Partner, a Google Cloud Platform Strategic Partner, and a Microsoft Azure Silver Cloud Partner. As an independent cloud-native organisation, our team of experts delivers objective advice and builds solutions on all the leading public cloud platforms. With a strong Nordic heritage, Nordcloud is headquartered in Helsinki with offices in Stockholm, Malmö, Oslo, London, Amsterdam and Munich.

jobs.title: Own and drive Intercom's policies & technologies as Senior Security Engineer
jobs.content:
What's the opportunity?


Our security team is responsible for making sure all our products are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. Keeping our customers' data secure is the most important thing that Intercom does. As both our product offering and our customer base continues to grow (we now have over 13k paying customers and counting!), we need to scale up our security and we’re looking for an experienced engineer to join our team.  


This is a special role in that you would be working on all aspects of security (app, infrastructure, penetration testing, audit & compliance, development, etc.) rather than specialising in just one aspect, as is the case with larger teams in larger companies. Also unlike most companies, we design and build our product entirely in Dublin, so you will be uniquely positioned to own and drive security policies and technologies across all parts of Intercom. Find out more about our engineering culture here.


What will I be doing?


You will get to work directly with our product and infrastructure engineering teams, you will also build and own tools, services and infrastructure used across the company.


You will:



  • Perform technical security assessments on web applications, mobile clients, and architecture designs

  • Maintain and create secure development practices and programs for our growing engineering teams

  • Communicate security risks to engineering teams through training and technical demonstration of vulnerabilities and secure design patterns for security topics

  • Conduct security code reviews, and architectural reviews

  • Partner with other teams at Intercom to constantly improve our defensive posture

  • Work on new product features to make Intercom users and data more secure

  • Help us maintain security compliance and certification


Example projects might include:



  • developing a new secure signup workflow for the main Intercom application

  • building a centralised, 2-factor authentication system to manage access to all internal Intercom systems

  • evolving our operational logging infrastructure, adding alerting on unusual events

  • helping us build a better corporate and production infrastructure

jobs.title: Recruiting Manager
jobs.content:
About Intercom

The way businesses talk to people online today is broken. Intercom is fixing it. 

Intercom is the first to bring sales, marketing & customer service products to one messaging platform, helping businesses avoid the stiff, spammy status quo and have real conversations with the people that matter. Designed to feel like the messaging apps you use every day, Intercom is the only business messenger to let you talk to consumers just about anywhere: inside your app, on your website, across social media and via email.

Intercom invented in-app messaging in 2011, and today more than 13,000 businesses use Intercom to reach a billion people around the world. Intercom has 300 employees split between its San Francisco headquarters and its Dublin R&D office, and has raised $116M in venture funding.

What's the opportunity?

We are the only Silicon Valley company that does all of our R&D in Dublin. As the Recruiting Manager in Dublin, you will work alongside the leaders of all our Dublin based teams (Engineering, Product, Design, etc) to deliver against our aggressive hiring plans. You will partner closely with the Director of Recruiting in San Francisco to build and enhance the Recruiting Infrastructure. You will be responsible for managing, developing, and growing the recruitment team in Dublin.

What will I be doing?

  • In partnership with the Director of Recruiting, develop and execute strategic approach to achieve company goals in staffing
  • Facilitate and lead key initiatives and projects with the recruiting team and client groups
  • Help develop the members of the recruiting function by providing mentorship, guidance and career development
  • Implement efficient, scalable recruiting business processes which support Intercom’s rapid growth
  • Develop and manage recruiting reports, dashboards, and metrics. Establish and track metrics to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of the recruiting team, hiring managers, interviewers, and referrers
  • Partner with the People team to provide guidance, identify efficiencies and build strong programs related to compensation, operations, on-boarding and the long-term success of candidates once they join Intercom
  • Create innovative programs, events and campaigns to help hire for all roles in Dublin, particularly focused on engineering, product, design, sales and support

What skills do I need?

  • Minimum of 5 years recruiting experience with a growing organization, hiring technical talent
  • Proven leadership experience guiding recruiting teams in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
  • Strategic thinker with exceptional data analysis and analytical skills
  • Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally
  • Creativity in problem-solving, resourcefulness, ability to be detail-oriented, strong organizational skills
  • Experience partnering with senior leadership and executive teams on hiring initiatives, ideally with technical roles
  • Passionate about Intercom and knowledge of the product and business

Benefits

We are a well treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity in a fast-growing start-up
  • We serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner every weekday! There are also snacks and drinks on tap to keep you topped up
  • Regular compensation reviews - we reward great work!
  • Peace of mind with life assurance, as well as comprehensive health and dental insurance for you and your dependents
  • Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need to
  • Paid parental leave to let you spend valuable time with your loved ones
  • Commuting is a breeze with our generous public transport allowance
  • Keep active with our roaming FlyeFit gyms in Dublin membership!
  • If you’re cycling, we’ve got you covered on the Cycle-to-Work Scheme. With secure bike storage too!
  • MacBooks are our standard, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done
  • We also offer generous relocation assistance for certain roles for people joining us from overseas.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Mentor ambitious engineers, develop strategy & write code
jobs.content:
Intercom is growing fast. We’ve created an environment where product teams, with big ambitions, can ship high quality product to our customers every week. Across a team of more than 60 engineers, we ship changes to production around 100 times each weekday. Our mission is to make web and mobile business personal. Come help us build a world changing product, a long lasting company and the most effective R&D team possible.


We’re particularly focused on building an organisation where people thrive, grow in their careers, and enjoy having high impact through their work. We’re looking for experienced engineering managers to help us grow our capabilities and capacity.


The Intercom platform comprises of several different and connected products. Each product is designed and developed — through invention and iteration — by a single team. As an engineering manager you’ll partner with a product manager to define a product vision, strategy and roadmap.


You’ll be expected to own your space: work with all disciplines on your team to build, launch and iterate. Talk directly with your customers, take part in usability studies, work with data analysts and researchers to ask the right questions and make good use of the answers.


This is an incredibly rare opportunity to join a company that’s still small but on its way to something much bigger, with a meaningful transformative mission. You’ll work directly with a product, design, and engineering team who’ve worked in places such as Amazon, Facebook, Google, Apple and Zendesk. And best of all, be early enough to hold a leadership position where you have a high impact role in our success over the coming years.


This role is based in our city centre office on St. Stephen’s Green, in Dublin, Ireland. Our entire R&D team is based here. You'll report directly to one of our directors of engineering.


What will I be doing?



  • Collaboratively set a product and technical direction with your team.

  • Support an ambitious group of engineers in their career goals. Work with our people ops team to maintain our high performance and high morale.

  • Be actively involved in hiring and growing our engineering team.

  • Care about agility as much you care for scalability and availability. Continuous deployment keeps us focused on incremental releases. Even our biggest technical achievements roll out piece by piece, feature flagged out of sight. Projects are kept short and tightly scoped. Teams build a weekly cadence of releases.

  • Drive, create and improve operational excellence, quality, security and privacy initiatives within your team and the entire engineering organization.

  • Help us evolve our culture.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a snap40 Software Engineer, you will work closely with our engineering team to build out our product and bring it to patients and healthcare professionals. You will contribute at every single stage of the product life cycle, deploy it out into the wild and see its impact on real people. You will work on new features as well as on our existing codebase.


Our IoT software tech stack extends all the way from the patient to the healthcare professional.



  • Embedded code running on a patient’s arm

  • Network protocols reliably handling sensor data transmission

  • A data pipeline that constantly seeks health deterioration patterns

  • Micro-services that power mobile apps, visualisations and push notifications to support clinical decisions


As a startup, you’ll be able to help shape and grow our engineering and our architecture as well as our business as a whole. You’ll have a direct and real impact on every part of who we are.


This job is for an excellent hands-on software engineer who can make an impact on our data pipeline and platform by building robust and secure systems that operate 24/7 to improve patient outcomes.

jobs.title: Graduate/Junior Software Developers (Windows, Linux or Mobile Technology)
jobs.content:
Graduate/Junior Software Developers (Windows, Linux or Mobile Technology)

Salary - £28,021 - £31,789

Hanslope Park, Milton Keynes

Full time, part time and flexible working patters will be considered.

You inspect every element to find creative solutions. We’ll give you some of the most interesting problems to solve.

You’re yet to start your software career, but you’re already inspecting every element to push the limits of your code. And you can see how a little creativity can help you discover new possibilities.

As a Graduate or Junior Software Developer at HMGCC, you can channel that creativity into helping safeguard the country and its interests. You’ll get to work on a range of complex projects within a team that designs and develops innovative, secure communications systems for HM Government use in the UK and overseas.

The role

At HMGCC, we give our new staff the chance to really get involved. In fact, you’ll quickly become a key team member - developing, testing, deploying and maintaining Windows, Linux or Mobile (iOS/Android) solutions that push the limits of software. You’ll have to use your creativity, taking on responsibility. It’s a real opportunity to test your theoretical knowledge and to learn and grow with our support. In fact, you won’t just benefit from the supportive and collaborative nature of our teams. Top-class technical training programmes, professional accreditation, mentoring and on-the-job-development will help you not just fulfil your potential, but stretch it too.

Your profile

  • You’ll have practical experience in the industrial, commercial or academic sectors or at least a 2:1 BSc/BEng degree in Computer Science/Software Engineering
  • You’ll bring an understanding of good design principles and good coding practices
  • You’ll have demonstrable programming skills in one or more of the following: C/C++, C#, Objective-C or Java
  • You can develop for one or more of Windows, macOS, iOS or Android
  • You know how to reason about the performance of different data structures and algorithms

Rewards

In addition to getting your career off to the best start, you can look forward to a great rewards package and a welcoming, modern workplace that has a cafe, gym and nursery.

To find out more and to apply, please visit our website.

To apply to HMGCC you must be a born or naturalised British citizen, over 21 years old and primarily have lived in the UK for the last ten years. In addition, one of your parents must be a British citizen, or have substantial ties to the UK.

jobs.title: Part-time Software Developers (Windows, Linux or Mobile Technology)
jobs.content:
Part-time Software Developers (Windows, Linux or Mobile Technology)

Salary - £33,126 - £37,585 (pro rata)

Plus up to a £5,000 welcome package*

Hanslope Park, Milton Keynes

Part time and flexible working patters will be considered.

You inspect every element to find creative solutions. We’ll give you some of the most interesting problems to solve.

You love finding creative solutions for technical problems, inspecting every element to uncover how you can stretch the limits of what’s possible. Which is why, even in this part-time role, HMGCC is the ideal place to take the next step in your Software Development career.

Our multi-disciplinary team designs and develops innovative, secure communications systems for HM Government in the UK and overseas. You’ll have the chance to work on a range of complex, absorbing projects – while helping to safeguard the country and its interests.

The role

You’ll get involved across the whole lifecycle – developing, testing, deploying and maintaining software solutions to never-seen-before problems. You’ll enjoy the benefits from the collaborative and supportive nature of our team. However, you’ll also be comfortable working on your own. Either way, you’ll use a variety of languages, platforms and technologies to bring your creations to life. We encourage everyone to share their expertise, which is why you’ll always be there to act as a mentor for our graduate and junior developers.

Your profile

  • You’ll have practical programming experience (including debugging) in at least one of: Windows, Linux, macOS, iOS or Android
  • You’ll be able to design, develop and test software in one or more of C/C++, C#, Objective-C and Java
  • You can reason about the performance of different data structures and algorithms
  • You understand and can intelligently debug both existing and new software

While not essential, experience of object orientated programming, along with scripting skills such as Python, PowerShell, Perl or bash would make you really stand out. And so would knowledge of networking and communications such as TCP/IP, HTTP, Protocol Buffers and application of encryption and compression.

Rewards

We’ll invest in your future, as we’re keen to see you stretch your potential too. Technical training programmes, professional accreditations, mentoring and on-the-job-development are just some of the ways we’ll do this. You can also look forward to a great rewards package and a welcoming, modern workplace that has a cafe, gym and nursery. Flexible working will also be considered.

To find out more and to apply, please visit our site.

*If you are relocating to the area then we can discuss the possibility of a relocation package.

To apply to HMGCC you must be a born or naturalised British citizen, over 21 years old and primarily have lived in the UK for the last ten years. In addition, one of your parents must be a British citizen, or have substantial ties to the UK.
