jobs.content:
Principal/Senior Software Developers (Windows, Linux or Mobile Technology)

Salary - £40,722 - £56,849 (depending on role)

Plus up to a £5,000 welcome package*

Hanslope Park, Milton Keynes

Full time, part time and flexible working patters will be considered.

You inspect every element to find creative solutions. We’ll give you some of the most interesting problems to solve.

You’re a developer who combines your natural curiosity with a close attention to detail - inspecting every possibility to stretch the limits of what’s possible.

As a Senior or Principal Software Developer at HMGCC, you’ll get to apply your creativity to a range of complex, absorbing projects that you wouldn’t find elsewhere. We design and develop innovative, secure communications systems for HM Government use in the UK and overseas. Join our growing team, and use your technical expertise to provide imaginative solutions to unique communication problems, helping us safeguard the country and its interests.

The roles We have roles at Senior and Principal level. The duties are broadly the same, with the Principal role calling for greater experience. Join us in either position and you’ll take responsibility for the technical direction of projects. You’ll define the approach for the whole lifecycle – leading a small team of Software Developers and supervising less experienced Engineers – to deliver work of the highest quality. As a senior member of the team, you’ll be given the freedom to use your judgement and creativity to get work done, while nurturing the supportive and collaborative work environment we pride ourselves on.

We have a range of Software Engineering Roles to specialise in. These include:

  • Windows Developer – Platform Security
  • Cross-platform Developer – Messaging & Data Infrastructure
  • Windows Application and Web Developer
  • Mobile Applications Developer
  • Cross-platform Developer – Telecommunications

Your profile

  • Practical knowledge of software engineering (that is, requirements capture, system analysis, design for test)
  • Proven experience in application or kernel development for one or more of Windows, Linux, macOS, Android or iOS
  • Proficiency in one or more of C, C++, C#, Java or Objective-C

While not essential, a relevant degree or Masters (or equivalent experience) will really make you stand out. And so would knowledge of networking and communications, data integrity and information, along with experience of mentoring staff in a software development environment.

Rewards We’ll invest in your future, as we’re keen to see you stretch your potential too. Technical training programmes, professional accreditations, mentoring and on-the-job-development are just some of the ways we’ll do this. You can also look forward to a great rewards package and a welcoming, modern workplace that has a cafe, gym and nursery. Flexible working will also be considered.

To find out more and to apply, please visit our site.

*If you are relocating to the area then we can discuss the possibility of a relocation package.

To apply to HMGCC you must be a born or naturalised British citizen, over 21 years old and primarily have lived in the UK for the last ten years. In addition, one of your parents must be a British citizen, or have substantial ties to the UK.

jobs.title: Perm Software Developer
jobs.content:
Software Developer (PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS & JavaScript)


About the role


Here at Dixons Carphone Group we are looking for a skilled and experienced software developer (PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS & JavaScript), to be responsible for the delivery of software projects to a very high standard across our new and exciting iD Mobile Platform. Adopting the team’s core values, you will be responsible for ensuring that projects are being delivered on time and also fit for purpose. You will meet with the iD Mobile team to understand the strategic direction and work to translate these requirements into technical solutions. You will bridge the gap between the business and the technical department having a strong focus on development yourself.


Our Software developers (PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS & JavaScript) would also be required to challenge developers & the business on concepts and ideas to make sure we’re adopting the best approach with all software development projects and offering our customers a truly unique experience.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
Front-End Developer:


Focused on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and light backend work.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Sr. DevOps Engineer (Operations) will design, implement, and scale our DevOps technologies, approach, and platform. The candidate will bring latest tools and techniques to accelerate our deployments and devise orchestration flows.



  • Perform system administration of DevOps infrastructure and implementation of virtual resources for running build and deployment processes

  • Work with DevOps counterparts to bring all systems into a unified platform and process

  • Automate the provisioning of environments and the deployment of those environments using containers, like Docker or Rocket

  • Develop scripts and glue code to integrate multiple software components

jobs.title: .NET Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Ben jij .NET Developer en toe aan een volgende stap? Kun jij ons team verder versterken met het ontwikkelen van mobiele apps of cloud toepassingen? Dan is deze baan bij Ridder Data Systems écht iets voor jou!


De uitdaging bij Ridder:


Ons ERP Systeem Ridder iQ wordt gebruikt door zo’n 800 bedrijven binnen én buiten Nederland. Continue ontwikkeling staat bij ons voorop. Daarom zijn wij bezig ons ERP systeem uit te breiden met mobiele applicaties en cloud toepassingen. Als .NET Software Engineer wordt het jóuw uitdaging om daar een bijdrage aan te leveren. 


Onze software ontwikkelen wij voor een grote klantengroep die op verschillende manieren en devices onze producten gebruiken. Één van de projecten waar we momenteel aan werken, is het ontwikkelen van nieuwe mobiele applicaties. Denk hierbij aan een Service Remote app en een CRM app. Daarvoor gebruiken we platformen als iOS, Android of Xamarin. Voor het verder ontwikkelen van cloud toepassingen kunnen wij jouw expertise gebruiken. Kortom, voor jou als .NET Software Engineer zijn er volop mogelijkheden om aan mooie projecten te werken. 


Het takenpakket is divers en onze developers zijn breed inzetbaar. We werken in 3 Scrum teams en de projecten variëren in grootte van enkele tientallen tot vele honderden dagen werk. Deze realiseren we in nauwe samenwerking met interne en externe stakeholders.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer to Market Risk IT, Nordea Capital Markets
jobs.content:
Take part in building the systems which provide Nordea with a foundation to measure and manage its risk. 


The position we offer


We are building systems which are responsible for Market Risk and Counterparty Credit Management across all of the Nordea Group. Modern risk management imposes a lot of challenges – systems are required to be highly scalable, reactive and capable. Our systems operate with millions of events and terabytes of data. They use thousands of grid cores and produce billions of records.   


We are now under massive transformation and redesign towards a service-oriented approach using loosely coupled services, asynchronous communication and resilient design. We use core java, microservices approach, in-memory grids and other things to achieve maximum performance and scalability.   


We work using agile processes in small teams with close relationships to the business. This is a good opportunity for a skilled java developer to participate and contribute to redesign of the whole system, implement your ideas and see them in action.

jobs.title: Senior Agile Test Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Agile Test Engineer who will be part of a development organisation where being agile is essential in the process of technological upgrading and building new platforms.   


You will participate in moving the test environment and testing as a discipline from a low to a professional maturity level in our organisation.   


The position we offer


As Senior Agile Test Engineer you will be responsible for the test of IT solutions: initially identifying and subsequently defining the required tests, monitoring the test coverage and evaluating the overall quality experienced.   


Typical tasks will be:   



  • Develop strategies for test area  

  • Building smart and efficient test code  

  • Test strategy framework  

  • Automating test code  

  • Define test scenarios and challenge business on requirements  

  • Test Planning  


You are expected to participate as part of a development team and participating in decomposition, estimating and automation of testing of user stories.   


In FRC IT we are servicing the Middle Office function in the capital Markets value chain. We are in the process of replacing legacy PL SQL based batch jobs with an event driven intraday architecture, using big data tools. We have also started to work agile in the last few years and are still on the journey.   


As part of this transformation it is vital that we build in the right test frameworks and methodology in our future platforms, as well as aggressively automating test.

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer (iOS & Android)
jobs.content:
We are looking for an outstanding Mobile Engineer to join our team to help us create high quality apps.

Qualifications

To join our iOS & Android team, you should meet the following criteria:

  • Computer science degree or comparable job experience
  • 5+ years of experience as a developer (preferably enterprise development)
  • 3+ years of iOS and Android application development using iOS and Android SDKs
  • Including knowledge of shipping and handling the app stores.
  • In depth knowledge of Cocoa Touch, Objective-C, Swift, XCode
  • and also the Android SDK, Java and the Android Studio
  • Good knowledge of CoreData, SQLite (ORMLite), AFNetworking, ION and REST/JSON and mobile persistence in general
  • Familiar with HTTP and the TCP/IP stack
  • Good knowledge of dependency management (CocoaPods, maven & gradle)
  • Good knowledge of GIT and versioning systems in general
  • Knowledge of CI/CD and unit testing
  • Strong passion for mobile UI and UX and experience building and debugging complex UI layouts
  • Experience in functional programming, React and React Native
  • Experience with JavaScript, CSS and the web technology stack
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Self-motivated to explore and create high quality solutions
  • Proactive, willing to get things done

Responsibilities

To get a better understanding of this position, please see below for a list of typical tasks and projects you could be working on:

  • Design and Implement mobile software including architecture
  • Maintain and optimize existing apps
  • Introduce creative concepts in order to solve customer needs
  • Implement and Map our own Backend Interface into usable Mobile components
  • Help customers with technical requests and troubleshoot issues

Benefits

As a small and successful software company we are able to offer the following benefits:

  • Highly-competitive salary and meaningful equity
  • Work on interesting projects and tasks you care about
  • Work from our awesome office in Zürich (2 minutes walk from Zürich Main Station)
  • Environment and freedom to do the best work of your career yet
  • Excellent gear and all tools you need (e.g. MacBook Pro, big monitor, Standing Desk)
  • Flexible working hours
  • At least 25 days paid vacation + public holidays
  • Chance to work on a passionate team that values work-life balance
  • Plenty of opportunities to learn, improve your skills and share your knowledge with the community as well as to grow with us

About Edge5

Edge5 is one of the leading Mobile App Development companies in Zürich that designs and develops extraordinary experiences for mobile apps. We employ the top mobile application developers in the industry and can help make any app idea into a reality.

Learn more about Edge5: http://www.edge5.com

How to apply

Interested? We would love to hear from you.

Please apply via email (contact@edge5.com) and make sure to include links to any projects you worked on, your GitHub or StackOverflow profile or similar.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
• Work productively and proactively as part of a great mobile development team

  • Design and implement outstanding mobile applications in iOS/ Android

  • Maintain and enhance existing apps, SDKs and components

  • Work closely with other functional team (web application development, backend engineering and QA team etc.) to develop and test mobile applications

  • Perform other duties assigned by the supervisor

jobs.title: Team Lead Web Development
jobs.content:
As a Team Lead Web Developer at Coolblue you will support your team define the shopping experience of hundreds of thousands of people daily.

What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like Yoda. ‘Code size matters not. Judge it by it's size you should not. For my ally is The Code. And a powerful ally it is.'"

What you will really be doing
  • You will work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master.
  • You will act as the technical conscience of the teams, keeping a bird eye view on the state of our codebase and initiating projects to keep it up to date and in tip-top shape.
  • You will help Product Owners in aligning the functional with the technical needs.
  • You will support team members defining their goals and the strategy to achieve them.
How will you be doing this?
  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members, you will make them “a little bit better every day”.
  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your teams in collaboration with our IT recruitment department and some more HR related tasks.
  • Taking part in team meetings to provide your knowledge and insights where needed.
  • Reviewing code, evangelising best practices and sustaining a culture of pragmatism as well as craftsmanship.
  • Keeping up to date with the latest in Web development, improving our tools and processes where needed.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice.
What a day in the office might look like
You arrive in the office in the morning, just in time for a coffee before the daily stand up with your team. You discover Marco is working on a story which is becoming more and more complex, so you help him keeping things simple and at the same time aligned better with the business case. After the stand up you sit beside Rafael who is having troubles working on a Google Analytics API client. You try to understand what is exactly the problem and with your help, Rafael come up with a new approach on how to solve the problem.

You meet a candidate over lunch. You aren’t looking at skills yet, you just want to get to know her. How would her personality match with the rest of the herd? Can she communicate ideas clearly and concisely? Can she talk fluently about the technologies Coolblue deploys? It’s your shot at filtering out candidates that don’t fit the mould. Not bad, not bad at all. She passes. For now. Of course, your senior team members will pick her apart technically later.

In the afternoon, you have a face to face sync with Rafael. You ask if the new approach for the API client is working. Then you talk about what he will be focusing on the upcoming months. He has no clear idea about that and so you ask him questions about which epic motivates him the most and which task he prefers. Rafael has a clearer idea now about his focus and he will think how to keep attention in this. 
Since you have no more meetings in the day, you propose a table tennis tournament with the whole team. The team loves that and even if you lose all of the matches, you have a great time.

Team
You'll work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master. They have different levels of experience and you will support them towards becoming even more amazing than they already are. Your teams, together with other teams in the same family, are responsible for a particular domain of our software architecture.

Required experience & skills
  • (Applied) university-level degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering or Mathematics.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a developer. 
  • Experience in web development is required: our backend technologies are mostly PHP and NodeJS, so having prior background in writing high performance code in these languages is beneficial, but not required (one of our team leads has a background in Ruby).
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving the skills of your colleagues both technical and professional wise.
  • You know how to automate your deployment and quality assurance.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.
If you're interested in this position, feel free to apply. We really appreciate if you include the following in your cover letter: why you want to work at Coolblue, what team (work) experience you have and we're curious about your experience/ideas when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.

jobs.title: PHP Pathfinder
jobs.content:
As a PHP Architect at Coolblue, you make sure that our web shops are architecturally sound and provide our customer with the best possible experience.

What you tell your friends you do
"I write code and help build webshops. No, I don't use l33t speak."

What you will really be doing
  • Come up with solutions that improve the performance of our webshops.
  • Improve the technology that runs over 300 webshops.
  • Work in teams that consist of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers. 
How will you be doing this?
  • You're an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You have your own expertise, but you're able to handle anything your team throws at you. 
  • You'll prioritize assignments together with your team and Product Owner.
  • You'll receive feedback directly from end-users, and you'll be given plenty of opportunity to experiment.
  • You'll work closely together with your team in order to meet ambitious deadlines. There's always a budget for good ideas.
  • You'll measure the performance and reliability of all the new features that you introduce, and you'll be ready to fix anything that goes wrong.
  • You'll actively coach your fellow team members and provide feedback. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice.
What a day in the office might look like.
You receive a Pull Request on Github from Erik, a Junior Back-end Developer who's working on extending the microservice responsible for order information. You notice he overcomplicated his code, so you ask him how he came to this solution. When you ask him if his work can be simplified, Erik decides to retool the code . Together, you create an even more SOLID solution. 

Whew, after that, it’s already lunch time. Outside, the sun is shining. So, you decide to have a sandwich with Erik at the square in front of Rotterdam Central Station, just outside of the office. During lunch, Erik explains he's interested in TDD and that he'd like to learn more about it. So, you decide to schedule a pair programming session for next week.

After lunch, you and Erik finish up the Pull Request and ask your co-worker Kevin to review it. Kevin thinks your test class is a bit messy, so he joins you and Erik to help out. You recognize you should have mocked up your dependencies better, so the three of you start making improvements.

Team
You'll be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization (back-end and front-end developers, or UX designers). Your team will work together with a Team Lead, a Scrum Master, and a Product Owner. Your team is part of a larger family, in which each team is responsible for one specific domain of the Coolblue website.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re a team player. 
  • A minimum of seven years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues' craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • Clean Architecture and Scrum/Agile are in your DNA.
  • You know how to write clean, readable, and extendable PHP code.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles, like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • You're willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or nearby).
We offer
  • Relocation assistance, from start to finish. 
  • Dutch language courses. To help you become a Rotterdammert.
  • Over 30 courses at our Coolblue University.
  • A relocation bonus on top of your first monthly salary. 
  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.
  • A 10% discount on all of our products. 
  • Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a hop and a skip away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk. 
  • An awesome workplace. With freshly prepared meals, monthly TGIF drinks at our own bar, epic Coolblue parties, extracurricular activities, and an informal, playful office space.
  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back. 
  • Parties. All night LAN.
  • Money. And we'll ask the government to give you a tax break.

jobs.title: I'm a roadie for Coolblue! Creating stability behind the scenes!
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.

What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no – I will not fix your computer."

What you will really be doing
  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.
  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.
  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.
  • Working in teams, consisting of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers. 
How will you be doing this?
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.
  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.
  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Machine Learning Engineer you use the data of millions of visitors to enable Coolblue to act smarter.

What you tell your friends you do
"I am the fortune teller of Coolblue. After investigating and analysing different data sources, I understand the past and I predict the future."

What you will really be doing
  • Performing complex in-depth analyses by using statistical models.
  • Create new insights, design procedures and smart solutions for the future of the business.
  • Integrating analyses, data and business processes by incorporating the data solutions in our systems.
  • Collaborate with the IT Development team to ensure the correct implementation of algorithms, the creation of new features and the launch of real-time model experiments
  • Proposing improvement initiatives that enable constant improvements at Coolblue.
  • Coaching junior Data Scientists.
  • Advising your team members and colleagues.
How will you be doing this?
  • You are fully aware of the fact that you first need quality data in order to perform optimal analysis, and you know just how to obtain this from various data sources.
  • Provide technical expertise and solutions to Data technologies with a focus on Business Analytics / Business Intelligence.
  • You use this data for analyses and implement this autonomously in the many software systems that Coolblue has at its disposal.
  • Implement machine learning techniques firstly as prototype, to later on implement it in a production environment.
  • You will use the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you.
  • You experiment with new technologies and ideas and put them to work on your own.
  • You work in multidisciplinary teams and you can easily navigate a quickly expanding organisation.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • We have implemented an online product alternatives done with PySpark. 
  • We have increased the precision and performance of our forecasting procedures by using a Stochastic Gradient Boosting method.
  • Preparing an approach for a daily price-elasticity estimation by product.
  • Internal challenge to predict the user gender using the information generated in a session. 
What a day in the office might look like
This day you’ll have the challenge to improve our weekly sales forecasting models. Of course you make a plan on how to achieve this. You would like to have more knowledge about the current situation. Therefore you need to gather the necessary data from our systems and plot it in such a way that you see the situation in terms of precision. In the afternoon you’ll have a talk with the colleagues who have worked on this problem earlier, but you would like to prepare yourself well for the meeting. You gained a nice idea from the meeting and work this out. Now you can make a prototype to improve the forecast working with only a small sample of the time series, in this case you decide to create a script written in R with your new approach. Nice! You increased the precision of the forecast by 2% in average.  It only pays off when the algorithm is implemented, so therefore you make plans how you are going to do this in the upcoming weeks..

Required experience and skills
  • Preferably university-level degree, MSc. or PhD. in Mathematics, Computer science or Statistics.
  • At least 4 years of relevant business experience in a similar environment (experience only in academia is not enough)
  • Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensional data from varying sources.
  • You have extensive experience in writing scripts in Python and/or R.
  • You have experience with Data mining, SQL, BigQuery, and NoSQL.
  • You have a sound experience in applying Machine Learning techniques like GBM, Random Forest, Elastic-Net, Deep learning and demonstrable experience in applying those techniques (or similar) successfully in a corporate setting.
  • Previous experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra is highly desirable.
  • It is a big plus to have knowledge in at least one of the following languages: Scala, Java, .NET, Delphi, Perl or PHP.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
Other
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize in an agile team.
  • Analytical thinker, flexible problem solver and team player.
  • Must be an individual with high integrity and strong work ethic
Offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Developer with passion for data
jobs.content:
You will bring your functional programming skills and passion to make sense of all kinds of data to our business intelligence teams.

What you tell your friends you do
"If it needs doing more than once, I automate it. If the data has value, I make it useable."

What we have worked on last quarter
  • Automated a ton of ETL process and deployment pipelines
  • Lots of BigQuery
  • Sent a ton of deprecated systems to the eternal dustbin somewhere
  • Made new logistic and commercial data actionable
Your team
In a few words, we - ask why a lot, automate everything, make data actionable, are willing to help, have a great team, use everything from SQL to Puppet to Python to BigQuery, enjoy our responsibilities. 

Required skills & expertise 
  • You ask why and then why and again why before tackling a problem.
  • You know how to get your development machine up and running - we love Darwin and Linux - we hope you do too :).
  • You have plenty experience with functional programming - we love Python.
  • You know how to chat up any database and get what you want - we flirt with SQL Server and BigQuery.
  • Before you asked, you checked Google and Stackoverflow.
  • Whether it’s Vim or Emacs knock yourself out we love to Bash zsh.
  • Spaces not tabs unless it’s Go - not the Pokemon variant.
  • The cloud is just someone else’s computer, it’s great when they manage stuff for us, and otherwise it’s just another place to have your container settle down and replicate.
  • Data, data, data and not the pale android.
  • You know how to get your code to production - continuously within in every sprint - some words that describe us: Git, TeamCity, Puppet, RESTful, API, you get the gist...
  • You are not scared to deploy awesome features on Friday, and know when you sleep in on Saturday all is well.
  • Bonus points if you have Untappd, like eating Chinese food Friday lunchtime and you want to work opposite the coolest and shiniest kapsalonbakje in Holland.
  • Kudos if you can beat us at the pooltable.
We offer
  • Money. And we'll ask the government to give you a tax break.
  • Relocation assistance, from start to finish. 
  • Dutch language courses. To help you become a Rotterdammert.
  • Over 30 courses at our Coolblue University.
  • A relocation bonus on top of your first monthly salary. 
  • Discount on a new bicycle. Because that's how we roll.
  • A 10% discount on all of our products. 
  • Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
  • An office at the best possible location. It's only a hop and a skip away from Rotterdam Central Station. Or a 2-minute walk. 
  • An awesome workplace. With freshly prepared meals, monthly TGIF drinks at our own bar, epic Coolblue parties, extracurricular activities, and an informal, playful office space.
  • 25 leave days. As long as you'll promise to come back. 
  • Parties. All night LAN.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
Meteorcomm, a global telecommunications company that provides data communications solutions and services for the railroad industry. We are looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to support our growing team based out of the Renton, WA area.


Summary:


 In this new role, you will be responsible for software ruby development activities for the Positive Train Control (PTC) Communication System (“the communication system”). This includes software application development activities including design, development, testing, and the creation of test/deployment tools and documentation. It also includes hands-on environment setup, development, issue triage and debugging tasks necessary in order to create and maintain an on-site expertise in our software application systems. The software applications and tools are mostly written in C++ and Ruby, and targeted to run on the Redhat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) platforms.


 Responsibilities:



  • Dedicates the majority of their time to the development of existing application and support of applications already in production.

  • Adherence to pre-defined programming standards set by Application Architects.

  • Develops recommendations regarding further definition of development standards and application architecture principles.

  • Performs unit testing and assists in user testing and debugging of programming modifications.

  • When scheduled, candidate is prepared to address system problems during off hours with minimal guidance from other members of the development staff as needed.

  • Mentoring other team members

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Meteorcomm, a global telecommunications company that provides data communications solutions and services for the railroad industry is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to support our growing messaging team based out of the Renton area.



Summary


This position will be responsible for software application development activities to deploy and support the Positive Train Control (PTC) Communication System.(“the communication system”). This includes all software application development activities including design, development, testing, and the creation of test/deployment tools and documentation. It also includes hands-on environment setup, development, issue triage and debugging tasks necessary in order to create and maintain an on-site expertise in our software application systems. The software applications and tools are mostly written in C++ and targeted to run on the Redhat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) platforms.


Major Duties:



  • Dedicates the majority of their time to the development of existing application and support of applications already in production.

  • Adherence to pre-defined programming standards set by Application Architects.

  • Develops recommendations regarding further definition of development standards and application architecture principles.

  • Performs unit testing and assists in user testing and debugging of programming modifications.

  • When scheduled, candidate is prepared to address system problems during off hours with minimal guidance from other members of the development staff as needed.

  • Mentoring other team members.

jobs.title: Mid / Senior Level Web Developer (Web Apps & CMS Development)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Baltimore, MD
URL: https://www.arsenalstudios.com/

Arsenal Studios is seeking a Web Developer for a full time opportunity. The immediate objective is to assist in development of our growing custom web software projects with a secondary emphasis on building highly customized CMS driven websites in support of complex, long term marketing campaigns.

In this position, the selected candidate will be working in a PHP / MySQL (LAMP Stack) environment to develop web based software, custom WordPress and Drupal solutions, and dynamic web sites. An ideal candidate will also have experience with front end technologies such as Bootstrap, Foundation and Angular.js (see the “Tool Box” section for all the cool toys we play with). You will be working with a talented team of developers and designers on fun and unique projects. We are waaaay different than your typical ad agency or web design company, and make this distinction as a point of pride. Our clients love us and we love them back. Do you want to share the love?

Example Projects
Just so we are on the same page, here are some example projects that will help you understand the role:

College application system - Work with a small team of developers and designers to create a robust online application system and reporting console for administrators with a LAMP stack back end and a Foundation / Angular.js front end.

CMS development - Work with a designer and front end developer to customize a WordPress site with Advanced Custom Fields or collaborate with our Drupal expert to build sites with Paragraphs. We build deep custom functionality and administrative features for advanced client use.

Budgeting system - Work with a small team of developers and designers to create a Mint.com style budgeting system with a LAMP stack back end and a Foundation / Angular.js front end.

Skills & Requirements
4+ years of experience in some or all of the following:

  • Baseline open source back end programming skills (PHP, MySQL or SQL based DB technologies, OOP etc.)
  • Custom development of modules / plugins for Drupal / WordPress CMS
  • Workflow development within task runners like Grunt and Gulp
  • Familiarity with jQuery, AngularJS, and other JavaScript libraries / frameworks
  • Solid grasp of Object-Oriented Programming (and ideally Doctrine ORM)
  • Source control (SVN, Git, etc.) familiarity
  • Ability to design database schemas
  • The driving desire to learn, innovate, and collaborate with a team of inspired, fun-loving developers and designers

Things you should know or be prepared to learn:

  • Working knowledge of SEO best practices
  • Experience working within a PHP development framework
  • Some familiarity with configuring web servers (Apache / Nginx)
  • Build deployment strategies to manage multiple production, staging and development environments
  • Mobile development (web or app) experience
  • Experience both interacting with and designing RESTful interfaces

Tool Box
Here are some platforms and technologies we regularly work with. Familiarity with any of these technologies is a plus and should be noted in your cover letter / resume. Note that this is just a survey of some of our tools. We are constantly innovating and you will be pivotal in the selection of future development technologies.

CMS

  • WordPress
  • Drupal
  • Shopify

Backend

  • PHP
  • Doctrine ORM
  • MySQL
  • Twig

Frontend

  • jQuery
  • Angular
  • Foundation
  • Bootstrap

Build tools

  • Grunt
  • Sass
  • NPM Scripts
  • Git
  • Subversion

Deployment

  • Beanstalk

About Arsenal Studios
Arsenal Studios is an ethical web design company. Since 2008, we have experienced growth and success due to our reputation for superior development practices, honesty and transparency through collaboration with our clients, and above all else, high quality websites and software. We care about our clients and are in close contact with them. We regularly work with the same client on a multitude of projects due to our depth of knowledge and problem solving skills.

Perks
There are many perks that come along with the job including a generous benefits package, ownership of all the gear we buy for you, employee retreats (last year we went to New Orleans), paid vacation, a flexible work schedule, and policies / incentives that we can adapt to your lifestyle and needs.

Team Culture
You must be an honest, sincere, likable person and be adept at interacting with clients through phone, email, video chat, and in person. Here are some values that we all share:

  • Passion for learning: You must possess an autodidactic mindset and zeal for knowledge sharing.
  • Forward-looking:  We are constantly evolving our practices and working with new technologies. Moore’s law can’t keep up with us.
  • Agility: You will be touching many different projects and working in a variety of industries including education, consumer advocacy, NPOs and the arts.
  • Positivity: We laugh way more than we grumble. Negative Nellies best step off.

Work From Home
Though we have offices in Baltimore, MD and Pittsburgh, PA, we primarily operate in an officeless work environment and can hire candidates throughout the USA. We work during regular East Coast business hours, but from home or from our personal studios and meet virtually on a regular basis. We supply you with a technology fund so that you can purchase the tools you need to bring the office to you.

Why We're Awesome
Our salaries are competitive, our employees are friendly, and our clients are more like collaborators. Due to our strong connection with the non-profit sector and education, we have some really unique and fun projects that are unlike anything you have ever done before.

Creating a diverse workplace is a priority at Arsenal Studios. We do not discriminate in any capacity including race, ethnicity, socioeconomic background, sexual orientation, gender, age, veteran status, religious belief, thought and opinion, professional aspirations, and more. Different is good.

Also, in the intangible department, we are a growing team that works closely together. We want the best for our employees. You will be treated like a human, not a code monkey. We truly care about the happiness and well-being of our employees, and in turn, we all happily grow together.

Questions?
Hit us up (and maybe even follow us for brownie points) on:
Facebook: facebook.com/ArsenalStudios
Twitter: twitter.com/AskArsenal

To apply: Send your resume / cover letter / code samples / whatever you deem relevant to jpeterson@arsenalstudios.com

jobs.title: Python Course Authoring Opportunity
jobs.content:
Are you a software developer with Python experience? Are you interested in sharing your knowledge with other developers, virtual mentoring, building your personal brand and earning extra income in the process? Want to join one of the fastest growing education companies in the world?


Pluralsight, the leader in online technology training for software developers, is currently looking for individuals to develop and teach online technical courses to subscribers around the world.  We are specifically looking for developers with relevant Python knowledge, passion and experience.  


As a Pluralsight Author, you'll collaborate with our curriculum and editorial teams to select and develop your own technical course. We'll work together to ensure your course is presented and marketed in the best way possible. Our author positions are freelance/part-time, enabling a very flexible work environment.


Join a community of recognized expert instructors that inspire, teach and transform lives everyday by helping learners obtain skills that provide career opportunities and advancement through online learning.

jobs.title: Systems Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo?
Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


As a System Performance Engineer at IMC, you:



  • Provide performance improvement ideas, solutions, and recommendations for trading strategies

  • Analyze exchange market structure to identify performance improvement opportunities

  • Be a latency detective; think Sherlock Holmes and the case of the missing microsecond

  • Understand and apply internal and external developments in technology, as well as competitor approaches that can help improve IMC’s performance

  • Build IMC’s knowledge base to ensure deep understanding of exchange infrastructure and protocols.

  • Write tools, build systems to analyze and monitor latency of critical strategies

  • Educate stakeholders (trading, risk & compliance, business development)


What makes it fun?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop. We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds. What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


Our Culture:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized as well as put into practice from anybody within our organization.

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to timely produce high quality solutions meeting requirements and managing overall complexity of our systems. You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.


Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation.  Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.

jobs.title: System Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
System Performance Engineer


IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win.


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


Role description


IMC is currently looking for a multi-talented and passionate hands-on System Performance Engineer to play a critical role in analyzing, optimizing, and continuously tune the complete trading stack, in order to improve performance of our low latency trading systems on financial exchanges.


As a performance engineer, you will interact heavily with other teams and be exposed to low latency technologies such as microwave links and FPGAs that are being used by thousands of trading applications daily.


Your primary source of information are full network captures that amount to terabytes of data per day. All these must be reliably captured, stored on an accessible medium, decoded and analyzed in order to find patterns, provide answers, verify theories and assumptions.


You will also be given the opportunity to try in a real environment any innovative state-of-the-art technology, be it in early initial commercialization phases or via collaboration with Universities / Research centers. This is done by implementing quick internal prototypes of early alpha versions that access both their latency improvements and their real-world applicability.

jobs.content:
Speedinvest is a leading European venture capital fund for digital startups. With $100 million under management, Speedinvest works side-by- side with early-stage entrepreneurs to build great companies. Thanks to its hands-on model, a global partner network and a subsidiary in Silicon Valley, it has managed to become one of the main focal points for the European startup community.


We are currently looking for a CTO for Bikemap – a rapidly growing global-scale digital sports community in our investment portfolio. In this position, you will lead major web and mobile development projects through all stages of the development cycle with a focus on time, cost and quality. You will lead an awesome young expert-team of sports enthusiasts who are passionate about their work.

Life at trivago is...

    The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

jobs.title: Junior Bug Detective - QA in a New Way

You will identify bugs using automated, exploratory and regression testing, as well as by performing data analysis using business intelligence tools. In some cases, when unforeseen problems arise, delays will be inevitable, so it is essential that you inform all relevant stakeholders of potential roadblocks so that overly optimistic expectations don’t lead to disappointment.

In your new role you’ll cooperate closely with individuals from Product Management and Business Intelligence, as well as engineers, and take full ownership of your work as a team – from the initial idea generation to the implementation in our search core. You should be passionate about your craft, versatile and ambitious to push our business forward.

  • Conduct rigorous testing of your work and monitor its impact on both our tech and business metrics.

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and help take trivago to the next level.



Essential requirements:



  • Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience.

  • Master’s degree (PhD preferred) in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.).

  • A very good understanding of Java with a strong focus on concurrency.

  • Knowledge of at least one scripting language, e.g. Python or R.

  • You have experience implementing multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment.

  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases.

  • You are comfortable communicating in English (our company language).



Preferred requirements:



  • Experience with Cassandra, Redis, MongoDB, or Spark.

  • Interest in machine learning.

  • You are knowledgeable in packages such as Pandas and NumPy.

  • Excellent English communication skills: you have the ability to easily convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.

  • You have worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highestquality of life in the world for expats.

  • As soon as possible.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Can you spot safety issues at a glance? Can you think like a hacker to boost security? Do you think differently? Join our Data Center Operations team and help ensure the safety and stability of the world's largest hotel search as you maintain and protect our site's servers. We’re always considering what we can change in order to improve so we’re looking for an experienced, creative tech-head who can give us a fresh perspective. You will monitor and maintain our multi-data center infrastructure and monitor the workload of critical systems, deciding on what changes we will need to make to cope with future workload. You will identify and strengthen vulnerabilities and protect trivago from attack. Think logically to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions and set up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup. You’ll have to find the perfect balance of safety and accessibility so that our users have the best experience possible. We want someone who will question our current approaches to technical problems and who can make sure that we stay on the cutting edge of technology as we rapidly expand. If you feel you can help us move forward, step up and show us what you’ve got.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 4 years’ networking experience in organisations with large networks – preferably in a web environment.

  • Holds a bachelor’s degree or has completed an apprenticeship in Computer Science or has equivalent experience.

  • Has hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting network-related issues using Linux or FreeBSD-based tools. For those unfamiliar with FreeBSD, although you will need to use it on a regular basis, we will provide training and only require that you are an avid learner.

  • Has advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Icinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd web server.

  • Possesses an up-to-date knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.

  • Has solid scripting skills.

  • Will speak up if they sense any problems and is fully able to communicate their thoughts, needs and intentions so that any potential misunderstandings are avoided.

  • Couples razor-sharp analytical abilities with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

  • Can start as soon as possible.



Life at trivago:


trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular code workshops, Hackathons and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn and practise their German.
Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.



Important additional information:



  • Please note that non-EU citizens will require a university degree in order to receive a work permit.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Team Lead Software Engineer - PHP - Leipzig Office
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Can you motivate a team in order to push us forward towards greater technical achievement? Our Leipzig office is looking for someone with PHP knowledge who can lead a team of software engineers and empower them to achieve their potential. If you want the chance to have an influence on how we approach software development, apply today.


What you'll do:



  • Lead and motivate your team: provide direction in technical matters, provide professional support to all members of your team and lead their personal development.

  • Evaluate and improve upon current work processes with the aim of driving innovation and continuously increasing quality.

  • Ensure your team is operating optimally and following best practices and inspire them to achieve more.

  • Manage stakeholder expectations and effectively communicate current progress and deadlines.

  • Act as the sole point of contact for your team.


What you'll definitely need:



  • 2-3 years’ experience in software engineering/web development.

  • An excellent understanding of PHP, system engineering and web programming.

  • Bachelor’s degree in an IT-related field.

  • A willingness to lead from the front and the ability to inspire individuals to achieve their potential and to work well as part of a team.

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. You must be able to make your thoughts and intentions readily understood and know how to effectively communicate in different situations.

  • An entrepreneurial spirit: you must have the desire to challenge existing processes in order to improve them.

  • The ability to create an atmosphere of trust among those you interact with.

  • Fluent English (our company language).


What we’d love you to have:



  • Fluent German.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, UI and data engineering guilds.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.


Start date:




  • As soon as possible.




Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

  • trivago GmbH is an equal opportunity employer. Applications from individuals with disabilities are welcome.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
What We Offer



  • A young company with a unique business model that just got a 7-digit funding by top firms

  • An outrageous office in Berlin- the vibrant capital of Germany

  • You will work on a more than promising concept with an expected tapping into a trillion USD market

  • Highly data driven technology start up with good pay, inspiring duties and an amazing team around you

  • Our vision: Liquidity for everyone

jobs.content:
What We Offer



  • A young company with a unique business model that just got a 7 digit funding by top firms
