jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
As an Application Developer (f/m) ERP (Supply Chain / Finance / Retail Store) you work autonomously in an international agile team. Within the framework of projects you develop and configure the company processes on our innovative ERP system (Oracle eBusiness Suite). In the course of your work you cooperate intensively with professional users, advise them, meet their requirements in a professional manner and receive direct feedback in a collegial atmosphere. You have a wide range of responsibilities which includes work in all stages of the software development process. You try out new methods, work with the latest Oracle technologies and expand your know-how in dialogue with other IT professionals.


you work autonomously in an international agile team. Within the framework of projects you develop and configure the company processes on our innovative ERP system (Oracle eBusiness Suite). In the course of your work you cooperate intensively with professional users, advise them, meet their requirements in a professional manner and receive direct feedback in a collegial atmosphere. You have a wide range of responsibilities which includes work in all stages of the software development process. You try out new methods, work with the latest Oracle technologies and expand your know-how in dialogue with other IT professionals.

jobs.title: Software developer
jobs.content:
As a back-end software developer (f/m) you are involved in the development of our e-commerce platform. You will also further develop our own platform and implement the features of the specialist departments in an agile team. You develop new components for text search function and Suggest as well as analytics and optimization tools. Apache Solr will be the main search technology.


Your passion are search technologies and you have fun to try new stuff. In cooperation with our product owner and search team, you make a significant contribution to the success of our shop development.


You are free to choose your preferred development environment. Furthermore you are free to choose between Windows or Apple hardware. The company supports you by providing you with tools such as git, maven and Jenkins as well as engaged and talented colleagues. Thanks to our training measures you always remain up to date on the latest technological developments.

jobs.title: Front-end developer
jobs.content: As Front-end Developer (f/m) you will work in a Scrum team on new features implementing these in PHP as part of our front-end team. Scrum is not just a slogan for us, but a living reality. Our team plans and organises its work autonomously. The Scrum Master and team leader see themselves as supporters and enablers of team requirements. We are currently in the process of setting up guilds in which our developers deal with team-overlapping topics such as architecture, code quality, testing and continuing professional development. Contact us if you are interested in working in an agile team.

jobs.title: Data Warehouse Developer
jobs.content: As a Data Warehouse Developer (m/f) you are largely responsible for the creation of design concepts and data models for the further development of the data warehouse infrastructure. You are also responsible for optimising and securing the ongoing operation. Your tasks include the implementation and performance optimisation of ETL flows, quality assurance and the documentation of developed solutions.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer C++ for Server Products
jobs.content: You will be working in a team of specialists with focus on developing high performance server solutions for XML/XBRL processing, data integration and information systems for mobile devices. Our office, located in Vienna’s first district, has an excellent infrastructure and is conveniently accessible via public transport. If you enjoy working in a highly professional, flexible and casual environment (flexible working hours etc.)

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
• Design, develop, and test new user-facing features of our platform

  • Innovate and advance the core planning, shopping, retailing and shipment algorithms

  • Optimize supply chain systems to maximize operational performance

  • Create high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable

  • Analyze and improve the scalability and security of our platform

  • Keep up with the latest technologies

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for world class websites

  • Design, create, own and maintain our web applications

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code

  • Develop application tests, including unit, integration, regression and performance tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for a world class web store

  • Design, create, own and maintain our high-performance cloud-based eco-system (Java stack)

  • Innovate, design and implement elements like the online store, order management, inventory and warehouse management, transportation planning and many more

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code and application tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: Full stack .Net Developer - Leading automotive retailer with a reach to millions
jobs.content:
Pinewood Technology is part of the Pendragon group, the largest car retailer in Europe. Within the development team we are responsible for the group web operations of Pendragon's flagship brands - Evans Halshaw, Stratstone and Quickco, with a monthly reach in excess of 2 million visitors a month. Your work would have a massive audience from day one in a mature development environment. As a company that believes in Innovation, Commitment and Simplicity, we recognise that a developers job is more than just writing code; it is delivering solutions.


Due to increasing investment in Pendragon's web operations, we are looked, at as a vital part of the group to provide cutting edge software to the automotive industry. We therefore need talented full-stack developers to join our team and make our ambitions a reality.


The ideal candidate has worked within a Microsoft development environment, has excellent problem solving skills, and is eager to work with very talented teams of people to build new features in an enterprise system, improving our existing code base. We strongly advocate quality first which is evident in our working environment from our use of TFS through to creating a truly agile/TDD environment.


Our Web team are experts in their chosen area and have a deep knowledge of the industry and how technology can revolutionise the automotive market. In time, you will be able to regularly make suggestions within grooming sessions and sprint planning that can help shape the system and improve our offering to new and established customers. We are always eager to encourage staff to learn new things and as such give Pluralsight licenses to our staff, allowing them time within their sprints to improve their skills.


Within Pinewood you will work as a truly full-stack Developer who is comfortable taking ownership of projects and solve new and existing problems on a day to day basis.

jobs.title: Full stack .Net Developer - SaaS ERP provider to the Automotive Industry
jobs.content:
At Pinewood, our Developers get to influence and enjoy access to the full development life cycle, working within a truly full stack development role.  You could be involved in enhancing a range of features and challenges, in which no two days are the same. We are constantly improving our product so it is fit for a growing global market.


Your core skill set will include:



  • JavaScript

  • jQuery

  • HTML5 /CSS3

  • ASP.Net and C#

  • SQL


We are a multi-skilled team that loves working with people who don’t mind chiming in with their opinions. If you are excited by solving complex challenges and furthering your career in a growing organisation, we’d love to hear from you!


A typical day for one of our developers:


9:00: Get my morning coffee and make breakfast


9:15: Arrive at my desk and catch up on any emails


9:30: Get involved in the morning stand-up and talk about successes you have had the day before


10:00: Start work on a new feature laid out in the sprint plan


11:00: Feedback session with Mentor on active projects planning how I will approach upcoming work 


11:30: Tackle a complex problem within one of my projects I have been working on alongside my team lead


12:30: Go out with the team for lunch


13:30: Refactor a section of code helping to bring our product up to the latest standards


15:00: Spend some time researching a technology on Pluralsight to hit targets in my personal learning plan


16:00: Do some code reviews on TFS of peers


17:00: Handle a few customer support requests


17:30: Finish up on some work


18:00: Maybe use the onsite gym before heading home!

jobs.title: Full stack .Net Developer - Automotive Retail software
jobs.content:
As a .Net developer with a quality first in mind, mentality you know there’s no such thing as “perfect code that can be left alone, everything has room to improve”.


What you will really be doing



  • Work on the software that drives the profitability and success of car dealerships written in .net.

  • Continuously improving the current code base and driving forward the system with the addition of new features.

  • Actively taking ownership of tasks from sprint planning through to review. Taking pride in the delivery of great features and improvements.

  • Working in a collaborative environment, where you can foster your own talent and the talent of others.


How will you be doing this :



  • You’re part of an agile, multidisciplinary team. You bring your own unique skill set to the table and relish the opportunity to solve problems.

  • You prioritise your work with the team and its product owner, weighing both the business and technical value of each task.

  • You experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time - with one thing at a time.

  • You are comfortable questioning established practices to further your learning and the skills of those around you.


Team


You will join a development practice of over 60, you get your own team work pod, expert product owners and project leaders help guide the process and represent client’s needs.


We offer



  • Money and a 5% bonus.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, have a generous car discounts being part of the largest dealership group in Europe and access to a range of corporate a discounts including holidays internet and much more.

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our learning and development programme with a Pluralsight licenses and progression monitoring from a mentor and team lead.

  • 25 days of paid leave, from day one in the business!

  • An onsite Gym to keep your body as healthy as your mind (if that’s what your into!).

  • We hold regular tech talks in which you can learn and hone new and existing skills.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free fruit, Tea, Coffee.

jobs.title: Full-Time Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Loloi Rugs is seeking a talented, hard-working Graphic Designer to work within our marketing department. The ideal candidate will be involved in projects that include key brand, business, and merchandising initiatives from conception to completion.. Having the ability to communicate our modern and original approach through clean and creative visual communications is a must. This position reports directly to the Art Director and Marketing Director.

Responsibilities

- Collaborate with our in-house creative team and other internal team members to develop and execute design decisions.
- Create graphics for email, print, digital, packaging, UI/UX, experiential design, and other marketing collateral that's cohesive with the our brand identity.
- Ensure work is done timely and within budget.
- Help design annual catalog from conception to completion.
- Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

- No personal ego; just a drive to elevate the Loloi brand aesthetic through clean and creative visual communications.
- Minimum BFA in Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or equivalent degree.
- Experience providing art direction to photographers is not a requirement but is considered a huge plus and worth listing in your cover letter.
- Willingness to work 45+ hours a week during busier periods.
- Skilled and passionate in the areas of typography, color, layout, and composition.
- Highly proficient in Adobe CS Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Lightroom.
- Ability and willingness to multi-task, prioritize and communicate progress in a fast-paced environment.
- Ridiculously organized and deadline oriented.

About Loloi

Founded in 2004, Loloi Rugs is a fast-growing, family-owned company that designs truly original rugs and pillows for the trade. We won the ARTS Award for “Best Rug Manufacturer” in 2010 , 2011, and 2015, establishing ourselves as one of the elite home accent brands. For more information, please visit our web site www.loloirugs.com.

How to Apply

Please send your resume, cover letter and work portfolio with your application.
In your cover letter, list expected hourly wage, available start date and your two favorite brands from a design perspective with reasons why.

jobs.title: Back-End Engineer
jobs.content:
The Engineering team at Brainly is working on some of the most complex challenges in the ed-tech space: creating communities for students around the world. We focus on building the infrastructure that enables Brainly users to ask and answer millions of questions every day. The systems we build are used across all of Brainly, making us one of the most cross-functional teams at the company.


We are taking over the world, and to do so we are looking for strong engineers that are ready to push boundaries and help us solve large-scale problems with solutions that translate into lasting impact.



Back-End Engineers at Brainly:



  • Build core features for a product that influences the lives of 60 million students worldwide

  • Push new features multiple times a day using continuous delivery pipeline

  • Contribute to development of Service Oriented Architecture

  • Have real influence on exactly what we build and how we build it

  • Work with various projects and technologies - machine learning in Python, comet in Erlang, high performance services in Go, core business logic in PHP

  • Develop and improve REST API used by mobile and web clients

  • Strive to write clean and high-quality code that makes them proud of what they do

  • Share their knowledge with and learn from the team

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Brainly application is one of the most widely used mobile applications by students. Join our team of seasoned engineers and take on this unique opportunity to delight millions of mobile users. If you are the developer who has the skills and passion needed to build the best application, we want to talk to you!


Android Engineers at Brainly:



  • Participate in designing and developing new features for Brainly application, having real influence on how the product changes

  • Participate in designing application's architecture

  • Use Dagger2, RxJava, Testing frameworks (Robolectric, Espresso, Mockito)

  • Work closely with other developers to ensure fast development and deployment process

  • Are really keen on data driven approach and testing everything


How we do things:



  • Code reviews

  • All code on Github, all tasks on Jira

  • Continuous delivery

  • Mobile first approach

  • Conferences

  • Knowledge sharing and personal development

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
At Maxcode, we’re looking for a bright, dynamic, and committed person to join our development team. If you're comfortable being actively involved in all phases of a project, sharing and debating your ideas, and constantly interested in learning and improving your skills, then we'd love to get in touch.


Please note that at the moment we're only looking to hire people based in the EU.


Technologies we use



  • Our .NET developers enjoy working with C#, using ASP.NET MVC and Web API for our back-end applications. They're also big fans of LINQ.

  • On the front-end side, we use either TypeScript or JavaScript, AngularJS, React and Underscore.

  • Microsoft SQL Server is our go-to technology for data storage, occasionally coupled with Azure Table storage. We use Entity Framework or LINQ to SQL for data access.

  • We test our code in isolation using MSTest or xUnit, and run integration tests using Selenium and Appium


Perks of working at Maxcode



  • You'll be able to learn from other smart people, who care about building quality software as much as you do.

  • You'll enjoy working in tight-knit Scrum teams, focused on delivering quality work at the end of each sprint. 

  • You won't be doing systematic overtime. If your team is running late on a project, we expect you to bring this up to management, not work late hours to keep up.

  • You will be listened to by your peers, your managers, and your clients. Everybody's voice matters here.

  • You'll also get flexible hours, the ability to work from home temporarily, great office equipment (you should try our chairs), a private medical subscription at Arcadia, fresh fruit each week, a fridge full of soft drinks. But of course, these don't matter as much to you as the perks listed above.


If this sounds like a job that would make you wake up in the morning with a smile on your face, then go ahead and apply. Or, if you want to know more about us, ask and we'll be happy to provide more details.

jobs.title: Senior Rendering Engineer
jobs.content:
To continue the expansion for our Kaufbeuren branch – or alternatively Mainz branch – we are looking for an experienced Senior Rendering Engineer to lead an experienced team of talented software engineers and artists, working on the next generation of our ATView Image Generator.


Key Responsibilities



  • Integrate a state-of-the-art 3D rendering engine in our ATView image generator

  • Maintain and continuously improve existing engine and image generator functionality 

  • Research, innovate and implement modern real-time rendering techniques

  • Advise and mentor junior software engineers in your team

  • Document technology, architecture and implementation details


What We Offer



  • Competitive salary commensurate with relevant education, experience, and application domain knowledge

  • Challenging products and projects pushing Air Traffic Control technology to new frontiers

  • Opportunity to make an immediate impact with one of our innovative product teams

  • High visibility position with opportunity for rapid growth and increased responsibilities

  • Excellent benefits including relocation support

jobs.title: Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Wall-to-Wall Studios is looking to grow the team in our Pittsburgh office and we have an opening for a Graphic Designer.

We're a creatively driven Branding Agency, in a fast-paced collaborative environment focused on delivering innovative, effective work. The candidate's primary role is to lead conceptual development, production, and oversee multiple creative projects for clients, while simultaneously being a hands-on contributor within the agency.

Responsibilities:

Create smart, compelling creative solutions across a wide array of integrated branding touch points including print, interactive/multimedia, and motion graphics
Oversee projects from concept through launch across all media
Report to Creative Director and assist Senior team in all aspects of execution of projects
Work closely with other creative team members, including other designers, developers, and writers
Provide guidance and mentoring for other members of creative team
Move comfortably among multiple projects with various audiences
Participation in collaborative ideation/brainstorming is a must
Work within identified budgets, meet all deadlines
Attend/manage photo sessions, video production/editing, and other broadcast-related tasks
Work closely with outside agency collaborators and vendors
Direct and supervise print-proofing and press-check approvals
Stay current on all industry trends

Requirements:

3 years+ experience in Advertising Agency/Design Studio/Branding Firm
Established portfolio that showcases integrated campaigns and your strategic creative thinking
Strong conceptual, problem-solving and executional skills
Ability to understand and identify key strategic issues, and develop creative solutions
Proven track record of utilizing best design principles and typography, coupled with strong conceptual design skills
Advanced knowledge of strategy and design development of printed and digital pieces
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to interpret creative direction to team and clients
Comfortable leading client presentations
Must be organized and very detail oriented
Works efficiently, proactively, accurately and independently
Expert knowledge and of Adobe Creative Suite products
Experience in managing and inspiring junior staff; foster teamwork and idea exchange
Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills, working well under pressure
Bachelor’s degree; Bachelor of Arts or Fine Arts preferred
Be familiar with our work before you apply
Love what you do, have a great attitude

This is a full time position in the great state of Pennsylvania (no relocation package is offered, sorry).

Please submit a cover letter, portfolio or portfolio link, resume and salary requirements.

About Us:
Wall-to-Wall Studios, Inc. is a Brand Design Agency creating compelling integrated experiences for smart challenger brands. W|W helps companies build their Brand Currency via websites and digital mediums; print media and graphic design; logos, rebranding, organizational identity systems; environmental design, signage and wayfinding; motion graphics, animation and broadcast video; and, advertising campaigns. Founded in 1992, W|W is headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, with a second office in Honolulu, HI. W|W maintains a diverse clientele; working with both local and national entities, ranging in size from regional non-profits to Fortune 500 publicly traded companies.

We are known as a firm that will do whatever it takes. At W|W, we strive to deliver exactly what the Client needs, in ways they never expected. Our approach is marked by experience, agility, curiosity and savvy, enabling W|W to pursue custom solutions for each Client, following processes that ensure that resources are used in the most efficient manner. We are able to accomplish these goals through our hybrid, multidisciplinary team that combines art, technology and creativity, pushing the boundaries of each individual discipline.

- - -
We get a lot of resumes sent our way, so just show us your best stuff. We're always interested in meeting creative, smart, talented, dedicated team players with a sense of humor. (Hey... maybe that's you.)
- - -
Wall-to-Wall Studios, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.content:
Come join us at Lundalogik and work on Lime CRM, our highly customizable application platform and flagship product that helps companies make a lasting impression on their customers. We’re looking for the right person to lead the development of our Windows client and to make sure it is up to date with all new features in our continuously improving platform. You will be working in a fast paced environment where teamwork, delivering quality software and having a great time at work are the highest priority.


What you will do:



  • Lead and coordinate the development of the Windows client for Lime CRM with its mixed C++/C# codebase (yes, that involves a great deal of programming).

  • Grab the opportunity (and responsibility!) to influence and improve the application and thereby the everyday working experience of a large number of people.

  • Work with product management in building the roadmap that makes the Windows client even more loved by our users.


This is what you get:



  • Employment in a product company where we own the entire lifecycle from development to end-user support. In other words – we understand that Doing Things Right pays off in the end.

  • Really smart and experienced colleagues with an agile and pragmatic mindset.

  • Healthy working conditions. We have a deep understanding of software craftsmanship all the way up in the executive management team.

  • Job security. We've been around for many years, with constant organic growth and real profitability from the start. This doesn't mean we're old and boring – we continuously improve, explore new ways and evolve everything from our products to how we work as an organization.

jobs.title: Junior utvecklare!
jobs.content:
tl;dr Relativt nybakad men kunskapstörstande utvecklare som vill skriva finkod tillsammans med likasinnade, mer rutinerade kollegor sökes. Ha kul, jobba hos oss. Söla inte med ansökan!


Nu letar vi efter en ny kollega till gänget bakom Lime CRM, vårt otroligt anpassningsbara system som ser till att mängder av företag runt om i Norden kan ha nöjda och glada kunder. Det händer just nu en hel del spännande saker med produkten som snabbt går mot att bli mer webbig, datadriven, plattformsoberoende och kul att jobba med både som utvecklare och användare.


Beroende på vad du tycker är kul kan vi anpassa vilka delar av produkten du ska jobba med – gillar du att knacka Javascript i webbklienten så fixar vi det och vill du hellre finlira med Python långt ner i plattformen går det också att ordna. Vad det än blir kan vi dock lova att du kommer hamna i ett team där vi prioriterar teamwork, ett gott hantverk och att ha kul på jobbet före allt annat!


Det här kommer du (bland annat) att få göra:



  • Skriva vacker källkod, ibland på egen hand och ofta tillsammans med någon annan.

  • Sitta tillsammans med utvecklare, designers och produktchef för att diskutera fram lösningar på kniviga problem.

  • Jobba med massor av spännande teknik. En relativt intetsägande harang om vår teknikstack som den ser ut idag: Python/C++, SQL Server, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, Javscript/AngularJS, AWS, Saltstack, InfluxData/TICK.

  • Åka på stugdagar där vi låser in oss i obygden i några dagar för att ha kul, bli bättre på något eller testa ny teknik.

jobs.title: Lead Experience Designer
jobs.content:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact candidates on our behalf.

We are looking for a Design Lead to join our team at Think Brownstone in Conshohocken or Philadelphia!

You should have experience leading major design and user research initiatives, being the client’s primary point of contact, and partnering with multi-disciplinary internal teams. If you love solving problems through an intensely collaborative design process with both clients and colleagues — and can communicate those ideas clearly — you may be our ideal candidate.

Your first project will be focused on the continued design of an established big data and analytics product, so experience leading digital product design initiatives is a must. You’ll be working with a client team of senior executives, product owners, developers, and data scientists. Ability to lead dynamic, engaging, fast-paced design sessions that sometimes require improvising on the fly to keep the conversations moving is critical. Experience synthesizing large data sets into meaningful data visualizations is a requirement. Past experiences working with big data and analytics are keys to success.

Our Design Leads serve on project teams by leading the creation of UX deliverables, leading Think Sessions, and overseeing other design activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain positive relationships with clients
  • Strategize and lead competitive and market research efforts
  • Lead and participate in creative brainstorming sessions with clients and internal project teams
  • Clearly and effectively present ideas, research findings, sketches, and other deliverables to clients
  • Design solutions that incorporate current best practices in usability, interaction design, data visualization, and big data solutions
  • Construct compelling narratives for product owner presentations that showcase new products and features to targeted audiences
  • Create deliverables from scratch, including: sketches, wireframes, workflow diagrams, requirements documentation, user research, and usability testing scripts and discussion guides
  • Conduct needs analyses by synthesizing client discussions, system assessments, user data,and market research
  • Lead UX research and usability testing sessions
  • Stay up-to-date on current best practices, trends, and technologies in user experience design

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in the UX design field
  • Experience leading projects and teams focused on UX design and research
  • Extreme attention to detail with a focus on efficiency
  • Proven ability to drive project work streams and deliverables with little to no oversight
  • Proven ability to clearly communicate design ideas to team members and clients in live presentations
  • Working knowledge of tools and applications that support UX deliverables, such as wireframes, prototypes, data visualization, and flowcharts

Take a look around our blog and you'll learn that we're a diverse group of designers who love our jobs and have a pretty good time here at work. If you're a talented Experience Designer with a laser focus on the user and work samples that highlight your skills, come think with us.

Think Brownstone is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Reverse Engineer embedded device hacker
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Software Engineer - AI Product
jobs.content:
Baidu Research, headquartered in Silicon Valley, is looking for software engineers with strong experience in developing software products and services. Our team's mission is to develop hard AI technologies that enable us to impact hundreds of millions of users. As a software engineer at Baidu, you will help develop new products and services that leverage the most advanced AI technologies to transform user experience. You will be working with a small team of highly talented designers, developers, researchers, and product managers. You will have the opportunity to develop creative new products and services that will directly impact hundreds of millions of users.


As a software engineer, you will be responsible for transforming core AI technologies built by our researchers to software products and services that solve real world problems for wide range of users.


Here's what you will do:



  • Learn about the latest in AI technology and create new products based on it.

  • Take ownership of software projects and be responsible for the full development cycle: design, development, testing, deployment, documentation, improvement, and maintenance of mobile and web applications and backend services.

  • Design efficient, scalable, flexible, sustainable, and secure software architecture from product requirements.

  • Create exceptional user experiences working with UI/UX designers to build usable and delightful interfaces.

  • Quickly design and build prototypes from ideas.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
¡Estamos formando un súper equipo Android!


Rappi ha logrado crecer exponencialmente en solo un año, sobrepasar retos técnicos y conseguir inversión de los fondos más fuertes de Silicon Valley. Como desarrollador de Android en Rappi, tendrás la oportunidad de liderar complejos proyectos de ingeniería que mejoraran significativamente nuestra operación logística, e innovar a través de nuestras aplicaciones.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer- Leading Open Source Company
jobs.content:
Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow our Cloud Site Reliability team. We're a part of the Elastic Cloud team with an operations background who aren’t afraid to get our hands dirty.  We are the first line of consumers for Elastic's products and our experience helps influence the direction of the product.   While most organizations may have a single or a handful of Elastic Stack deployments, here, you’ll be responsible for identifying, troubleshooting and reporting platform problems to developers in order to ensure that the thousands of Elasticsearch clusters that we manage are providing a stable and reliable service.  We’re looking for people who are just as excited about troubleshooting issues with distributed systems as they are to automate, code and collaborate to solve problems.


Responsibilities



  • Report and troubleshoot problems within the Elastic Cloud infrastructure services and collaborate on issues with developers

  • Handle day to day operations around the Elastic Cloud such as customer trouble tickets managing cloud provider infrastructure (maintenance/expansion), and software deployments

  • Develop and enhance tooling to deploy and manage the Elastic Cloud product and infrastructure

  • Demonstrate and promote best practices for teams using cloud platforms

jobs.title: Software Engineer Cloud Leading Open Source Company
jobs.content:
Elastic is building out our Elastic Cloud Team focusing on Elastic as a Service. This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation.


Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This product would be built on technologies such as OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elastic Clusters.


Job Duties and Requirements



  • Develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.

  • Have familiarity with failures and complications related to a cloud offering

  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Elastic Cloud Product and Engineering Team

  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters

jobs.title: Handbag Designer
jobs.content:
We are a company that works with artisans all over Mexico. We are looking for a designer that is willing to learn a little about each artisans ancient traditions of weaving and embroidery in order to design modern day handbags and perhaps textiles. The artisans weave plastic, make amazing fabric on pedal looms and back strap looms.

We are looking for someone to help us keep up with the seasonal trends (designs and colors) and be able to apply them to what each artisan weaves.

If you are a designer that would like to work with a company that works directly with artisans to improve their well being and would like to create modernized products using ancient techniques, please contact us.

We are looking for a freelance designer to work on a per project basis.

Best, Jennifer

PS: We are based in Cancun, Mexico and have an office in New Jersey.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Here at Thumbtack, we’re building the easiest way for people to hire local professionals for projects big and small. From house painting to personal training and everything in between, we match millions of customers to the right professionals for all of life’s projects -- while allowing skilled local service providers to reach customers directly and sustainably grow their business at their own pace.


As a Software Engineer, you’ll focus on bringing the Thumbtack vision to life. You’ll collaborate with other engineers, designers and product managers to execute on a broad range of projects. This could include building new features to improve the experience of our users, architecting infrastructure to support a fast-­growing user base, or optimizing our marketplace mechanics to make better matches between customers and professionals.


At Thumbtack, we value ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. On each of our teams, engineers have their say in choosing the projects they believe will have the greatest impact for our millions of users.

jobs.title: (Lead) Software Engineer Machine Learning
jobs.content:
Berlin AI fintech company with beautiful lakeside office further grows its team



SMACC is a technology company that helps small and medium enterprises master their financial processes with beautiful, intuitive software and superior customer service.



https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/28/goodbye-accountants-startup-builds-ai-to-automate-all-your-accounting/



We need your technical know-how to revolutionize the way businesses operate!



We are looking for an experienced (Lead) Senior Software Engineer Machine Learning (m/f) to make magic happen with state of the art machine learning technology.



Your Mission:




  • Be part of an amazing development team that works closely with all departments of the company to develop a truly visionary product.

  • Design and develop machine learning algorithms to help SMEs make financial decisions

  • Develop predictive models and conduct experiments to better forecast company cash flows

  • Cross-collaborate with engineers on building statistical models, applying machine learning techniques and visualize results.

  • Define and help implement architecture design for efficient processing of “big data”.



Your Profile:




  • University degree in computer science, mathematics, or statistics. Preferred qualification: M.S./PhD in computer science or mathematics with research exposure in machine learning/AI field.

  • Strong programming and software engineering skills

  • Experience with statistical, predictive modeling. Experience with financial analysis and modeling is a plus

  • Proven track-record as software engineer in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, feature engineering, artificial intelligence.

  • Experience with high-performance server systems design and development.



Our Offer:




  • A creative corporate culture with a common and visionary goal.

  • A competitive compensation package composed of base salary and company stock participation.

  • A professional working atmosphere with a healthy dose of fun during and after work.

  • A learning environment which challenges and encourages you.

  • An interesting and challenging task with a high degree of autonomy.

  • And of course fresh fruits, the best craft beer and artisanal coffee.



Become part of our team. We're looking forward to meeting you!


Just send us your CV, a few sentences why we need you and work samples via email to career@smacc.io. You'll be hearing from us shortly.

jobs.title: Information Security Engineer
jobs.content: Twitch is looking for a focused Security Engineer with deep technical skills and problem solving abilities to take on a leadership role in addressing security issues across the organization. We are looking for an individual who has the passion for engineering novel solutions to complex security challenges, recognize gaps in capabilities and fill them in an exceeding capacity, as well as the ability to quickly design and build internal-facing tools that enable scaled programmatic automation.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
GoEuro is looking for an iOS expert who can build, maintain and continuously improve our native iOS App, keywords: objective-C & swift, complex APIs, reactive programming, fancy animations, fantastic team. You are a great mobile Developer with product not project mindset? Keep reading!


What is GoEuro?


GoEuro is Europe’s leading travel platform. In a single search it connects you to any city center in Europe via train, bus and plane. GoEuro’s smart technology makes international travel comprehensive, convenient and cheap.


Who are we?


Headquartered in Berlin, we’re a bunch of more than 170 travel enthusiasts with 35+ different nationalities. We believe in the power of technology and travel to transform people’s lives. We value healthy work relationships, creative problem solving and, naturally, fun.


As iOS Developer at GoEuro, you will...


... be part of a small, but powerful team that is owning & constantly improving our iOS App. We have been featured several times already in the App store (in 21 countries :) and are proud of what we have achieved so far. Now we are searching for technically strong teammate who´s fun to work with and sharing our passion for building an outstanding mobile product at GoEuro.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
You love programming, latest technologies (ES6, React, Angular), DON´T want to support legacy code, enjoy to develop from scratch, are interested in topics like functional reactive programming - and want to do all of that in a very nice team, located in Berlin? Keep reading!


What is GoEuro?


GoEuro is Europe’s leading travel platform. In a single search it connects you to any city center in Europe via train, bus and plane. GoEuro’s smart technology makes international travel comprehensive, convenient and cheap.


Who are we?


Headquartered in Berlin, we’re a bunch of more than 180 travel enthusiasts representing 35+ different countries. We believe in the power of technology and travel to transform people’s lives. We value healthy work relationships, creative problem solving and, naturally, fun. 


As Frontend Developer at GoEuro, you will…


...be part of an international, talented and agile Development team that is responsible for building the user interface of GoEuro´s desktop, mobile web apps. You will work with latest technologies and have a great impact on our product. Even though we are very proud of what we have achieved at GoEuro already, there´s still some space for improvement and lots of interesting technical challenges to overcome going forward. That´s why we are searching for you!


In an agile context you will share the following tasks with your teammates:



  • Building new features and rewriting old parts of GoEuro frontend with modern technologies (yes, no legacy code support)

  • Writing Unit, integration and end-to-end tests

  • Working with product designers and product owners

  • Taking feedback from users and making interaction changes

  • Troubleshooting performance issues

  • Technologies you will be working with: CSS3, ES6, React, Angular, RxJs, jQuery, HTML5

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
GoEoruo is searching for an excellent Software Developer with a passion for software craftsmanship, TDD and CD who loves to build scalable solutions within a strong, cross-functional, agile development team in Berlin


What is GoEuro?


GoEuro is Europe’s leading travel platform. In a single search it connects you to any city center in Europe via train, bus and plane. GoEuro’s smart technology makes international travel comprehensive, convenient and cheap.


Who are we?


Headquartered in Berlin, we’re a bunch of more than 180 travel enthusiasts with 35+ different nationalities. We believe in the power of technology and travel to transform people’s lives. We value healthy work relationships, creative problem solving and, naturally, fun.


To help us on our mission in building the perfect travel companion for the continent, we are searching for a Senior Java Developer.


As a Senior Software Engineer at GoEuro, you will...


...be part of an international, talented and agile Development team that is building the core backend components of our system. We are mainly working with Java, but are happy to hire strong C++ Engineers as well. To serve our huge and constantly growing user base, we have put a nicely scalable architecture in place and split our software into micro services. Even though we are very proud of what we have achieved at GoEuro already, there´s still some space for improvement and lot´s of interesting technical challenges to overcome going forward. That´s why we are searching for you!


The following tasks are waiting for you:



  • Play a leading role in improving our travel search backend & booking engine

  • Work with a massive amount of parallel ingoing and outgoing requests

  • Design and develop scalable systems

  • Integrate travel providers from the air, rail and bus industry

  • Implement scalable and highly efficient ways of data processing

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
We are hiring an iOS Developer, to develop and deliver the Company technology stack and platform components to enable accelerated development of our company, providing technical leadership and expertise from idea to exit. You will need to be passionate about creating clean, beautiful, well-crafted, maintainable code and have strong experience working on UI/UX and user-focussed design.


As our iOS Developer, you will help NetworkingUp break new ground, create and test new concepts to accelerate our growth. You will play a role in establishing one of the most innovative business units within the corporation.


You will be part of a collaborative team of technical and design specialists, to develop the full technology stack for NetworkingUp, its activities and range of ventures. You’ll be involved across the innovation process, from idea to MVP, developing alpha and beta products and core components of our software architecture to make our operations run fast and constantly move forward.


You’ll need flexibility, adaptability and a healthy dose of pragmatism when providing expert support and advice to our ventures while never slowing things down. You will build strong relationships with technical partners as required to accelerate the growth of our ventures. You’ll provide a supportive environment for our technical talent that prizes innovation, continual personal improvement and effective product development methodologies.


You will distill technical ideas into simple effective plans, working closely with your team of developers, designers to drive their execution within the challenges of an agile startup environment. You will evolve our thinking, and help identify and develop our capabilities across the back-end, front-end, UX, as well as machine learning and optimization techniques.


You’ll have the chance to develop and define the requirements for the core platform, ensuring NetworkingUp is a business that is synonymous with technical excellence and innovation. The choice of technology or language is continually evolving and it’s up to you to shape and keep our activities at the forefront of technology.


The importance of a strong corporate culture


Because most of our time we are at the office, that is most than important to take pleasure of it. 
We want to implement and create a positive innovation culture in a collaborative environment. 
Because your team is also your core product, we give to our employees all of the tools to start in the best way an honest relationship. 
Our guys need to forge close working relationships with our leadership team to meet the need of the organisation. But work has also to be a place where you could realize yourself. That's why we dearly support our employees to find their places in the project.  
To summarize, we create and nurture a sense of ownership and commitment amongst the engineering team.
Finally we would rather hire people who have a deep thirst of knowledge. We support and encourage self-improvement of our employees.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer - relocation to the Netherlands
jobs.content:
The main specializations are biomechanical sensing, photonics, embedded solutions and signal processing. You will have about 20 colleagues, and the organizational structure is quite flat. This means that the communication lines are short, and there is plenty of room for your own ideas. We are flexible when it comes to working with your strengths, and the type of products you will work on. As an embedded software engineer you will work in-house on a diverse range of sensor related products.


Examples of innovative products which you can choose to work on:
- Wearable devices (in example: Fitbit or other devices to measure activity);
- Internet of Things;


- Advanced medical products that run on software;


- Industrial sensors.


You will get a chance to work on a very diverse range of products, from the stage of concept creation. Ideas emerge mostly from academic settings, and you will be the first person to bring the prototype to life. This position is extremely exciting for creators, who are not afraid to go where they have not gone before, and are eager to independently work on innovative concepts.

jobs.title: Software Designer - relocation to the Netherlands
jobs.content:
The company is active in many different verticals. Depending on your strengths and background, you will work at clients in the Healthcare, high-tech, Automotive and/or Machinery industry. In addition, there are internal projects to work on. In this position, you will work on innovative solutions developed for social challenges in the areas of energy, mobility and sustainable production. The company works with different units, each offering services to clients in the High-Tech, Machine & Systems, Healthcare and Automotive industry.


As a Software Designer you will be responsible for the development and implementation of software for different projects. You will work in complex development environments with plenty of opportunity to learn and develop yourself within certain domains. Of course we expect you to keep up with the latest technical developments and we will offer plenty of opportunity to do so.

jobs.title: Software Developer C++ - relocation to the Netherlands
jobs.content: As a C++ Software Developer you will work on new products that aim to bring innovative solutions for client - companies that offer financial services, like mobile payments. You may also work on high-end solutions for Governments, or for the healthcare industry. The goal is to develop high tech solutions with the purpose of protecting classified information. Due to the nature of the products, we cannot go into details too much. In this job, you will mostly work on Cryptographic middleware and applets.

jobs.title: Quality Engineer-deliver a service that will make life easier4business travelers
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about building high-quality, highly-scalable Cloud Software? If so, please come and help us build the next generation travel product that will drive growth for Concur and reach millions of customers around the world! We are looking to build web based services with innovative UI and design practices, leading edge indexing and language technologies, and a scalable architecture, all with a fast paced delivery focused team mentality.


In the first 12 months you will:

• Work as an equal partner in an Agile team that is tasked with “Blazing the trail” on new technologies, processes, and methodologies
• Works across project teams to plan and cost features
• Improve test automation tools/processes and build/improve shared libraries

In order to do this you will:

• Investigate product issues, provide clear and insightful analysis of root cause, analyze patterns of bugs including customer impact, and effectively prioritize bugs
• Provide critical feedback on feature requirements, designs and code changes
• Write efficient and reliable automated regression tests to fully assess product quality

jobs.title: Manager, Database Administrator
jobs.content:
Come and be a part of a global database administration team that spans half the world from London to Seattle, and have the opportunity to mentor and lead subject matter experts in Couchbase, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle Database.  We are responsible for 40,000+ databases located in multiple corporate data centers as well as in public cloud infrastructure.


In the first 12 months you will deliver:



  • Enhanced Database Administration through Automation: Concur is seeking to enhance manageability and scalability of our database environments through automation of standard tasks such as database provisioning, monitoring, and machine responses to common alert conditions that eliminate the need for DBA involvement in low-level or repetitive tasks.

  • Standardization of Database Administration Across Platforms: Concur is working to standardize how databases are administered across all platforms.  This is accomplished by implementation of cross-platform tools such as SolarWinds for database monitoring.

  • Improvements to Database Performance: We emphasize proactive involvement with developers and infrastructure experts in identifying opportunities for enhancing performance of our databases.

  • Improvements to the Database Implementation Lifecycle:  Continual service improvement, including outreach efforts to the development, QA, product management, and service management teams, is a focus for Concur.


In order to accomplish this you will need to:



  • Identify opportunities for improving efficiency in database administration, enhance the performance of our databases, improve our database implementation strategy, and improve how we provide database expertise to other internal Concur teams.

  • Mentor and lead a team of database administrators located in multiple European countries.

  • Foster communication and teamwork between the Europe-based DBAs and their counterparts in the United States.

jobs.title: Development Manager
jobs.content:
Join Concur and lead a talented team of world-class IT professionals who are on a mission to reinvent our next generation of tools to provide rapid deployment and testing; help to Automate, Audit and configure Cloud services all around the world. Work in an agile team to build and maintain our scalable SaaS offering in our internal and external environment.

In the first 12 months you will:



  • Make an impact: Continue to evolve our CI/CD process with Kubernetes and Docker to provide automation at every stage

  • Write scripts, implement new tools and deploy software that delivers great experience to our 85+ R&D teams globally

  • Lead and manage a team of experienced developers and operation engineers to provide the next generation of automation in a fast paced agile environment and bring in great service with stable features. 


In order to accomplish this you will:



  • Take quality seriously: We work on our projects end-to-end, being responsible for the output and quality of these services

  • Use interesting tools: like Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  • Contribute: to CI and CD architecture and new components design

  • Be an Agile Team Lead: work with Product Managers and other technology organization to deliver on requirements and increase the adoption of tools.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for Senior Ruby on Rails Developer who have deep knowledge and hands-on experience. Beyond the required technical ability, we are looking for an individual with a “just do it” attitude, a passion for building awesome stuff and a love of disrupting industries.


What you'll be doing



  • Developing and owning the most critical parts of our system 

  • Writing code that can work at a massive scale

  • You will be working on all areas of the technology stack

  • Direct participation in the decision making process
