Make history in the digital team of REWE International AG at the new digital site in Vienna (1120, Euro Plaza)


Ensure quality in life on a daily basis right at the point where all the pieces come together: at the central companies of REWE International AG. Become a part of the Austrian market leader in food and drugstore retail and seize your chance to shape the REWE BOW with us.


In our newly founded and strongly growing unit RIAG Digital in Vienna, we pool the entire technological advancement of all online activities of REWE International AG. We want to become the leading provider of online solutions in all relevant markets.


Your responsibilities:



  • Architecture, specification and optimisation of long-term, internationally applicable IT solutions

  • Stabilisation and enhancement of scalable, highly available micro services

  • Planning and development of existing and new modules in an agile Environment


Our offer:



  • Cutting-edge development hardware

  • Active development work in one of the currently most exciting digital projects of a leader in retail and tourism in Europe

  • Dynamic start-up atmosphere with all benefits the above-mentioned leading retail enterprise has to offer

  • Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths

  • Possibilities in continued education and training plus flexible work hours

  • An annual gross salary from € 45,000.- (the actual salary will be based on qualification and prior employment times)

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Blacklane provides an outstanding ground travel experience in over 200 cities and 50 countries worldwide. Our success comes from a collaboration of nearly 200 people from 40 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us! Help us solve the challenges of moving travelers around the world and support a thriving community of professional drivers.


Senior Backend Developer (Ruby or Javascript) (f/m)


Your challenge:



  • Develop our exciting and innovative product in a large market based on in-house software solutions covering mobile apps and diverse tailor-made platforms.

  • You will be part of a motivated, open-minded and nerd-friendly team determined to improve ground transportation.

  • We use, support and like to write open source software: 


    • https://github.com/troessner/reek

    • https://github.com/isaiah/jubilee

    • https://github.com/lipanski/slow-down


  • You can freely choose your workstation (MacBook Air or Pro / Lenovo Thinkpad).


About you:



  • Proven work experience with Ruby or Javascript.

  • Interest in other programming languages like Elixir, Go or Rust.

  • You know your HTTP codes better than your Pokémon and have some experience with using and or developing APIs.

  • You are test-driven (Rspec, Capybara), quality-minded (code reviews and pair programming) and put emphasis on agile development (Kanban, Scrum).

  • Experience in Ansible is a plus, but not mandatory.

  • Fluent in English, any additional language is a plus.

  • You are highly motivated and passionate about programming, you are a team player and you think things through on your own and can convincingly present alternative approaches based on your expert level in team discussions.

  • You show organizational and communication skills and the ability to prioritize your workload.


More than a job:



  • You will work in the exciting and innovative market of global ground transportation.

  • You will become part of an unique, international and professional team, that is characterized by flat hierarchies, a family-like atmosphere, flexible working hours and an open feedback culture.

  • You will have the tremendous opportunity to grow with us and develop your skills, supported by our talent training team.

  • You will work in a modern office with a variety of fresh fruits and drinks, regular company & team events and a lot of fun games.

  • We will support you in visa, relocation and other administrative issues.


If you want to be a part of an award-winning company that promises a consistently exceptional experience around the world, please apply through our contact form. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Tech Lead - Business Systems
jobs.content:
To support the rapid growth of Trustpilot, we’re looking for a talented Tech Lead to join our agile Business Systems team in Copenhagen.  As our new Tech Lead, you’ll be responsible for guiding the agile team and working on various cross-organizational projects, such as enabling our subscription process. You’ll do this by closely interacting with business leaders from Accounting, Finance, HR, Legal and other business areas within Trustpilot.


Your Role:



  • Guide the team on self organization to continuously improve the team’s technical level and to ensure the most relevant results are delivered

  • Take the lead on overall architectural choices within Business Systems, in close cooperation with our Business Systems Architects

  • Team up with fellow Tech Leads throughout the company to ensure that we follow best practices and introduce new technologies and ways of working

  • Work closely with your Product Manager to facilitate the frequent discovery sessions

  • Collaborate with business project leaders throughout the organization on needs and ideas

  • Develop software to streamline and automate business processes; as well as maintain them and track results

jobs.title: Public Cloud & DevOps Consultant
jobs.content:
Since 2011, Nordcloud has been on a mission to help people embrace the cloud. To do that we're looking for Cloud Archtitects to join our world class team and help our customers gain the maximum benefits of the cloud.


At Nordcloud you'll get the chance to work with leading technologies as we partner with the premier global cloud platform infrastructure providers, including Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure. With a great set of colleagues across our offices in Amsterdam, London, Stockholm, Malmö, Munich, Oslo, and Helsinki, together we will tackle a wide range of challenging customer projects to drive and support Europe's leading cloud consultancy expansion.


Why Nordcloud as your next career move?


We offer a full-time position as a Cloud Architect in our small and fast growing team in Bjørvika, in the heart of Oslo.


Oslo is currently one of the fastest-growing cities in Europe. Situated between mountain ranges and at the head of the beautiful Oslofjord, the city has everything to offer in terms of outdoor activities. The recent years’ boom in everything from underground music, niche art, tasty microbrewery beers, the vibrant tech community with lots of meetup groups and several hacker- and makerspaces, means there is always something to do. The Oslo office is the fastest growing in the company.


As one of our Cloud Architects you will, together with our experts in cloud technology who come from various backgrounds, work on projects of varying duration, complexity and technical environments. You will also have a chance to work with a variety of high-profile customers from several industries.


Day-to-day work can be anything from implementing configuration management infrastructure, to taking a step back and giving design recommendations to a technical team.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Quantitative Developer to join our team. 


Key responsibilities include:



  • Adding functionality to major software modules such as Backtester or Regression-Platform.

  • Maintaining the central database.

  • Handling market data connectivity.

  • Translating code from MATLAB to Python.

  • Maintaining server infrastructure.


Other information: 



  • Contract type: Permanent / Fixed-term / Temporary.

  • Contract hours: Part-time / Full-time.

  • Salary: Competitive.

  • Start-date: ASAP.

jobs.title: Quality Architect
jobs.content:
Ticketmaster is looking for a new member of its Enterprise Architecture group. Reporting directly to the Chief Architect, and working closely with senior members of all Product, Engineering and Technical Operations teams, you will define the standards that foster a culture of quality. You will guide standards and best practices company-wide and ensure their application to both software delivery and development.


This is not a line-management role: you will be working with and through your peers in order to implement a shared vision of Quality throughout the organisation.


If you have the track record that proves your ability to execute, your clear communication and analytical skills, your hands-on experience, and deep knowledge of the practices that produce measurable improvements in quality at scale, we look forward to receiving your application.


This is a six months fixed term position, however the role may be extended.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you the next QA Engineer we’re looking for? Join the Ticketmaster team to help us develop our next generation platforms, services and APIs. We are on the hunt for confident, enthusiastic, star QA Engineers, who are quality focused, forward thinking, innovative and enjoy finding new approaches to challenging technical or commercial problems.


The future of accessing live events starts here. We provide our Software as a Service to clients to enable fans access to tickets and events across multiple platforms 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Our systems work at scale; handling tens of thousands of concurrent users, selling thousands of tickets for massive sporting, music, multi-show stadium, touring, festivals and thousands of smaller events globally. Every large event on-sale is a Black Friday for us and enabling 1000s of people access in to events efficiently is equally challenging. Working at this scale and keeping up with rapidly changing technology ensures that even the most innovative person will be consistently challenged and pushed to develop new solutions in a highly collaborative, cross functional and diverse organisation.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you the next senior front end engineers we’re looking for? Join the Ticketmaster team to help us design, build and scale a new generation of products and services with the latest technology like ES6, React and Node. Working with a talented pool of engineers, architects and UX experts in a DevOps culture, you’ll help guide and deliver the engineering vision with a special appreciation for crafting exceptional user experiences.


The future of accessing live events starts here. We provide our Software as a Service to clients to enable fans access to tickets across multiple platforms 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Our systems work at scale; handling tens of thousands of concurrent users, selling thousands of tickets for massive sporting, music, multi-show stadium, touring, festivals and thousands of smaller events globally. Every large event on-sale is a Black Friday for us. Working at this scale and keeping up with rapidly changing technology ensures that even the most innovative person will be consistently challenged and pushed to develop new solutions in a highly collaborative and diverse organisation.


Responsibilities 



  • Take technical ownership of the front end code base and best practice.

  • Create clean, testable JavaScript for dynamic high performance websites.

  • Build cutting edge UI for multiple devices.

  • Drive standards in performance, scalability and reliability.

  • Share knowledge through workshops, documentation, code reviews and coaching.

  • Follow software development best practice.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Tickethour a leading Ticketing provider, is seeking a professional to cover the following opening: Senior DevOps Engineer


Your Role


DevOps Automation Engineer will be a member of team responsible to design and implement automated dynamic environments to support the needs of delivery teams in both host – and cloud – based infrastructure. Candidates should also have the ability to analyse, design, implement and validate strategies for continuous deployment demonstrating strong collaboration skills with functional and technical teams for delivering existing or new types of services.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Software Developer


Do you enjoy working in a team setting on the full stack, from GUIs to servers to databases, taking correctness, stability and scalability into consideration? Are you experienced in C++, Python, C# or Java and do you consider yourself a polyglot? Then you might be our new Software Developer.


IT at Optiver
Since trading on the floor changed to screen-based trading, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best IT-professionals to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. The atmosphere we are working in is fast, but exciting. This makes IT at Optiver a great challenge whereby expertise, innovation and fun go hand in hand every day.


What you'll do
As our new Software Developer, you will be developing systems which will be used by our traders and control departments in a fast moving trading environment. Since we deal with a lot of data, many users and multiple systems, you will be exposed to multithreading, concurrency, performance profiling and optimization. You will be responsible for the full development lifecycle, where you will get a lot of freedom to decide on code base, technology and architecture. The more knowledge you gain about the business, the more opportunity you get to partner with the business. You will need your analytical skills to advise the business about legislation, rules and regulations and other documentation. With direct access to end users, you will see your results in production and get immediate feedback. You will be part of an agile team and you will get a chance to work with the latest technologies on the latest applications and learn from highly educated and experienced colleagues.

jobs.title: Trading Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Trading Software Engineer


Do you want to add value to our trading business? Enjoy working on a variety of products across the stack? Do you not shy away from taking full responsibility over your products and seeing immediate results and feedback on your hard work? Are you master of your craft? Then you might be our new Trading Software Engineer.


IT at Optiver
Since trading on the floor changed to screen-based trading, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best IT-professionals to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. The atmosphere we are working in is fast, but exciting. This makes IT at Optiver a great challenge whereby expertise, innovation and fun go hand in hand every day.


What you'll do
Being part of our Trading Technology team means you are responsible for the full stack of applications required to run the trading business. Activities range from developing ultra-low-latency exchange protocol encoders and decoders, writing and fine-tuning our automated trading strategies, to helping our monitoring and analysis effort by creating and extending user interfaces to provide the traders with more information and control. You will be interacting closely with our traders and researchers constantly. Sitting on the trading floor frequently you will be amidst the action, getting instant feedback on the results of your work. As you prove your worth you will gain more and more responsibility and freedom.

jobs.title: C++ Core Applications Developer
jobs.content:
Technology at Optiver
In order to be successful in our trading domain, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best technologists to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. With 12 datacenters and thousands of servers we run ten thousands of trading components executing hundred thousands of trades every day. These systems produce a lot of data that needs to be wrangled to turn it into valuable information for different areas of the business.


What you’ll do
As member of the Core Applications team you will be focusing on the infrastructural and strategic components of our software landscape. We provide the rock-solid software backbone on which the business relies every single day, and we lay out the technical arena in which the trading-focused development teams can continue to innovate.
 
As developer in our team you will not only be challenged on your technical knowledge and skills, but also on your capacity for producing simple and elegant solutions in face of a hectic and ever changing business environment

jobs.title: Technical Application Specialist
jobs.content:
Do you get excited about designing, implementing and managing Microsoft based communication platforms? Are you the person that will make our business applications as cutting edge as our trading applications? As a Technical Application Specialist you could be part of the team which owns the Optiver IT business systems on premise and in the cloud. 



What you'll do
As a Technical Application Specialist you will work closely with the business to understand their needs and translate those into strategic technical solutions. You will show the business how to make the most of the systems they use. Within our team you will have the freedom to lead projects and work independently, but you will also co-ordinate, communicate and work in partnership with other technical teams to deliver cross platform distributed solutions. As our new Technical Application Specialist you will bring expertise in Microsoft Exchange / Office 365 and Lync / Skype for business to optimize our use of these platforms. Furthermore, you will liaise with Global counterparts in our Sydney and Chicago offices to contribute to the innovation of solutions in and around your core competencies.
In short, as our new Technical Application Specialist you will be:



  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of our Microsoft applications like AD, Exchange, ADFS;

  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of video conferencing with Skype for Business;

  • Responsible for managing daily operations including fixing incidents and solving technical problems;

  • Automate these daily operations as much as possible with PowerShell.

jobs.title: Java/Spring Developer To Work on Articles
jobs.content:
We’re looking for Java/Spring Developer to work on creating technical articles.

Budget and Time Commitment
========================
Article budgets are simple:

Level 1 (OK article - editorial work needed)
750-1000 words – 35$
1000-1250 words – 40$
1250-1500 words – 45$
1500-1750 words – 50$
...

Level 2 (good article - almost ready to publish)
750-1000 words – 40$
1000-1250 words – 45$
1250-1500 words – 50$
1500-1750 words – 55$
...

Level 3 (very good article - ready to publish)
750-1000 words – 45$
1000-1250 words – 50$
1250-1500 words – 55$
1500-1750 words – 60$
...

Additional budget levels you can access based on experience and a few other factors.
In terms of time commitment, a good target is one article a week - but that’s very flexible (as long as our  communication is good).


About the article (+ some examples)
=============================
We’ll usually pick articles out of the existing content calendar of the site (based on the areas you want to work in). You can also suggest your own topics as well.

Here are a few examples of topics:
Using the Spring @Scheduled annotation
Spring JDBC Pagination
Sorting in Hibernate
Spring Data Redis introduction

And here are a few finished article examples:
http://www.baeldung.com/spring-data-rest-intro
http://www.baeldung.com/spring-data-elasticsearch-queries
http://www.baeldung.com/registration-verify-user-by-email
http://www.baeldung.com/2013/01/31/exception-handling-for-rest-with-spring-3-2/

jobs.title: Senior Cloud Architect
jobs.content:
• Performs architecture design of the services and shared component framework that hosts a set of components, as well as the functional and foundational services of the Avid Everywhere Platform using an API and event-driven methodology.

  • Translates product, business and design into architectural requirements to evolve the core platform architecture, as well as its use to meet platform, product and workflow goals.

  • Formulates object models and API design and provide comprehensive documents.

  • Drives innovation into successful productization with proof of concepts and technological reviews and assessments.

  • Works directly with and in Engineering scrum teams for design tasks and ensure alignment with architectural decisions.

  • Interacts with senior level industry and customer leaders to drive the adoption of best practices and innovations.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer -  Help build Smart Cities!
jobs.content:
Who we are!
Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry. Our products are used every day by commuters in the UK, Boston, New York, Los Angeles, Athens and other major cities around the world, affecting millions of journeys every year and making waiting in line for tickets a thing of the past.


Our mission is to create stress-free, frictionless journeys for passengers and help streamline operations for transport agencies. We improve daily life around the globe by simplifying the way people move around cities. We strive to make the world a better place – one ride at a time.


The IT Operations Team


In IT Operations we follow an “Infrastructure as code” philosophy to deploy and manage the many servers that allow commuters all around the world to buy their tickets on their mobile phones. We recognise that this is a really big responsibility and we are proud and excited to be able to make such a big impact on people’s daily lives.


We love our devs! They are an awesome bunch that feel the same way about our product as we do, so we try our best to give them all the support and tools they need to deliver this world changing product. We don’t like getting in the way, so in general we try to enable others to do things themselves, by automating as much as possible and giving them the buttons to push. This isn’t easy because the environment needs to be PCI compliant, but we see that as a cool challenge, and so far we are doing great!


We also love AWS. AWS services like EC2 and RDS allow us to do so much with so little, so we use it as much as possible and try avoid deploying anything to our in-house VMware cluster. We also like Docker – we don’t love it yet, but who knows :)


We have a lot of fun in Ops, mostly laughing at with each other about stupid things, but when the business needs us, we are there for them. We believe that it is our personal responsibility to ensure that our commuter friends in Boston or Athens or New York are able to ride the train/bus with our app, so we do everything that it takes to ensure that
happens.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer - Help Build Smart Cities
jobs.content:
Who we are!
Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry. Our products are used every day by commuters in the UK, Boston, New York, Los Angeles, Athens and other major cities around the world, affecting millions of journeys every year and making waiting in line for tickets a thing of the past.


Our mission is to create stress-free, frictionless journeys for passengers and help streamline operations for transport agencies. We improve daily life around the globe by simplifying the way people move around cities. We strive to make the world a better place – one ride at a time.


The Opportunity


As a member of our Hub team you will have a unique opportunity to interact with most of the systems that make up Masabi’s JustRide platform. Whether that is our retail server that allows customers to purchase tickets, or our validation devices that check if tickets are valid (like gate scanners or handheld devices), the continuous flow of data presents a number of very interesting challenges. How do we store it? How do we search it? How do we visualise it? And how can we help our customers make sense from the data and drive high value, highly visible changes to their transit networks?


If you enjoy being in the thick of it, co-operating with a multitude of very talented engineers and driving a product forward, Hub is the team for you.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile Security
jobs.content:
You will join our team developing security solutions for Samsung OS mobile devices. You will be working within an established team which specialises in the development of Security solutions. You will be responsible for providing expertise in the area of mobile security vulnerability analysis and solution development to strengthen overall device security.


As you will be working in a team, it is essential to have good inter-personal and communications skills.


This role requires strong understanding of Mobile Security including latest technologies and processes. You will assist remaining team in understanding underlying process and options.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Linux Platform
jobs.content:
We are looking for an enthusiastic engineer with strong graphics software development background in embedded systems. The candidate will contribute to the window system integration, optimisation and enhancement of GPU device drivers for Samsung mobile and wearable devices running Tizen operating system. Tizen 2.4 has X11 window system and Tizen 3.0 is based on Wayland. 


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to develop and maintain a wide understanding of all Linux based platforms including the graphics components that can be used in Samsung devices and to provide high level technical input to architectural designs. You will be expected to liaise with GPU vendors to ensure that Tizen products are the highest performing in their class.

jobs.title: Game Ecosystem Engineer
jobs.content:
Working as a Senior Engineer, your main responsibility is to facilitate development of games and other heavily graphical applications on Samsung’s Android-based mobile products. The Ecosystem team exists to ensure that Samsung’s software and hardware systems are easily accessible to developers and offer a world-class experience in terms of performance and ease of development.


The role of Ecosystem Engineer within the Ecosystem group includes taking senior technical responsibility for the tasks allocated and providing a competent level of technical authority in one or more technical skill areas within the group.


An important part of the job will be building relationships with external parties such as game developers and related companies. You must be comfortable with presenting technical data and advice to developers and will be expected to collect and prioritise their issues and concerns so that Samsung can provide advice and solutions.


You will be involved in incubating new projects, which may involve feasibility, design and prototyping work across the complete range of mobile software platforms and applications used by Samsung, its suppliers and customers.


You will be responsible for performing all, or part, of the software development cycle (from Analysis, Specification, Designing, Documentation, Implementation, Verification and Commercialization Support) for a given area of software development (Android). A particular focus will be on optimisation and improvement of the software stack to support high-performance graphics applications.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to develop and maintain a wide understanding of all Linux based platforms including the graphics components that can be used in Mobile devices and to provide high level technical input to architectural designs within the Core Graphics group and other groups within Samsung.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Digital TV
jobs.content:
SRUK designs and develops key components of Samsung’s flat panel digital television product range. Our software is deployed in products destined for European and sometimes worldwide markets. We have many years of experience with traditional DVB broadcast systems and considerable expertise in interactive TV and IPTV technologies.


As the Television revolution continues then the next generation of Televisions will become increasingly Web-centric in their operation and the Web browser becomes the key technology component. SRUK are looking to grow their existing Web browser development technology team.


Ideally we are looking for people with extensive and comprehensive knowledge of the WebKit or Blink source code. Developers with exceptional C++ skills that have an enthusiasm for WebKit/Blink and Open Source are encouraged to send their resumes. Successful candidates would become part of the Web Browser Team and would perform tasks including the following



  • Development and enhancement of the Blink based browser and related Web-platform technologies for Samsung TV platform.

  • Working with/in the Open Source community

  • Analysis and design parts of a digital television system, which may range from the user interface to the driver level. The majority of this software shall be designed using a combination of MS Word documents and UML2 (with a variety of tools). Good written English skills are essential.

  • Implement these designs in various embedded systems to a high standard. The majority of this software shall be implemented in C++.

  • Ensure that work packages meet requirements, pass quality standards and are integrated with other parts of the system.

  • Report to the project manager for project planning, budgeting etc.

  • Assist other team members with their work.

  • Assist in identifying staff training and development needs.

  • Assist in identifying the need for recruitment of additional members of the team.

  • All work is to be of a professional standard, paying due regard to safety, efficiency, cost

  • Excellent knowledge of the Web Engine (WebKit or Blink) code base. Ideally an active contributor  to the appropriate open source community (reviewer/committer)

jobs.title: Talent Mgt & Strategy Specialist
jobs.content:
Position Summary

Our Team
Global Talent Management & Operations (GTM&O) is the connective tissue between on-air and digital series Talent and the global businesses of Discovery Communications to effectively and efficiently manage their business strategy, prioritize their activities outside of Production, align with Production, and optimize global operations.

 

As the Talent’s key relationship holder with Discovery Communications, GTM&O strategically manages relationships with Talent, their representatives, production and internal clients to onboard, coach, advocate, enhance, prioritize and leverage the Talent to drive business value for ratings, revenue, relationships, renewals and brands.


The Role
The Specialist position will reside in the Global Talent Management & Operations (GTMO) group and offer operational support for the Manager and department for Animal Planet and Science. GTMO serves to mentor network on-camera Talent, advise the respective networks on all Talent related issues, trouble shoot Talent issues, and focus on the business of Talent branding to maximize their opportunities worldwide.

Responsibilities

1. Actively engage the Talent early on and build and maintain strong relationships with network Talent, providing them with ongoing guidance and mentorship. Be aware of and appropriately acknowledge milestones in the Talents' personal and professional lives.
2. Remain knowledgeable of the talent’s personal and professional lives e.g. deal terms, personalities, interests, likes, dislikes, skills, expertise, etc., and apply this insight to successfully execute responsibilities.
3. Work closely with and build relationships with relevant internal (e.g. international communications, production, production management, business affairs, etc.) and external parties (e.g. production companies, managers, agents, etc.) to ensure a 360 degree Talent Management strategy.
4. Track and help manage internal requests from network teams and support groups, as well as external requests from partners, clients, and third parties for various Talent across the organization.
5. Support overall operational workflow of team initiatives and tasks led by Manager. Implement and maintain evolving processes and procedure to ensure group efficiency.
6. Coordinate with the Talent Operations group to maintain the Talent information databases, including updating Talent and representative contact information.
7. Attend internal meetings as needed to represent Talent team, learn, contribute and report back on Talent related requests and issues.
8. Arrange travel itineraries and prepare/process travel for Talent.
9. Research and arrange gifting for Talent and other external parties as needed.
10. Perform other administrative and related duties as assigned.

 

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree with a focus in communications, marketing, general business or media related field
 Extremely detail-oriented with the ability to manage and prioritize a spectrum of projects while meeting various deadlines in an ever-changing environment
Excellent administrative, critical reasoning, and problem-solving skills
 Excellent work ethic and eagerness to learn about entertainment/talent business
Proven written and verbal communications skills
 Proficient computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)
Ability and willingness to travel when needed
 Four years of work experience in entertainment, Talent management/relations, administrative and/or event management
Experience managing needs of VIPs
 Eagerness to contribute and thrive in a fast-paced, high profile, deadline driven, results oriented and environment
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and strong business judgment
 Ability to read and understand Talent contract language
* Must have the legal right to work in the United States

jobs.title: SVP - Marketing
jobs.content:
Position Summary

The SVP, Marketing is part of the chief commercial organization, which is responsible for monetizing Discovery’s intellectual property. This role leads the development of branding and creative for the divisions that are part of the CCO organization. Additionally, this position oversees all strategic and creative campaigns across the sales, digital and Discovery Global Enterprises (DGE) organizations to ensure maximum revenue potential.

Responsibilities

1. Determine marketing strategies for the CCO organization based on the ad sales, digital and DGE business strategies and priorities.
2. Lead the Ad Sales, Digital and DGE marketing teams.
3. Direct, lead and motivate multi-disciplinary teams.
4. High-level face-to-face interaction with clients and internal teams.
5. Provide thoughtful creative leadership that impacts the teams’ way of conducting business on a day-to-day and long-term basis.
6. Produce intelligent and on-strategy creative solutions that reflects brand personality of Discovery, business partners and clients.
7. Work with sales, digital and DGE to maximize revenue potential of all initiatives.
8. Develop creative strategy for large events and experiences
9. Oversee the creation of formats, budgets, and staffing requirements

Requirements

Candidate must have at least 15-20 years of creative ideation and strategic execution experience within the advertising industry
 In-depth knowledge of TV, digital and social landscape
Experience connecting consumers with brands
 Experience leading creative teams
New York based
 Strong relationships within production
Agency experience a plus
 Some travel will be required
College degree required
 Must have the legal right to work in the United States

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:



  • Perform fundamental and applied machine learning in large-scale distributed analysis, streaming data analysis, time-series and feature discovery

  • Create predictive models for user behavior using any and all data available in our clusters

  • Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning models (e.g. predictive, forecasting, clustering) using proven and experimental techniques

  • Work with engineering to implement predictive models in production environment

  • Initiate high impact data science projects and with actionable outcomes

  • Provide expertise on concepts for machine learning and applied analytics for the data team and inspire the adoption of data science across the breadth of our organization

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content: We are searching for Front End Developers to join our Camp in Melbourne, evolving the JavaScript and Sass/CSS within our codebase. Our flagship application is built with Ruby on Rails, and with modern ES6/ReactJS powering all the new front-end features we have in the works. You love crafting beautifully designed and intuitive user experiences, and you believe that creating well tested, clean code is just as important for the front end as the back end. You enjoy being surrounded by talented engineers, learning from others, as well as contributing to their development. To top it off, we hope you’ll share our passion for culture and changing the world of work for the better. We are an inclusive development team that uses lightweight Agile processes to contribute to the codebase. We use Git and an automated CI setup for builds, which include a growing JavaScript test suite. We review each others’ pull requests. We believe in automation over repetition, and aim to make our code and infrastructure modular and reusable.

jobs.title: Associate Agent - North (Independent Contractor)

You own your own schedule and you can work as much or as little as you'd like, provided we've got the demand in your area.

Who You Are:

jobs.title: Treasury Manager
jobs.content:
Job Description

Are you an experienced Treasury Manager with a rock-solid work ethic, a good sense of humor, and mind-blowing attention to detail? If so, we’ve got a home for you on our world-class Treasury team. Our newest Treasury Manager will join a team that is responsible for looking after cash and liquidity management, investing, and foreign currency risk management activities at Atlassian. You will be responsible for daily cash positioning and cash flow forecasting, intercompany funding activities, month-end journal entries and reconciliations, and bank account management. You will also play an instrumental role in driving treasury management system implementation, developing and managing Treasury reporting, handling internal and external audit requests, as well as managing special Treasury projects. We love our teams at Atlassian, and you can expect to partner with multiple cross-functional teams. You'll also work with the broader finance team, including accounting, FP&A, tax, and external stakeholders.

More about you

On your first day, we’ll expect you to have:

  • 5+ years of experience in international treasury operations and cash management at a multinational company
  • Ability to work independently and problem solve
  • Strong critical thinking, organizational, interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills
  • Experience and comfortable working in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment
  • Treasury management system implementation experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or business related field

It’s great but not required, if you have:

  • Experience in the software industry
  • MBA, CTP or CFA

More about the team

You would be joining a team that is super smart and very direct. We ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are a talented, collaborative team with a stellar mix of industry, operational, and Big Four experience. We’re not afraid to take on the big problems and innovate. Growing, learning, and adapting is at our core.

More about the perks

Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including beer and bubbly), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage for you and your family, 401k matching and more.

More about Atlassian

Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With more than 50,000 global customers (including 85 of the Fortune 100) and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like JIRA, Confluence and HipChat–and we’re just getting started. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.

Atlassian. Powered by You.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Atlassian, Inc., will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art.49.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world through the power of software and we are looking for a technical wizard to help Synchrony's development team. Synchrony is the engine behind Confluence's co-editing feature. 


As a Senior Developer, you’ll be crafting and implementing with the team a data synchronisation service for tree data structures using operational transformation on a large scale. All the hard problem of OT with nested tree data, n-squared complexity issue, support of key-value maps and many other challenges are solved in Synchrony. 


We are supported by robust deployment systems, mature algorithmic solutions, and an experienced team with a strong desire to build the best synchronisation technology out there. Think Nasa launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting children born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. You'll need a strong technical prowess with incredible coding ability across a diverse set of languages and technologies. 


What you do 

  • Solve challenging problem with simple, elegant solutions

  • Deep dive into operational transformation algorithms

  • Possess authority in performance, scalability and service system architecture

  • Work on a leading technology to enable more real-time collaboration across different types of applications


 Basic Qualifications 



  • 5+ years of functional programming experience (Clojure, Haskell, Scala, ...)

  • Experience building scalable, high performance systems that are highly available

  • Strong functional programming fundamentals

  • Ability to rapidly self-train on new technologies

  • Knowledge of web-based applications and architecture

  • Real passion for solving complex problems


Preferred Qualifications

  • Clojure experience

  • Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field

  • Familiarity with eventual consistency systems

  • Experience building on AWS

  • Experience evaluating and adopting new technologies

  • Good communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences



Atlassian. Powered by you.




We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
What You Get To Do

  • Your life’s work. Use your WordPress, HTML, CSS and jQuery skills to grow our audience and make a difference in the lives of thousands of people every day. You’ll do this by working with our marketing and growth team, copywriters and designers to develop web pages that people can’t resist.
  • You’ll get to develop variations of sales pages and new lead capture landing pages, develop responsive pages and update and maintain our website. You do this with the cleanest code, that’s cross-browser compatible and on brand.
  • Have balance in your life. You get to work from home, so long as home is in Canada. Without a commute, you get to dive right into your personal life. You get to spend more time with family and friends, doing the things you love to do.

    • Our Ideal Candidate

  • Is experienced. You’re a bright, talented front end dev and have a few years of experience with WordPress, HTML, CSS and jQuery. You know how to build for mobile devices versus just poorly adapt, and code and test responsive HTML emails. If there’s something you don’t know, you’re willing to learn.
  • Is thorough. You are careful, conscientious and incredibly meticulous; you have an extremely high attention to detail. Yet, you don’t let it hold you back by getting bogged down.
  • Is collaborative. You like being part of a team that is respectful of each other, even in the face of disagreement. In fact, we encourage disagreement - it almost always results in a better approach. You proactively share information that the marketing team and designers need to move their work forward and likewise, you ask for info when you need it. When you have an opinion, you share it - we may not always integrate it, but we do value every one’s input equally.
  • Doesn’t mind repetition. You know the importance of our site performing well across browsers, browser versions and mobile devices and you don’t mind testing them all out to be sure everyone can access our content.
  • Owns the clock. You’re highly organized, know how to prioritize, adapt quickly when the scope changes, because it often will, and thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
  • Is flexible. You aren’t married to your ideas and you can shift gears easily when things change. You don’t sweat the small stuff and are focused on the bigger picture.
  • Welcomes feedback. You consider feedback a useful tool that gives you opportunity to learn, grow and benefit the project. You don’t view it as an attack.
  • Works hard to make a difference. This isn’t just another website. You get to work on interesting projects and solve complex problems that transform people’s lives. You’re proud of the work you do and you’re willing to do whatever it takes to get it done.
  • Likes to help out. It’s not all about you. Whenever a team member needs a hand, you make time for them, and they do the same for you.
  • Is self-motivated and can work independently. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don’t need a lot of direction. You are a self-starter and prefer mentorship over management. You have a thirst for learning and applying the latest and greatest so that you can continually hone your craft.
  • Has worked remotely. You are highly organized, have strong self-structure and discipline and have worked remotely either currently or in the past so you know the benefits and the challenges.
  • Knows that we really mean what we say. Being part of our team is a privilege. Yep, that’s a bold statement. Not only do you have to have the skills, you need to be a great fit for the team and care about what we do. So, if it feels like we’re putting you through the wringer during the hiring process, it’s because we want to find the right person who gets it and really wants to be here.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Designer
jobs.content:
What You Get to Do

Help thousands of people live healthier, happier lives. At PN our mission is life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching for everyone. You’re a big part of the for everyone. Your job isn’t to just make things pretty. You’ll need to use your creativity and design skills to expand our reach to new audiences. You’ll do this by working with our marketing and growth team, copywriters and front-end developers to design digital content that people can’t resist.

You’ll get to design variations of sales pages and new lead capture landing pages, put together social ads, create email designs and custom graphics, develop e-book and .pdf packages, source images for our blog and update our website. You do this with the highest of quality while staying on brand.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Is committed to their craft. You were meant to be designer. It is your unique ability. You have exquisite design taste, take deep pride in your work and want to continually improve.
  • Wants to spread the word. You have a growth mindset. Not only do you identify with Carol Dweck’s research, you want to grow our organization’s reach. You are all about results. You are constantly challenging yourself to come up with ideas that will drive increased leads and conversions so that we can help more people eat, move and live better.
  • Owns the clock. You’re highly organized, know how to prioritize, adapt quickly when the scope changes, because it often will, and thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
  • Welcomes constructive criticism. This is a very iterative process and many of your ideas won’t work. When you get feedback, you don’t take it personally or view it as an attack, even when you’ve poured hours into a project. You view it as an opportunity to learn, grow and make things better.
  • Is thorough. You are careful, conscientious and incredibly meticulous; some may even call you nitpicky - in an endearing way, of course! Yet, you don’t let it hold you back by getting bogged down with perfecting pixels.
  • Is flexible. You aren’t married to your ideas and you can shift gears easily when things change. You don’t sweat the small stuff and are focused on the bigger picture.
  • Likes to help out. It’s not all about you. Whenever a team member needs a hand, you make time for them, and they do the same for you.
  • Is self-motivated and can work independently. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don’t need a lot of direction. You are a self-starter and prefer mentorship over management.
  • Leaves their ego at the door. You have integrity, talent, confidence, are genuinely excited about the future and aren’t a show off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism and excessive "constructive criticism" are out.
  • Has worked remotely and lives in Canada. You get to work from home, so long as home is in Canada. You have strong self-structure and discipline and have worked remotely either currently or in the past so you know the benefits and the challenges.
  • Knows that we really mean what we say. Being part of our team is a privilege. Yep, that’s a bold statement. Not only do you have to have the skills, you need to be a great fit for the team and care about what we do. So, if it feels like we’re putting you through the wringer during the hiring process, it’s because we want to find the right person who gets it and really wants to be here.

    • Life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching. That’s our mission at Precision Nutrition.

    As an organization, we:

    • Pay in the top 10% in the world for each position.
    • Seek and support diversity.
    • Offer 4 weeks paid time-off, benefits, and the ability to work remotely in Canada.
    • Set you up with whatever fancy gear you need to perform at your best.
    • Give you the flexibility to make your own schedule.

    Not only that, but if you join us you can:

    • Work in the fitness and nutrition industry. We love exercise, we love nutrition, and we love sport. That’s why we started this company. If you do too, you’ll appreciate how rare it is to find a career you really love. For active, fit people, Precision Nutrition is that opportunity.
    • Work with fun, bright, and talented people. We’re a small company, and we’re picky about who we work with, because to us, this isn’t just a job; it’s our life.

jobs.title: User Experience Designer
jobs.content:
Blackbox is hiring a User Experience Designer who wants to help us build tools for independent artists, customers, and warehouses.

The ideal candidate is excited to deeply understand complicated problems and contribute holistically to solving them. We’re interested in hiring well-rounded people with hobbies and side projects who are curious about learning new things and contributing to our culture in unexpected ways. We are committed to diversity and especially encourage members of underrepresented communities to apply.

The technology we’ve built so far has shipped the most-backed Kickstarter game in history, sold over 10,000 Cards Against Humanity Trump Bug-Out bags in under two hours, distributed 30,000 pieces of cow poo, and helps our clients run their successful small businesses.

This is a full-time position based in Chicago, IL with benefits including full health and dental and generous vacation. We work out of our wonderful co-working space full of other amazing artists, developers, game designers, photographers, and the occasional dog.

Responsibilities

  • Create thoughtful and appropriate solutions to design challenges while collaborating with developers, designers, and account managers
  • Conduct user research to define opportunities and assess solutions
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, personas, user flows, and process flows to support the design process
  • Help create the product roadmap that will guide the company for the years to come
  • Translate research and business requirements into wireframes, mockups, and prototypes

Skills and Qualifications

  • A minimum of three years experience designing usable experiences for both desktop and mobile
  • Understanding of user interface design, interaction design principles, and human factors
  • High attention to detail, including proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
  • Be collaborative and articulate. Be able to clearly explain your design choices, but value the feedback of your team
  • Adept at rapid prototyping, from pencil and paper to Axure/InVision
  • Ability to create wireframes and mockups

jobs.title: PALS Radar Technician
jobs.content:
The selected candidate will provide technical support for the AN/SPN-46(V) Precision Approach and Landing System (PALS) for US Navy Aircraft Carriers.

Initial responsibilities may include a training period of up to 6 months at Patuxent River Naval Air Station in Lexington Park, MD performing daily maintenance, troubleshooting, providing flight testing support and performing various certification test on the SPN-46(V) systems at the test bed on Patuxent River NAS.

Once training is complete the candidate will be part of the AN/SPN-46(V) Forward Deployed Fleet Support Team working out of the San Diego, CA office with responsibilities that will include:

  • Performing onsite and distance Technical Assistance to the Fleet in support of the AN/SPN-46(V)
  • Performing AN/SPN-46(V) Category I, II and III Certification Testing aboard CVN’s
  • Performing AN/SPN-46(V) C5RA testing aboard CVN’s
  • Providing OJT for fleet technicians
  • Fleet installation of system upgrades including Light Off/Installation Check Out and System Operational Verification Testing (SOVT)

These assignments include the performance of Fleet Support duties to include troubleshooting, maintenance, equipment installation, cable fabrication, fiber-optic cable installation, and other fleet support related requirements of U.S Navy Air Traffic Control approach and landing systems on board US Navy ships. The position will require working onboard US Navy Carriers as well as getting underway on US Navy vessels for periods of several weeks at a time.

Other responsibilities could include:

  • Assisting in resolving parts obsolescence issues
  • Developing ECP drawing packages
  • Developing Test Plans and Procedures
  • Supporting Environmental testing
  • Developing Field Change Bulletins
  • Updating existing drawings and test procedures

Thisposition is located in San Diego, CA. There is no relocation assistance available for this position. Applicants must be currently residing in orstate willingness to relocate self to San Diego or surroundingareas.

Pleasebe sure to address all requirements of posted requisition in resume. Onlyresumes that include all requirements will be considered. Required Skills and Education High School diploma

Completion of a technical school, trade school, or advanced armed services technical school curriculum or course of training in electricity, electronics, avionics, mechanics, or engineering technology OR Completion of at least thirty (30) semester hours of course studies at an accredited college or university in an engineering, scientific, or technical curriculum.

At least 10 years of experience in performing technician functions. At least 3 years of engineering technical functional experience shall have consisted of performing engineering/technical functions in Air Traffic Control Systems.

Ability to obtain a passport

Ability to lift bulky material, not to exceed 50 lbs

Ability to work onboard US Navy Ships, to include walking up and down multiple flights of stairs

Ability to obtain and maintain the required security clearance Preferred Skills and Education Military electronics training (Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Air Force or Coast Guard) in AN/SPN-, ASR-, SPS-, TPN-, TPS- or FPN- equipment.

Formal education in electronics theory and troubleshooting

System troubleshooting experience including the use of various types of test equipment

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That’s BAE Systems. That’s Inspired Work.

To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel. EEO Career Site Equal Opportunity Employer. jobs.title: IT Administrator
jobs.content:
This position will be part of a team responsible for supporting an exciting, mission critical applications and data science environment to understand and analyze a wide variety of information. This position is responsible supporting the production and test systems for a project’s Linux and Windows Server environments, which entails hands-on IT assignments requiring technical expertise necessary to implement systems administration strategies support leading edge research within a data intensive, environment.

This position has daily interaction with our customer, and as such requires customer focus. Effective communication skills, flexibility, a strong teamwork approach, and the desire to work in an exciting environment are necessary for success. Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Maintain existing development and production Windows Server & Linux Server systems as well as architect, document, test, and deploy new systems to support user requirements.
  • Responsible for building and maintaining documentation for production and development systems.
  • Responsible for documenting and rehearsing disaster recovery plans and procedures.
  • Ensure that all systems are maintained and updated to required patch levels throughout the lifecycle of the system, including configuration management through automation.
  • Write scripts to automate administrative functions and provide a more consistent work flow for the program.
  • Provide 2nd and 3rd Tier hardware and software support to end-users.
  • Respond to internal trouble ticket system requests to repair systems that are not performing correctly. Document repair in ticketing system, and if appropriate publish in the knowledgebase. Communicate issues and timeframes for issue resolution to the customer.
  • Maintain inventory of equipment and software in infrastructure racks.

jobs.title: Manager, Modeling & Simulation Department
jobs.content:
Background:

BAE Systems is looking for well qualified professionals to join our team for an exciting opportunity to support the procurement of the USAF GBSD (Ground Based Strategic Deterrent) ICBM program. The ICBM System Program Office must prepare a sustainment and acquisition concept to ensure a safe, secure and reliable MM III weapon system as required by the war fighter (Air Force Global Strike Command) through 2030. This activity replaces the current ICBM Prime Integration Contract (IPIC) and is identified as the Future ICBM Sustainment and Acquisition Construct (FISAC). The Integration Support Contract (ISC) will not only assist in acquisition and technical sustainment engineering, but also help train and develop this capability in the government. This contract will augment organic resources by providing breadth and depth of capabilities for system engineering and integration, risk management, technical assessment, acquisition program management, strategy development, organization and change management, interface with operations and logistics, business analysis, mission effectiveness, and ICBM Demonstration/Validation (Dem/Val) Integrated Applications Programs.

The position will be located at Hill AFB, Utah.

Job Description:

A manager for the Modeling and Simulation Department is being sought to perform the following responsibilities:

1. Manage a growing group of aerospace analysts within the Systems Engineering & Integration functional group. The Modeling and Simulation department currently consists of nine people, but is growing. Disciplines include missile trajectory, civil engineering for ground structures, propulsion ballistics and thrust vector control, structures, heat transfer, guidance, electrical and electronic systems, and software engineering. Establish work scope and schedules to meet customer and upper management expectations.

2. Create and maintain a meaningful analytical architecture, tying modeling and simulation together in a logical manner to reflect interdependencies and sequences, which would become the foundation of the Model Based System Engineering analytical approach.

3. Have the ability to win the trust of company management, government customers, and the analysts in the department. This would be done while meeting all business and program objectives with high quality deliverables on time.

4. Establish plans to staff the department with needed expertise. Be responsible for budgets, forecasts, and financial performance.

5. Follow and add to the existing road map to acquire the right software tools to evaluate the design concepts that will be proposed for the weapon system.

6. Perform specific analyses at times in a discipline the manager brings to the position.

7. Review contractor-provided models and analyses for proper technical content. Include analytical results in the Technical Maturation & Risk Reduction program to improve the weapon system throughout its development and operational life cycle. Provide oral and written evaluations of internal and external analyses to the highest levels of the DoD to justify the soundness of the project’s technical positions at important program milestones.

8. Operate in a Model-Based Systems Engineering environment that will influence each decision to be made. Have the ability to be agile on a quick-moving technical program with many stakeholders.

9. Coordinate across other product and process-oriented IPTs (Integrated Product Teams) to meet ultimate program goals.

10. Support USAF uniformed and civilian leadership in program development.

11. Conceive, communicate, and execute courses of action to help teams achieve program goals under highly dynamic situations.

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security:

BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services. Information Solutions, based in Reston, Virginia, is among the 10 largest IT providers to the U.S. government, serving most of the federal defense and civilian marketplace. It provides network-centric command, control, computing, and intelligence (C3I) solutions; wideband networking radio systems; information systems for the U.S. intelligence community; geospatial information services; and information technology services. Leveraging its knowledge of signals and data derived from signals, Information Solutions has attained a market-leading position in advanced information technology research, intelligence analysis and production, and geospatial exploitation software. People are the greatest asset in any Company. BAE Systems is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression.

Minimum Education and Experience Bachelor’s Degree and 15 years work experience or equivalent experience Required Skills and Education Required education: Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or other technical discipline.

15+ years (13+ years with MS degree) of progressive experience in aerospace analysis of military hardware and systems.

Excellent cognitive, communications, and interpersonal skills.

Preferred Skills and Education MS or PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or other technical discipline is highly desired.

ICBM Weapon System experience.

Model-Based Systems Engineering coursework or experience.

Clearance. About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That’s BAE Systems. jobs.content:

jobs.title: Parkinson's Disease Nurse Educator - West - TXA08656
jobs.content:
Description

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, Quintiles understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our teams help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product’s value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma’s sales force to physicians or providing nurses to educate patients or prescribers. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.

We are excited to announce that at this time we are looking for a Nurse Educator to join our team of over 10,000 global field personnel supporting our pharmaceutical and biotech clients

Nurse Educator

Patients are at the center of our business strategies. The Nurse Educator Program is an educational based program designed as a resource for patients and caregivers living with Parkinson’s disease. Nurse Educators are responsible for participating in one-on-one communications with patients and caregivers. Since the program is strictly educational based, Nurse Educators do not provide medical advice or work clinically within this role.

The Nurse Educator will:

  • Answer and respond to in-bound calls in an appropriate time frame for patients interested in learning more about a new medication for Parkinson’s disease.
  • Conduct outbound calls to patients prescribed this medication, providing product education, services available and referrals to services as needed.
  • Answer questions about a new PD medication, in an on-label, compliant fashion, to patients seeking additional information and education.
  • Provide prospective PD patients in the community (support groups), education about this new medication and support execution of patient programs (Hosting, moderator and support)
  • Provide high-touch support and customer interactions developing relationships with returning clients and strong rapport on phone with new customers.
  • Execute patient programs with defined frequency,
  • Manage accounts and patient case-load in a large geography, becoming a valued team partner with knowledge of local resources.

Quintiles offers a friendly, progressive work atmosphere and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance and vision coverage, tuition assistance, bonus plan and 401(k).

We look forward to the prospect of working with you! Please apply on-line at: http://www.quintiles.com/

Job Qualifications:

Minimum:

  • Bachelor’s degree Preferred
  • BSN and/or RN licensure
  • Current nursing license in good standing
  • 5 yrs. clinical experience in healthcare to include hospital, home health, pharmaceutical or biotech
  • Nurse educator experience preferred
  • Preferred background in Movement Disorders/Parkinson’s Disease and prior patient programs
  • Direct interaction with patient and support for persistence and compliance
  • Knowledge of clinical data and pharmacology
  • Sales experience is a plus
  • Spanish fluency is a plus
  • Demonstrated time management skills; planning and prioritization skills; ability to multi-task and maintain prioritization of key projects and deadlines
  • Demonstrated effective presentation skills; ability to motivate others; excellent interpersonal (written and verbal) skills – with demonstrated effectiveness to work cross-functional and independently
  • Demonstrated ability to work and drive for results and with enthusiasm
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and execute plans in an independent environment
  • Demonstrated ability to take initiative and vision: challenge existing assumptions and interpretations
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships with third parties using good negotiation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to be adaptable to changing work environments and responsibilities
  • Fully competent in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and iPad technology
  • Flexibility to work weekends and evenings
  • Willing to travel locally extensively (75%)

jobs.title: Clinical Project Manager/Senior Clinical Project Manager, Project Leadership - GI: NASH, IBD
jobs.content:
At Quintiles we help healthcare and biopharma companies improve their probability of success. We do this by connecting our scientific, therapeutic and analytics expertise with superior delivery. From advisory through operations, Quintiles and its affiliate companies is the world’s largest provider of product development and integrated healthcare services.

As one of FORTUNE’s ‘Most Admired Companies’ in 2016, we offer great opportunities for a career in world-leading clinical research. Our global projects, innovative tools and industry leading customers combined with outstanding support from our leadership team and clear career mapping allows you to make a difference in patient health.

Description

This is a critical and high-profile role within Quintiles. Project leaders are the people who deliver our studies, bringing drugs to market faster and more efficiently, thus improving the health of patients more quickly. It is a role that requires you to liaise directly between Quintile and the customer, and it requires you to always keep the wellbeing of the patient as our priority.

It is also a role where the size and scope of Quintiles will allow you to develop and experience rapid growth across national and global studies, specialising in clinical or project management, and across our wider business. Whichever route you choose, you will be working on several projects at the same time, and enjoying a varied and busy schedule. At the same time you will have dedicated support to develop the career of your choice. In fact, you will be building a smart and flexible career with no limits.

While projects vary, your typical responsibilities might include:

  • Managing and coordinating cross-functional project teams
  • Serving as the primary project contact with the Sponsor (Customer)
  • Monitoring team performance against contract, customer expectations, and project baselines
  • Leading problem solving and resolution efforts to include management of risk, contingencies and issue resolution
  • Developing study management plans, together with team assignments and accountabilities and oversight of database maintenance
  • Ensuring consistent use of study tools and training materials and compliance with standard processes, policies and procedures.

You will need to be comfortable collaborating and communicating with a variety of colleagues and customers. Ideally, you will also have some global experience and a pharmaceutical or CRO background.

You should have:

  • A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a life sciences or related discipline
  • Ideally five years clinical research experience with two years project management experience
  • Alternatively, you should have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience

If you want to make an impact in the global research market, where we are working to make a real difference in patient health, we ask you to apply now and join our team.

Connect to great opportunity™

Quintiles is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

EEO Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

jobs.title: CRA/ Clinical research associate
jobs.content:
As you develop your career as a CRA, this role offers you the opportunity to plan and progress your career in the direction you choose. At Quintiles, we do not believe in a ‘career ceiling.’ You can make the Senior CRA role a stepping-stone into wider opportunities like operations management, dedicated customer solutions, and project management. And you won’t do it alone – you will have dedicated mentoring and receive structured quarterly reviews on performance, promotion and bonus awards.

Award winning and innovative, we will give you access to cutting-edge in-house technology, allowing you to work on global projects but with a regional / home state travel remit, so no need for national travel in certain countries. You will be building a smart and flexible career with no limits.

While projects vary, your typical responsibilities might include:

  • Performing site selection, initiation, monitoring and close-out visits, plus maintaining appropriate documentation
  • Supporting the development of a subject recruitment plan
  • Establishing regular lines of communication plus administering protocol and related study training to assigned sites
  • Evaluating the quality and integrity of site practices – escalating quality issues as appropriate
  • Managing progress by tracking regulatory submissions, recruitment, case report form (CRF) completion, and data query resolution

You will need to be comfortable collaborating and communicating with a variety of colleagues and customers. Ideally, you will also have a good basic knowledge of applicable clinical research regulatory requirements.

You should have:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in a health care or other scientific discipline or educational equivalent
  • At least two years of on-site monitoring experience
  • Alternatively, you should have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience

If you want to make an impact in the global research market, where we are working to make a real difference in patient health, we ask you to apply now and join our team.
