jobs.title: Product Design Engineer
jobs.content:
SUMMARY:

Responsible for surface development, preliminary part and assembly engineering of a specified range of Brookstone Laboratory projects of various mixes of materials and overall part complexity. Primary focus of efforts will be on maintaining alignment of industrial design intent with cost objectives set by design and engineering teams while considering capabilities and skill level of the selected vendors.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supports all phases of product development including 3D surface development and documentation activities within the Brookstone Lab team.

Activities include, but are not limited to the following:
•Assist in developing the specific project criteria and product design goals.
•Set and maintain project schedules, enforce project-to-project priorities set by management.
•Develop solutions that fit both cost goals for the product as well as fit within the selected manufacturer’s core competencies.
•Proactively partner with Industrial Design, internal and vendor Mechanical Engineering teams to assure that design intent and product performance goals are delivered through to production.
•Maintain ‘resident expertise’ of new materials and manufacturing processes to help guide the development of achievable and cost-appropriate design concepts.
•Actively champion a high level build quality that minimizes or eliminates entirely down stream effort and changes required by all vendors in the relationship.
•Actively champion the failure analysis of all level – 3 & 4 B_Lab projects with both internal and external QA teams.
•Maintain a proactive and engaged presence through out the duration of the design and post-design release phases of a project.
•Develop and maintain a professional rapport and time-sensitive dialog with internal/external project managers and manufacturing partners.
•Communicates project related information, documentation and direction to Asia sourcing teams and selected vendors in a clear/concise timely manner.
•Collaborates with external vendors and consultants as required on a project to project basis


REQUIREMENTS:

•A degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
•1 – 4 years of work experience in a consumer product development environment (preferably internships or working experience in consumer electronics).
•Strong analytical/problem solving skills and general mechanical engineering analysis.
•Strong materials knowledge and working knowledge different materials and grades.
•Good hands-on model-shop experience (e.g. mill, lathe)
•Solidworks 3-D CAD skills (Part, Assembly, and Surface Modeling)
•Requires demonstrated ability in plastic and metal part design.
•Working knowledge of finite element analysis theory and ability to use statistical tools and techniques.
•Flexibility and comfort working in a quickly changing environment.
•A consummate team player with strong written and oral communication skills, outstanding business relationship skills along with exceptional project management skills is required.
•Capable of thriving in a diverse, ever changing product development environment, constructive critique, and a passion for developing product solutions that consistently exceed business objectives.

jobs.title: Packaging Designer
jobs.content:
SUMMARY:

Design, develop, and implement Brookstone packaging from initial design creation through to production to meet marketing goals. Define style guide lines and create packaging solutions to drive innovation related to Brookstone products that meet branding requirements and suits target audiences.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Packaging development for new products, product improvements and new opportunities to support marketing objectives. This development includes brainstorming and ideation along with design, sampling and package testing.
•Manage packaging projects through structural design, material selection, prototype and performance testing, to specification development.
•Evaluation and implementation of cost reduction opportunities.
•Identify and recommend opportunities to improve process capability and quality.
•Collaborate with vendors on potential designs, to determine production capabilities and methods to optimize materials, structural components and production efficiency.
•Responsible for the packaging design process by working directly with our PDM team and suppliers to implement project specifications and document compliance.
•Creative thinker with the ability to look beyond current packaging systems and processes to increase the consumer experience.
•Access white box construction, packaging, construction quality review.
•Standards owner of packaging, style guide, communication to partners.


REQUIREMENTS:

•1-3 years of experience
•Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in Industrial Design or related field
•CPA, CFE, CMA desired
•Must be collaborative team player, who can bring and energetic can – do attitude to the team.
•Must be the “resident materials expert”
•Must have the ability to conceptualize innovative ideas and processes.
•Ability to simultaneously organize, and successfully execute multiple project responsibilities.
•Excellent oral and written communication.
•Must possess highly effective communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within both marketing/sales and operational environments with both clients, and suppliers.
•Ability to work effectively in cross-functional groups across the organization and foster teamwork.
•Adobe Creative Suite
•MS Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.


QUALIFIED CANDIDATES may apply online at hr@Brookstone.com. Please include in the title of the email the position title you are applying for and your name. Also include a cover letter, resume, and salary history /expectation.

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Data Engineer at Catawiki you will build scalable data platforms that enable data science and analytics, and data products such as recommendation engines. You will work in cooperation with a DevOps team (for physical and/or virtual infrastructure) and data scientists on projects like:



  • Building machine learning pipelines and applications for a variety of topics, including churn modeling, recommendation engines, customer lifetime value predictions, etc.

  • Evaluate and develop Big Data solutions. You will advance our software architecture and tool set to meet demanding business requirements regarding performance and data-quality

jobs.title: MySQL Database Engineer! Mission: make special items available to everyone!
jobs.content:
As a MySQL Database Engineer at Catawiki, you are the master of hundreds of servers and dozens of services. All Catawiki users will appreciate you for placing great importance on high-availability and fault-tolerance in each and every piece of infrastructure. Your colleagues will praise you for the awesome runtime you are building to provide them with the highest level of service and security.


With your broad knowledge of the infrastructure and X-Ray vision you can see everything what will happen in the next second. Any cloud provider is envious of your magical provisioning script when setting up a new cluster. You know that the heaven is a place where each packet, connection and log line matters. You'll achieve all of this and more by working closely together with the team of system engineers and back-end developers who really appreciate the pragmatic approach you are taking. Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:



  • Automating database systems management;

  • Actively monitoring and troubleshooting of all database infrastructure;

  • Providing knowledge and support for software developers.


The list of the tools you'll be faced with includes but is not limited to: Linux, KVM, Ansible, Git, Nginx, MySQL, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, InfluxDB, Solr, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, Redis, Zabbix, ELK, AWS.

jobs.title: Lead Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
As the fastest growing technology company in Europe, we offer a unique opportunity for you, as a Ruby on Rails developer! We are rapidly expanding our Development team to facilitate the tremendous growth of the company. As you can imagine, our website faces numerous complex development challenges as a result of our continually increasing numbers of sellers and buyers. We’ve already implemented localisations for various European countries and will be expanding even further, outside of Europe, in the near future.


That is why we need your help; we want to expand our team by introducing even more expert knowledge. You will work in product driven innovation teams in which front-end developers, back-end developers, a designer, a data scientist, and a product owner all work closely together. We are driven by A/B-testing and automated testing, which allows us to do multiple releases per day on our high-traffic website.


You will work with Ruby on Rails, nginx, MySql, Redis, Solr, jQuery, and Git in an agile development team of 50 developers (and counting). We have headquarters in both Assen and Amsterdam, the Netherlands

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer - React
jobs.content:
As a Front-end developer for Catawiki you’ll be part of an agile development team of 50+ developers and will mostly be developing parts of the product that are used by our millions of customers. You will interact with our Back-End, UX, Product Management, Data and Marketing teams (plus Catawiki’s users!) as you develop new functionality to:



  • Create and implement features, frameworks and designs using Javascript (JQuery and React) that work on all browser types and are fully responsive.  

  • A/B test our website and apps in order to calibrate or evaluate new features.

jobs.title: Industrial Design Intern
jobs.content:
Industrial Design Intern 00329333

Honeywell International is a $40 billion diversified Fortune 100 leader with more than 131,000 employees in 100 countries around the world. We invent and manufacture technologies that address some of the world’s toughest challenges linked to global macro trends like energy efficiency, clean energy generation, safety and security, globalization and customer productivity.

We are building a world that’s safer and more secure, more comfortable and energy efficient, more innovative and productive. For more information, please visit Honeywell.com or follow us @HoneywellNow.

Endless Opportunities
Honeywell has big plans for the future, just like you. We understand that it takes preparation and hard work to get there. So, we offer challenging purpose, ownership of your role, great teams, and tools to build your capability. In our performance-based setting, you can take your career in exciting new directions - and as far as you want to go. Honeywell is looking for an Industrial Design Intern to work in the Golden Valley, MN area.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer.
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.
Minneapolis is one of our nation's most livable cities with an active cultural and entertainment calendar. It offers a vibrant city and easy commuting. Spring, summer and fall are beautiful seasons with pleasant temperatures for lots of outdoor activities.

Candidate must be able to work in the US on a full-time basis after graduation without sponsorship

What You’ll Do
• Participate in defining and endorsing project parameters
• Ensure a variety of conceptual design alternatives are presented to satisfy user needs
• Create aspects of form, aesthetics and interfaces between users and products
• Generate appropriate documentation to satisfy project criteria
• Collaborate with team to effect convergence on one or more solutions and/or final designs
• Model Honeywell core behaviors of growth and customer focus, gets results, champions change, self-aware/learner, effective communication, integrative thinking and fostering teamwork and diversity.

How you’ll do it
• Participate in design projects to collaborate and develop convincing products with solid stories and great user experience.
• Maintain a continued understanding of the marketplace, competition, industry, methods, and relevant trends.
• Active interest and proactive approach to gain a solid fundamental understanding of the company’s objectives.
• Ability to carefully maintain and evolve the Honeywell brand design language in collaboration with the cross-functional team and design leadership, and to align with Honeywell’s overall branded goals.


Basic Qualifications
• Must be pursuing a graduate or undergrad degree in Industrial Design or related field
• Will have completed Junior year at start of Internship and graduating between Fall 2017-May 2018
• Able to complete internship prior to graduating
• Must submit a portfolio to be considered
• Minimum 1 year of experience with Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, and 3D software (Rhino or Solidworks preferred) Coursework included


Additional Qualifications
• Proven ability to develop products through conceptual sketching, prototypes, model studies, 2D and 3D computer software.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
• Experience in both consulting & corporate design environments is a plus
• A great can-do, fearlessly positive attitude.
• Previous intern experience

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
We've just created a new department in our company for Research & Development (R&D) and we are looking for proficient developers who want to do complex and innovative projects.


 #If you are any of the following:



  • Proficient developer (with strong programming skills, mainly OOP)

  • Hacker (white!! or black in the past)

  • SQL engineer (experience with deep sql optimizations)

jobs.title: Backend Developer C++ (m/f) - Distributed In-Memory Engine
jobs.content:
ABOUT US

We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from text mining, routing algorithms, and social networks to compiler technology and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to advance CeleraOne’s technology and products every day.

We develop our backend mainly in Python and C++. The frontend is based on modern JavaScript technologies. We strive for high code quality and rigorous testing. Each line of code must pass the review.

ABOUT THE JOB

  • Enhancement of CeleraOne’s in-memory architecture and business logic
  • Development of efficient algorithms and data structures for real-time processing of large data volumes
  • Multi-threading in C++ by using state of the art technologies (C++ 11, Boost, ZeroMQ, Intel TBB)
  • Implementation and design of highly scalable and distributed architectures

SKILLS

  • Graduate in Computer Science or similar knowledge
  • Advanced skills in modern C++ (C++11)
  • Experience with other languages, like Python, and at least one functional language
  • Experience in server programming and multi-threading
  • Theoretical and pratical experience in machine learning is a plus
  • Knowledge of compiler technologies and experience with LLVM is desirable

WHY JOIN US?

  • Flexible working hours
  • Modern technology stack
  • Professional and friendly international team
  • Flat hierarchies
  • Central location in Berlin

jobs.title: Backend Developer C++
jobs.content:
We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians from diverse backgrounds - from text mining, routing algorithms, and social networks to compiler technologies and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve CeleraOne's technology and products every day. 


We develop our backend mainly in C++ 11 and Python. The frontend is based on modern JavaScript technologies. We strive for high code quality and rigorous testing. Each line of code must pass peer review.


About the Job




  • Enhancement of CeleraOne’s in-memory architecture and JIT compiler technology based on LLVM




  • Development of efficient algorithms and data structures for real-time processing of large data volumes




  • Multi-threading in C++ by using state of the art technologies (C++ 11, Boost, ZeroMQ, Intel TBB)




  • Design of highly scalable distributed architectures

jobs.title: Senior Designer/Brand Manager
jobs.content:
Zoku is an innovative product development company located in Hoboken, NJ, right outside of Manhattan. Our company is focused on creating design-driven products for the home. With roots in design consulting, Zoku prioritizes design as strategy and operates more like a design consultancy than a traditional corporation.

We are the recipient of numerous design awards including 3 IDEA Awards, Spark Gold, a Core77 Design Award, and a Good Design Award to name a few. More information about Zoku can be found at www.zokuhome.com

We are currently seeking a Senior Graphic Designer/ Brand Manager to join our design team, and help shape the future of our brand. The successful candidate will have 5+ years of experience in a design consultancy, design-driven corporate environment, or in-house position, a compelling portfolio, leadership skills, excellent visual and verbal communication skills, superb methodology, the ability to excel within a team environment, and project management experience. Responsibilities include managing and executing all phases of design for a wide variety of projects including packaging (international and domestic), product graphics, catalogs, trade show displays, photography, website design, trade ads, sales materials, sales presentation files, social media campaigns, email marketing campaigns, art direction, photo editing, and more. As well as managing and keeping up with the project schedule, deadlines, budgets, and advising a junior designer. The position also involves managing freelancers and outside vendors.

Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter telling us a little about yourself and why you would be a good candidate for the position.

 Specific Skills:
• Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office
• Sound methodology and problem solving skills
• 5+ years of relevant design experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Passion for typography
• Open-minded team player
• Keen sense of color and graphics
• Proficient hand comping skills
• Project management experience
• Basic photography knowledge and strong photo editing/photoshop skills; art direction a plus
• Technical knowledge of print and web production
• Strong leadership skills
• Management experience a plus

To be considered for this position, please submit resume, cover letter, and portfolio in PDF format or website link. Also include 'Senior Designer / Brand Manager' in the subject line of your e-mail.

jobs.title: Art Director - Seton Hall University
jobs.content:
Working under the direction of the Art Director of publications/university editor, the art director will conceive and create compelling, sophisticated materials to tell the Seton Hall story and engage the university's alumni, donors, students, employees and friends.
The Art Director is responsible for conceptualizing, designing and producing high-profile marketing materials, advertisements and publications for Seton Hall University, including the award-winning Seton Hall magazine as well as key projects for a variety of constituents including the Office of the President, Development, Alumni Relations, Admissions and the individual Schools and Colleges.
The Art Director also provides the vision for photography and directs the university's photography efforts by overseeing image assets, arranging and art directing high-profile photo shoots, maintaining photographic archives and serving as photo editor. These photo assets are used for print and digital communications including emails and the Seton Hall website among other venues.

Duties and Responsibilities:
● Oversee the design, layout and production of Seton Hall alumni magazine.
● Act as the liaison between Seton Hall and the magazine printer. Select photographers, then set up and manage photoshoots. Serve as photo editor.
● Hire, manage and coordinate assignments with freelance designers who may assist with magazine production.
● Archive all materials and format materials for the Web.
● Create well-developed and strategic creative solutions for various types of projects, and execute those ideas completely—from conception and design through to production.
● Projects may include (but are not limited to) advertisements, brochures, newsletters, magazines, web pages, emails and other digital assets.
● Help define, solidify and refine Seton Hall's brand and visual identity among key audiences.
● Evaluate, update and maintain the University's brand through its graphic and visual identity on an ongoing basis.
● Ensure the execution of a thoughtful and consistent creative strategy across multiple platforms and throughout the breadth of the university's marketing materials.
● Conceptualize and produce high-impact image advertising and provide design/image input on key enrollment advertising and materials.
● Design and produce compelling visual materials for high-profile university initiatives. The art director is typically involved in the design of high-impact projects for the university, including such things as image advertising and important or broad-scale advertising campaigns, important fundraising projects for University Advancement including capital campaign materials, True Blue and specific annual fundraising initiatives, key projects for admissions, individual schools and colleges, and the Office of the President, etc.
● Oversee the University's photographic assets/photography function.
● Arrange and art direct high-profile photoshoots for a variety of internal clients. (These images are used in both digital and print communications as well as the University website.)
● Improve and extend the capabilities of the University's photo archive by fulfilling ongoing requests for University photos and other materials.
● Manage the university's photographic archives.

Required Qualifications:
● Bachelor's degree in Graphic design or fine arts with approximately 8 or more years of design experience or other related experience.

To apply, please visit the Seton Hall University website: www.shu.edu
Seton Hall University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. It honors diversity and respects the religious commitments of all its employees. In turn, its employees respect Catholic beliefs and values, and they support its mission as a Catholic institution of higher education.

jobs.name: Gwen Frostic School of Art, Western Michigan University

jobs.title: Assistant/Associate Professor of Art -- Product Design and Innovation
jobs.company: Gwen Frostic School of Art, Western Michigan University
jobs.content:
The Frostic School of Art at Western Michigan University invites applicants for this full-time tenure track faculty position beginning spring or fall 2017. This is a position to lead and shape a new undergraduate program in Product Design and Innovation and to provide integration into our creative design community.

Job Description
We are seeking an experienced product design teacher, practitioner, and colleague, who will work with our community of designers and artists to shape this new BFA in Product Design program. The program will acknowledge the value of the interdisciplinary relationship building between design, fine arts, business and engineering. It will provide opportunities for entrepreneurship and practical experience through our community partners.

This position will be essential to provide recognition of existing practices in product design while implementing emerging methods of thinking and making that are user centered; to inform and support a sustainable, social, environmental and economic culture; and ultimately to create a collaborative environment resulting in graduates who are skilled, innovative and thoughtful designers and leaders.

This is an exciting opportunity to lead, guide and implement the new curriculum and the renovation of an existing building connected to the current Frostic School of Art facilities.

Successful candidates will have a strong teaching philosophy. They must be able to provide students with a well-rounded vision of product design framing concepts within a social, cultural, and historical context; engage students in a discourse on the relationship of form and content; foster critical thinking; and advance students’ understanding of a broad variety of methodologies and practices including contemporary, innovative and emerging technologies.

The faculty member will be expected to participate in research and service in the school and the university and work collaboratively with internal and external research partners, organizations, and corporations.

Qualifications Required
• Terminal Degree MFA or MID in Product Design, Industrial Design or International equivalent or equivalent experience in professional practice.
• Prior teaching experience: minimum of 3 years teaching in an equivalent program or teaching experience blended with professional practice will be considered.
• Ability to implement and develop curriculum.
• Knowledge and experience with current and emerging technologies.
• An active career in collaborative Product Design.
• Evidence of professional and creative accomplishment.
• Experience with community engagement through design curricula or other means.
• Experience that is informed by worldviews in theory and practice.
• Strong research methods in design thinking, history and theory.

The University: Western Michigan University (WMU), located in Southwest Michigan, is a vibrant, nationally recognized student-centered research institution with an enrollment of 25,000. WMU delivers high-quality undergraduate instruction, has a strong graduate division, and fosters significant research activities. The Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching has placed WMU among the 76 public institutions in the nation designated as research universities with high research activities.

Kalamazoo: Western Michigan University is located in the arts-friendly community of Kalamazoo, Michigan, a metropolitan area of 250,000 residents located halfway between Chicago and Detroit. The design community in Kalamazoo and the region is rich with significant industry partners including Fabri-Kal, Landscape Forms, Newell Brands, Stryker Instruments, Stryker Medical, Techna, Eaton and Whirlpool. The city was named number 3 for creatives in the US: http://www.mlive.com/news/kalamazoo/index.ssf/2015/07/kalamazoo_named_no_3_city_in_t.html
Learn more about the city: http://www.downtownkalamazoo.org. The “Kalamazoo Promise,” an endowment program that provides each Kalamazoo Public School graduate with the opportunity to attend post-secondary education with up to a 100% tuition scholarship, enriches the community.
http://www.kalamazoopublicschools.com/initiatives-and-supporters/kalamazoo-promise

The School: The Gwen Frostic School of Art is one of four units in the College of Fine Arts and is comprised of 350 art majors, 21 full-time faculty, 12-15 part-time faculty, and eight staff. The school is NASAD accredited and offers the B.A. in Art and in Art History; B.F.A. in Art Education and in Graphic Design; B.F.A with emphasis in Ceramics, Metals/Jewelry, Painting, Photography/Intermedia, Printmedia, and Sculpture; and the M.A. in Art Education Online. The school resides in 40,000 sq. ft. of new galleries, lecture halls, classrooms, design and art studios in the Richmond Center for Visual Arts and 88,000 sq. ft. of renovated classrooms and art studios in South Kohrman Hall.

The College: The College of Fine Arts consists of the Gwen Frostic School of Art, Department of Dance, School of Music, and the Department of Theatre. All four units are nationally accredited. The College of Fine Arts is housed in Dalton Center, Richmond Center for Visual Arts and South Kohrman Hall, and the Gilmore Theatre Complex and overlooks Fountain Plaza. Facilities for the learning and practice of the arts are exceptional in the Mid-America region. The College facilities are some of the best found anywhere in the country.

Application: a letter of intent that addresses the listed qualifications; One pdf file upload should include current curriculum vitae, statement of teaching philosophy, 20 samples of professional work, and 20 samples of student work or project samples by teams you have directed, or a website address where this visual information can be viewed and contact information for three professional references. Submit to https://www.wmich.edu/hr/jobs Upon receipt of your file upload, you will receive a confirmation email.

Salary: Competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience, with an excellent benefits package.

Expected Start Date: Spring or Fall 2017

Application Deadline: The position will be open until filled. To ensure first consideration, application materials must be received by December 1, 2016.

If you have problems uploading your complete portfolio materials please contact Human Resources at (269) 387-3620.

Western Michigan University is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer consistent with applicable federal and state law. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  - Cloud Foundry
jobs.content:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team in Pivotal London is looking for several great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


We are looking for either Software Engineers or Operations / System Engineers who want to learn new skills! 



  • Watch this short video from the engineers at Pivotal!

  • Pivotal Cloud Foundry overview by Onsi Fakhouri


Where


We are based in our brand new fully refurbished offices in The Bower, Old Street London.


You


You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.


Either way, you measure  your success by the success of your team; you are dedicated to learning about distributed systems, and you are excited to work on open source and be connected to the open source community.


Us


Cloud Foundry is an open source project co-developed with Pivotal Labs, a leader in the field of agile software development. We are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all day, every day, because we know it delivers remarkable results and supports a cooperative learning environment.


We work in small teams and rotate between them frequently in order to help you gain a diverse set of skills, and to encourage cross team communication and cohesion.  We are committed to working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.

As part of the London team, you'll be immersed in all the latest database technologies — From Cassandra, Redis, RabbitMQ, and more.  A proficient understanding of these services, as well as VM and container technologies (Docker), is a plus.


Desired Skills/ Experience:



  • We are looking for people with either Operations experience or Software Engineers - but you must be interested in the other and be excited to learning new skills. If you have development and operations experience - amazing!

  • We use Golang, Ruby and Java but you don't have to have experience with these technologies - if you have great experience in other programming languages we can train you up on the technologies we use

  • Experience and/or interest in: Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies, database technologies, and containerization

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience



Perks


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly lunchtime talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.



We also offer benefits including healthcare, pension and equity in a high growth market.


We’re seeking more amazing developers that complement our London team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.

jobs.title: User Experience Leader - Human Resources
jobs.content:
HR User Experience Leader

Deliver business value through human-centered design.

Lead end-to-end design of intuitive, easy to use experiences for every Human Resources touch point with Honeywell’s employees, managers and HR Generalists. You will teach and employ human-centered experience design mindset and methods to help teams understand needs, make ideas visible, evaluate and refine design. Influence teams across HR to embed Honeywell User Experience in their daily work to continuously improve accuracy and speed.

Proactively engage stakeholders in design of tools and services across channels, from desktop and mobile, to call center and face-to-face interactions.

Challenge yourself to learn and grow as you interact with a variety of businesses across diverse cultures and developing markets.

Be the voice of customers, lead change and drive continuous improvement of internal customer experiences and processes.

JOB ACTIVITIES

• Act as a human-centered design expert guiding Human Resources teams to embed user experience and Design Thinking mindset and methods t improve systemic processes and touch points.
• Assist with planning and facilitation of design workshops globally, guiding and interacting with senior functional leadership, developers and subject matter experts.
• Lead and contribute to planning and design in Agile development programs and traditional Waterfall projects.
• Do external benchmarking of comparable experiences, spotting design and technology trends.
• Act as a catalyst to bring focus to usability and effective interaction design on multiple teams.
• Collaborate to understand user needs and translate them into user experience definition.
• Lead and create comprehensive interaction design for mobile and desktop web applications.
• Create low to high-fidelity wireframes, visual and interaction design, and prototypes for testing and production.
• Plan and conduct evaluation of processes and interactions using Usability Testing, Cognitive Walkthroughs and other methods.
• Enable measurement of User Experience current state and impact of improvements.
• Manage and collaborate with external design and development firms.

MUST HAVE

• Bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts, Human Computer
Interaction, Industrial/Communication Design, Psychology or related field
• 10 years of experience in User Experience Design
• 3 years of experience in end-to-end Customer Experience or Service Design

WE VALUE

• 3 Years of User Experience leadership
• Experience in a large, global organization, fostering teamwork and diversity across functional boundaries
• Strong background and understanding of technology
• Excellent project management skills
• Excellent organizational and change management skills
• Ability to think critically, solve problems, and be a strong team player across diverse teams
• Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
• Experience integrating User Experience in Agile and Scrum processes
• Ability to travel up to 35%, domestic and international

Wonder how we work across Honeywell in our functions and businesses as we design experiences? Check out our Honeywell User Experience Design Studios video on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BXmOdckEqlU&sns=em

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer.
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

jobs.title: .Net Developer (Medior)
jobs.content:
.Net Developer (medior) Belastingdienst

Functieomschrijving Ben jij de .Net ontwikkelaar die praktische softwareoplossingen bouwt?

State-of-the-art-applicaties ontwikkelen die bijdragen aan een professionelere dienstverlening; daar krijg jij energie van! Als .Net-ontwikkelaar duik je in verschillende uitdagende projecten en ga je toepasbare software ontwikkelen om ijzersterke applicaties mee te bouwen. De Microsoft-ontwikkelstraat geeft jou de mogelijkheid om spijkers met koppen te slaan en alle voordelen die .Net te bieden heeft, te benutten.

Vaak begin je de dag met een scrumsessie, waarin je teamleden vertellen waar ze staan en/of tegenaan lopen in het project waar jullie samen aan werken. Je voert reviews uit van detailontwerpen van applicaties en bouwt applicatiecomponenten op basis van gedetailleerde ontwerpspecificaties. Je bedenkt objectgeoriënteerde softwareoplossingen en weet deze te implementeren. Het is belangrijk dat je bekend bent met design patterns en met de laatste ontwikkelingen in .Net-omgevingen. Ook documenteer je bouwtesten, zorg je ervoor dat applicaties binnen de infrastructuur geïntegreerd worden en handel je incident- en probleemmeldingen af.

Functie-eisen

  • Je bent in het bezit van een hbo-diploma in een relevante ICT-richting.
  • Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare kennis van en ervaring met software development op het .Net-platform.
  • Je hebt aantoonbaar ruime kennis van en ervaring met Microsoft-technologieën, zoals ASP.Net, MVC, C#.Net, .Net Framework 4, Visual Studio 2015 en SQL-Server.
  • Ook heb je ervaring met unit-testen, waarbij het een pre is als je ervaring hebt met TDD.
  • Als je MCSD-gecertificeerd bent, is dat een pre.

Jouw competenties?

  • analyseren
  • samenwerken
  • resultaatgerichtheid
  • flexibiliteit
  • zelfontwikkeling

Wat vinden we nog meer belangrijk? We vinden het belangrijk dat onze .Net ontwikkelaars goed in teamverband kunnen werken. Samen met specialistische collega’s ga je elke dag opnieuw voor het beste resultaat. Dat doe je het liefst in een goed gestructureerd proces, waardoor jij en je team het overzicht weet te behouden. Je hebt een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en ziet het bovendien als een uitdaging om de grenzen te verleggen en je kennis te verbreden.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salarisniveau: schaal 10 Salaris: Min €2519 – Max €4049 bruto per maand het genoemde salaris is gebaseerd op een volledige werkweek. Salarisomschrijving: Naast salaris en vakantiegeld kun je rekenen op een eindejaarsuitkering. De Rijksoverheid hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en loopbaanontwikkeling en biedt daarvoor tal van mogelijkheden. Tot de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden behoren onder meer ouderschapsverlof, studiefaciliteiten en een vergoeding woon-werkverkeer. Bij de Rijksoverheid heb je een aantal individuele keuzemogelijkheden bij het samenstellen van je arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket. Dienstverband: Vaste aanstelling (eventueel met een proeftijd) Minimaal aantal uren per week: 32 Maximaal aantal uren per week: 36

Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden Het kan voorkomen dat je buiten je reguliere werktijden gevraagd wordt om stand-by te staan om verstoringen in het productieproces op te lossen. Hiervoor krijg je een vergoeding.

De Belastingdienst streeft naar een evenwichtig samengesteld personeelsbestand, dat een afspiegeling is van de samenleving. Bij gelijke geschiktheid van kandidaten bepaalt dat streven de selectie van de kandidaat.

Wij verwachten van onze werknemers dat ze integer zijn. We werken met wederzijds vertrouwen in een professionele organisatie. Onze basis wordt gevormd door oprechte betrokkenheid van en naar ons personeel.

Bijzonderheden Deze vacature is extern opengesteld.

We ontvangen je brief en cv graag in een Word- of PDF-bestand, waarna jouw sollicitatie conform geldende afspraken in beschouwing wordt genomen. Als je een beroep doet op een voorrangspositie, stuur dan ook een kopie van die beschikking mee.

De voorkeur gaat uit naar kandidaten die het meest aansluiten bij het opgestelde profiel. Dit heeft betrekking op zowel de genoemde opleiding(en) als werkervaringseisen. Vermeld deze daarom duidelijk in je cv.

Een (online) voorselectietest, een assessment, het maken van een casus, het opvragen van referenties en (online) screening, bijvoorbeeld via databanken, (zoekmachines) en sociale netwerken, kunnen deel uitmaken van het sollicitatieproces.

Jouw sollicitatie wordt alleen in behandeling genomen als je met de sollicitatie-button reageert en je cv en motivatiebrief zijn bijgesloten. Na sluitingsdatum is het niet meer mogelijk om je sollicitatie in behandeling te nemen. Houd er rekening mee dat het solliciteren technische problemen met zich mee kan brengen. Wacht hiermee dus niet tot het laatste moment.

Solliciteren Solliciteer snel en gemakkelijk op deze vacature via onze sollicitatiepagina.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

jobs.title: .Net Developer (Senior)
jobs.content:
.Net Developer (senior) Belastingdienst

Functieomschrijving Ben jij de ervaren .Net ontwikkelaar die onze applicaties naar een hoger plan tilt?

State-of-the-art-applicaties ontwikkelen die bijdragen aan een professionelere dienstverlening; daar krijg jij energie van! Als ervaren .Net specialist ben jij de ontwikkelaar die in verschillende projecten duikt en daarbinnen ijzersterke applicaties bouwt. De Microsoft-ontwikkelstraat geeft jou de mogelijkheid om spijkers met koppen te slaan en alle voordelen die .Net te bieden heeft, te benutten.

Vaak begin je de dag met een scrumsessie, waarin je teamleden vertellen waar ze staan en/of tegenaan lopen in het project waar jullie samen aan werken. Als senior .Net ontwikkelaar ben je van alle markten thuis, adviseer je vanuit deze rol je collega’s en sta je junior ontwikkelaars bij in hun werkzaamheden. Hiermee geef je sturing aan het team en neem je waar nodig de rol van coach op je. Maar met jouw expertise ben je ook in de uitvoerende taken hard nodig. Je reviewt detailontwerpen van applicaties en bouwt applicatiecomponenten op basis van gedetailleerde ontwerpspecificaties. Ook documenteer je bouwtesten, zorg je ervoor dat applicaties binnen de infrastructuur geïntegreerd worden en handel je incident- en probleemmeldingen af.

Ook onze managers hebben baat bij jouw .Net-kennis; dus ook zij gaan graag het gesprek met je aan. Vakinhoudelijk kan niemand om je heen, ben je de vraagbaak bij uitstek én voel je de verantwoordelijkheid om werkzaamheden goed te stroomlijnen. Je treed op als spreekbuis van de ontwikkelteams in overleggen met zowel de interne, als externe stakeholders.

Functie-eisen

  • Je bent in het bezit van een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in een relevante ICT-richting.
  • Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring in de ontwikkeling van complexe webgebaseerde en service georiënteerde enterprisesystemen.
  • Ook heb je minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in het geven van inhoudelijke richting en sturing aan teams van ontwikkelaars.
  • Je hebt ruime kennis van de Microsoft-technologieën ASP, C#, .Net Framework 4, Visual Studio 2015, MVC en SQL, met daarbij ontwikkelprocessen zoals Scrum, Agile, TDD en RUP.
  • Je hebt daarnaast ook aantoonbaar ervaring met het opstellen van coderingsrichtlijnen en kunt infrastructurele en technische aanpassingen in het IT-landschap bedenken en realiseren.
  • Je bent in staat om objectgeoriënteerde softwareoplossingen te bedenken en te implementeren op basis van de mogelijkheden van Visual Studio, bent bekend met design patterns en met de laatste ontwikkelingen in .Net-omgevingen.
  • Je hebt een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.

Jouw competenties?

  • zelfontwikkeling
  • communiceren
  • samenwerken
  • resultaatgerichtheid
  • flexibiliteit

jobs.title: Java Developer (senior)
jobs.content:
Java Developer (senior) Belastingdienst

Functieomschrijving Ben jij een senior Java ontwikkelaar die inspireert en vernieuwt?

Als senior Java developer loop je bij de Belastingdienst voorop in het delen van kennis en het inspireren van collega’s. Dat doe je onder andere door het coachen van en het geven van workshops en presentaties aan Java vakgenoten. Je neemt ze mee in de laatste ontwikkelingen en informeert over de toepassing binnen het werk. Daarmee ben je een inspirator voor collega’s, de vakspecialist, een aanspreekpunt als het gaat om complexe zaken en/of degene die de rol van lead developer kan oppakken.

Onze 250 Java ontwikkelaars realiseren applicaties, die direct impact hebben op onze samenleving. De Online Aangifte applicatie is er één waarmee we miljoenen mensen bereiken. Maar onze Java bouwers doen meer, bijvoorbeeld voor de Douane en FIOD. Dat doe je in zo’n 70 groot- en kleinschalige projecten en 100 multidisciplinaire scrumteams, waardoor er voor jou steeds weer een nieuwe uitdaging ligt te wachten. We werken in een Agile-ontwikkelomgeving met standaardisatie op ‘proven technology’. Dat biedt ons houvast en geeft ons zekerheid om goed functionerende applicaties te ontwikkelen. Uiteraard kijken we ook vooruit naar de ontwikkelingen binnen ons vakgebied. Jij kan als Java ontwikkelaar een rol spelen in hoe we deze ontwikkelingen toe kunnen passen in onze Java ontwikkelstraat.

Bij de Belastingdienst krijg je volop de ruimte om jezelf blijvend te ontwikkelen Als software engineer heb je de mogelijkheid om actief je kennis uit te bouwen en te delen, bijvoorbeeld door (onder werktijd) bijeenkomsten van onze Java vakgroep, conferenties en hackathons bij te wonen en diverse opleidingen te volgen en certificeringen/diploma’s te behalen. Daar profiteren niet alleen jezelf en wij van, maar ook de burgers en bedrijven van Nederland. Een goed voorbeeld hiervan is de Online Aangifte applicatie, waarmee we in 2015 een Computable award wisten te winnen voor het beste ICT-project binnen de overheid.

Functie-eisen

  • Je hebt minimaal een hbo-diploma, bij voorkeur in een ICT-gerelateerde richting.
  • Naast SCJP/OCPJP, beschik je ook over enkele aanvullende Java-certificaten.
  • Je hebt meer dan 5 jaar werkervaring met het ontwikkelen in Java.
  • Je beheerst diverse van de frameworks en tooling die wij gebruiken, o.a. Java EE, Wicket, AngularJS, Spring MVC, Maven, Jenkins, SonarQube, Git & JIRA.
  • Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Je hebt bij voorkeur ervaring met het geven van presentaties/workshops en/of met het coachen van mensen.

Jouw competenties?

  • analyseren
  • samenwerken
  • klantgerichtheid
  • resultaatgerichtheid
  • plannen en organiseren

Wat vinden we nog meer belangrijk? Het is belangrijk dat je uitstekend in teamverband kunt werken. Samen met specialistische collega’s ga je elke dag opnieuw voor het beste resultaat. Dat doe je het liefst in een goed gestructureerd proces, waardoor jij en je team het overzicht te allen tijde behoudt. Je hebt een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en je vindt het bovendien een uitdaging om de grenzen te verleggen en je kennis te verbreden én te delen. Je wilt niet alleen jezelf ontwikkelen, maar ook een bijdrage leveren in de ontwikkeling van je collega’s.

jobs.title: Java Developers/Java Full Stack Developers
jobs.content:
Description


About us


Tieto is a recognized European leader in Technology Services and Modernization (TSM) which primarily includes Applications Services (AS) and Infrastructure & Platform Services (IPS) businesses. Our services support the current and future IT deliverables in line with our customers’ business needs and are designed to support main business challenges.


Custom Applications Delivery service area within Application Services (AS) is a global team of ca 1300 skilled and motivated professionals located mainly in Finland, Sweden, India and Czech Republic. The current turnover of Application Services is ca 220 M€ and that of Custom Applications within Application Services practice is ca 170 M€. This global team is led by Matti Mentula, Head of Custom Applications Delivery.


With us you will be responsible for


We are searching for 30+ SW developers specialized in Java to work on our agile projects. As SW Developer, you will work on development and maintenance of applications as part of a domain team with altogether approximately 15-25 members. You will report to a Domain Team manager.

jobs.title: JUNIOR UTVECKLARE TILL TIETO
jobs.content:
Är du nyutexaminerad dataingenjör eller har upp till två års erfarenhet av programmering? Vill du få chansen att samla på dig ovärderlig erfarenhet genom att praktisera det du lärt dig i skolan på ett mycket attraktiv företag som Tieto?


Academic Work söker för Tietos räkning juniora dataingenjörer. Tieto ärett ledande IT-tjänsteföretag i Norden och tillhandahåller tjänster för hela IT-livscykeln. Teamet i Karlstad som är inriktat mot Telecom och datakom har just nu mycket att göra och mycket erfarenhet att dela med sig av till juniora förmågor. Det är här du kommer in i bilden!


Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Tietos önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work


Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du kommer vara anställd av Academic Work och arbeta som konsult hos Tieto. Tietos intention är att du på sikt ska kunna bli anställd direkt hos dem, förutsatt att alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Hos Tieto kommer du arbeta i ett team bestående av av 6-8 personer. Genom ett agilt arbetssätt med Scrum arbetar man i sprintar av 3 veckor som stäms av dagligen i teamet. Du blir tilldelad en fadder på plats hos Tieto för att få en bra stöttning i din roll.


Vi tror att ditt tekniska intresse är mycket stort och att du inspireras av att bryta ned komplexa system och hitta lösningar på problem i systemen. Tieto har många olika typer av kunder och projekten kan variera i storlek men uppdragen handlar främst om abstrakt teknikorienterad programmering i inbyggda system. Du kommer arbeta mycket brett inom området genom att bryta ner problemet, programmera, testa och dokumentera samt redovisa resultatet. Du kommer under din första tid att teamas ihop med en mer erfaren kollega för att komma in i arbetet så bra som möjligt. Här finns chansen att erhålla mängder av erfarenheter genom gott samarbete och ett målinriktat arbete!


Tjänsten passar dig som är tekniskt intresserad och vill anta utmaningen att tillsammans med ett mycket kompetent team lösa de problem som Tietos kunder står inför.


ÖVRIG INFORMATION




  • Start: 1 oktober




  • Omfattning: Heltid 100% under ett år med möjlighet till överrekrytering




  • Placering: Karlstad




  • Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på Ansök nedan. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.




  • Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten besvaras dessa på lin03@academicwork.se under kontorstid. Skriv annonstiteln i rubriken och kopiera gärna in länken till annonsen i ditt mail. Academic Work är Home of the Young Professionals. Vi vänder oss till dig som är akademiker och fortfarande studerar på högskola/universitet, är nyutexaminerad eller har några års arbetslivserfarenhet.




  • Vårt erbjudande till dig som heltidskonsult hos Academic Work inkluderar utöver kollektivavtalsenliga villkor och dedikerad konsultchef också rabatter och erbjudanden genom vår konsultportal. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande här




SKYDD FÖR DIN PERSONLIGA INTEGRITET När du skickar in din ansökan till Academic Work godkänner och samtycker du till att Academic Work behandlar dina personuppgifter enligt Personuppgiftslagen. Läs mer under vår PuL-sida.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Booking.com is looking for the world’s best Front End Developers all around the globe! Join us at our beautiful headquarters in Amsterdam and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation website with some of the industry’s smartest people!

Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a Developer in the Front End team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in small startup-like teams that take full ownership of their part of our platform. You’ll work side by side with designers, back end developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyze, hand code & test your ideas. You’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of users.

Our ideal candidate has an excellent eye for detail, pragmatic approach and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. We make all of our decisions based on experiments and testing, so you should be excited by taking a data-led approach to development. If you believe you’re also a passionate advocate for the user, and are looking to work in an agile, collaborative environment than we would like to hear from you!

B.responsible

  • Translate requirements and mockups into fully functioning features using JavaScript and HTML/CSS
  • Continuously look for ways to improve Booking.com and implement A/B tests
  • Take ownership of sections of Booking.com‘s desktop, tablet and mobile web sites

B.skilled

  • 3+ years of experience in a relevant role, preferably in a commercial environment
  • Expert understanding of core front-end web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
  • Experience with JavaScript libraries such as JQuery
  • Experience with templating languages
  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code
  • Experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues
  • Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc
  • Knowledge of version control systems
  • Comfortable working on a command line
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal

B.offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Front End Developer in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

jobs.title: Data Scientist – Machine Learning
jobs.content:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.

This product development team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.

As a Data Scientist you’ll work side by side with Developers, Designers and Product Owners, and take full ownership of your work – from the initial idea-generation phase to the implementation of the final product on our website. Our ideal candidate is result-focused, innovative and has solid quantitative background and a good business understanding.

B.responsible

  • Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles
  • Research & Development on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data
  • Actively contribute to taking Data Science at Booking.com to the next level

B.skilled

  • Minimum two years of relevant work experience
  • Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
  • Excellent English communication skills; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders
  • Prior experience with a few of the following models: Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, (Deep) Neural Networks, Hidden Markov Models, Conditional Random Fields, Game Theory, Mechanism Design and/or Latent Dirichlet Allocation

Required

  • Experience with at least one scripting language, e.g. R, Octave, and one programming language, e.g. Python, Perl, C/C++, Java
  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases

Preferred

  • Experience implementing a real-world Recommender or Ranking system
  • Worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem
  • Implemented multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment

B.offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT has monthly hackathons, trainings and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Data Scientist - Machine Learning in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

jobs.title: Data Scientist – Analytics
jobs.content:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.

There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.

B.responsible

  • Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights.
  • Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.
  • Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.
  • Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.
  • Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

B.skilled

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role
  • Experience solving real problems using data mining techniques and with statistical rigor
  • Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.)
  • Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, machine learning and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, R and/or Excel.
  • Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders

B.offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Data Scientist - Analytics in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

jobs.title: SOC Security Subject Matter Expert
jobs.content:
We believe that the passion and talent of our employees is our strength – it is what drives us towards outstanding performance. We offer a dynamic, motivating and sophisticated work environment. A culture that is open, innovative and performance orientated. Our scale and scope, commitment to people and high standards of integrity make Booking.com a great place to work.


As a SOC Subject Matter Expert, you are the person that Alert Analysts and Incident Responders turn to when they run out of clues. As a senior member of the Security Operations team, you get to dissect the most complicated security issues. You can pull off all the skills needed to find out whether a suspected issue is a real issue, and if so what the root cause of the issue is. Time pressure is a natural given in the environment where you work.

jobs.content:
We believe that the passion and talent of our employees is our strength – it is what drives us towards outstanding performance. We offer a dynamic, motivating and sophisticated work environment. As a SOC Incident Responder, you will be investigating potential security incidents originating from our Security Operations Center. You can pull off a wide range of skills needed to find out whether a suspected issue is a real issue, and if so what the root cause of the issue is. Time pressure is a natural given in the environment where you work.

jobs.title: Backend Python/Tornado Engineer
jobs.content:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 33 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get the fastest way to their favorite takeaway food. The company has grown from its inception in 2010 to become one of the World's largest food-ordering networks. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at "getting things done". You can play an active role in our future - an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you! 



Your mission:



  • Design, implement, integrate and maintain new services and APIs.

  • Scale and improve existing backend services.

  • Grow and expand your expertise and Delivery Hero’s technology stack.

jobs.title: Email Designer
jobs.content:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 40 countries worldwide. We feature an environment with feedback exchange throughout the company from people who are genuine, ambitious and fun. We are looking for passionate and smart people to join us on our mission. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative, and good at “getting things done“. Play an active role in our future. An exciting job opportunity in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you.


Your mission:



  • You’ll be part of the customer management team.

  • Design and development of responsive HTML emails.

  • Leverage third party email tools and scripting language to deliver highly dynamic and personalized content.

  • Work with CRM managers to understand key campaign parameters and inputs, such as email audience, program frequency, degree of personalization and overall creative approach.

  • Work within the design team to create email templates and modules, and find innovative solutions to keep improving the designs that are already defined.

  • Test email rendering for consistency across all email clients (Gmail, Outlook, Mobile, etc.).

  • Code dynamic content and map variables within the campaign, to drive versioning and customization of the emails.

  • Stay up to date with latest email best practices, including design and responsive development.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Lead Engineer
jobs.content:
At Rakuten, we aim at building a global ecosystem of interconnected internet services.  Our team ensures the highest quality for those services which all handle vast amounts of transactions every second.  We are now looking for experienced QA Engineers to join our team and apply modern software testing techniques to Rakuten's most critical components.  If you have a passion for automation and total customer satisfaction, we would love to talk to you!


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the full testing life cycle of Rakuten's platforms;
