jobs.title: Lead Front End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About SecurityScorecard
We’re a quickly growing, Sequoia Capital and GV backed information security SaaS company based in Manhattan. We’re helping organizations across the globe manage and understand their security posture and their vendor’s security posture through our security ratings platform. At SecurityScorecard, we're building a cloud-based threat intelligence solution and big-data security platform, pushing the limits of technology, and energizing our growth while at the same time improving the data accuracy and reliability of our services. We’re fun, fast, smart, and looking for individuals that can help us grow and make the most of what we have to offer, taking initiative and advantage of the flexibility we provide.

About the Position
SecurityScorecard is seeking a front-end engineer to join our team. We’re working on some interesting problems, and we’re searching for a mid to senior level front-end engineer to build Javascript-driven, customer facing interfaces while working with the product team to create a clean, intuitive experience.  As a front-end engineer, you’ll be building, deploying and maintaining large-scale, Javascript-driven applications. 

What You Have

  • Minimum of 5 years of professional hands on experience
  • Working knowledge of a server-side programming language (Ruby, Python, Java, etc.)
  • Comfortable with both "vanilla" Javascript and libraries like React, Angular, or Backbone
  • Strong CSS skills
  • Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms 
  • Excitement regarding great UI and API design
  • Experience with documentation, unit, and integration testing 
  • Love for the journey as much as the destination 
  • Experience with or a strong interest in security

Why You’ll Love Us 
At SecurityScorecard, we take working hard and playing hard very seriously. We provide competitive salaries, stock options, and the full gamut of benefits along with the perks that come with being a Sequoia and GV-backed company. We expect a lot from our people and we reward them handsomely. We have a work-from-home Friday benefit, weekly Lunch and Learns and Security Learnings to further our employee’s education. In addition to the beer keg and foosball table, we even provide a stipend for any career-related education.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Since 1996, Electric Pulp has focused on developing cutting-edge interactive solutions. We’re looking for a Web Developer who can help us continue to produce top-of-the-line digital experiences for our clients. So if you're great at what you do, and what you do happens to be front-end development, we want to hear from you.

We prefer that you are or could be local to Sioux Falls, SD, but don’t let your location stop you from making contact. We understand that the right fit might not live here. We do need you to be a U.S. resident, however.

About The Job
As a Web Developer at Electric Pulp, you'll be integral to the success of the project, working with our designers and project managers to implement designs and ensure they're carried successfully through to completion. You'll be using HTML, CSS and JavaScript to accommodate the ever-growing list of viewports and browsers in play.

While coding is the core function of this role, there are a few other things we'll be looking for:

  • Ability to work well with others
  • Self-starter tendencies (especially important if you're out of the area)
  • Dedication required to meet a deadline
  • Interest in and proven history of learning new methods and technologies
  • Ability to write effectively and without typos

This position is available now and is already loaded with work, so you'll need to hit the ground running. We want someone looking to grow and improve, but we need you to have skill from day one.

Things You Should Have

  • 2+ years of experience
  • Expert knowledge of standards-compliant HTML5 & CSS3 (& preprocessors) as well as Responsive (RWD) techniques and methods
  • Experience with JavaScript (jQuery, React.js, pure, something else)
  • Sketch/Photoshop proficiencyExperience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress)
  • Familiarity with PHP frameworks (e.g., Laravel)
  • Familiarity with front-end frameworks (e.g., Bootstrap)
  • Familiarity with ecommerce platforms helpful (e.g., Magento)
  • Knowledge of version control (Git)
  • Understanding of onsite SEO and content hierarchy
  • Understanding of accessibility best practices
  • Understanding that code needs to work across devices/browsers

Cheat Mode / Real Talk

It's tough to list things we want you to be into. Familiar with Bower? Great! It's not a deal breaker, though. Have experience with Magento or React? YOU NEED TO SHOUT THAT AT US RIGHT NOW. We're flexible, though. Tell us what you're good at.

This is a full-time position with benefits.

  • Paid time off for vacations or illness
  • Excellent health insurance (company pays full single rate)
  • Vision / Dental insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • SimpleIRA Retirement account with company match
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Laptop provided
  • Competitive Ping Pong environment
  • Things to drink

We're very serious about our work, but the team is cool, the projects are fulfilling and the Fridays allow for casual attire. As do the other days.

Send us your resumé and your github repo or examples of your work in the wild. We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Who We Are
We’re a New Orleans based Ed-Tech startup seeking a talented iOS mobile software engineer to join our team on an immediate contract basis to help us diagnose and fix a number of bugs and issues with our native iOS app. We provide a video-based teacher observation and feedback platform that is focused on improving K-12 teacher quality via cost effective remote observation, feedback and content offerings.



About the Job
Your role is to help Torsh’s lead developer a) implement several new features and b) diagnose and fix a number of iOS 9 and 10 related bugs in our existing iOS app. Our app is a native app written in Objective C, so we are looking for someone who is well versed with iOS development using Objective C and with bug fixing and updating existing code. It would also be helpful if you had experience with Amazon's S3 multipart uploads.



Requirements

  • B.S. Comp Science or related field
  • 2+ years experience building mobile applications and developing in an object oriented programming environment
  • 2+ years of iOS programming experience
  • Understanding of the full mobile development life cycle
  • Deep knowledge of Apple’s iPhone SDK framework
  • Deep knowledge of Objective-C, REST, SOAP, XML, and JSON
  • Ability to discern user requirements and development specifications
  • Experience working with public and/or private APIs
  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability and general reliability

Who You Are

  • You are talented, entrepreneurial, and driven and want to get in on the ground floor of a great startup
  • You stand out among your peers for your communication skills
  • You are self-motivated and able to set your own schedule

Why This Is A Great Gig

  • You will be working on cool products that will significantly impact the lives of millions of people
  • We are a ROWE environment, so there are no set work hours – the work just needs to get done
  • We are able to offer a competitive hourly rate
  • You will be treated with the respect you deserve

How To Apply

  • Send your resume and details (recent projects, github, stackoverflow, etc.) to dev@torsh.co

jobs.title: Systems Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
At Canonical it is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We believe the best way to fuel innovation is to give the innovators the technology they need.  As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) for the Information Services (IS) team you'll play a key role in driving this mission and helping to define the future of free software.  
--
Why this job is important
IS supports and maintains all of Canonicalâs production services and IS team members use real-life operational experiences to contribute to product improvements.  The IS team at Canonical runs the services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.  As an SRE youâll be in a unique position that will allow you to provide critical feedback to developers by writing code, submitting bugs, and working with others within the company to ensure that Canonical products are as good as they can be.  You will also be able to develop and submit fixes and enhancements directly.

What you will learn at this job
SREs work closely with development teams to build and maintain the extraordinary infrastructure required to run all of Canonical and Ubuntuâs systems and services.  The scope of our responsibility combined with the overall size of our environment means that our SREs face new challenges every day.  You can expect to gain hands-on experience in the following areas:
  • Software development in Python and Go in order to automate repetitive tasks
  • Continuous integration and continuous deployment using a combination of open source and Canonical developed tools
  • Operating clouds at scale using OpenStack, Ceph, MAAS and Juju
  • Deploying, troubleshooting, and optimising services running on both private and public clouds using open source software like Ubuntu, Apache, HAProxy, PostgreSQL, and Squid.

Canonicalâs IS team embraces autonomy and to that end has instituted Self Directed (SD) time. A portion of your work week is set aside to allow you to work on what you think will most benefit the IS team specifically and Canonical in general.

--

Key Responsibilities

SREs rotate through three roles:
  1. Maintaining all core services, networks, and infrastructure (including public and private clouds).  The ability to work under pressure and demonstrate sound problem solving skills in a fast-paced and complex environment are key here.
  2. Working directly with a variety of development teams within Canonical in a devops role to test, deploy, monitor and maintain services running on our production clouds. This will require an overlap of development and administration skills, as you help write and review code you will then use to deploy and maintain services using Canonical's cloud products.
  3. Larger project work, currently focused on large scale cloud deployments and overall process improvements.  This role gives SREs the ability to utilize development and architecting skills in a focused manner that is unique to Canonical.
--
Skills & Requirements

Required:
  • You have prior experience working in a large highly available environment
  • You are willing to be flexible and adaptable with the ability to learn new things quickly.
  • You have strong development skills (Python, Go, Ruby, etc.) with experience writing code.
  • You are heavily focused on automation preferably with experience in building and maintaining self-service tools.
  • You have authoritative understanding and experience with the administration of infrastructure services such as DNS, DHCP, SSH, Apache/Nginx, HAProxy, Squid/Varnish, PostgreSQL/MySQL etc.
  • You have practical knowledge of IP networking and routing
  • You have a strong security focus including knowledge of network, operating system and application level practices
  • You have familiarity with software development and code review practices, including use of DVCS (e.g. git or bzr)
  • You have experience deploying, administering and maintaining services in a cloud computing environment
  • You are able to communicate clearly in English, especially using email and IRC
  • You have a college degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
  • You are are self-driven and able to troubleshoot, ask others when appropriate and find answers
  • You are motivated, organised, and willing and able to work well remotely within a distributed team
  • You are able to participate in our weekend on call rotation approximately 1 weekend every 18 weeks

Desired:
  • You have prior experience administering OpenStack
  • You have familiarity with Juju and MAAS
  • You have familiarity with Ubuntu or Debian
  • You have prior experience with configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc.)
  • You have prior experience maintaining and configuring routers and firewalls (Cisco, iptables)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
--
About Canonical
If you want to make a difference, make the move to Canonical.

Life at Canonical is anything but corporate. As a company that exists to support one of todayâs most important open source projects, we are changing the world on a daily basis. Itâs a collaborative environment, but one in which every member of the team takes personal responsibility for everything they produce.

To apply: Please apply via our website at the following link - http://bit.ly/2daVU8U

jobs.title: Senior Database Administrator
jobs.content:
Rockstar San Diego is seeking a Senior Database Administrator to join our award-winning development team. Your primary role will be architecting and operating the databases that play a vital role in the support of critical platforms and services. You should have prior experience in database operations, design and architecture, administration (monitoring and proactive maintenance, tuning and backup and recovery).

The ideal candidate will have a passion for database engines and developing a deep expertise in database internals and systems integration. The DBA must possess strong ownership qualities and be service oriented. Experience in the game industry is not required, but a passion for gaming is a huge plus.

RESPONSIBILITIES

-Installation, architecture, and configuration of MS SQL 2014 & 2016.
-Proactive and reactive performance tuning.
-Participation in ongoing SQL development projects.
-Physical data modelling.
-Develop SSIS and other ETL solutions to analytical platforms.
-Issue detection and resolution.
-Development of automation and scripts to perform proactive maintenance.
-Participate in 24/7 operations via on call rotation schedule.
-Backup and recovery.
-Provide guidance to engineers, architects and additional team members.
-Strong knowledge of deployments and source control.
-Documentation skills for processes and procedures.

QUALIFICATIONS

-Six or more years of current administration experience in MS SQL Server.
-Must possess advanced SQL skills.
-Proficiency in TSQL.
-Expertise in storage, servers, operating systems and application interaction.
-A sense of ownership, initiative and drive.
-Experience in MongoDB, Hadoop, Vertica or Redis is a big plus.
-Solid understanding and proficiency in Linux is a big plus.
-Passion for Rockstar Games is a plus.

jobs.title: Software Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Rockstar is looking for a seasoned developer and security guru to help drive our various software security initiatives. The successful candidate will be committed to keeping our games and services fun for our players through defense against cheaters, hackers, exploiters, and any and all troublemakers. If you consider yourself an expert and champion against hacking, JTAG/jailbreaking, ISO-modding, save modding, trainers, cracking, or any other spoil-making, this may be the job for you.

RESPONSIBILITIES

-Create and innovate new solutions to better secure our products from known vulnerabilities.
-Proactively research unknown vulnerabilities in our products and implement appropriate mitigations.
-Reverse engineer software intended to compromise online gaming environments.
-Research and implement various forms of anti-tamper technologies and/or DRM.
-Follow software SDLC to integrate into the game team’s operations.
-Test cross-platform software solutions to ensure quality.

QUALIFICATIONS

-Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
-3+ years’ experience on a fluid software development team.
-Strong understanding of reverse engineering concepts and methodologies.
-Strong understanding of game protection technologies.
-Experience implementing core cryptography concepts.
-Experience with various debugging environments: WinDbg, x6dbg, OllyDbg/Immunity Debugger.
-Experience with disassemblers and decompilers: IDA Pro.
-Fluency with the following languages: C, C++, x64 assembly.
-Experience with malware analysis preferred.
-Experience with LUA preferred.

jobs.title: Software Development Specialist (ABT00001692)
jobs.content:
Pioneer Hi-Bred, a leader in plant biotechnology delivering advanced plant genetics to farmers, is seeking a software developer to meet ongoing trait informatics research software needs. We are developing leading-edge software to support the characterization and development of commercial traits for various crops in all Pioneer markets. We are looking for creative individuals with critical thinking skills to develop robust and innovative solutions to complex problems in an evolving research environment.

Duties/Responsibilities: Application architecture and development of mission critical shared service oriented systems in and around enterprise middleware tools. Ability to rabidly learn and leverage new technologies as needed.

Work independently and in small groups to achieve goals for the team. With clients directly but mostly with other development teams and business analysts.

Responsible for QA of tools through means of unit tests as well as testing applications for both load and functionality. Also responsible for providing demo code and/or applications for other groups to learn from.

Responsible for some level of system stability, management and deployment as it relates to group managed applications.

Qualifications:

8 years of software development experience required and some years doing systems administration and support. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field or equivalent levels of relevant education and/or experience.

Competencies:

The ideal candidate will have strong written and verbal communication skills and have the demonstrated ability to design and implement robust and effective software applications with a high level of reliability and failover. This position requires:

  • Proven skill in multiple object oriented and scripting languages. (C#, Java, C , Python, Ruby, etc.)
  • In-depth knowledge and experience of at least one large framework (.NET, Java, MFC, etc.)
  • Designing, using, complex relational database systems.
  • Development of Service level component systems.

Desirable but not required:

  • OpenID, OAuth
  • Enterprise middleware experience (IBM Integration Bus, Microsoft BizTalk)

Also should have an interest in biology, genetics, agriculture or just science in general and the ability to understand complex problems.

jobs.title: Telecommute Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Do you hate to maintain code? So do we. That is why we are looking for a creative individual to come up with elegant solutions to unique problems while writing as little code as possible. As an integral part of a small team, you will have the opportunity to introduce new technologies and work with minimal oversight. Our weekly release cycle will make sure you always have something different to work on and keep you excited about what's next.


Most development is focused on our search marketing platform that is used by online marketers focused on search engines – SEM and SEO, social media, local search, mobile search, and shopping engines. Our robust crawler, dashboards, charts and reporting provides marketers with competitive intelligence, brand policing, and policing of affiliate marketers.

jobs.title: Sales Consultant
jobs.content:
HomeAway Software is seeking a talented inside sales team-player based in our Seattle office to generate new business within North America. This position will report to the National Sales Manager and is base plus commission in a team selling environment. To be successful, you'll need to have a world-class combination of organization, time-management, and self-starter abilities all in a consultative team sales environment. You'll need to work closely with your other sales team members as well as across departments. 

Primary Responsibilities:

Prospect, present, and sell complex, Software-as-a-Service vacation rental management software to managers throughout North America
Outbound prospecting based on relevant campaigns (email and phone) 
Qualify and sell to inbound leads in the 0-25 unit market segment. Qualify and triage all others inquiries as appropriate. 
Research and profile targeted companies to identify key contacts & uncover opportunities
Excellent and professional qualification and follow up on leads from website, advertising and trade shows
Identify and document prospect's needs, expectations and priorities
Conduct virtual demonstrations of HomeAway Software offerings
Document every touch point via Salesforce.com
Work closely with HomeAway Software marketing to define and deliver regular outbound campaigns
Weekly and ad-hoc prospect reporting 

Required Skills:

2+ years of sales experience via phone and email (software sales preferred) 
Proven success in lead generation and lead qualification
Knowledge of CRM Systems (Salesforce.com a plus)
Excellent Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word) and organizational skills
Solid understanding of Internet technologies
Strong communication skills
Must be a highly motivated, dependable self-starter with the ability to work independently while maintaining a sense of teamwork
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience


Location: Seattle

Territory: North America
Benefits:

Great Medical & Dental Plans
Highly competitive salary
4 weeks Paid Vacation
Free Vacation Rental on a Yearly Basis (taxable benefit)
Ability to work up to two weeks in any of our offices around the world on a yearly basis
Free Snacks
Weekly company update talks with our C-Team
Free Listing on HomeAway.com
Stand-Up Desk

jobs.title: CS Coordinator French & English/Spanish
jobs.content: Customer Service CoordinatorFull permanent positonWorking days: Monday-Sunday / Bank holidays/Night shift (11.00 pm to 8.00 am) (2 days off a week)Salary: Very attractive salary for the marketRole Description:HomeAway, a leader in the travel industry and a part of one of the strongest companies in the sector globally, is looking for a new Customer Service Coordinator based in Madrid who will lead a multicultural team of 12 people, including agents and a team lead ensuring operational effectiveness whilst meeting department KPI’s and objectives. The HomeAway CS Coordinator is committed to continually delivering great new ways to help our Team Leads and Customer Service Representatives to succeed. This position will work directly with our HomeAway Europe brands with an eye towards helping our organization achieve operational excellence.Key responsibilities:- Manage facilities, Team Leads and Customer Service Specialists ensuring resource is used effectively and responsibly. Execute WFM schedules in line with departmental policies in a timely manner- Closely coordinate with Team Leads and Management pertaining to support service levels and customer experience, and take appropriate actions to correct when needed- Proactively communicate with CS Manager regarding work flow, staffing issues/performance, and customer experience items- Act as an information source for agents' questions pertaining to process, policy and work schedules- Carry out performance measurement (Quality Audits), CSAT scores/feedback, general monitoring, and evaluation of all agents and operators to improve the teams' efficiency. Provide feedback to CSRs and Team Leads in 1:1- Take incoming inquiries over the phone and email about products and services from owners, agencies, and travelers to maintain subject matter expertise and support service level goals- Resolve escalated customer complaints and questions within required timeframe; assist team with de-escalation of calls in real time as needed- Communicate solutions, successes, and opportunities to the Manager of customer support. - Coordinate training for new hires and existing staff; participate in the delivery of training- To demonstrate a commitment towards your own continuous personal development, attend training sessions as required and support and encourage Team Lead and CSR’s personal development and training- Supervisor must be available to cover all hours of business operation and coordinate with the Manager and other leads as point of contact to ensure continuous and full support- Inspire and motivate agents; lead by example- Encourage good team morale- Special projects as designated by managementWho you are (Essential Functions):- Fluent in French in addition to Spanish and English (Spoken and written)- 3+ Years of customer service experience (in contact centers preferred but not essential) with Management people experience- Focus on Customer Loyalty: We are looking for people who are able to understand our customer needs and deliver a World Class customer support- Highly motivated, focused passionate about connecting to the customer- Ability to inspire and support people- Task orientation; ability to plan well and prioritise work. Balancing the need to engage in a positive customer relationship and deliver in line with personal and team KPI’s Must have attention to detail and ability to interpret management information making sound recommendations from analysis- Exemplary communications and leadership skills- Demonstrated time management and organisational skills- Initiative and proactiveness. Proactive anticipation of customer Team Lead and CSR needs- Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must- Professionalism and team work; good people and interpersonal skills to build effective relationships. Maintain calmness under pressure- Good decision-making, IT, and cross-departmental communication skills.- Industry advantages: travel websites, online advertising, eCommerce or additional languages; these are desirable but certainly not essential.- High standards of computer literacy and keyboarding skills. Experience with business support software applications such as MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.) are required. (Intermediate level).

jobs.title: Staff Financial Systems Analyst for FAH or SLA
jobs.content:
World class Enterprise Systems are the foundation enabling the growth of our company. With over $3 billion in annual bookings, HomeAway is the world's leading online marketplace for the vacation rental industry, with sites representing over one million paid listings of vacation rental homes in 190 countries.  The Enterprise Systems team provides the applications that manage people data, count money in multiple currencies, report taxes, and manage our cash with rigorous integrity. We develop system processes to pay the bills, property owners and our people.

As an Enterprise Systems Analyst at HomeAway, you will serve as a functional expert for Information Systems related to Commerce and Financial applications.  Your expertise will help drive long term strategic direction, design requirements, features, functionality, and necessary enhancements.  You will also be responsible for collaborating with internal resources and third party vendors to implement effective solutions to support both strategic and ad-hoc team needs. Working closely with the product owners for Finance, Accounting, and Tax teams, you will leverage both your systems knowledge and your professional expertise to provide support and resolution to functional, technical, and data issues.

Our ideal candidate, at a minimum, will be able to:
- Serve as subject matter expert (SME) for Oracle EBS financial globally including but not limited to: General Ledger, Subledger Accounting, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, E-Business Tax, Cash Management
- Provide applications support by troubleshooting application and data issues
- Document system configuration, functional business processes, user training and technical requirements.
- Identify business requirements and identify technical, procedural and functional gaps.
- Collaborate with product owners, development team, systems team, administrators and consultants to provide in-depth technical and functional solutions and ensure development of efficient and sustainable application systems utilizing established standards, procedures, and methodologies.
- Contribute to the creation and execution of project plans, project schedule, including defining activities, sequence, dependencies, work effort, and task duration.
- Provide strong understanding with the ability to analyze and query application data schemas.
- Document requirements, design and analyze a variety of reports or queries.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
- Demonstrated functional and technical knowledge of Information Systems with 8+ years of global implementation, support, integration, and development / customization experience in Oracle EBS modules.
- Proven experience with multi-national, multi-currency, implementations in a multi-org environment
- Exposure to application administration functions and security module in a multi-org environment.
- Experience with eCommerce systems and processes
- Exposure to AME configuration and Workflow administration.
- Knowledge of Service Oriented Architectures
- Proficient in the personalization of OAF pages
- Strong analytical, change management, task/project management and problem solving skills.
- Knowledge of change management tools and processes, including source code control, versioning, defect tracking and release management.
- Ability to travel on a global basis is required and is estimated at 5-10% depending upon actual projects.
 
Benefits:
- Great Medical & Dental Plans
- Highly Competitive salary
- Target annual bonus
- Company stock (RSU's)
- Employee Stock Purchase Plan
- 4 weeks paid vacation
- Ability to work up to two weeks in any of our offices around the world on a yearly basis
- Free drinks & snacks
- Weekly company update talks with our leadership team
- Free listing on HomeAway.com
- Stand up desk
- Casual dress code

jobs.title: Home Decor Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
notNeutral , founded by Rios Clementi Hale Studios, creates bold, idea-based, accessible objects for the everyday modern lifestyle. Blurring the boundaries between the figural and abstract, and the decorative and functional, the pieces we design are durable, playful, and imbued with a clever take on the ordinary that is unquestionably not neutral. This is a challenging and exciting role that will offer the opportunity to touch all aspects of product development.

The ideal candidate must possess the following skills:
Knowledge of product pattern and surface design for tabletops, beddings, home accessories, hard goods etc.
Technically savvy, detail oriented, creatively versatile, willing and able to learn, and thrive in a fast paced team environment.
Effective communication with factories, vendors and all external and internal customers
Market and trend research; including maintaining and updating physical and digital archives

Graphic Design duties include; pattern design, designing/ creating and preparing layouts, images and content for web mailers, banners, signage and print ads as needed and assisting with social media marketing efforts.

jobs.title: Technical Business Analyst
jobs.content:
Summary of the role: 


The Hotel IT Reporting and BI team is responsible for the Business Intelligence, Reporting, and creating and maintaining the Big Data Architecture for the Amadeus Hotel Platform.  Our team monitors all functions of the system and delivers data analysis in near real time for a platform that runs at greater than 10,000 transactions per second.
Our highly skilled Technical Business Analysts are the people who shape and guide the functional and technical design of our system.  They translate the business needs of the customers into the features and specifications used to implement our systems.  
We work in SCRUM and are looking for experienced Analysts able to propose technical and functional solutions. We value individuals who can see the big picture while still understanding the details of the system. The people who thrive the most at Amadeus are those that are looking to work in a highly collaborative environment with a team drawn from around the world.
We are most interested in candidates who excel at communicating inside and outside their team. Candidates should be able to handle full cycle project work, including reporting, risk analysis, and coordination with all teams (e.g. R&D, Operations, Product Management, and Project Management).



Responsibilities:

• Analyze the business requirements gathered by our product management team 
• Create the functional specifications and report documentation to define how our system 
• Interface with customer during functional specification, testing and initial implementation phases as necessary.
• Work with the development team on the technical design of our products
• Act as the product owner within the SCRUM team to ensure what is delivered meets the customers’ needs
• Identify interactions and assess impacts with other Amadeus packages/products /solutions to ensure functional compatibility of their own area.
• Provide inputs to Product Management for product functionalities enhancement, business cases and RFP responses, based on their knowledge & product experience. May participate to customer workshops

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Summary of the role
 


The Hotel IT Reporting and BI team is responsible for the Business Intelligence, Reporting, and creating and maintaining the Big Data Architecture for the Amadeus Hotel Platform. Our team monitors all functions of the system and delivers data analysis in near real time for a platform that runs at greater than 10,000 transactions per second.


The Java Engineer for Reporting and Business Intelligence is an expert on building high availability, UX driven web applications.    Our ideal candidates are experts in Java and have strong experience in working on database design and Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).


We work in SCRUM and are looking for developers who thrive in a fast paced development cycle.  The people who thrive the most at Amadeus are those that are looking to work in a highly collaborative environment with a team drawn from around the world.



Responsibilities

• Design, build, and test RESTful services in Java capture, analyze, publish and display data 
• Provide technical leadership to the development team
• Provide architectural guidance for our reporting platform
• Work with the Business Analyst to understand how best to meet our customer business needs 
• Design, build, and test our operational data stores on RDBMS (Oracle) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Hadoop ecosystem)

jobs.title: Team Leader / Manager Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Shaping the future of travel is important to us at Amadeus. Today, with technology getting smarter by the minute, that future is more exciting than ever.


Our business success relies on our people being always passionate about what we do. We believe in aiming for excellence, taking responsibility, working together and putting our customers first.


We encourage you to be part of new and exciting projects and for you to take the lead when it comes to your progression.


Since mobility allows you and Amadeus to grow, we always look internally first when searching for candidate.


Summary of the role


Amadeus is the leading provider of IT solutions for the global travel industry. Our North American R&D group in Greater Boston area is expanding! 
The mission of the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is to offer travel search expertise to major customers in 3 distinct areas: airline (Southwest), travel agency (Expedia), travel metasearch engine (Kayak).
The purpose of the Travel Media team is to be the competency centre for the travel metasearch customers: it provides technological support to consultancy teams, understands requirements specific to the business, implements and drives evolutions of products used by these customers.
In a global context of cloud computing adoption, the team is also in charge of redesigning some metasearch products and components to this architecture and operating model.

We are looking for an enthusiastic team leader / manager interested in the Travel Media segment (a business area between the distribution and the airline IT worlds). This position requires a right balance between:
-          functional skills: the meta-search players use a wide list of Amadeus products
-          technical skills: our scalable platform is massively distributed, with 20,000 CPU computing up to 10,000 transactions per second. Solid designs and right technology choices are thus needed to ensure stability and robustness.
-          leadership and management skills: inspire team, build positive relationship with other divisions and other Amadeus sites worldwide, influence at all levels
 


What do we offer:
-          A collaborative Agile organization with teams spread across continents
-          Opportunity to work with some of the best technical minds in the world
-          Opportunities to lead and innovate/drive a new idea 
-          Numerous benefits: awesome health plans, flexible working environment, game room, breakfast, technical conferences…


Main Responsibilities


Empower and coach team members. Provide expertise, support and guidance, when required.


Monitor team activities, budget, milestones, quality and deliveries


Build a competency center dedicated to Travel Media segment


Foster curiosity. Advocate proposals to develop product and platform vision. Use influence skill to defend team ideas


Work with leader peers to develop team spirit. Reinforce relationships with other divisions and other sites

jobs.title: Software Engineer C++ / Python
jobs.content:
Shaping the future of travel is important to us at Amadeus. Today, with technology getting smarter by the minute, that future is more exciting than ever.


Our business success relies on our people being always passionate about what we do. We believe in aiming for excellence, taking responsibility, working together and putting our customers first.


We encourage you to be part of new and exciting projects and for you to take the lead when it comes to your progression.


Since mobility allows you and Amadeus to grow, we always look internally first when searching for candidate.



Summary of Role 



We are seeking today’s leaders who can move toward greater responsibility and results. We also offer internships to college and university students who want to grow and learn from some of the industry’s best experts. Discover how you can shape the future of travel with us.
 
The mission of Amadeus’ Hotel IT team is to design and deliver high performance systems that can process tens of thousands of requests per second and return the highest level of accuracy in the fastest response time. Our SaaS platforms are designed to serve millions of users who are seeking information and reservations from tens of thousands of hotels offering millions of hotel rooms around the world. Utilizing our proven ability to build and deploy mission critical software for the global travel industry, we are creating the next generation of technology solutions for the hospitality industry including: reservations and distribution, high-volume data acquisition from heterogeneous sources, sophisticated search engines, payment processing, hotel operations, business intelligence, and revenue management.



Main Responsibilities



The Data Integrity and Publication team is responsible for guaranteeing that the data in the Amadeus Hotel Platform is synchronized to the rest of the ecosystem with a very high level of reliability and transaction volume.  The team has complete responsibility from defining the APIs, to creation of the publication feeds, to managing the guarantee of delivery and production monitoring.  The system is able to publish thousands of individual events per second at peak.


The Senior Engineer for Data Integrity and Publication the glue that holds the publication system together.  They are responsible for implementing the business logic that allows system to run at peak performance and stay in touch with the rest of the hotel ecosystem. 


We are looking for Senior Software Developer with strong C++ skills and an interest in working in Python to join the team and participate in these efforts in an Agile and collaborative environment. 
 
    • Design and build our outbound API service that publishes our data to the wider ecosystem
    • Architecture our internal data management and prioritization system
    • Implement bindings to bridge our C++ middleware with our Python application layer
    • Provide technical leadership to the development team

jobs.title: Sales Tax Research Analyst
jobs.content:
TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 5,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. Weâre passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers."

We offer TaxJar Reports , a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation.

We have an immediate opening for a Sales Tax Research Analyst who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

As a Sales Tax Research Analyst you will:

  • Monitor sales, use tax and VAT rules and rate changes for all regions supported by TaxJar
  • Confirm and document definitive sourcing rules for all transaction types supported by TaxJar
  • Build and maintain a database of product-level exemptions and reduced rates
  • Research, confirm and document the taxability of shipping and handling
  • Maintain up-to-date sales tax holiday information
  • Identify publicly available data sources and help create process to efficiently update changes within TaxJarâs systems
  • Work directly with the product development team to improve maintainability of data
  • Communicate directly with states and local municipalities where necessary

This is a full-time position available to folks located in the US only. Compensation will be influenced by experience.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree in accounting or finance-related field
  • 3-5 years of experience in a tax-related field, preferable sales and use tax and VAT
  • Prior experience dealing with US state departments of revenue a big plus
  • Superior attention to detailâ¦in this field, itâs critical
  • Clear, concise writer
  • Strong process and documentation skills
  • Self-directed, self-motivated
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc).
  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (Weâre all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Benefits

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

To apply: Submit your application, https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/343376/candidates/new

jobs.title: Lead iOS Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a skilled and experienced iOS Developer with a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits. You are keen to join our team of talented engineers, working to design and build our mobile apps for advancing transportation with connected biking.


What connects us is a passion for cycling, digital technology and good design as well as the desire to try out new things and always question the status quo. We want to make a difference and put ourselves at the forefront of a new movement.


COBI has established a brand new market segment, of which we are the leader. Our partners value this and want to take advantage of this. All of our marketing activities are aimed at making COBI touchable and tangible. We scrutinize every action to ensure that it delivers the COBI experience – whether by trying it out, listening to experiences from others or from a trusted partner. The user, rather than technology, is our key priority.


The ideal candidate will have a great passion for COBI and execute all activities with respect to the COBI brand strategy.


COBI is based in Frankfurt am Main/Germany.

  • et autres activités en fonction des compétences complémentaires dont vous disposez (graphisme par exemple).




GENESIS Groupe est une ESN lyonnaise à taille humaine créée en 1988. Nous sommes une centaine de collaborateurs et intervenons pour nos clients dans le cadre de missions dans les domaines du Conseil, de l’AMOA, des Infrastructures et de l’Ingénierie.



Nous sommes convaincus que notre succès repose sur l'implication et la compétence de nos collaborateurs, aussi nous nous attachons à leur offrir des missions stimulantes ainsi qu'un véritable accompagnement de proximité.



Vous voulez en savoir plus, rencontrez-nous !




Contactez-nous :


Frédérique Moins


Directrice des Ressources Humaines

jobs.title: Staff Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Stryker’s Staff Industrial Designers work with an interdisciplinary product development team to create and launch new products for the medical industry. At Stryker we expect industrial designers at all levels to be passionate about the design process and to demonstrate process leadership with their teams. The industrial designer becomes the product development team’s visual communicator, using visualization tools and methods to improve the team’s ability to collaborate and communicate.

The staff industrial designer informs the team of key trends in design related topics such as product design, color, materials and finishes. Candidates should show passion for design research and the ability to define a product’s aesthetic theme.

Most importantly, the designer’s role is to define the user experience and product attributes that support the experience. In support of the user experience, the staff designer creates divergent product and service solutions to key market and business problems their team has identified as critical to the success of a project.

Finally, the staff industrial designer is responsible for following the product through to production reviewing early manufacturing samples to assure quality and craftsmanship of the final product execution.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
- Assure product concepts proposals are inclusive of market winning attributes consistent with, or inspired by, global design and technology trends.
- Responsible for defining Stryker product offerings, form development, human factors and ergonomics, material selection, finishes, color, brand language and graphical user interfaces.
- Lead the development of a product visual brand language in accordance to the business unit’s product line and portfolio.
- Plan and use a wide range of design tools and methods to create concepts and communicate product direction.
- Work to support a product development team with visual communication in all phases of the product development process.

Qualifications & Experience

- 2+ years of Industrial Design experience.
- Exposure to and some level of competency using digital design tools that may include: Rhino, - Bunkspeed, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Corel Draw, Engineering CAD software, etc.
- Working knowledge of design process, design principles and engineering principles.
- Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.

Education

- Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Design.

jobs.title: Dev Web Fullstack
jobs.content:
Enjeux


Pour nous épauler dans le développement de notre produit, et contribuer directement au succès d’Entr’UP, vous devrez faire face à de vrais enjeux techniques :



  • un serious game poussé pour l’expérience irréprochable et unique de nos utilisateurs ;

  • de l’algorithmique avancé au service de la fluidité de l’expérience, et des performances et de l’efficacité de l’Ace et de son évolution pour les grands groupes. Cet enjeu s’inscrit dans la volonté et le besoin d’automatisation de nos outils, via notamment une exploitation et une analyse de données recueillies.


Nous attendons enfin de notre futur collaborateur un réel engagement et l’objectif est qu’il s’approprie les différents projets d’Entr’UP.


Projets


Les trois projets principaux d’Entr’UP sont les suivants :



  • l’amélioration de la plateforme de matchmaking, en fonction des retours quotidiens des 3000 entrepreneurs inscrits ;

  • l’amélioration de l’expérience et du fond de l’Ace, notre outil de compatibilité entre associés, suite à une analyse des passations de nos clients et de leurs retours ; 

  • la conception et le développement de notre nouvel outil d’aide à la décision automatisé pour la création de Business Units et le recrutement dans les ETI et les grands groupes (projet lancé dès septembre). 


Responsabilités


Vous devrez :



  • vous intégrer au sein de notre équipe de 7 membres, dont 3 cofondateurs (dont un CTO, avec qui vous échangerez régulièrement) et 2 développeurs (que vous « leaderez » au quotidien) ;

  • veiller au bon respect des deadlines imposées par nos clients, et préalablement déterminées en accord avec le CTO ;

  • amener votre expérience à l’équipe, et nous aider à améliorer nos workflows déjà bien définis (dans le cadre d’une intégration continue notamment).

jobs.title: Cloud Support Engineer
jobs.content:
__Overview & Responsibilities__

Rackspace is seeking an Enterprise Cloud Support Engineer in Toronto, Canada to join the Strategic Accounts team.  The Cloud Support Engineer will support one of our largest Enterprise clients based in Toronto, helping them develop into a Cloud Operator while working with bleeding-edge cloud technology.
 
__Cloud Support Engineers will:__

* Manages and supports the Dev to Production cloud IaaS and platform, to ensure quality, performance and availability of hosted services. 
* The Engineer provides guidance and support for cloud technology practitioners.  The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting IaaS and PaaS hosted on the Cloud.  The end result will advance and integrate with existing support model to produce an ITIL compliant ecosystem that minimizes human interactions in support of true cloud solutions.
* Provide Level 2 cloud infrastructure support across all environments operating in the Cloud. Primary focus is on Openstack.
* Provide planning, communication, and reporting of day-to-day ticket metrics for daily huddles
* Manage non-standard/complex major incidents, standard incidents, and service requests efficiently and expediently
* Ensure customer service satisfaction and enable continuous improvements
* Oversee higher complexity operational and preventive maintenance tasks
* Manage complex remedial and unscheduled urgent changes
* Accessible via a mobile device to support on-call escalations
* Ensure timely and accurate communication of business objectives
* Promote and support an environment that encourages productivity, innovation, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism

__Job Requirements:__

* Must have infrastructure experience working with enterprise level RedHat Linux
* Cloud platform experience (OpenStack, AWS, Azure)
* The successful applicant must have a solid understanding of Incident, Change, and Problem Management methodologies, as well as solid experience in a large Production environment.
* Understanding of provisioning platforms (e.g. OpenStack, Cloudify, SaltStack, Rundeck, etc.)
* Development background in scripting/automation is an asset (python, java, etc.)
* Middleware/Applications (Redis, RabbitMQ, Tomcat, JBoss, WebSphere Application Server)
* Databases (Oracle, SQL Server)
* ITIL v3
* Strong understanding of virtualization fundamentals; IaaS services (compute, storage, network)
* Understanding of Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Software Defined Infrastructure (SDI)
* Proven ability to work in a fast paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities
* Strong technology background, demonstrated history of design and implementation experience
* Demonstrated ability to understand, evaluate, and deploy new and emerging technologies
* Strong analytical skills with ability to assess dependencies, risks, issues, etc.
* Solid understanding of technology governance process and policies
* Proven ability to work in a fast paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities
vExcellent written and verbal communication, negotiation and partnership skills - ability to stay resilient under pressure
* Expertise in working effectively in teams â requires a track record of working cross-organizationally and with multiple stakeholders at varying levels
* Strategic thinker able to think conceptually and high degree of attention to detail
* Demonstrates resilience, persistence and flexibility in all aspects of Innovation Delivery

jobs.title: Visual / Interaction Designer
jobs.content:
EchoUser is a growing full-service User Experience research & design firm based in San Francisco, CA, with satellite offices in Boulder, CO (THIS JOB!), and Washington, DC. We're looking for our next Visual / Interaction Designer, based in Boulder or Denver, to help our great clients. Check out the details of the job and ideal candidate below. Could this be you? Send along a brief letter of interest and link or attach resume information to careers@echouser.com.

JOB TITLE
User Experience Designer (early career or experienced -- We are considering multiple openings, the exact title would be appropriate to your level.) Depending on your background, a specification could also be added to your title; e.g., 'Visual Design', 'Interaction Design', etc.

JOB DESCRIPTION
First and foremost, having great oral and written skills can be a cliche, but for us it is a lifeblood. Our specialty is communicating user experience. Awesome visual & interaction design is a starting point. Communicating that design amongst ourselves, and most importantly to the clients, is key to our success.

This role would primarily involve visual & interaction design across a broad set of projects. Our clients range from enterprise to consumer, Fortune 500 to unfunded start-ups. Products include software apps, mobile apps, websites, technical tools, hardware, medical devices, services, spaces, public transportation, asteroids (yes, asteroids), and more. Broad UX skill-sets are a must. We specialize in complexity, whether that is in the product itself, the domain, user population, idea, actual design, etc. Deeply understanding our client’s needs and reducing it to the compellingly simple is a common thread of our work.

While "visual & interaction design" is the label for the primary role, we very much understand the Hunting the Unicorn conundrum (search for that and Design Staff, Google Ventures, if you haven't read that great blog). Basically, all designers are unique. You may have an art, political science, journalist, industrial design, or database administrator background. Or you may have very direct educational and training background. Either way, now, through experience, you can demonstrate yourself as a great designer in some fashion. If this sounds like you, please read on.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS
* Knowledge and skills in visual and interaction design. Wireframes, graphic artwork, design specifications, functional prototypes, concept designs, etc. You should be able to show us work samples that demonstrate your passion for design and breadth of ability.

* Ideally you have ‘big company’ experience. Many of our clients require a certain level of ‘big company’ professionalism and design detail (in fact, many of them are actually big companies). Having said that, your ability to take all that you know and fit it to a super-charged fast-as-we-can early-stage start-up client is important as well. One size does not fit all.

* Technically adept with a variety of software products. We are constantly testing new software for clients, from top-end enterprise to mobile consumer products. We are also expected to deliver results across a variety of publishing formats; e.g., simple reports, web delivery, video, etc.

* Well-versed in "user research and usability". Given that we wear many hats, no one will be designing in a cave. User research and usability is a core business driver for us. You must be able to participate in these activities.

* Some more technical skills. What exactly? Who knows; you tell us. There's something you do, can build, or know about that is interesting to you and that we'd like to hear about.

* A degree in a design-oriented specialization is required. Other technical degrees with emphasis or specific experience in these areas are also welcome.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The EchoUser Team
www.EchoUser.com

Application Details

Along with your resume (LinkedIn preferred), please send us a brief letter introducing yourself, your goals, and why you'd like to work with us at EchoUser. Some portfolio is required (even student or personal ones). It doesn't need to be perfect (in fact, showing messy process is great), but we do need to see design examples.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Small Company, Big Opportunities
jobs.content:
We're looking for software developers of all experience levels to join our Chicago-based team. We build complex and compelling web applications for clients in the health and well-being industry, utilizing our own software, Pepper. To best serve our clients, you'll delve into new subject matter every day, and you'll always be on the lookout for innovative ways to approach our software projects. We're looking for curious, collaborative people who are eager to teach what they already know and who jump at an opportunity to dive into new territory. 


Here's where you come in:


You'll join our cross-functional consulting teams in developing custom web applications for our clients. Our software is currently written with Java, the Spring Framework, Vaadin, HTML5, CSS (using Less), and a very heavy dose of JavaScript (primarily jQuery, Dojo, and Angular). You might have a greater interest in some of these technologies than others, but we're looking for people who want to make a well-rounded, full-stack contribution to every part of a project.


Since work is a huge part of your life, we want it to be interesting (new technologies, subject matter, and challenges) and fun (company outings, team sports, catered lunches, etc). Vodorians work hard, support each other, and walk away satisfied. We keep up with the latest technologies, tools, and tricks of the trade - we're always refining our approach, and everyone has a seat at the table.

jobs.title: Front-end wizard with full stack experience
jobs.content:
There’s plenty of cool stuff to be done, and we’re looking for skilled developers, to help us do just that!


We are working hard to meet and supersede customer needs and expectations. Serving more than 100.000 customers, we have our hands full, and are looking for more talent, to help us grow and maintain our application.


We are primarily working on the .NET stack with a cutting-edge JavaScript client-side and are always focused on building for stability, performance and scalability.


Don’t like what you see? Change it! For any given task at hand, choice of tech is up to you! If it could work, why not try it? We encourage exploring new tech, as well as adhering to proven principles and methods. Nothing is set in stone, except the urge to deliver quality.


Sounds interesting? Read on!



To help us stay on top, as a market leader, we need someone who



  • Loves code and takes pride in their work

  • Is looking for an opportunity to gain and share knowledge

  • Knows that developing software is a team effort

  • Dares to challenge the status quo



If you join us, you will have



  • A chance to work with some of the best professionals in the industry

  • Influence on the tools and technologies in our stack

  • Professional and personal growth through inspiring colleagues, challenging tasks, conferences, hackathons and meet-ups

  • An excellent Christianshavn location with a view of Den Sorte Diamant across the harbor

  • Open and friendly colleagues in a very informal social culture

  • Free phone, internet and choice of Mac, Win or Linux work machine

  • A first-class canteen


We expect you to have



  • Solid experience working with CSS and developing Web Applications

  • Solid experience working with .js and preferably familiar with React.js

  • Senior (5+ years of professional experience)

  • C# / .NET experience

  • Cloud (Azure) experience


We think you should have



  • A genuine desire to stay updated on new tools and technologies

  • An interest in Continuous Integration, DevOps and high frequency deployments

  • Excellent English communication skills

  • A burning passion for building, shipping and deploying business-critical web applications

  • Adequate programming competencies for the full stack



Please apply with both CV and cover letter



About Us
e-conomic resides on Christianshavn in central Copenhagen and is part of Visma. We build and design a cloud-based accounting product that helps companies run their business. 100.000 happy customers use our product on a regular basis. We are 170 employees from 20+ nationalities.


The development department consists of 40+ people, including Product Owners, QA engineers and UX designers, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB.


We serve more than 50 million requests a day, push to production several times a week, love to talk about (and write) code, believe strongly in automation, and are driven by a desire to measure and monitor in order to constantly improve our product.

jobs.title: Hardcore engineer to platform team
jobs.content:
Engineer to join our Platform Team
Do you feel motivated about making complex things simple? Do you want to demonstrate your skills in the most used cloud based accounting platform in Denmark?
If yes, then read on.
e-conomic is growing and we still need talented people to join our exciting journey. This time, we are looking for an Engineer to join our Platform Team.

As a person, we expect you to…



  •       Be self-motivated

  •       Have strong developer skills

  •       Have MS SQL Knowledge

  •       Have a DevOps mind-set

  •       Show willingness to take ownership

  •       Contribute to our good team chemistry

  •       Have strong customer focus


Your responsibilities
You will be part of our Platform Team that is responsible for leading the design and evolution of our platform. That involves both long term planning to take our developer experience to the next level as well as strong urge to automate all things repeated. You will have a high degree of influence on your daily tasks, and you will be expected to take an active part in identifying your own tasks and set an example for how things are done best. If you are not comfortable refactoring legacy code and writing tests this job is not for you.


What can we offer you?



  •       As many challenges as you want

  •       App. 40 developers

  •       Social activities

  •       Strong customer focus

  •       A possibility to make a change

  •       The chance to work for a major player in Nordic countries

  •       Large customer base (100K +)

  •       Highly instrumented platform

  •       A platform that isn't just in maintenance mode

  •       Cloud platform

  •       A prime location in the Copenhagen Harbour


So who are we?
e-conomic resides on Christianshavn in central Copenhagen and is part of Visma. We build and design the cloud based accounting system e-conomic.dk that helps more than 100,000 happy companies run their business. We are 170 employees from 20+ nationalities.


The development department consists of 40+ people, including Product Owners, QA engineers and UX designers, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB.


We serve more than 50 million requests a day, push to production several times a week, love to talk about (and write) code, believe strongly in automation, and are driven by a desire to measure and monitor in order to constantly improve our product.


If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact hiring manager Rasmus Beck on +45 4011 1772 or on rbb@e-conomic.com.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer for machine learning startup
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Mid / Senior Frontend Developer to join our team and help turn dreams into reality. If you’re always on top of the latest technologies, have a keen eye for design and you love creating scalable frontend architectures (yes it’s a thing!) - read along! :)


Our tech stack:


We always strive to use the most suitable tool for the job, so our stack is constantly evolving. We write our frontend code in Typescript using ES6 modules. Our frameworks of choice are: Angular 1.5 (yay for multiple transclusion slots!) and React + a simples flux implementation (stateless components ftw!) . We have several applications that are yet to build so you'll have the opportunity to choose the technology that will best fit each project.


We’re not afraid to challenge our choices, we love open source and above all, we’re a product driven company so technology is at the core of everything we do. You can check out our full stack on StackShare.


Our development culture:


We are a small team that moves fast and iterates. We do weekly sprints, code reviews, testing, and once your code is submitted it gets pushed to production through our continuous deployment infrastructure (using Jenkins). We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness. You will get to work with a dedicated UX designer, and amazing engineers specializing in machine learning and distributed systems.


What you can expect from us:


As an early engineer in a small team, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on the product, company vision and culture. You will get to work with the latest technologies out there, without being bound to any legacy. Have the opportunity to solve real-life problems using machine learning. We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring! it's going to be an exciting ride!


Compensation


Your annual compensation will be between 20,000 and 42,000 EUR pre-tax ( about $22,500 - $47,000) plus equity, based on your experience, qualifications and location.


If this sounds like a company you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch with your CV and work samples at: JoinUs+Frontend@findify.io


Also, be sure to give us an idea of what kind of person you are in addition to your skills, because cultural fit is as important to us as your front end development abilities!



We’d love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
UBIMET has its headquarters in Vienna, Austria and ranks among the leading weather service providers in Europe. International experts in the fields of meteorology, physics, biology and geography issue customized, individual and precise weather forecasts for several million private and industrial customers in many countries. The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. In order to deal with a rapidly growing number of potential clients, we are looking for highly skilled, exceptional people to join our team in the position of         


Android Developer (f/m)


(Full-time)


As part of the Mobile Development team you will develop the latest and greatest mobile weather apps.


This is an amazing opportunity to be involved in every step of the development process, from


brainstorming product ideas, to pushing apps outside the door.



Your Responsibilities:





  • Development of intricate and innovative native weather apps




  • Participation and contribution in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including requirements definition, specifications, development, testing, product release and maintenance




  • Contribution to the existing mobile app portfolio for B2C markets
