jobs.title: PRODUCT SUPPORT MANAGER (REMOTE)
jobs.content:
Location: remote; 40 hour/week plus occasional weekends; Start: asap

We are Europeâs largest developer of open source tools for news media. As an organisation, we are at the forefront of developments taking place at the intersection of nonprofit, technology and journalism.

The community around our open source products for media consists of journalists, writers, developers, publishers, open source advocates, existing clients, potential clients and more. We love them all and we want them to love us back. Thatâs why we are looking for an amazing person to communicate with them.

Our Product Support Manager is vital, sitting at the forefront of our organisation and acting as the first point of contact for the community. Being a great communicator with good technical understanding, you will be able to answer incoming enquiries and bring other experts into the conversation as required. You will report to our Head of Support and join a fantastic team made up of two other product support managers.

YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES...
  • Be the first point of contact for all enquiries and keep track of all these conversations 
  • Provide information to potential clients across the range of our product and service offerings including hosted services, paid implementations, support and consulting
  • Manage the accounts of all existing clients across all our systems
  • Regularly liaise a with Sourcefabricâs existing clients and community and share that feedback with the team
  • Provide troubleshooting in instances where things have gone wrong for a client
  • Communicate with the wider Sourcefabric team, relaying the communityâs concerns, wishes, questions and problems to the respective responsible parties

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR...
  • Candidate able to work 18:00-02:00 EST / 08:00-16:00 AEST to cover West coast of the USA and Australia working hours (not necessary to be based in those time zones)
  • Great communicator, written and verbal
  • Good problem solver
  • Ability to understand and convey technical support
  • Ability to gather and relay complex information
  • Fluent in English and very good skills in at least one other language (German preferred)
  • Well organised and flexible self-motivator
  • Team player who can work with little supervision and report effectively
  • Experience with SaaS provisioning and relevant programmes (ideally WHMCS and 2checkout) would be great but are not necessary

WHAT WE OFFER
At Sourcefabric, we know how to work hard, but we also know how to have fun. Our employees are so much more than their jobs, and we recognise that and celebrate it in many ways. From marathon runners to music composers, we continue to learn new and interesting things about our fellow employees every day.

THE PERKSâ¦
  • An international environment: Find yourself surrounded by talented team members from across the globe (more than 14 countries).
  • A competitive work package: This includes flexible working arrangements, fantastic office locations (think Prague, Berlin, Toronto and more) and training opportunities to help you grow and develop your personal skill set.
  • Annual jamboree: Our staff get-together, Sourcecamp, is part hackathon, part show-and-tell, part strategy-wrangling and all fun. We fly everyone from wherever they are based to our chosen location (which could be anywhere) and spend a few days working together and creating great memories in a lovely setting.

HOW TO APPLY

Send us your CV (no more than two pages), a cover letter (including your salary expectations) to jobs@sourcefabric.org.

Deadline: 31 October 2016
Start: asap

Wait for us to reply. Even if we donât think it will be a good fit for the both of us, we will get back to you.

* NO AGENCIES PLEASE. Please note that we only consider applications submitted by individuals, recruiting agencies should refrain from contacting us.

To apply: jobs@sourcefabric.org

jobs.title: Android Hunt - up to 2000 EUR per month
jobs.content:
Position: Senior Android Developer


Salary Range: up to 2000 EUR per month


Number of developers: 5


First of all, people say you’re a genius at what you do! This is precisely why we waited for you all these years. We’re celebrating NSoft’s eighth anniversary in a few days and we would like to use the opportunity to introduce you to our employees. We’ve already announced your arrival. Everyone’s thrilled, even Krišto.


You’ll fit in easily because our employees are of all profiles and dimensions – at NSoft we don’t mind if you’re different. We choose sides only when it comes to Pokemons – either you chase them or you don’t. If you want to join the hunt, just take a glance at our development and you’ll see the Pokemon crew passing between desks in zigzag maneuvers like Janica Kostelic holding up their smartphones – they definitely want to be the best Pokemon trainers. If you’re one of those who are surprised that someone could spend hours catching virtual monsters using their smartphones, you’re free to visit our cafe and say the magic words: “Ah these Pokemons, we used to chase girls/boys back in my time”, and you will definitely find a new crew to sit with and discuss major world issues such as this one.


When you meet our cheerful staff at SPARK caffe, soon it will become your favorite place for a drink with Skoo, a break, fresh orange juice or PES match.


Our Android team is currently small and young, and we need your help to grow and develop it. You'll be part of our "core team" for the development of our games and software solutions on the Android platform, which will be among our most important products in the future. The job is dynamic and challenging, as you will be working constantly on new things and using new technologies to develop interesting applications.


There are rumors that you’ve programmed for Android since the days of Eclipse and that your knowledge of Android is extraordinary. The story goes that you’re great in Gradle and Git and that you’re a master of fragmentation. Your UI can handle all widths and lengths. We know you’ve tried all the libraries, but yours are simply better :-) In the end, your years of experience left no one indifferent, and we’re no exception.


We’re glad you like Mostar and hopefully you tolerate heat well – after all, we spend our weekends at the seaside or on Neretva river banks.


Send us more information about yourself at posao@spark.ba so we can know on which bank account to release the paycheck up to 2000 EUR high.


#androiddeveloperbecausebadassmiracleworkerisnotanofficialjobtitle


Visit page

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer - Full Stack - £50k
jobs.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer - Node, Angular, MongoDB, Redis, Message Queues - Padiham (40 minutes from Manchester) - up to £50k + benefits.


We're a B2B startup with strong financial backing, big ambitions and plans for rapid growth. Our product makes it easy for businesses to build, host and manage bots in messaging platforms such as Facebook Messenger and Slack. Try it at https://flowxo.com.


What does the work involve?


You'll be working on both the front-end (Angular) and also the back-end (Node, MongoDB, Redis and a message queue). The work is challenging, as we're building a platform that is sending and receiving messages to/from several platforms.


Although there's obviously some complexity in the codebase, we've worked hard to reduce technical debt, achieve excellent test coverage, and follow conventions where possible. So you'll be joining a project where most of the working day is spent thinking about the future rather than catching up with the past. That's not to say our work is done, we have a long way to go!


The role is for a senior developer, who will lead other developers as we grow our team in Padiham, UK. It's a 40 minute commute from Manchester, with plenty of free parking and a view of the countryside!


The team


We're a small team split between head office (near Manchester, UK) and remote developers based in the UK and worldwide. Tools such as Trello and Slack help us communicate. We try and make roles, responsibilities and goals clear so that we can each get on with our own work without needing to be in constant communication.


Ideally, you will:



  • Have experience of Node, Angular & MongoDB.

  • Preferably have worked with Redis and MySQL too.

  • Know common tools such as Git, unit testing frameworks, and PaaS such as Heroku.

  • Have worked with API's, and are familiar with SOAP, XML, JSON and API authentication strategies.

  • Be engaging, approachable and pragmatic.

  • Be great at written communication.

  • Be thorough. Always be considering 'what if', so you can write code and design logic that is robust and secure.

  • Have commercial acumen and business awareness.


What's in it for me?



  • A very competitive salary.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Part-time remote working available.

  • A great team.

  • Free parking.

  • We're a business that believes in finding great people, giving them clear goals, and letting them get on with the job.

jobs.title: DevOps engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a talented, experienced, full-time DevOps engineer to help us with our infrastructure development. The work relates to both multi-tenant cloud infrastructure (currently hosted in Google compute engine) as well as making sure the product we deliver to customer specific on-premises installations meets the myriad customers needs. In order to thrive in the job, you might occasionally need to touch the backend codebase as well.

REQUIREMENTS

  • A deep understanding of Linux systems and Storage technologies
  • Solid programming skills (Ruby, Ruby on Rails)
  • A dedication to solve problems and deliver solutions
  • Knowledge of version control systems, binary repositories and registries for software asset management

Knowledge in the following technologies is a must:

  • Docker
  • Rails stack
  • Chef
  • Bash
  • Networking
  • Storage solutions
  • Cluster, high-availability and disaster recovery configurations
  • Continuous Delivery, Jenkins
  • Common linux distributions (RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian)

Bonus points for:
  • Interests in blogging and showing off your work in public.

BENEFITS

We offer possibilities for career progression in the company. You will have an opportunity to make a difference in an innovative tech startup. You will be able to work from anywhere and anytime, as long as you can make some of your working time overlap with business hours in the GMT+3 time zone. Read more about our working culture and hiring process at https://deveo.com/about and check our stack from http://stackshare.io/deveo/deveo

The perfect candidate has a passion for craft and a resume to back it up. Please send us links to your works, Github, Blog or any other resources you are proud of. Also, please attach a cover letter telling about yourself and why do you want to work for Deveo.

To apply: https://deveo.workable.com/jobs/342944/candidates/new

jobs.title: Frontend Developer for heavily funded start-up with 450,000 new users per month
jobs.content:
Our engineering teams are passionate about building the best recruitment platform in the world. The teams are responsible for giving Jobandtalent’s service to millions of people, processing millions of job openings, and generating millions of job suggestions. Your code is more than meaningful, it changes lives.


As a member of our engineering team you will build and improve our products, add new features, and work closely with other teams across the company to define our engineering roadmap. Engineering at Jobandtalent is divided into small teams that work independently, focused on a feature set: mobile, candidates, companies, algorithms and architecture are some of those teams. They’re multidisciplinary and manage the life-cycle of any idea from inception to deployment.

You will join one of our cross-functional teams at Jobandtalent: being involved with the rest of team members in all of the steps of the development process, from planning and design to the actual implementation.

As a Frontend engineer you’ll be in charge of developing new functionalities for our web applications writing elegant and maintainable code.



Requirements and responsibilities



  • You care about the quality of the code that you write and are familiar with clean code methodologies.

  • Knowledge of modern Javascript frameworks as well as vanilla Javascript (both ES5 and ES6): with a solid understanding of the basics and tricky parts of the language.

  • CSS and preprocessors for developing responsive web applications.

  • Experience on implementing different types of automated tests for the code that you write, using frameworks like Mocha, Karma, PhantomJS, …,

  • Understanding of Web Performance Optimization techniques.


Why it´s a great place to work


We value learning and feedback and are committed to encouraging and supporting each other’s professional growth. Moreover, we believe in sharing our knowledge with and contributing to the wide tech community. We frequently host guest speakers at our Gin & Talent events, which feature technology and business leaders from top start-ups in the area.


We’ve put a lot of energy into creating an office environment that sparks creativity and promotes social interactions. There are plenty of spaces where you can take a break from work to refresh your mind. Jam in our DJ spot, spend an afternoon in our sofa area, or battle your teammates in a nerf© guns war.

jobs.title: Frontend: Browserify, WebComponents, eHealth
jobs.content:
Predict patient at risk and prevent

Severe adverse events due to inappropriate medication is a major problem in health care. Since 2008 we are a startup at the University Zurich and identify patients at risk using rules and increasingly artificial intelligence. We are building a web application to empower the physician in the prevention of these problems. Our group of students, pharmacists and physicians is currently selecting new staff to work with us onsite. You may be employed via the university as a scientist or at the startup.

We offer to be part of a young enthusiastic team. Our next three years may change healthcare and will be for everyone involved the experience of a lifetime. Lunch is free ;)

You can find a demo of our projects at e.g. https://matrix.epha.ch (Chrome, Mozilla, Safari). We need someone with experience and contributions to other public projects.

Frontend Engineer (60-100%)

  1. WebComponents
    e.g. https://github.com/epha/component-button-color

  2. Nodejs (browserify,tape,synaptic,..)

jobs.title: Advertising Engineer
jobs.content:
The Role


As a member of the Advertising Operations Team, the Advertising Engineer will plan, manage and monitor the technical implementation of both video and display ad units across a wide variety of platforms like native and web-apps on Desktops, iOS, Android and more. Beyond dealing with conventional ad units, you’ll work on strategic projects that require a deep understanding of the latest technologies in the Online and Apps universe.


As the Advertising Engineer you will report to the Product Manager Advertising. Besides the daily tasks within the Ad Operations Team you will work closely together with the engineering and sales teams to align market requirements and technical constraints to lay the foundations for further growth in Zattoo’s ad revenues.


In this position you will benefit from a high degree of independence and flexibility due to our small team. You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work at with our flat hierarchies, pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to developing and selling world class products.



The Responsibilities



  • Evaluate technology-driven business opportunities

  • Setting up and managing ad units utilizing our existing ad server setup (Google DFP 6)

  • Managing Ad Network and Sell-Side-Platform integration

  • Support and backup the ad operations team (processual and hands-on)

  • Optimize the direct sales process chain from offer to invoice using CRM tools and engineering know-how

  • Giving early warning in case of aberration

  • Special projects/assignments to help building new platforms and advertising products

jobs.title: Devops Engineer
jobs.content:
We are hiring for Devops Engineer for our Routing team based in Berlin


About the Team:


 The Routing team aims at providing the best possible directions to drivers, pedestrians and public transit users. We've been developing cutting-edge routing solutions as well as web services used by millions of users around the world through



  • smartphone apps such as HERE Drive and HERE Maps,

  • web sites like here.com (feel free to give it a try!),

  • integrated solutions in the automotive context.


Joining us as a DevOps Engineer, you'll be key player in the release process of one of the most versatile route calculation engines, capable of both running on low-end devices and taking advantage of high-end cloud computing virtual machines. You'll bring your experience and skills to our exciting project within a competent, cross-functional, “multiculti” (10+ nationalities), passionate and self-organized team.


 In an Agile context, your responsibilities will include:



  • continuous delivery per se: providing reliable software releases through build, packaging, test, and deployment automation,

  • release management: planning, gate-keeping (definition of Done), etc.

  • data management: performance monitoring, usage breakdown, etc.

  • communication aspects: reporting results, prepare release notes and user guides, bridging gaps between R&D and stakeholders.

jobs.title: Lead /Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HERE location services are used by millions of people every day on mobile devices, in cars, wearables and on the web. We are pushing the boundaries of, and extending the horizons for the highly-autonomous driving, Virtual Reality and IoT.


HERE IoT is one of the business units, developing and bringing to market focused products and services.


 What will you do? 



  • This role will lead cloud development team of IoT Cloud Platform Product targeted for location centric IoT use cases for large variety of IoT verticals from consumer products to asset and goods tracking, fleet management, on-demand mobility and delivery services, smart cities, smart home, smart office and many others.



  • You will work together with UX designers, frontend developers, embedded and hardware engineers, data scientists, infrastructure teams, and other diverse sets of disciplines. You will be part of larger development organization developing IoT Cloud Platform, IoT Client libraries and E2E reference applications on mobile and web for location tracking and geo-fencing use cases both outdoors and indoors.

jobs.title: Software Engineer C++
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about object-oriented design and C++ programming? Are you looking for a cross-cultural team to learn new things and be technically challenged? Do you want to see your software used by millions of people? Then come and join


About Maps Search Team


We are an international team with a high competence in C++ software development, Information Retrieval, Statistics and Search Quality Measurement. Our product is responsible for answering geographic search queries on millions of mobile devices, wearables and in-car navigation systems for premium brands. Examples of search queries are street addresses, cities, landmarks and points of interest (POIs). We use locally stored map data to answer user queries without the need for an internet connection. We apply agile software development processes and tools to build our product. We are solving problems with state of the art information retrieval models and measure quality of our search. Our team members are keen to learn from each other and soon from your experiences and skills!


As a C++ Engineer in our team, you will:



  • Develop a search software for mobile, wearables and in-car navigation systems

  • Writing efficient code and algorithms to answer our queries instantaneously

  • Design efficient data formats to store millions of places

  • Discuss and review software design and code before checking-in

  • Use query logs, simulation queries and metrics to measure the quality of our search

jobs.title: Senior C++ Engineer - On-Device Search
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate engineer with excellent C++ skills to help improve our on-device local search; the position is located in Berlin, Germany


About HERE


HERE, a Nokia company, offers the world’s freshest maps and location experiences across multiple screens and operating systems. Formerly known as NAVTEQ and Nokia Location & Commerce, we established our new unified brand in 2012. HERE inspires a new generation of location services and devices helping more people to navigate their lives with ease and confidence every day and everywhere. Built on 30 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers “Maps for Life” for 196 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries, live traffic information for 41 countries, and support over 50 languages. Our maps can be found in 4 out of 5 in-car navigation systems in North America and Europe. We have powered mobile and web companies for more than 10 years. Our customers include Amazon, Yahoo, Garmin, BMW, Toyota, and many more. We are very proud of being the largest and most highly-trained team of map-makers on the planet with 6,000 people in more than 56 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit http://360.here.com


About our on-device search team


Our software answers geographic searches on millions of mobile devices.Examples of search queries include street addresses, cities, landmarks and points of interest (POIs). We use locally stored map data to answer user queries, without the need for an online connection. Our challenges include answering these queries using the latest Information Retrieval (IR) techniques in resource-scarce environment. We develop efficient lookup methods and highly compressed indices based on world-class geo-data.


As a Senior C++ Engineer in our team, you will be:




  • Developing local search software for mobile and car


  • Reviewing C++ software design


  • Designing efficient data formats


  • Measuring and optimizing software performance

jobs.title: Junior Software Engineer, Routing - C++, Algorithms
jobs.content:
Have you recently graduated and are you now looking for a challenging entry-level position in one of the fastest growing and most exciting industries of today? Read on and join our Routing Team at HERE Berlin as a Junior Software Engineer and have the opportunity to work on one of the most versatile route calculation engines. The initial duration of the contract is 6 months.


Who we are


The Routing team aims at providing the best possible directions to drivers, pedestrians and public transit users. We've been developing cutting-edge routing solutions as well as web services used by millions of users around the world through:



  • smartphone apps such as HERE Drive and HERE Maps,

  • web sites like here.com (feel free to give it a try!),

  • integrated solutions in the automotive context.


In order to scale up our response to an energizingly increasing demand, we're now looking for a new teammate who will bring his experience and skills to our exciting project within a competent, cross-functional, “multiculti” (10+ nationalities), passionate and self-organized team.


What you’ll be doing


As a Young Professional in routing software engineering, you'll have the opportunity to work on one of the most versatile route calculation engines, capable of both running on low-end devices and taking advantage of high-end cloud computing virtual machines. You'll contribute to a wide range of features impacting routing graph preparation, core routing algorithms, maneuver/instruction generation, road traffic update, REST and native APIs, etc.


In an Agile context, you'll share the duties of your teammates:



  • elaboration of user stories, (including initial estimation & acceptance criteria)

  • writing executable acceptance tests, (specification by example)

  • writing unit tests,

  • writing performance tests/benchmarks where applicable,

  • development of new features per se, (refining acceptance criteria)

  • maintenance and refactoring of existing code,

  • sharing progress and impediments (daily stand-up meeting) and addressing them with your teammates,

  • participating to team ceremonies, (review/demo, retrospective, planning)

  • taking part in the development infrastructure, (build, testing, continuous integration, etc.)

  • contributing to the documentation. (deliverables, team's wiki)

jobs.company: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis
jobs.content: The Earth Observation Systems (EOS) Research Group within IIASA’s Ecosystems Services and Management (ESM) Program has built and deployed tools and platforms to use citizen science, crowdsourcing and expert knowledge in order to improve in-situ data and the overall information base of land cover and land use globally via product integration and geospatial approaches and is now looking to recruit an Application Developer.

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.company: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis
jobs.content:
Mobile App Developer, Ecosystems Services and Management (ESM) Program - 2016 - IIASA


The Earth Observation Systems (EOS) Research Group at the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA) is devising new approaches to collect, harmonize, verify and share spatial information, with an emphasis on citizen science.


Background:


The research carried out by IIASA's Ecosystems Services and Management (ESM) program focuses on ecosystem management for provision of services related to fiber, food, water and bioenergy under global change. The team benefits from a pluridisciplinary research environment, where quantitative analysis plays a strong role in linking a wide spectrum of models, reaching from detailed process based biophysical models to global economic models. The Program is strongly connected to the international academic community, placing emphasis on transdisciplinary synergies and applied approaches. The work accomplished has long been recognized through regular publication in high-ranking scientific journals. In addition, the ESM Program has been invited to participate in numerous policy-oriented consultations and large scale scientific exercises.


Accurate and reliable spatially explicit information on the Earth’s surface, and in particular its anthropogenic use, is at the crux of our need to understand our changing planet and to be able to create biophysical and economic models with reliable input and calibration data. However, it is exactly this information that has been shown to be highly inaccurate over many areas of the globe and across multiple sectors. Hence the Earth Observation Systems (EOS) Research Group has built and deployed tools and platforms to use citizen science, crowdsourcing and expert knowledge in order to improve in-situ data and the overall information base of land cover and land use globally via product integration and geospatial approaches.


The GROW Observatory (GROW) will create a sustainable citizen platform and community to generate, share and utilize information on land, soil and water resource at a resolution hitherto not previously considered. The vision is to underpin smart and sustainable custodianship of land and soil, whilst meeting the demands of food production, and to answer a longstanding challenge for space science, namely the validation of soil moisture detection from satellites. GROW is highly innovative project leveraging and combining low cost consumer sensing technology, a simple soil test and a large user base of growers and plant enthusiasts to contribute individual soil and land data. It is designed to engage primarily individual growers and small-scale farmers across Europe, and to enable them to develop new wisdom and innovative practices through the collective power of shared and open data and knowledge.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer - DevOps / AWS @ FinTech startup
jobs.content:
If you've got high standards and are passionate about customer experience this is the role for you. Our customers rely on us day-in day-out to provide a reliable, responsive and secure service, all whilst scaling to meet the demands of a rapidly growing customer base and data volumes.


We're a heterogeneous Windows/Linux shop, with the core of our main product in .NET and new service buildout currently in Golang. We're not precious about technologies, and we're keen to take the right tools for the task at hand - we've got code across C#, F#, PowerShell, Ruby, Python and Golang. We've adopted a number of AWS services including the use of Lambda for serverless architectures.


We take our software seriously, employing Continuous Delivery through TeamCity, Octopus Deploy and AWS CodeDeploy. Logging and monitoring are key too - with SumoLogic, AWS CloudWatch and PagerDuty key components of our stack.


Having completed a full migration to AWS in the last 12 months, we're currently hard at work making full use of the HashiCorp Suite/HashiStack (Atlas, Packer, Terraform and Consul) to manage our AWS production infrastructure. We're building 12-factor, cloud native applications using best of breed practices from the operations space.


You'll be helping to build out, deploy and maintain a service-oriented architecture (SOA) to support features in our main product and new product development as well as infrastructure work relating to our production AWS infrastructure.

jobs.title: Software Engineer C# in Test Automation
jobs.content:
This is an opportunity to work in a dynamic, international, professional testing team to ensure the high quality of our Fitting Software used by acousticians worldwide to fit hearing instruments to hearing impaired customers. In this position you are responsible for analyzing the software, developing  comprehensive automated tests and enhancing existing automation frameworks in a continuous integration environment.


Your tasks 



  • Analysis of the software under test; design and develop comprehensive automated integration and regression tests; test execution and reporting of test cases

  • Enhance and extend test automation libraries and frameworks

  • Specify and develop test infrastructure as part of CI/CD environment

  • Effectively investigate and communicate test results

  • Close collaboration with Software Developers and Test Engineers to ensure high software quality

  • Promote effective software testing within the organization

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Findmypast are looking for engineers that want to make a difference, that believe and adhere to the right practices.  We want passionate people that use the right technology for solving problems and like to deliver in a lean agile environment. You will help us build our new platform to enable us to deliver new features even faster and more successfully to the market. We have opportunities in both our London and Dundee based offices.


You will be part of a like-minded team of engineers who all agree and follow the practice of pairing, TDD and automating the entire delivery pipeline. You will work on a range of aspects from Services, API’s and high availability websites using a range of technologies and constantly striving to deliver at high quality.


Our core languages are Elixir and JavaScript. Our architecture greatly incorporates the micro services paradigm, implementing fault tolerant applications to deal with high levels of traffic and data.


We use technologies such as Apache Solr, Microsoft SQL Server, Riak, Redis, Neo4j, RabbitMQ, etc. We also have a mix of traditional MVC and SPA applications written in ASP.net, Node, React, Angular, Coffeescript. Knowledge and experience with more than one programming language and platform is a distinct advantage.


 We use GitHub for source control and Trello for tracking our work. We have a strong DevOps culture and manage our continuous integration and deployment with Teamcity. We use great communication tools like Slack, Screen Hero and Google Hangouts!

jobs.title: Lead 3D Windows Application Developer for Automated Factory of the Future
jobs.content:
CNC milling machines are at the heart of manufacturing with almost half a trillion dollars worth of components produced by them each year. Despite this, their software is in the dark ages. Industrial CNC machine in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=80iIhfjTm5I


We’re researching and applying breakthrough AI methods to control these machines automatically and more optimally than ever before, revolutionising how the things around us are made. From MacBook cases, to jet engine turbines.


Our mission is to make milling machines one click devices that can produce a part easily, efficiently and with minimal human intervention.


Working as part of a world-class team, your role will consist of leading the technical development of the client-side application that will provide an interface to our core service. This will involve building, from scratch, a windows application that can load and display 3D CAD models; provide UI for interacting with the models to add additional data; and displaying simulation of CNC machining.


We are also passionate about good UI design and a strong user experience. Your role will also include guiding the UI and UX of the application.


We've just closed one of the largest seed round investments in Europe to bring our solution from prototype to market from 42 investors including:



  • Episode 1 Ventures.

  • Paul McNabb, ex-head of strategy for Cisco Systems.

  • Simon Murdoch, ex-VP Europe for Amazon.

  • Charlie Songhurst, ex-head of strategy for Microsoft.

  • Nicolas Berggruen, billionaire investor.

  • Chris Liddell, ex-CFO of General Motors.

  • Chris Barter, ex-head of Goldman Sachs Russia.

  • Chris Mairs, ex-CTO of Metaswitch Networks.


https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/cloudnc

As a full-stack team with a very strong expertise in mobile, web, and back end development we are currently looking for a


Senior Android Developer, Software Engineer


to work with us at our headquarter office in Munich, Germany.

jobs.company: Totaljobs Group, part of the StepStone Group
jobs.content:
You & your role;


You’ll be working within one of our dedicated scrum teams, amongst other highly talent Developers, QA’s, BA’s and Scrum Masters.


The Senior Developer will undertake a hands-on development role whilst mentoring less experienced members of the team, leading technical discussions and providing technical leadership.


The ideal candidate will have a mixture of both back end and front end web development experience gained using a range of .Net related technologies gained within an Agile/Scrum environment.


You’ll join a team of smart, motivated people whom work within a full agile and scrum environment helping candidates find jobs they love and help companies recruit great talent, like you!


We’re based on the Southbank in the fantastic Blue Fin Building, with great transport links and brilliant facilities including a subsidised canteen, a gym and a 10th floor roof terrace.



For a full list of technologies tools and practices we use, plus an insight into our development culture please visit our tech blog: http://www.tjgtechblog.com/



Some of your responsibilities as a Senior Developer;



  • Show leadership and experience in architecting solutions that meet the needs of the business

  • Full stack development – from using front end technologies like AngularJS to database technologies such as SQL Server and everything in between – MVC, Web API, WCF

  • Present interesting technologies tools and practices back to the department via brown bags and communities of practice meetups

  • Work alongside dedicated Scrum Master, BA, QA and 3 other developers in a cross-skill team to develop and deliver high quality code in lightning fast time

  • Using XP practices such as pair programming TDD and its variants to develop high quality maintainable code

  • Feed into departmental engineering strategy and platform improvement backlog

  • Feed into our Tech Radar that guides which technologies tools and practices that we should trial, assess, adopt or hold

  • Refactor and iteratively upgrade older parts of the platform to use the latest tech and design patterns while still delivering business value

jobs.title: Database Developer

Web Developerto join our international team in Amsterdam. The current team consists of 7 developers, including Back-end and Front-end. As a (jr.) Web Developer you are responsible for designing and programming applications to support the ‘LOGEX Smart Hospital Grid’. You are passionate about innovative technologies. You have a proven ability to comprehend functional requirements, and can translate those insights into scalable and user-friendly solutions. jobs.title: Senior Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
The EPFL Extension School is looking for a Senior Web Application Developer (full-stack Rails) to build our online learning platform. If building an easy-to-use online learning platform while having a great work-life balance in one of the most beautiful parts of the world appeals to you, please apply at http://bit.do/epfl-srails or at jobs.exts@epfl.ch.

The EPFL Extension School is launching with the goal to leverage accredited, online education for the rapid translation of technical skills into the marketplace. The initial focus of the EPFL Extension School will be on the skills most relevant for the digital age: web, mobile, and data science.


Your responsibilities:

The Senior Web Application Developer is a position with many responsibilities - the ultimate responsibility being the development and maintenance of our online learning platform. This platform will be handling learner registration, payments, content delivery, peer interactions, coding and other assignments, course management, user management, and many other aspects. It is ultimately the home and public face of the EPFL Extension School. Correspondingly, ensuring a fantastic user experience for both teachers and learners as well as the stability, speed and robustness of the platform are key responsibilities in this role.

jobs.title: Be part of a growing team building SDN Solutions with Arista Networks
jobs.content:
As a C++ Software Engineer your core responsibility is to deliver new product features. A major part of this is writing and owning the code that drives our products. But the role of a C++ Software Engineer is much bigger than ‘simply’ writing code. Software Engineers work on the whole development process, including:




  • suggesting and deciding what features to build




  • driving the design




  • writing the code (of course)




  • pushing, testing, documenting the feature




Engineering Driven. Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers -- you are in charge of delivering your work from design to code to test to customer shipment.   


Insane amount of automation! We put a premium on building and using tools that make everyone super-productive. This translates into quicker turnaround times on new features and products for increased revenue with smaller teams.   


We value openness. No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. Our interns have the same responsibility as our full timers who have the same responsibility as our old timers and all get to work side-by-side on important, customer-impacting projects.

Senior Software Engineer, Rails

Fairy Overview: Fairy (www.itsfairy.com) is a daily hotel-style housekeeping service, and our mission is to deliver happiness to every home in the world! Through our platform, residents are easily able to connect with housekeepers of their choice, and will receive 30-minute daily cleanings up to five days a week (Monday through Friday). Housekeepers are equipped with several years of residential cleaning experience and they continuously are striving to learn more about your personalized needs and habits.

We are well funded by top investors in Silicon Valley and are growing rapidly! Our team has started and sold venture backed startups and have helped scale companies like Instacart, NextDoor, Box and LinkedIn through their IPOs.

Role Overview: Senior software engineer is a unique opportunity to join our high performing Fairy Engineering team, also know as the “Builder” organization. The Builder organization is fearless, collaborative, and challenges the status quo on a daily basis. As a senior software engineer, you will have a direct impact on the experience for both customers and our housekeeping partners.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Application Services
jobs.content:
Do you want to solve complex problems and build systems that will change the Internet? Do you want to be part of a company that is on the cutting edge of technology? Do you want to work with a world-class team of engineers? Do you have what it takes?

The engineering team at 128 Technology is looking for a software engineer focusing on developing a highly scalable distributed networked applications. We are looking for extremely motivated engineers who can work collaboratively to help build carrier-grade networking infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design and develop large-scale, distributed systems and scalable real time, fault tolerant, high throughput message and event driven services
  • Develop robust data storage solutions around NoSQL databases

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • B.S or M.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field
  • 5+ years of experience in developing large-scale software/network systems and services software on all platforms
  • Demonstrated ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.
  • Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm and object-oriented design, problem solving, data structures, and complexity analysis
  • Extensive working experience with development, debugging and testing multi-threaded applications on distributed systems.
  • Thorough understanding of IP networking and socket-based programming
  • Excellent C++ developer and debugging skills
  • Experience developing software in the fastpath and packet forwarding (IPv4 & IPv6, VPN, VLAN, MPLS Label etc. .) components of a networking device, including flow processing functions such as filtering, QoS, NAT, Firewall etc.
  • Knowledge of layer-2 switching and layer-3 routing concepts and protocols (BGP4, BGP4+, OSPFv2, OSPFv3)
  • Ability to deliver clean, modular code quickly and efficiently
  • Strong background in developing networking software applications on Linux/Unix.

BONUS POINTS:

  • Familiarity with ZooKeeper and Cassandra
  • Working experience with C++11/14
  • Team player with strong interpersonal skills and able to adapt and thrive in an Agile environment.
  • Experience with Test Driven Development and Continuous Integration
  • Sense of humor

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Developer
jobs.content:
Do you love sharing web development skills with others? Are you eager to tackle the challenge of leading a team of ambitious software engineers? Are you a lifelong learner and experimenter of new things? Take on an exciting role in a fast moving technology education startup!

Overview

  • Launch Academy is seeking a Sr. experienced software developer to lead a small team of like minded engineers to guide our immersive web development program in Philadelphia.
  • We strive to provide a best-in-class educational experience. As such we are always tinkering and finding new ways to improve. Our agile educational approach and the ever-evolving technical needs of our hiring partners ensure our curriculum and the technologies we teach will remain interesting and exciting.
  • Minimum Experience 3 years

The Challenge

  • Traditional education is broken and we are seeking to offer an alternative to people who want to learn the craft of web development.
  • We've graduated and placed over 400 people to date but we have a long way to go to make a substantial impact.

The Role

  • Mentoring students in small groups and one-on-one settings
  • Writing new exercises and learning challenges to reinforce concepts
  • Developing internal education software
  • Introducing new material to the class via facilitations and small clinics

What We're Looking For

  • We're interested in candidates with more than 3 years of engineering experience and ideally team leadership experience in some capacity. Our Curriculum runs the full spectrum of modern web technologies. We teach Javascript, Ruby, SQL, HTML, CSS, React, Rails, Sinatra, and Foundation to name a few languages and frameworks.
  • Teaching experience is a definite plus but a willingness to learn how to become a better educator is a requirement.
  • Patience and empathy are qualities equally as important as technical prowess.
  • Someone who likes to help others
  • We want an engineer who has enough industry experience to know that they are excited to tackle the challenge of leading a team and the soft skills involved in that work.

Why Launch Academy?

  • Launch Academy aims to engineer the optimal path to learning web development and software engineering. Being an Experience Engineer at Launch Academy allows you to share your craft with aspiring developers alongside a team of capable and ambitious peers.
  • We're applying Agile methodologies to iteratively design a premium learning experience. Following each cohort, we take 3 weeks for some rest and reflection in order to vastly improve the next session.
  • In addition to a great team and environment for personal growth, Launch Academy offers competitive compensation, 80% coverage of health care cost, and a use it as you need it vacation policy.

Interested? Apply Here

jobs.title: Director of Software Engineering, Simulator
jobs.content:
The Director of Software Engineering at PhishMe is a motivated professional member and leader in our Software Development organization. The Director is primarily responsible for managing multiple Agile development teams for a single product line.

The successful candidate will possess a background in software development (and related technologies), have strong management skills, be able to interact with product, sales, marketing and the engineering teams, work under tight deadlines, and have experience managing complex software development projects within an Agile framework (Scrum/Kanban).

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Operations, Engineering, and internal customers to deliver functioning features, enhancements, and remediations.
  • Team capacity planning to assure that team sizes and make-up are aligned with development needs and company goals.
  • Create, maintain, and track job postings for new hires.
  • Team member onboarding/offboarding activities.
  • 1-on-1 meetings with team members.
  • Approve and track PTO and expense reports.
  • Resource/skill needs planning and balancing.
  • Create, maintain, and report on tactical and strategic schedules.
  • Establish and maintain communications with all project stake holders, participants, and business units using PhishMe standardized tools and channels.
  • Assure/coordinate communication on strategic product direction in partnership with Product Management, other impacted business units, and the software development organization.
  • Proactively ensure communication and coordination with other teams and business groups.
Ensure defined quality standards are met independently and through coordination with Quality Management.Ensure that all relevant documentation is complete and available to all project stake holders and participants in authoritative collaboration tools (currently Jira and Confluence).Spearhead training and off-site activities for the team in coordination with other engineering and business groups.Identify and provide/arrange individual training as needed.Status reporting as required but no less than on a weekly basis.
  • Prepare and deliver regular and incidental project status updates.
Perform process reviews and recommend/enact improvements in alignment with Engineering and Quality standards.
Required Skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • Possess a background in Ruby development and related technologies is a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience delivering projects on-time in an Agile framework.
  • Deep understanding of SDLCs, with specific and extensive experience with Agile frameworks (Scrum/Kanban).
  • Experience as a ScrumMaster or Product Owner is a plus.
  • Approximately 10% travel.  Some occasional international travel may be required.

SNS Bank N.V. heeft voor haar locatie in ’s Hertogenbosch een vacature voor een


Informatie- en Applicatie Architect




Ben jij de architect die ons helpt om de nieuwe strategie van SNS Bank te vertalen naar concrete oplossingen?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste informatie- en applicatiearchitect met visie die helpt om de nieuwe strategie concreet te maken. To apply: Send a resume, github username, or portfolio to matthew.ensor@daveramsey.com

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
About Octer


Octer is one of the hottest start-ups in the mobile technology space. We have one ambition:
To make online shopping simple.


In March 2014 investors backed this vision to the tune of $1m in 24hrs on the crowdfunding site, Seedrs. We followed up with a similar round in autumn 2015.


With this backing and our drive and determination we are making it simpler for consumers to get what they want, and simpler for big retailers to find their new customers. We have an awesome team, work in a fun environment and are tackling the biggest issues in shopping which affect hundreds of millions of consumers.


How we are solving this problem.


We’re building technology that enables the big stores to operate as a single digital marketplace, with all of the advantages of a marketplace for smaller retailers (think Amazon and Etsy); 1 stop shop, easy comparison, single checkout.

To do this we need to first amalgamate 3 million products from the top 200 retailers and make sense of them. We need to understand what a product is, it’s true availability (sizes, in stock), how it relates to other products (for comparison) and who to show it to (relevance). Then we need to make those products simple to buy, from multiple retailers, with one click.


The Tech


We achieve this using various search, image recognition, macro, AI and API technologies. Over the past six months we have built a robust, horizontally-scalable and performant back-end infrastructure that processes over 3 million items per day.


Octer's tech stack is run on a LEMP architecture with performance and security improvements earned by integrating LXC virtual containers, job publish/consume processing and search indexing. All our code is integrated using a continuous integration pipeline initialised by hooks from Bitbucket into our Jenkins CI server.


We operate on an Agile software development practice around GIT and JIRA, and implement a custom take on Git Flow branch management. All our code is tested, integrated and seamlessly deployed to our network of virtual servers in the cloud, real time.


*Please note, this is an onsite role only*

jobs.content:
The internet is growing at a phenomenal pace and mobile app development is advancing even faster. So we’re looking for mobile engineers who are one jump ahead of that rapidly accelerating curve.

Like you, Skyscanner is also on a high-speed growth journey. Over 30 million people a month trust us to turn their travel nightmares into sweet dreams. Increasingly, they’re doing this on mobile devices, resulting in 35 million app downloads to date, and counting - which is where you come in. We’re currently expanding our app development capability and we’re looking for world-class mobile developers with mentoring or management experience to work within a small team of innovative engineers, in an ultra fast paced environment. We can offer you the flexibility and fast pace of a startup combined with the opportunity to develop products that are used by multiple millions of people every day. Products people actually want and find useful, built by a company that still has massive potential ahead of it.


To be clear, we aren’t just developing an app; we are building and shipping features from the ground up. Product teams working on mobile apps also do data analysis, design systems, and release services – which all builds up into a mobile experience. If you're flexible, eager to learn and can’t move forward fast enough - apply now.


You can offer us:


A hunger to learn, and learn fast. A desire to meet challenges. A passion for developing apps that work in a global and scalable environment. A commitment to applying engineering best practice to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:


An excellent career move. The chance to work with great developers, in fact, great people across the board. The space to be trusted to do what you do best. And to make decisions that matter. The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack
jobs.content:
Are you a Polyglot Technologist? As software engineers and architects, we solve problems. We don’t just write code. The problems we solve are to improve the product that we offer our users.


“In this internet based economy every Software Engineer is a polyglot by necessity. We’re required to switch technologies efficiently, relying on our fundamental engineering skill-set to progress. That’s not to say we should all be generalists, specialists are also needed, but the core and fundamental skills of a specialist can be applied in many technologies.”  Skyscanner Senior Architect & Tribe Lead


Skyscanner is the world’s travel search engine with ambitions to be everybody’s personal travel assistant. As a full stack engineer, we want to employ your problem solving capabilities. Solving complex scalability challenges, proposing new design and systems solutions and all the while, instigating and promoting best engineering practices. To be really useful to us, you should have across the board experience – a bit of database, a bit of back end as well as some UX familiarity into the bargain – after all, if you don’t know what can go wrong, you won’t know how to fix it. We’re looking for exceptional engineers who can make difficult decisions and take ownership of a problem from end to end.


If you hate doing what you’ve always done but love finding new and better solutions, make our technical challenges part of your new engineering problems – apply today!


You can offer us:


A hunger to lead in a continuous learning culture, a desire to solve complex technical challenges, a passion for technology and tech leadership and ultimately a commitment to applying engineering best practices in order to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:



  • An excellent career move

  • The chance to work with great developers, in fact, great people across the board

  • The space to be trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter

  • The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff

  • You do best and to make decisions that matter

  • Ownership – the freedom and space to be trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter

  • A real opportunity to explore & experiment – developing new & improving current features & systems

  • An excellent career move – complexity, challenge and real variety

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Functieomschrijving:


Tuinmaximaal is op zoek naar onlangs afgestudeerde software ontwikkelaars. In een gelijkwaardig teamverband ben je continue bezig met het verbeteren van de webshops van Tuinmaximaal en de bijbehorende applicaties. De input voor verbeteringen komen van jouw team en van de marketeers van Tuinmaximaal. De afgelopen 4 jaar is Tuinmaximaal gemiddeld met 200% gegroeid en is er onlangs de 127e positie behaald van alle webshops in Nederland met een omzet van meer dan 10 miljoen euro per jaar. Het jonge team van Tuinmaximaal legt de lat hoog en meedenken wordt zeer gewaardeerd!


Waar je direct mee aan de slag gaat


- De huidige webshops draaien op Magento 1 wat op dit moment is uitbesteed en het is de taak van jouw team deze compleet opnieuw op te zetten in Magento 2 (MySQL/ PHP/ OOP/ MVC/MVVM).
- Het maken van management tools.
- Een kijkje nemen bij alle afdelingen van Tuinmaximaal waardoor je inzicht krijgt van alle facetten van het bedrijf, aangezien de webshop invloed heeft op alle afdelingen binnen Tuinmaximaal.


Werkzaamheden:


- Binnen het team van software ontwikkelaars zorg je ervoor dat je met de laatste trends in webwinkelverkopen meegaat en om dit bij te houden moeten we continu blijven veranderen en door te blijven automatiseren.
- Je dient actief mee te denken met de marketing afdeling en zonder te veel documentatie wijzigingen door te voeren (Scrum & Agile).
- Je gaat zelf op zoek naar de meest effectieve oplossing waarbij je probeert gebruik te maken van reeds bestaande software die in de markt verkrijgbaar is die je eventueel nog aanpast zodat aan alle wensen wordt voldaan en de software goed te onderhouden is. In bepaalde gevallen kan je tot de conclusie komen om een geheel nieuw stuk software te ontwikkelen.
- De website heeft vele koppelingen naar andere applicaties die onderhouden en uitgebreid moeten worden.
- Je bent ervoor verantwoordelijk om de websites draaiende te houden.


Over ons bedrijf:


Branchewinnaar Tuinmaximaal slaat door middel van intelligente oplossingen binnen het bedrijfsproces sinds 2013 alle schakels in de keten over en verkoopt terrasoverkappingen en glazen schuifwanden via een webwinkel rechtstreeks aan consumenten en dealers. Tuinmaximaal is in korte tijd marktleider in de Europa geworden door de verkoop van meer dan 15000 terrasoverkappingen en glazen schuifwanden per jaar en blijft sterk doorgroeien. Door de korte implementatietijden en het meegaan met de laatste technologieën blijft Tuinmaximaal haar concurrenten voor. Tuinmaximaal levert en monteert in heel Nederland, België en een groot deel van Duitsland en heeft daarnaast een showroom waar klanten van ver naartoe komen door het grote prijsverschil met andere aanbieders. 


Werktijden:

- 40 uur per week
- Maandag t/m vrijdag
- Een werktelefoon van de zaak rouleert tussen de software ontwikkelaars. Indien jij de telefoon bij je hebt dan ben je bereikbaar voor extreem urgente zaken zoals het niet werken van een website.


Wat wij jou bieden:


- Indicatie startsalaris €2600,- bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week plus reiskostenvergoeding en overuren, pensioenregeling en flinke toeslagen op feestdagen. 
- Een gezellige werksfeer inclusief vrijdagmiddagborrel in onze club!
- Je hebt zelf veel invloed.  
- Je werkt in een gelijkwaardig teamverband waarin iedereen zijn specialisatie heeft.
- Je hebt contact met alle afdelingen van Tuinmaximaal, waardoor je ook kennis zal vergaren over de structuur van Tuinmaximaal.
- Beslissingen worden snel genomen.
- Je krijgt veel mee van het bedrijf aangezien je contact hebt met alle afdelingen.
- Vrijwel alles wat je maakt wordt direct live gezet.
- Ruim budget beschikbaar voor ontwikkeling van de e-commerce.
- Het werken binnen een jong enthousiast bedrijf.
- Je werkt binnen een snel groeiende onderneming.
- Je maakt gebruik van de laatste technologieën.
- Tuinmaximaal is zelf de opdrachtgever, dus geen uitgebreide uren verantwoordingen


Functie-eisen:


- Je hebt een HBO ICT opleiding afgerond
- Je hebt de drive om continu veranderingen door te voeren
- Je wil jezelf blijven ontwikkelen.

Ben jij de persoon naar wie wij op zoek zijn?


Stuur dan je CV met foto en motivatie naar ivo@tuinmaximaal.nl.

jobs.title: SQL Server DBA
jobs.content:
Join our fast-paced growing company in the role of SQL Server DBA and be part of our great challenge of moving the entire company data layer to Azure cloud.


With support from our Architecture team, you will be responsible to provide technical database expertise and support for maintaining performance and reliability of database solutions. You will track and resolve database related incidents and requests as well as perform database administration functions including: security access, performance tuning, capacity planning, database replication/backups for recoverability. The testing, and implementation of database changes with accuracy and timeliness will also be part of your daily activities. You will be communicating with developers, reviewing sql code, applying changes and improvements.


You have 3 to 5 years of experience in database administration in a SQL Server environment and a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent education and experience. You are a great communicator, able to juggle multiple projects,  from handling database administration tasks of installation, configuration, patching, upgrade, backup to recovery and troubleshooting database problems. Further you have a strong understanding of SQL scripting, construction of highly complex queries and refactoring techniques as well as stored procedures, functions, triggers. If you have a certification for Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014 Databases (70-462) or other industry recognized SQL certification, it’s a great plus.


If you recognize yourself in the description above, we would like you to be part of our dynamic international technical team. This position is based at our headquarters in the Netherlands, so fluency in English is a must, fluency in Dutch is a plus. If you are interested in working at Suitsupply, please send us your CV and cover letter in Dutch or English.


This position is based at our headquarters in the Netherlands, so fluency in English is a must and fluency in Dutch is a plus. If you are the one we are looking for, send us your CV and cover letter in Dutch or English.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer for multi-skilling fun
jobs.content:
Coniq is looking to add a permanent Senior Software Engineer to the tech team located near Farringdon.


We hire smart people that get things done. Our small, agile team is motivated by seeing the work that it does making a difference. This senior role will be able to influence the technical direction we take and have the opportunity to take on technical leadership responsibilities without the burden of line management.


We face some interesting technical challenges as we build a SaaS marketing and loyalty platform that caters to the diverse needs of our clients and is handling an ever increasing amount of data. The development work varies, but in the last six months you could have worked on:


• implementing a queueing system with RabbitMQ to handle a high volume of triggered events


• introducing a new columnar analytic database to support near real-time advanced customer segmentation


• improving job scheduling and reducing data usage in our Android applications


• adding new standardised user interface for filtering used across the platform


• migrating our servers and applications to PHP 7


You'll be able to choose your own computer so you can perform at your best. Your day will be filled with meaningful development work that clients actually use. You can take a break at the gym with a free pass from the company, or perhaps grab a piece of fruit before a game of darts or table football.


Must be eligible to work in the UK without sponsorship.


Want to know more?


Start a conversation by sending us your current CV — email it to techjobs@coniq.com with the subject line "Senior Software Engineer -- your name".


RECRUITERS: Please see our policy on working with recruiters at http://www.coniq.com/jobs/#recruiters before contacting us.

jobs.title: Sr. Front-end developer - AngularJS
jobs.content:
Do you have The Knack?

LogZilla Corporation is now interviewing for top tier, Senior developers, to add to our team of highly skilled programmers. As a UI dev, you must be a master in your field and possess, at a minimum, the following skills:

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI, front-end products optimized for extreme speed.
  • Solid understanding of front-end MVC architectures
  • Strong experience with AngularJS
  • Strong JavaScript basis with a very good understand of the JS core
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Adept in building interactive UI's with Bootstrap 3 and Less
  • Good background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with extremely large amounts of data is a plus

Additionally, candidates should:

  • Be able to work from home efficiently
  • Be an honest, no politics, type of person.
  • Strive for perfection while maintaining on-time delivery of code
  • Never create tech debt
  • Have already developed software for large-scale, enterprise applications (using AngularJS) in former roles
  • Experience with Enterprise-grade Network Management software/tools is a major plus

Our development team is Agile, with two-week sprints. We monitor burndown and all task completions on a daily basis and have a high degree of team communication - most of us are available throughout the day (globally). We are a very fun group with great people, but we also work hard to deliver the next generation of tech Our employees are based in the US and Eastern Europe - candidates can work from anywhere but will need to be able to attend meetings and work with the team based on GMT+1 hours.  The team communicates in English through Slack 99% of the time - your ability to read and write English effectively is important. IF YOU ARE A RECRUITING FIRM: You may only submit up to 2 candidates - and please, make sure they are top level/sr people. We have had too many firms submitting people who can't even pass our basic skills challenge.

About LogZilla

Our software collects and indexes machine data at a massive scale allowing users to quickly and easily search, analyze, monitor and report on this data in real time. Our unprecedented scale, event automation and event enrichment capabilities make LogZilla a truly 'Next Generation' tool. Here's a preview of our product.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer (Part-Time / Freelance)
jobs.content:
NOTE:  This is aremote role and is Part-Time / Freelance.  

About Us
We are about to release our firstSaaS Enterprise platform to private beta.  Our product will revolutionizethe speed of how large companies intentionally re-invent their culture andworkforce for digital.

We seek a part-time / freelance Site Reliability Engineer toassist in establishing the right infrastructure, process, and monitoringrequired to deliver world class application availability, performance, andsecurity.

jobs.title: Ninja UX Digital Product Designer (Freelance / Part-Time)
jobs.content:
Our Mission:

We are a company revolutionizing digital work-life in large traditional companies. We turn industrial dinosaurs into digital ninja's. We make dilbert companies more like Apple and Google. How? Super powers maybe :-)

Our Challenge to You as a UX Digital Design Ninja

We're seeking a ninja UX digital product designer to help us take our secrets and unleash them in the form of an entirely new agile performance and innovation management system for large Enterprise.

Your experience will include both modern Web/Mobile product design (no boring Enterprise apps here) and, *SOME* early experience and insight into Conversational UI's and ChatBots. The entire application will NOT be Conversational UI, but somje of the most innovative experiences we're designing rely on ths form of interaction. Additoinally CHAT (like Slack) will also play a HUGE role in the app.

The Current State of our Product

We are currently STUCK. That's right STUCK. We have months of conceptual wireframes and fantastic ideas. What we need next is a hard nosed, super creative, genious design problem solver to get us UN-STUCK.

What we've Acomplished So Far

We have a basic set of wireframes and user flows (not very exciting) as well as tons of fantastic, super creative conceptual Wireframes and interactions designed for Mobile.

What we Need

We someone that is uber smart, savvy, and fast at assimilating tons of ideas and previous design work who can then help us knit this all together in a compleeling, comprehensive set of user experiences that kick butt!

The Deliverables

Ultimately what we need (and fast) are both well designed and documented user flows, interactions, and ultimatley HIGH RESOLUTION wireframes / style guides for developers to use in building out our MVP.

Your Portfolio Please

Please include with your email a link to your online portfolio and a description of any recent web/mobile product design projects you're most proud of and why.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

jobs.title: Streaming Analytics Developer
jobs.content:
*** The role is currently opened for a 12 months contract with possible prolongation based on the project progress***


Location for the role: Prague, Czech rep/Bratislava, Slovakia


 As a Streaming Analytics Developer you will work on eoMind – Anritsu’s Service Assurance product for telecom network services – which brings true 360-degree multidimensional visibility into the customer experience and service performance with real-time, in-memory streaming analytics, providing a superior approach to the traditional methods. As machine learning platform, eoMind offers data streams with real-time alerts whenever issues impacting customers arise, which, for the first time, enables operators to deploy automated operational and customer intelligence, improving performance and customer quality. eoMind presents true innovation based on a deep understanding of future needs and applications.


The Streaming Analytics Developer will be involved in the design, implementation and maintenance of the innovative products and will be responsible for the full architectural lifecycle of our Streaming Analytics solution, including requirements analysis, supporting in technical architecture design, application design implementation and delivery. You will be designing and implementing the streaming analytics solution in a large-scale cluster data processing systems (primarily Hadoop, Java, Storm). You will as well interact with domain experts, product managers, solutions architects and analytics developers to define models and algorithm for machine learning and predictive analysis to automatize the data processing and analysis - including working with key customers.



In this exciting role you will have the opportunity to identify solutions and strategies which help in maximizing the value of the customer data, reduce the time to process them as well as reduce the amount of the human interaction needed. Your role will also include investigation and follow-up with deviations, bug reports, clarifications and inquiries raised internally and by other departments. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a team that will grow rapidly in the next few months and will be working using cutting edge technologies.

jobs.title: Senior Back-end JAVA Developer for Big Data Systems
jobs.content:
***We are happy to talk both to candidates interested in permanent employment as well as temporary employment as we also can offer 12 months contract cooperation***


You will work on MasterClaw – Anritsu’s Service Assurance solution for telecom network services – which optimizes the customer experience, reveals the usage of data and troubleshoots their network and service issues. We are one of the Market leaders in telecom network service assurance and a main data solution provider.



The Rome office hosts one of the key European Research & Development centers. Our R&D team work on Anritsu’s own product being in charge of its design, development and delivery.  R&D Staff have the unique opportunity to work with colleagues from different countries delivering solutions for our worldwide Customer base. We offer professional development opportunities that are relevant to you and your role, this may also include opportunities to work overseas or to travel. In addition to all of this we offer excellent flexible working opportunities as well as a relaxed work environment.



Job description:


We are looking for a Senior Java Developer with the ability to design, maintain and extend backend applications to join an international Development Team. This is a permanent position within a team that is continuously growing as they create high-performance mediation backend applications using cutting edge technologies.


You will provide technical advice throughout the project cycle: identification, conceptualization, preparation, project design and implementation, test, documentation and maintenance.



Main tasks:


You will decide with the Product Managers the strategies and guidelines of existing and new products being regularly in contact with the Departments involved in the Product delivery and support. You will also attend regular meetings with the Department Director as well as with your team members to discuss the roadmap and contribute to the Product architecture. Some of the key tasks that you will perform:




  • Work with local and remote teams In cooperation with other teams and liaise with both internal and external departments

  • Work with the Test & Quality department as part of the module release process, coordinating bugs and enhancements

  • Under the overall strategic and policy guidance of the R&D Manager, Chief Software Architect and Project Manager, participate and contribute to the development process, such as design meetings, Agile stand-up briefings, post-implementation reviews, hand-over sessions to other departments and internal training.

  • Write, correct and update technical documentation pertaining the design, testing procedures, installation and migration procedures for operator manuals.

  • Investigate and follow-up with deviations, bug reports, clarifications and inquiries raised internally and by other departments.
