jobs.title: Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
We're ClickTime. We help businesses become more productive every day. Our time and expense tracking tools are used by thousands of companies worldwide.

Our office is in the heart of downtown San Francisco, with great food and coffee just steps away. As a bootstrapped, privately held, profitable entity, we provide big company benefits while maintaining the size and energy of a startup. Working with us means youâll be challenged, surrounded by high-quality teammates, and empowered to thrive.

__About the Role__

ClickTime is all about making companies more productive, and we log tens of thousands of customer hours every day to fulfill that mission. The key to our success is creating a simple application thatâs available 24/7. Thatâs where you come in.

As ClickTime's Systems Administrator, you'll be working on the ClickTime platform to make sure the lights are on all the time. Youâll help with system monitoring, troubleshooting, general maintenance, and upgrades and enhancements, all while exercising good judgment and responsibility toward a critical application.

__Responsibilities:__

* Build, maintain, and monitor server operating systems, databases, networking equipment
* Manage our in-office IT when necessary (some desktop setup and support)
* Be on-call after hours on an alternating schedule
* Keep our datacenter running smoothly. We are constantly developing techniques to improve our reliability, backup, redundancy and security -- all while deploying new code to offer our customers new and better features
* Be the primary resource supporting the Linux portion of our environment
* Assist in the support of other systems (MS Windows) as needed
* Maintain production application uptime at 99.99%
* Perform standard systems maintenance of the whole platform stack
* Perform system updates, replacements and additions as directed
* Maintain our Dev/QA and stage environments and the accompanying infrastructure (build machines, virtual hosts, test systems, source code repositories, etc.)
* Resolve internal IT issues as appropriate.

__Requirements:__

* Technically flexible. This is a broad role that works with many different technologies
* Proficient in administering Linux based operating systems (Ubuntu and CentOS)
* Proficient in administering Windows based operating systems
* Comfortable working in a virtualized environment (VMware)
* Comfortable maintaining and upgrading computer hardware
* Understanding of network technologies and relational databases

__Bonus if you have:__

* Experience working with AWS or another Cloud based infrastructure provider.
* Experience automating system builds
* Experience working with a software development team.
* Basic understanding of relational databases.
* Experience with Git, Jenkins, CoreOS, Docker and/or Chef

__We Offer__

Competitive salary, profit-sharing (did we mention we're profitable?), medical/dental/vision, health savings account, subsidized transit, 401(k) with matching, weekly catered lunches, unlimited coffee, a dinosaur.

__What's Next__

Please submit your resume, cover letter, and relevant links (e.g. Github/bitbucket/personal website). Please, no phone calls, drop-ins, or recruiters.

_ClickTime provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics._

jobs.title: Senior Java Engineer / Solution Architect
jobs.content:
Summary


Greenfinch Technology is looking for an experienced senior engineer or solution architect to join our growing Java team in Dublin. You’ll be working with a team of engineers and testers, delivering web & mobile applications to our customers across a variety of industry verticals (financial services, pharma/life sciences and facilities & asset management).


You


You enjoy working in a senior role with mixed responsibilities (team leading, architecture, customer facing) but you’re a developer and technologist at heart. You want to steer a project from start to finish and put your stamp on it, while bringing up the quality of the entire team as you do.


You can take ownership of tasks and are confident in your ability to drive and deliver a project to completion; both organisationally and technically. You want to contribute to solution designs and specifications and make recommendations on technical roadmaps and technology adoption.


You want to go home at the end of the day knowing that your clients are happy with the solutions you've delivered, that they have been delivered on time, and that your team are proud of the code they've produced. An aversion to working in a silo and a willingness to operate out of your comfort zone is a must. The opportunity to make a real impact on our processes, approaches and business is granted in return.


Us


Greenfinch Technology is a software engineering company focused on innovation & quality. We solve business problems with our technology solutions. We provide our clients with a Design, Build & Manage service to help them meet the challenges of their business in today’s fast-changing world.


We have a number of teams/projects running in parallel and we work in an agile manner (SCRUM! No, really). We place a lot of emphasis on quality and automation so testing and devops are very important to us.


We like to use tools that make our lives easier (Jira, Slack Jenkins. SonarQube, Octopus) and we love it when people bring new tools and suggestions to us.

jobs.title: Senior Product Integration Engineer for Power NPI
jobs.content:
Job Description

As a Senior Product Integration Engineer in the Power New Product Introduction Group, you will be responsible for the evaluation and qualification of all new products for Cree’s line of silicon carbide discrete MOSFET and Schottky diodes.  You will be responsible for the qualification schedule, response to identified issues, generation of specifications, complete documentation of the final product, and qualification of new products to JEDEC and AECQ guidelines.  Close interaction with the Marketing team, Production team and R&D team is required throughout the new product introduction process, from the initial product definition through the final phase of the product release.

 

Responsibilities Include:

  • Manage Power NPI products through the formal Gate Review process
  • Own and maintain the schedule for new product introductions, from concept phase through market release
  • Coordinate and manage pre-production prototype lots and qualification lots through fab, test and assembly in conjunction with R&D and Production scientists and engineers.
  • Ensure product qualification per JEDEC and AECQ guidelines
  • Schedule and manage all qualification testing and failure analysis in conjunction with the Reliability team
  • Drive resolution to identified issues in conjunction with the Failure Analysis team and Power device experts.
  • Manage handoff from R&D to Operations after successful completion of NPI and deliver all required documentation for launch
  • Data sheet generation in conjunction with the Applications Engineering team
  • Deliver product launch on schedule and coordinate release details in conjunction with the Marketing tea

Requirements:

  • At least 5 years of industry experience in high volume semiconductor fab manufacturing
  • Must be a hands-on problem solver
  • Bachelors degree in electrical engineering, chemical engineering or closely related field
  • Semiconductor device physics expertise
  • Project management skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
  • Understanding of device-related Reliability tests required for qualification including gate reliability, temperature stability and moisture/bias related reliability tests
  • Candidate must be a US citizen or Green Card holder

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in power semiconductor high volume manufacturing.
  • Power Device Physics knowledge and expertise
  • Wafer Level Reliability, Design for Reliability, Design for Manufacturing experience a plus
  • Six sigma training and experience
  • Prior experience qualifying power products into industrial or automotive applications
  • Data and statistical analysis experience with JMPÔ or similar software
  • NPI experience as key owner and driver of New Product qualifications
  • Problem solving and problem resolution skills including 8D, FMEA, DOE, ANOVA.

Company Overview

At Cree, we’re a little obsessed. We’re fascinated by how things work and how we can make them work better. Our products enable systems that are more powerful and efficient than previously thought possible, because we’re constantly looking for ways to push past the limits of today’s technology.

 

Our devices are built on silicon carbide, a material that has vastly expanded the capabilities of electronic components.  Our power division is the world’s leading manufacturer of silicon-carbide Schottky diodes and MOSFETs for efficient power conversion. These devices provide increased efficiency, higher switching frequency and reduced system size and weight in a variety of applications, including power supplies and solar inverters.

 

Our RF division is a proven leader in high performance and reliable gallium-nitride components for wireless amplifiers. We fabricate transistors and MMICs that drastically reduce overall energy consumption. Our wide-band, RF-operating semiconductors enable enhanced performance while reducing the number of required amplifiers. Our RF group supports several applications including wireless infrastructure, RADAR and defense technologies.

 

We’re looking for bright minds and passionate hearts to help us build a more powerful and energy-efficient world.

jobs.title: Contractor and Public Agency Specialist – Central Italy
jobs.content:
Overview

Rain Bird Corporation, the international irrigation industry leader for over 80 years, creates innovative irrigation products that make beautiful landscapes, golf courses, and grow productive agricultural crops while saving water. Rain Bird seeks a results-driven Contractor and Public Agency Specialist for the to implement strategies for profitable product sales and market share growth throughout Italy.  Rain Bird irrigates projects like Valderrama Golf Course in Spain, Olympic sports fields and community parks in a Rio de Janeiro, and the Imperial Forum and Coliseum in Italy.

 

Combine your drive, energy, proven sales skills and achievements to provide a real-world solution that addresses smart water management and conservation. You will have strong interpersonal and leadership skills, as well as, be proactive, customer-oriented, and driven to succeed in a fast paced environment.  You will be self-motivated and enjoy independent field work that will deliver extraordinary results.  Your work history shows you work effectively at various customer levels including dealers, contractors, consultants and government bodies, to educate, justify and successfully sell products. 

 

Who you are:

 

You are a creative problem solver with strong influencing skills.  You have the ability to diagnose, analyze and recommend strategies for varied projects/ jobs.  You are highly motivated to achieve excellence and be surrounded by others who inspire innovation. You are an out of the box thinker and can easily rise up to the sales challenge. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. 

Responsibilities

  1. Sell contractors, municipalities or public entities, private companies and specifiers on using/buying Rain Bird landscape products and services
  2. Demonstrate to these customers Rain Bird’s landscape products and services, their application, key benefits and ease of troubleshooting.
  3. Make field visits to landscape sites in order to solicit orders for product and service sales
  4. Coordinate sales efforts with the Regional Sales Manager and possible key distributors to secure Rain Bird turf sales
  5. Participation in demo days, road shows, customer fly-ins and trainings, tradeshows and regional sales meetings
  6. Managing phone basic technical support to all customers/users in local language
  7. Strive to differentiate Rain Bird from its competitors by providing superior customer service, high visibility and aggressive call coverage cycle
  8. Maintain & utilize customer data base for direct marketing and communication efforts

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Undergraduate university degree
  • 3+ years work experience in sales or equivalent
  • Computer skills including working knowledge of Word & Excel
  • Self motivated, team player, aggressive, and strong communication skills
  • Fluent in both Italian and English (written & verbal)

 

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  •  Experience in the irrigation industry


OTHER INFORMATION:

  • Must be willing to travel at least 70% of the time and live within the region.

 

Rain Bird is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Speculative Applications  Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication

Build and maintain tools for deployment, systems monitoring and operational support; troubleshoot / resolve issues in our automated development, test and production environments.


You will be responsible for the System Administration of Linux systems and applications used to support our development operations; integrate and manage development systems for embedded and non-embedded applications and build RPM packages for deployment and test.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager - Uber For Business - UberEVENTS
jobs.content:
Uber for Business builds products to make Uber the default choice for their business transportation needs at the employee, company, and customer level. This includes everything from our business platform that allows companies to adopt Uber organization-wide to in-app, to features like Business Profiles which make business travel more seamless for our millions of riders, and UberEVENTS that enables businesses to provide transportation to individuals for things like conferences, and recruiting.

As the Product Marketing Manager for UberEVENTS, you will execute on go-to-market, demand generation and growth strategies for UberEVENTS focused on both B2B and B2C audiences. You will craft effective launch plans, including key messaging. You will drive customer insights and market validation for new products. For B2B, you will drive highly impactful programs to generate leads and maximize lead conversion. You will enable a growing sales team with the content, training and analytics they need to have successful sales conversations. For B2C, you will expand the reach of UberEVENTS by building a consumer marketing strategy with targeted campaigns focused on a few key consumer use cases.

Your performance will be measured by the impact of the programs you launch, and your ability to work closely with and enhance the productivity of a high-performing cross-functional team that includes counterparts in Product, Design, Engineering, Business Development, Sales, and Operations.

Job Description

QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:

  • 5+ years experience delivering highly successful B2B and B2C go-to-market, demand generation and growth strategies with your fingerprints all over them - you’re extremely proud of what you’ve accomplished
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Business or related field
  • A lead generation expert: You can devise highly effective programs to generate qualified leads for your product. You’re super creative and can rapidly execute on your ideas.
  • An email master: You possess an uncanny ability to run and iterate on highly effective automated email marketing campaigns.
  • Finger-tippinesses with data: You just go get the data you need with no muss/fuss and can whip it into an insightful story with no help. You know how to leverage data to make decisions and drive growth.
  • Scary-good at articulating the essence of products and the value they create. You can develop a strong messaging hierarchy and effective content strategy plan. You can also play copywriter.
  • Top-notch at market research: You’re a truth-seeking missile. You know your market, customers and competition better than anyone, and you’re strong at integrating this information into your growth strategies.
  • A “driver” personality: You’re biased toward action, a great collaborator and master disambiguator/simplifier. You never stop pushing towards clarity and delivery.
  • Rider-centricity - examples from your past of tough product challenges that you powered through because you were unwilling to make your problems your riders’ problems.
  • Grittiness: You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on, you persevere when others fall away.
  • True passion for Uber’s mission and the company’s hybrid technology / operations nature.

Perks

PERKS:

  • Employees are given Uber credits every month
  • The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product you built. We’re not just another social web app, we’re moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally.
  • Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.
  • You’ll be able to travel to Uber’s most interesting international cities.

BENEFITS (U.S.):

  • 401(k) plan, gym reimbursement, nine paid company holidays.
  • Full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs.
  • Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it.

We're bringing Uber to every major city in the world. We need brains and passion to make it happen and to make it happen in style.

Sounds perfect.  At Custobar you will join us in building a tool that collects all transaction data of an individual customer and makes it understandable and actionable. The tool serves retailers in their sales and customer engagement activities.


What do we offer? You’ll have a lot of freedom in tech choices; a flat organization, team that’s not too big or too small and your colleagues will be very experienced for a start up gang.


We’re waiting for your application at jobs@custobar.com. Also, if you have any further questions, don't hesitate to drop us an email!

jobs.title: Test Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Binnen het Servicekantoor van de Bijenkorf vormt de afdeling E-commerce onze jongst en snelst groeiende afdeling. In 2009 openden wij onze volledig vernieuwde webshop en inmiddels is Bijenkorf.nl uitgegroeid tot een van de grootste webshops van Nederland. Het team groeit steeds verder uit met nieuwe specialisten die onze kennis aanvullen. Op de afdeling E-commerce werken we momenteel vanuit de volgende specialistische teams:



  • Category Management: de selectie van het juiste assortiment voor onze online winkel

  • Operations: de volledig verwerking van alle bestelling in samenwerking met onze fullfillment partner

  • Online Marketing: alle online campagnes en SEO / SEA activiteiten

  • Content: alle tekstuele content die op debijenkorf.nl terug te vinden is

  • Datawarehousing/Business Intelligence team: verzamelen en gebruiken van informatie uit alle Bijenkorf systemen

  • Design: de vormgeving van alle banners en landingspagina’s

  • Business Development: alle activiteiten gericht op de systemen en de ontwikkeling hiervan


Over de functie Test Automation Engineer Jouw dagelijkse werkzaamheden zullen plaatsvinden op het Servicekantoor van de Bijenkorf te Amsterdam. Je wordt onderdeel van het Business Development team wat weer onderdeel uitmaakt van de E-commerce afdeling. Het Business Development team is verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoering van diverse projecten en tevens bied ze ondersteuning aan verschillende interne afdelingen. Als Test Automation Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van testen en releases. Je zal deelnemen aan een van de autonome multidisciplinaire scrum teams en daarvoor de test werkzaamheden uitvoeren. Daarnaast ben je bezig met verder optimaliseren van de kwaliteit door onder andere het automatiseren van testen.


Jouw werkzaamheden



  • Verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van testen en releases;

  • Onderdeel van de autonome multidisciplinaire scrum teams en daarvoor de test werkzaamheden uitvoeren;

  • Optimaliseren van de kwaliteit door onder anderen optimaliseren van de testen.

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.content:
DWP is transforming…


DWP are going through one of the highest profile digital transformation programmes in the world.This is a once-in-a-generation opportunity for digital experts including Lead Software Developers to improve millions of lives.


As a Lead Software Developer you will provide technical leadership to a talented and committed team of Software Developers and provide expert oversight to the products they develop.


You will own the team’s software development process along with setting the strategies for products and the wider community. You will be using open source technologies like Java, JavaScript, Node.js


Working with a range of colleagues, including Technical Architects, you will contribute to the Architectural & Software Engineering principles and help ensure systems are fit for purpose.


With a focus on stability and availability and a passion for quality you will be accountable for the code your teams produce.


A skilled practitioner and role model in software craft, you will lead colleagues across the department and beyond in the pursuit of best possible practices and guide teams on the best ways to deliver a quality product.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Software Developer who values code quality and a good laugh
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced full-stack software developer? And are you up for the challenge to work with an advanced standardized web application? TOPdesk offers you an open and fun work environment, and an international team of talented product developers.


Job description: Full-Stack Software Developer


To build great software you need mad skills and a clear overview of the complete product. This is what we expect from a full-stack software developer in our teams. With your knowledge of back end, front end and user interface you’ll be able to build the best products together with the team. You recommend best practices, and discuss the 'why’s in the team: why should we use this technology, why is this important in the back end, en what are the consequences for the front end if we do this and that. You know why you want to ask these questions.


What will your work day look like?


As a full-stack software developer you work in a multidisciplinary team. At TOPdesk we use all facets of the scrum method to create solid and cool functionalities and new modules. This works both in a relaxed and a target driven way. Target driven because, as a market leader, we’re on an innovative path and have a high priority for quality and user friendliness. And relaxed, as there is room to make mistakes and learn from them, we openly discuss the quality of code, and we appreciate a good work-life balance.


What can you expect from TOPdesk?



  • An agile work environment with a great focus on learning and craftsmanship.

  • A team culture in where free and open discussions are encouraged.

  • 10% time, to encourage your inquisitive nature: explore new techniques, or broaden your knowledge.

  • Fun.

  • An informal team of international colleagues in the Netherlands, Germany and Hungary who work together and for example actively share their knowledge during our International Development Meeting.

  • A steady and financially healthy employer.

jobs.name: the 3rd Best Employer of the Netherlands

jobs.title: Java Developer who wants to work
jobs.company: the 3rd Best Employer of the Netherlands
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Experienced Java Developer with a great passion for high quality code and great software architecture. Being a software developer, you know that developing software is not just a simple(monkey) trick, but a craftsmanship which requires talent and the constant honing of skills.


              Your vision on software development has been formed
              by your inquisitive nature and passion for programming


Job description: Experienced Java Developer


Right from your first day you work on a product that is used by more than a hundred thousand people on a daily basis. In (and outside) your scrum team you analyze problems and search for technical solutions for the complex challenges of a large software tool. As an Experienced Java Developer you comprehend the impact of technical choices. You involve junior developers in these choices and challenge them to grow with pair programming and code reviews.


Creating software is a challenging job. Especially when you are writing code that you still want to use in ten years. This requires vision. An Experienced Java Developer actively thinks along on improvements and how future-proof our product is. This helps our department do what we do best: deliver a high-quality product.


Like all TOPdesk developers, you receive the chance to direct your attention to matters that you find important. You can do this through 10%-time or Communities of Practice, for example. We improve quality through regular collaborations and insight sharing with international teams. This helps our department to what we do best: deliver a high-quality software product.


What can you expect from TOPdesk?



  • An agile work environment with a great focus on learning and craftsmanship.

  • A team culture in where free and open discussions are encouraged.

  • 10% time, to encourage your inquisitive nature: explore new techniques, or broaden your knowledge.

  • An informal team of international colleagues in the Netherlands, Germany and Hungary that for example actively share their knowledge during our International Development Meeting.

  • A steady and financially healthy employer.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Data & Semantic - AI team
jobs.content:
What will you be doing?


We are looking for a software engineer with big data experience to join our data & semantic team. You will be working on developing our market-leading products, in the collaborative and growing AI team based in our central London office. The future of our product is focused around utilising AI solutions to revolutionise how we diagnose, treat and prevent diseases; your effort will contribute heavily to the services that the data science and NLP teams are building within the Artificial Intelligence team.


You will help us build and support great products across Babylon, as well as shaping our vision of an intelligent virtual assistant for the medical domain, in order to make health care affordable and accessible for everyone.


You will be working with the rest of the AI team, identifying solutions that can enhance their services through data integration, planning how required data can be sourced, provided and utilized to have the greatest impact. This will include working with the output of our information extraction pipeline and feeding it into our large medical domain knowledge base and graph database. This will be done via transforming existing data sources as well as a crawl-and-extract pipeline to form new ones. You will be involved with setting up a reproducible, automatic process across different data sets, and making sure that our knowledge base is up to date when an update is published for a data set that was loaded in the past.


As a member of our artificial intelligence team there will be opportunities to learn about ontologies, data science, natural language processing and information extraction. Our company is a fast growing, dynamic environment where your tasks will constantly evolve and you will have the opportunity to learn something new every day.


We have a team of the best people you’d ever want to meet, working on some of the most futuristic projects. We like people who are smart, funny, innovative and tenacious, who can adapt and work together.

jobs.title: Core Backend Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Core Backend Developer (m/f) to support our Data Engineering Team. You will be responsible for providing high level PHP code as well as analyse an refactor our existing code base. As an expert for clean code and design patterns, you will help your colleagues to further build a modern software architecture. You will work in a friendly team atmosphere, use agile methods and have the chance to develop yourself professionally and personally.


Your responsibilities:



  • PHP development on a very high level

  • Build and maintain our next-generation background jobs framework “Orchestra” using technologies like PHP7, Docker, Mesos, RabbitMQ, Redis

  • Help clean up and refactor our legacy code base and move it to a modern architecture centered around composer, containers and microservices

  • Understand and solve performance issues and faults from a low-level perspective

  • Support our Devops team in moving forward towards a true continuous deployment process

  • Mentor other team members in topics like: clean code, design patterns, development standards

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Amperity, a stealth-mode enterprise software company, is looking for a Principal full-stack software engineer to join our initial team as we build the next great billion-dollar Seattle company! Using the cloud, scale-out automation, data science, and a pinch of machine learning, we're taking siloed enterprise data and turning it into integrated, actionable datasets!


Amperity is backed by some of the most notable names in tech -- including Madrona Venture Group, Liquid 2 Ventures, Hyde Park Ventures, and top executives and founders from multi-billion dollar companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Concur, and Isilon Systems. Amperity is well capitalized, having raised $9M in its seed round in February. Full press release


If you thrive on solving hard problems, have a desire to push yourself to the limits, and want to have fun in the process, then we would love to talk with you about joining our team.


Interesting problems:



  • Our system involves ingestion of terabytes of data per day, blending batch processing with real-time events

  • We automatically combine data together across disparate systems, and improve this process in generalized ways

  • We allow users to perform complex, real-time queries across aggregated datasets


Technologies we use:



  • Open Source tools, such as Accumulo, Spark, and Kafka

  • Cloud-first automation, including Apache Aurora and SaltStack

  • Neural nets, random forests, logistic regression, and probabilistic databases

  • Emacs AND vi!


About you:



  • You have at least 10 years of software development experience

  • You have experience leading complex distributed systems

  • You think about scalable architectures and great customer end to end experience

  • You improve things by 10x, not just 10%

  • You have worked in a DevOps environment, and drive sustainability such that DevOps is more Dev than Ops

  • You have built JVM oriented production systems

  • Your ears perk up when somebody says “graph traversal”

  • You are open-minded, inclusive, and motivated to make good decisions

  • You bring something new and rare to the party!

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.


Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


With "Share with Creatubbles", any company, organization or individual can very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and creative!) ways.



  •        Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com

  •        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

  •        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com


About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 18 people, covering 11 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $16MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.


About our development Team and Technologies



  • Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO, 1 front-end developer, 4 full-stack developers and one test engineer.

  • We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly Sprints.

  • Github, Codeship, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.

  • ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.

  • Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the decision-making process.

  • We love Ruby on Rails but have switched our web app over to Ember.js in the past year, building up a lot of Ember.js experience.

  • With our apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques.

  • Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

  • The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

  • Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to review our security strategy.


About you



  • You have experience working with Rails and one of the Javascript frameworks.

  • You know your way with databases and APIs but what you are really passionate about is javascript, html and css.

  • You insist on clean code that leads to beautiful user-interfaces.

  • You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc

  • You have experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues

  • You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

  • You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).

  • You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

  • You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.

  • You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity


What we offer



  • A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

  • We love remote work but relocation to Tokyo can also be arranged.

  • Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone to work when they are the most productive.

  • A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Lynx Analytics is seeking a Senior R&D Software Engineer in Budapest, Hungary.



  • Join us on an ambitious product development project! Besides programming, the work involves challenging mathematical, algorithmic and graph-theoretic problems.

  • Our very flat engineering organization needs lighthouses who can understand business goals and make technical decisions to support them.

  • Work with our fast growing team (currently around 10 people) on the design and implementation of the software. The team is a diverse mix including industry veterans (e.g. ex-Googlers) and recent graduates. Work with research professors from Columbia and Berkeley on the theoretical challenges.

  • Work in Budapest, visit the US and Southeast Asia. On your trips you would lay the foundations of grand new projects, solve problems that nobody else can, and generally impress clients and coworkers.

  • Build on modern technologies that will influence the future of computing.


    • Our primary language of development is Scala, a fantastic and apparently successful experiment at fusing functional and object-oriented programming.

    • Our software is designed from the start for cluster computing and linear scaling. We use the Apache Spark distributed computing framework, which is on track to becoming the de facto industry standard.

    • We use Docker for everything that makes sense. (And more!)


  • Help guide projects within the monumental business world of giant telecommunications corporations, banks, Smart Cities, UN Regional Groups and more. (The total reach of all Lynx Analytics clients is close to half a billion people.)

  • A flexible work schedule, a cheerful team, and great salary await you! (1,000,000 – 1,300,000 HUF / month gross.)

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - Product Engineer

TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.

Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking for a number of Product Engineers to join our Tallinn office. As a Full Stack Product Engineer you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. There are a number of teams that we are currently looking for awesome developers to join in Tallinn, you will be applying for all and throughout your journey with us you will get to find out about them all!



As part of the a Product-Engineering team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.



Product engineers only

Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production.

We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results. We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world. They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.

jobs.title: Junior/Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world.


As a member of our experienced IT team you will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a very professional and agile project management setup. We have developed a highly refined product in the last years and now massively scale up the company on a global level. Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!



About the job




  • Developing the HelloFresh web presences in 6 countries

  • Development and implementation of new features 

  • Close cooperation with Backend Developers and Designers 

  • Creating a smooth and pleasant end user experience

  • A-B testing to optimize our website

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world.


About the job


As a Big Data Engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop distributed services that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain distributed, service-oriented and message-oriented data platform components 

  • Design, build, and maintain data ingestion, ETLs and infrastructure for batch and near real time processing.

  • Build and maintain Business Intelligence and reporting solutions.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.content:
• Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team

  • Build and take operational responsibility for the HelloFresh platform

  • Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate microservices that serve millions of users, using DevOps practices and tools

  • Monitor and improve the usage of the services you build

  • Close cooperation with Frontend, Devops and Business Intelligence teams

  • Creating a smooth and pleasant end user experience, for both our customers and our internal users

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
For the expansion of our ever-growing team we are looking for an engaged and competent person at the earliest possible date for the position of


Full Stack Web Developer (m/f)


Your responsibilities



  • Full stack software development of the web application of 7LYTIX

  • Further development of the 7LYTIX web applications

  • Backend: data integration from e-commerce and ERP systems as well as from web analytics, social media and other sources


We offer an exciting job and unique future perspectives in a dynamically growing start-up which is operating in an innovative growth sector. Moreover you can expect a team oriented working atmosphere, flat hierarchies, short decision making processes and plenty of room to manoeuvre.

7LYTIX GMBH
Franziskos Kyriakopoulos, CEO

jobs.title: Lead UI Artist
jobs.content:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

jobs.title: Golang Software Engineer

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Simplesurance, a now expanding startup in the middle of Berlin, is waiting for your application! 


We offer the position Technical Project Manager (f/m) which combines project management skills with technical experiences. So you can bring in and develop your full potential.


You have a passion for both, programming and project management? Then this is probably the right job for you.


Read on and check the job description:

jobs.title: Development Team Lead, 80-100%
jobs.content:
You will be the top tech person in our company, responsible for the development team and its output. As the interface between your team and the rest of the company, you’ll be translating business needs into architectural decisions and manageable features. Because our CEO was previously the CTO, you will get lots of understanding and appreciation for the work of your team. Besides your managing duties, we also expect you to get your hands dirty in code on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage our team of software developers, which currently consists of five people

  • Take decisions on our architecture from backend to frontend, which currently consists of a Python REST API hosted on AWS and AngularJS as well as native iOS and Android apps on the client side

  • Lead by example by writing well-tested, concise code across our stack

  • Choose the right tools and institute good development practices

  • Be the interface between the development team and the rest of the company

  • Manage the hiring process for your team


In addition to senior candidates with management experience, we are also considering ambitious juniors who want to take the next step in their career.

jobs.title: Lead Developer for a new venture of smava
jobs.content:
In the last 12 months we have built a new product (www.scorekompass.de) in-house which we want to take to the next level as an independent new venture. You will be a part of an experienced team of highly motivated and talented people and report directly to a management team of seasoned entrepreneurs. With your deep experience in software development, architecture and entrepreneurial drive you will not only help us to extend our conversion relevant applications but also lead the way towards smart applications and a micro service driven architecture.


What we would like you to do:




  • You will define the technical roadmap of www.scorekompass.de




  • You will take care of the whole application including Web and Mobile (iOS, Android)




  • You will translate business requirements into future ready architecture and applications




  • You will define clear technical requirements for your team and ensure an in-time delivery of your projects




  • You will handle technical communication in between the venture, internal smava teams,  Management as well as with external contractors




  • You will do code reviews and ensure a good code quality and structure




  • You will review existing technologies and chose the most suitable ones for new features




  • You will support the recruiting process




  • You are willing to get your hands dirty

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Developer
jobs.content:
Our IT-Team takes care of the concept and realization of our web application. We continuously develop our online loan marketplace and implement new product features. We decided to ramp up a team fully focuses on innovations. The team will be led by an experienced Product Manager with deep technical understanding and intention to implement state-of-the-art features in the FinTech world.


Currently we are looking for a really experienced Fullstack professional, who (1) wants to take engineering responsibility and who (2) choses and uses the best technologies for our business.


Team insights


https://www.smava.de/jobs/project/it/


https://www.smava.de/Bilder/development_infographic.png


Tech Stack you need to handle



  • Java Spring (DI, Security, Scheduling, Tx)

  • PostgreSQL

  • JUnit

  • Maven

  • ActiveMQ

  • Apache CXF

  • HTML5

  • CSS (Sass, Less)

  • backbone.js

  • Jira

  • Confluence


What we would like you to do



  • Take engineering responsibility (Backend/Frontend) for new financial product innovations with perspective for a Teamlead position

  • Pick up requirements from your Product Manager and Architects and turn them into execution plan

  • Integrate 3rd party systems into new product innovations

  • Implement representation layer and visualization of data

  • Code review of future team members

  • Deliver high quality code to Release Management team

  • Participate in internal and external Stakeholder Meetings and Tech Talks

  • Nothing more nothing less


How we would like you to do it



  • Implement REST endpoints to query, manipulate and persist data

  • Implement Spring based services that handle business logic

  • Adjust database to store required information

  • Control access rights using Spring Security

  • Make sure that frequently accessed information is cached in ehcache

  • Work in Confluence with our architects on concept implementation

  • Split epics and user stories in JIRA into specific tickets with precise estimation

  • Generate SOAP service stubs and Data Types from WSDL using Apache CXF

  • Implement secure communication with 3rd parties

  • Make sure that our system is not overloaded and is distributed using ActiveMQ

  • Ensure data consistency by controlling transactions scope

  • Submit your code to your feature branch in our Git repository

  • Manage Jenkins jobs to deliver your code to the QA team

  • Manage dependencies of multi-module Maven project to build in fail-safe and timely fashion

  • Implement Backbone.js based Views and Models, define user flow using routers

  • Render representation of interface using Handlebars.js

  • Control loading and utilization of modules using require.js

  • Customized display using Sass


Mission to accomplish



  • Full digitalization of loan application process

jobs.content:
Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer (DevOps) with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  


This role will be based in Cake's global HQ in Houldsworth Mill, Manchester.


The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
About Helpling


We at Helpling love helping people to find the cleaner they want. On our website or app, you can outsource the time-consuming housework within a couple of clicks. For cleaners, our technology platform makes it easier than ever to access new clients and to manage when and where they want to work. For our vision to digitize the world of home services, we have raised more than 56 million Euros from renowned internet pioneers such as Lakestar (Airbnb, Facebook, Spotify) and Mangrove Capital (Skype). Today, we are already a team of 300 and two thirds of us are based at our headquarters in the vibrant heart of Berlin. If you want to make a difference and help changing a whole industry, then Helpling is the right place for you.


Currently, we are looking for a Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer (m/f) to enhance the technical architecture behind the scenes.


How we work


Our application is build on top of Ruby on Rails framework using PostgreSQL database. We use Redis and Memcache as well, and Sidekiq as a queue system. We have integration with Stripe, Adyen, Nexmo and Twilio.


We have a strong agile culture, where some of the teams uses Scrum or Kanban.


We believe that testing should be part of the implementation and not something to (rarely) do later. We do TDD with Rspec for Unit and Integration test and we use Capybara for feature tests.


We develop on a fully reproducible environment using Vagrant and provisioned by SaltStack that we can completely create from the scratch in less than 10 minutes.


We deploy several times a day to Heroku and AWS through a continuous Integration pipeline with Snap-ci and Jenkins.

jobs.title: Senior Back End Developer - Big Data
jobs.content:
At INFARE, we are not happy if we simply achieve our goals, we want to blow them out of the water! We want to get ahead of the scaling curve, so we can deliver even better solutions, with minimal technical debt and continue to be the leading competitive airfare intelligence provider. To achieve these goals, we will be hiring a number of experienced Backend Developers, who will join our development team based in Copenhagen or Vilnius.


As our company is going through an exponential growth, we decided to transform our beckend to use all the newest and coolest tech that is out there. You will be working on scalable applications in BigData (Hadoop/Spark/NoSql/Sql) as well as Java/Scala services and C#.Net/SqlServer applications.

jobs.title: Analytics Master
jobs.content:
We're looking for a person with the skills, experience and drive to become the 'master' of all our data and analytics. You'll be working directly for our decision makers, proactively bringing them the data that they need to make data-driven decisions.


You'll become very knowledgeable about all of our internal data schemas (in both MongoDB and MySQL), as well as the way that our partners and customers interact with us through URLs and APIs. You'll work with people throughout our company, learning their needs, and creating awesome Tableau dashboards to support their work.


You'll be proactive with our data, watching the dashboards you create and following up with teams when you identify new opportunities for data-driven decisions. You'll be in charge of curating our data sets and making new data sets available in Tableau. This will include some light programming duties in Java and/or Linux shell, as well as work with MongoDB and MySQL, to make new data sets available.


And through this work you'll be helping us feed starving children and saving lives!

Ruby Developer Contractor


Are you an experienced Ruby developer interested in putting your skills to the test? Fuga is looking for a contractor with strong backend development experience to join our full-stack Ruby team as soon as possible.


Tasks and responsibilities:



  • Maintaining and extending our royalty accounting SaaS platform written in Ruby 2, Rails 4, Reddis, RabbitMQ

  • The main task will be productizing, stabilizing and introducing scalability to the multi-tenant background job platform.

  • Help expand our continuous integration and continuous deployment systems using Chef, Capistrano, Jenkins and Docker.

  • Work and learn with experienced team to build a super modular, performant and maintainable SaaS platform

  • Combine tried-and-trusted dev practices with the latest development tools. Test driven development within a Scrum process backed by continues integration, ie. doing it right!


 Looking for/offering:



  • A very experienced Ruby on Rails developer with a solid background in Computer Science and at least seven years of relevant experience

  • Currently located in the Netherlands and preferably directly available  

  • Fulltime assignment for a period of 2-3 months


 About Fuga:


FUGA is a music company that operates at the heart of the music industry with an impressive clientele: Spinnin' Records, Armada Music, Epitaph, Domino Recording Company and more. FUGA connects these record labels, artists and distributers with digital service providers like Spotify, iTunes, Beatport and more. By doing so FUGA enables it's clients to optimize their business processes and successfully execute their strategy. FUGA's products & services provide a complete ecosystem for the digital product cycle. Clients manage, distribute and promote their music and collect on their revenue.


Interested in this position? Please send your resume and a short cover letter to jobs@fuga.com

What you can expect from us


We value technology and innovation over convention and status quo. We are all rich with ideas, ardent towards developing new and better solutions and love bending the limits of what is possible on the web. The Lever Story:

Lever builds software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $33 million. This year, we're doubling the team in size, and we're looking forward to supporting more great companies like Netflix, Eventbrite, and Lyft.

Lever is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

A look into life at Lever!

jobs.title: Back end Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Maxwell, we are inspired by the opportunity to make a difference in society by helping people make better health, wellness and financial decisions. We build web and mobile applications that support a rich set of interactions among consumers, employers, brokers and product vendors. Our domain requires us to consider usability, design, business workflow, self-service and process scalability. We view ourselves as the stewards of change for a very complex industry.


About Our Team



  • We passionately solve problems.

  • We think critically and systemically.

  • We commit to quality as the leading design principle.

  • We are agile practitioners.

  • We are building a culture of automation.

  • We scale ourselves through small, self-empowered and self-organizing teams.

  • We focus on learning, at an organizational and personal level.

  • We value a diverse team with a variety of educational backgrounds.


Buzzwords we use a lot: event sourcing, domain driven design, functional programming, devOps, TDD, agile, docker, automation.


About You


You are joining us to teach us something new and to learn a few tricks from us too. You care deeply about engineering high quality and resilient features. You are excited to work with a team that strives to delight customers no matter what it takes. You are an idealist at heart, and our mission resonates with you.


What you will do



  • Work on a new project to improve Maxwell Health's integration with enterprise partners

  • Use functional programming to design our new public REST API and integrate with our partners' APIs

  • Take full ownership of the platform, from definition, to development and testing, to deployment and monitoring

  • Practice TDD and BDD on a day-to-day basis within agile teams.

  • Invest in constant personal development and learning


Benefits



  • All benefits covered 100%

  • Flexible working hours

  • Healthy snacks

  • Open vacation, personal, and sick day policy

  • Gym reimbursement

  • Generous 401(k)

  • Transit benefits

  • Located right next to the subway

jobs.title: Lead Software Development Consultant
jobs.content:
We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills. Our current positions require significant experience and the ability to shape a new client engagement, coach other team members, provide technical leadership and be comfortable leading a development team on client site - but our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology that carries real business value. There are opportunities to make an impact beyond your day-day project too - our consultants regularly speak at conferences, get published and provide thought leadership as experts in software delivery.


As a Technical Lead at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:



  • Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using languages such as Java, Ruby and/or .NET, Scala, Clojure, Mobile and Python (to name a few)

  • Design innovative, evolutionary architectures

  • Build, support and mentor effective delivery teams

  • Writing code alongside your development team

  • Champion software quality and engender technical vision and ensuring clients are satisfied

  • Ensure there is a balance between technical innovation and what’s right for the client by considering appropriate technology choices and understanding the business vision

  • Champion Cross Functional Requirements

  • Champion agile best practices and Continuous Delivery

  • Be an ambassador of ThoughtWorks and safeguard our reputation

  • Build strong relationships with business people

  • Learn something new everyday

  • Facilitate problem solving and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

  • Help to grow the next generation of technical leaders and have a positive impact on the industry


Here’s what you’ll bring:



  • Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies

  • Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess

  • Experience with architectural design whilst leading and inspiring software development teams

  • Have helped lead development on large, custom-built object-oriented applications

  • Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration

  • Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code etc,

  • Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

  • Experience in communicating technical vision at a high and low level

  • Ability to influence on a commercial and technical level

  • Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, Encapsulation etc  

  • Experience of working in a forward thinking, OSS-centric environment


We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel.


We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, childcare vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.

jobs.title: Ervaren PHP Developer - Samen de wereld veroveren!
jobs.content:
Studenten en editors genereren 50.000 pageviews per dag op de back-end. Jij zorgt er samen met het development-team voor dat de processen in de back-end efficiënter worden en er twee-wekelijks nieuwe features worden released.


De vacature


SCRiBBR is een online scriptienakijkplatform waar 350 freelance taalkundigen bij zijn aangesloten.


We helpen jaarlijks duizenden studenten en onze server verwerkt duizenden pageviews per dag.


De beste ideeën komen voort uit problemen waar de studenten en editors tegenaan lopen. Werken voor SCRiBBR betekent dat we problemen samen oplossen, en dat we jou dus ook bij alle processen betrekken. Van de ontwerp- en ideefase tot aan de realisatie van een oplossing. Geen week is hetzelfde!


Waar zijn we naar op zoek


De ideale kandidaat is een PHP back-end developer die minimaal 4 jaar ervaring heeft. Ervaring met Symfony is een pre.


Wat doe je nu écht?



  • Dagelijks navigeer je door de Symfony codebase om de werking van het framework tot in de puntjes te begrijpen. Een junior-developer uit het developmentteam leg je uit waarom de keuze voor een specifiek design pattern binnen onze applicatie zo belangrijk is.

  • Van een use-case maak jij een technisch ontwerp, na afstemming met het team bepalen we wie de feature zal gaan implementeren.

  • Omdat jij je weg door de applicatie geblinddoekt weet te vinden, kun je zeer optimaal nieuwe features ontwikkelen. Je ontwikkelt nieuwe services binnen onze back-end applicatie en zorgt dat de functionaliteiten door middel van test-cases gedekt zijn.

  • Voor de applicatie liggen altijd nieuwe ideeën op de plank. Je stelt voor om een feature van de backlog te verschuiven naar de actieve milestone omdat een andere developer met dezelfde component een andere feature aan het ontwikkelen is.

  • Je voert in de huidige codebase deprecations door waardoor onze semantic versioning en daarmee major release van later dit jaar op schema blijft.

  • Ook de Symfony component waarmee je een feature geïmplementeerd hebt, zou gebruik kunnen maken van jouw verbetering, dus je stelt op Github een PR op voor de LTS-versie en vraagt het Symfony coreteam voor een review.


Met wie werk ik samen?


SCRiBBR bestaat uit een jong, internationaal en enthousiast team. Samen zorgen wij ervoor dat studenten met volle tevredenheid van onze diensten gebruik maken.


Het developmentteam bestaat momenteel uit 3 personen.


Hoe ziet een werkdag eruit?



  • 09:00 – Voordat je je dev-machine boot, verstuur je in de lift vanaf je mobiel een packet zodat het koffiezetapparaat aan je Chai Tea Latte begint. Eenmaal opgestart lees je in Slack de git history door van de commits die je collega’s gisterenavond nog gepushed hebben.

  • 11:00 – Onze Spaanse growth-hacker staat aan je bureau omdat haar experiment tot een kritische bug heeft geleid. Met de co-founder stem je af dat er een hotfix-release gedaan zal moeten worden.

  • 12:30 – Bug solved, live-update uitgerold. Tijd voor de dagelijks variërende lunch met alle andere start-ups binnen TQ.

  • 13:15 – Tijd om een use-case voor het optimaliseren van onze financiële processen uit de opkomende milestone uit te werken. De prioriteiten zijn verschoven dus deze feature kan gelijk ontwikkeld worden.

  • 16:00 – De implementatie is af, met co-founder Bas stem je de functionele werking af en hij heeft nog wat feedback. De feature kan echter de translation-release-cycle in zodat deze in 11 talen kan worden uitgerold.

  • Rond 18:00 – Stap je op de fiets en rijd je langs de grachten naar huis… of sluit je aan voor het avondeten op kantoor!


Wat wij de afgelopen 3 maanden hebben bereikt…?



  • Scribbr heeft de Best Entrepreneurial Student Initiative gewonnen en is genomineerd voor de Deloitte Rising Star 2016.

  • We zijn online gegaan in Zweden, Noorwegen, Denemarken en Finland. Nog meer studenten weten ons te vinden.

  • We zijn samenwerkingen aangegaan met Franse, Italiaanse en Spaanse editors en bieden nu ook de Franse, Italiaanse en Spaanse nakijkdienst aan.

  • We hebben een nieuw record van 20.000 unieke bezoekers per dag.

  • We zijn verhuisd van Tilburg naar Amsterdam om sneller te kunnen groeien. Wij zitten nu direct aan de Singel bij TQ.

  • Het team is weer flink gegroeid en het kantoor is alweer te klein. Vanaf 17 oktober hebben we 18 werkplekken :-)

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.content:
We protect children and save lives.


Our technology analyzes textual data created by students (chat, email, documents, etc) for the purpose of identifying child abuse, bullying, suicide, and other serious concerns that affect today's youth.


You will work on a small team to design and implement innovative ways to better solve this problem.

jobs.title: Technical Content Creator
jobs.content:
At Compose, we're looking for strong writers with technical backgrounds to join our eclectic writing team. Do you find yourself writing and reading technical blogs for enjoyment? Maybe you've squashed your last 4AM bug and want to step out of the fire and share your wisdom with others? Or, perhaps you're an experienced fan of a particular database and want to share your praises (...or foreboding...) with the masses?

If you're technically inclined - programming, analytics, technical marketing - and want to stay comfortably plugged in to the software world, we would love to hear from you. At Compose, quality technical content is a major part of what we do. Our articles, how-tos, case studies and marketing materials are a crucial piece of our overall puzzle. If you'd love to spend your days growing with a fantastic, casual and close-knit team, we have an unbelievable spot for you.

Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.

**Technical things we hope you're good at (or can become excellent at):**

* Databases: We provide databases as a service. We'd love for you to have all sorts of experience with different types of data-storage.
* Dev-y Things: It would be helpful if you can git, script, code things, and work with common software tools like Slack, Ghost, Google Analytics and Segment. The more technical know-how and experience, the better. Our stack is built with Ruby/Go and it would be excellent if you could contribute to that, too.
* Tech Talk: Distill complicated technical ideas to any audience. It's a tough thing to do!

**We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:**

* Driven: We're a self-managing organization that gives you the respect, trust and responsibility to operate with minimal oversight.
* Compassionate: Compose is stuffed with many great hearts, minds, and spirits. We'd love for you to want to collaborate and grow with them.
* Inventive: You'll need buckets of creativity to help you solve a wide range of (sometimes vague) conundrums.
* Accepting: Freedom to fail! Things won't always work, but things will always iterate. This is a fun role and should feel that way.

**Think you're a match?**

Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.

Good luck, and have fun!

**Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.**

jobs.title: Mobile Experience Developer
jobs.content:
At Mendix, we practice what we preach. We develop our feedback and collaboration platform using the Mendix Modeler. The modeler is part of an extensive technology stack that combines the best of breed tools to create and shape a great user experience for our customers.


We enjoy working on a range of applications throughout their lifecycle, from initial design to maintaining and improving them while in production. We believe that if you build it, you should run it. We’re persistent and we like to get to the bottom of things.



For our next team member, these are the things we're looking for:



  • A fan of agile, if not an evangelist

  • Someone who likes to share ideas (and who can communicate them in English)

  • An innate urge to improve the status quo, whether it's product or process

  • Clean code makes you happy, but satisfied customers make you happier

  • For you, work is also about having fun and playing the occasional game of foosball

  • We can check out your skills on Github or StackOverflow

  • Unix commands don't scare you



There are many reasons why we like to be part of Mendix in general, but some stand out:



  • Everyone is appreciated for their skills and ideas, regardless of mother tongue, ability to grow a beard, or crazy hobbies

  • Monthly crafting days allow us to explore side projects or try out cool new technologies, and share our experiences with the rest of the organization

  • Teams are autonomous and responsible for coming up with innovative ideas that contribute towards the bigger picture

jobs.title: Software Engineer Meta Modeling
jobs.content:
Mendix builds the next generation of innovative software to help companies make their digital revolution a reality: a platform to rapidly model modern applications (for desktop, tablet, and phone with excellent UI and APIs based on REST, OData, or web services), which we run in our cloud. 


The MetaServices team first and foremost maintains the formal specification (aka, the Meta Model) of the Mendix modelling language and builds the tooling required to do this. It also maintains and improves the [Mendix Model API and SDK] (https://developers.mendix.com/sdk/). This team is right at the center of Mendix R&D and talks to everyone to see how we can speed up and improve the development of our whole platform. Effectively, MetaServices provides for Mendix R&D what Mendix provides to our customers: a low-code platform that greatly improves productivity.
