jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Role: Senior Web Developer
Location: London, Head Office
Salary: £41,774.11 with a fixed sum allowance of £1003
Duration: Fixed term contract until 31st Dec 2017


The Labour Party is looking to recruit a Senior Web Developer to work in our Digital team. The post holder will maintain the Labour Party’s website and associated sites, and will lead in the creation of Digital online assets, including apps, email landing pages, implementing analytic programmes, lightboxes and splash pages.


The successful candidate will have the ability to project manage work in line with deadlines, knowledge of the principles of responsive design, the ability to work proactively with a variety of stakeholders and excellent technical skills with the ability to write modular, efficient, well documented Java Script optimised for performance.


To apply for this role, please complete an application form and return this to fedvac@labour.org.uk by no later than 3 October 2016.


The Labour Party values equality and diversity, and welcomes applications from candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.


Key purpose:           To lead the creation of online campaigning tools


 Specific responsibilities:



  • To be responsible for the maintenance of labour.org.uk and associated sites.

  • To build and maintain online assets including campaigning tools, landing pages, single page apps, microsites etc.

  • To build to tight deadlines in rapid response situations.

  • To actively communicate with project managers and stakeholders.

  • To participate in the wider digital team, identifying opportunities to advance Labour’s wider digital and campaigning goals.

jobs.title: Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Role: Lead Developer
Salary: £41,774.11 with an annual fixed sum allowance of £1003 per annum
Location: Head office, London
Duration: Fixed term contract until 31st May 2018


The Labour Party is seeking to recruit a Lead Developer to work in the Elections and Stakeholders team.


The post holder will be responsible for leading the detailed specification, development, maintenance, and documentation of software and reporting systems used to support the Party’s field operations, and working with others to support procurement and contract management of externally developed software.


The post holder will need a detailed understanding of the principles of software development, experience of analysing complex business requirements and specifying detailed business rules to implement them, experience of using PHP MVC frameworks in a production environment, and the ability to use both PHP and other programming languages to design and build applications and reporting systems hosted on servers running both Windows Server and Linux.


To apply for this post please complete an application form and send it to ldvac@labour.org.uk by no later than 3 October 2016.


Key Purpose:              Managing and leading the detailed specification, development, maintenance, and documentation of internally developed software and reporting systems used to support the Party’s field operations function, and working with others to support procurement and contract management of externally developed software.


Specific Responsibilities:



  1. Leading on specification and management of internally created and managed software used by the Party’s field operations function.

  2. Line management of directly employed developers working on internally created and managed software used by the Party’s field operations function, and being contact point for contracted developers working on software used by the Party’s field operations function.

  3. Leading on development of new platforms and systems for reporting, including systems for translating logical and statistical analysis of databases into natural language.

  4. Working with the Head of Contact Creator, Targeting & Analysis on specifications, development, and contract management for externally supplied software which supports our field operations function.

  5. Working with the Head of Training, Development, and Community Organising on contract management and software development for volunteer management.

  6. Working with other teams within Elections & Stakeholders on specifications and software development as directed by the Head of Contact Creator, Targeting, and Analysis.

  7. Ensuring the full technical documentation of internally developed software and assisting in the production of user guidance and user support materials.

  8. Assisting with development of user guidance and user support materials for externally developed software used in the Labour Party in furtherance of our field operations function.

  9. To carry out any other reasonable task as directed by the Head of Contact Creator, Targeting and Analysis; or the Executive Director – Elections & Stakeholders.

jobs.title: Ruby Developer - to join a growing and award winning Development team!
jobs.content:
Are you the Ruby Developer we've been looking for?


We're on a mission to build on our existing world-class team of exceptional developers who are dedicated to devising exceptional solutions to challenges in the online travel industry!


The role is for a specialist Ruby developer who will join our existing Ruby team to help build and maintain new products and features for On the Beach’s customer facing website and back office systems. You will be joining a team of skilled and experienced Ruby developers and becoming part of one of the UKs most progressive, talented and successful application development teams. Key to success will be the ability to work in a highly agile environment collaborating daily with both technical and commercial colleagues, to think innovatively and challenge convention and to enjoy being part of a closely knit team of like minded individuals. You will be genuinely passionate about technology and enjoy the challenge of building exciting and innovative new user experiences.


Like most of the talented profiles on Stack Overflow you're in demand and may not be actively seeking a new challenge but - what if we are the company you've been looking for? A company where you’ll never stop learning and have the opportunity to work with some of the top techies in the country in their field. We know how important it is to keep up to date with the latest technologies, which is why we spend every Friday afternoon on research, development and testing out cool new ideas.. This can be either an internal hack session, one of the team presenting some of their ideas, or perhaps an external speaker.  Not only will you learn great skills that can be applied at work, they'll also be useful for your interests and personal projects.


We pride ourselves on continuous improvement so, code reviews and knowledge sharing is a standard, as is our policy of learning and not blaming! We never lose, we either win or learn.


We're growing fast - so this role could be ideal for someone wanting to lead by example.


We offer a competitive package including discounted holidays, flexible working arrangements and a great working environment (including a 9-hole putting course, chill-out areas and summer BBQs). 


If you join our team you will also have the opportunity and support to develop your skills by learning about the many open source languages and technologies On the Beach deploys.

jobs.title: Finance & Accounting Analyst
jobs.content:
Remote Year Business Description

Remote Yearâ is a program for global professionals that travel for a year with interesting people while working remotely (12 cities, 12 months). Remote Year organizes accommodations, shared workspace, travel, and events in each city for the group.

Finance Analyst Role Description

If you enjoy cracking financial numbers, setting down smooth processes, and building great relationships with colleagues and vendors, then we are looking for you! The Finance Analyst will be responsible for reporting accounting information internally and managing financial transactions with Remote Yearâs customers, banks, vendors, and partners.

Responsibilities

  • Drive internal expense reporting process across programs, cities, and internal RY teams
  • Generate monthly customer invoices, track and follow up on outstanding receivables, and respond to customer billing inquiries
  • Create monthly dashboards for internal leadership and investors, and confidently convey that information in both written and verbal modes
  • Work with external accountants to establish and maintain monthly reporting cadence (i.e. revenue realization, prepaid expense allocation, etc.)
  • Manage QBO reporting system integration with different data source inputs including bank feeds, and expense and billing platform imports
  • Help identify and act on process improvement opportunities as well as with international research and forecasting

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâs degree in a related field
  • 2 years of demonstrated experience in financial accounting or similar role
  • CPA License and experience with QuickBooks Online a plus
  • Excellent communication skills and organizational skills
  • Ability to work with minimal guidance and be comfortable operating in ambiguity

Qualities
  1. Ownership â we are looking for someone that will own this and crush it
  2. Passion for travel â role will require frequent presence on Remote Year programs
  3. Organization skills â great time management skills, ability to multitask
  4. Interpersonal skills - while the role is more strategic in nature, each member of our team touches Remotes (customers) in one way or another

To apply: Apply online at http://remote-year.breezy.hr/p/db5a59d151ca-finance--accounting-analyst

jobs.title: People Operations Business Partner
jobs.content:
Remote Year Business Description
Remote Year is a program for global professionals, during which we travel for a year with interesting people while working remotely (12 cities, 12 months). With a massive shift toward cloud / remote productivity, and a millennial passion for experiences and travel, Remote Year delivers a year-long work and travel experience.

Role Description
Remote Year is looking for two driven, creative People Operations Business partners to help our functional teams align their objectives with Dreamers (staff) and team leads.  Using a consultative tool set, the Business Partner will act as a change agent to drive success for the assigned internal teams.  The first role will specialize in the recruiting and onboarding of local talent in the international cities where Remote Year focuses its operations.  The second role will focus on policy, procedure and benefits for the entire Remote Year team.  Longer term, both roles will also take over responsibility for other facets of our People Operations solutions.

Responsibilities for People Operations Business Partner - Talent Acquisition
  • Proactively establish communications channels with team leads in the operations side of the organization, facilitating the identification of needs and opportunities for assistance with a special emphasis on recruiting and onboarding local talent.
  • Manage sourcing, recruitment and selection processes for other assigned roles, with a special emphasis on empowering hiring managers to have ownership in each step of the strategic staffing cycle.
  • Create, implement and manage culture initiatives to help our Dreamers (staff) live the Remote Year brand and values.
  • Gather, analyze, and provide insights from key People-related metrics and develop solutions where appropriate based on this data
  • Consult on the resolution of complex Dreamer (staff) issues, including investigations and other unforeseen challenges facing our distributed workforce.
  • Champion frequent, daily performance management philosophy including guidance and other related talent management components (e.g., coaching and career development)

Responsibilities for the People Operations Business Partner - Policy
  • Proactively establish communications channels with team leads in the operations side of the organization, facilitating the identification of needs and opportunities for assistance with a special emphasis on policy, procedures and internal communications.
  • Take ownership of employee handbooks, employee information, and other core activities that support our Dreamers behind the scenes.
  • Gather, analyze, and provide insights from key People-related metrics and develop solutions where appropriate based on this data
  • Champion frequent, daily performance management philosophy including guidance and other related talent management components (e.g., coaching and career development)

Qualifications
  • Bachelorâs degree in human resources or business administration; Master's degree preferred
  • PHR/SPHR certification a plus
  • Start-up or entrepreneurial environment experience a plus
  • Experience working in and traveling to international locations for recruiting
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of legally defensible sourcing and recruiting required
  • Experience managing complex projects
  • Excellent communication skills and organizational skills
  • Ability to work with minimal guidance and be comfortable operating in ambiguity

Qualities
  1. Ownership â we are looking for someone that will own this and crush it
  2. Passion for travel â role will require frequent presence on Remote Year programs
  3. Organization skills â great time management skills, ability to multitask
  4. Interpersonal skills - while the role is more strategic in nature, each member of our team touches Remotes (customers) in one way or another

To apply: Apply online at http://remote-year.breezy.hr/p/9bf03cb33ecf-people-operations-business-partner

jobs.title: Python/Django Developer
jobs.content:
About Us

We are a SaaS startup that is making life easier for sales teams by eliminating the back-and-forth of scheduling calls and video conferences with customers & prospects. If you've ever seen a "Schedule Demo" button on a website or in emails, we want to be that button.  Our software is small, but the impact it has on our customers is huge.

What weâre looking for

We are seeking a Python developer to help maintain and build new features for our Django-powered JSON API that drives our app.  Our ideal candidate has strong skills with Python/Django, and has a good working knowledge of Python development workflows.  Here are some technologies weâd like you to be familiar with:

  • Django REST Framework
  • MySQL
  • Heroku/AWS
  • Google APIs
  • OAuth2
  • Git

If youâre interested in shooting for the moon, it would be amazing if you were familiar with:

  • Javascript
  • AngularJS (v1)
  • ReactJS
  • Bootstrap/LESS
  • Grunt
  • UI/UX

Who this job is for

This position is for someone that...

  • Is very customer-focused.  You must be excited about developing solutions, not just code.
  • Is self-motivated and able to be productive without supervision.
  • Knows (generally) how the SaaS industry works.
  • Has good communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Doesnât want to work for a corporate machine.  There are three of us; youâll be the fourth.
  • Wants reasonably flexible hours and a laid back work environment.

To apply: Send a GitHub profile (or equivalent) and a resume (or LinkedIn) to jared@appointlet.com.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
800response is seeking an open source virtuoso to join our team in helping us continue the journey of our advanced call routing & tracking / speech analytics platforms into the realm of the latest Web 2.0, Asterisk and VoIP technologies, and beyond.

You must be a serious application developer, with at least five years’ experience designing and building flexible, scalable, and secure back-end and outward facing systems on open source platforms:




  • Fully versed in web-enabled application development within the Linux environment

  • Excellent system architecture and application design skills

  • Strong database experience, particularly with MySQL

  • Fluent in Node.js and associated tools (such as NPM, grunt/gulp, nodeunit, etc.)

  • Fluent in JavaScript front-end applications and associated tools and frameworks (Angular.js, Bower, etc.)

  • Experience with PHP (including object-oriented programming) is helpful

  • Comfortable with MVC/MVVM design methodologies

  • Familiarity with team development tools (Git, Confluence, Jira), change management, quality assurance, testing and integration protocols

  • Comfortable at the command line (scp, ssh, bash, etc.)


 Special consideration will be given to candidates with skills in configuration management under Spacewalk / Ansible / Docker, CI/CD, Asterisk AGI, and VoIP network engineering.

If you are an experienced technologist with a hunger for new challenges, then we would like to hear from you. Please be prepared to demonstrate your skills by providing code samples to document your involvement in significant prior projects, and to participate in a skills assessment exercise as part of the qualification process.

800response offers competitive compensation and an outstanding benefits package. Please send resume with cover letter noting HR Dept Code WP-CB to: HR@800response.com.  EOE.

jobs.title: Senior / Lead Frontend Web Developer with Angular JS
jobs.content:
We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Art Galleries, Non Profits and Charities. We’ve been growing fast over the past few years and so we’re back on the lookout for a confident and ambitious Senior/Lead Front End Web developer to join our team. We offer a great work-life balance with flexible working hours and a real team mentality! 


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but we've got a long client list that includes other companies, trade associations and government bodies making us a rich and rewarding place to work.


The role will expose you to a really wide range of projects and you can expect to be developing all sorts of web applications, sites and apps for a range of clients. The ideal candidate will have: 


– Excellent HTML and CSS skills including working knowledge of LESS or SASS, Bootstrap or Zurb Foundation and other frameworks etc


– Excellent experience with Angular JS


- Strong Git experience (you know your submodules from your subtrees!)


– Confidence in a PHP based environment


- Some exposure or experience with Drupal CMS a positive (but not essential)


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a young team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us. If you're interested in the role, please send your CV through to us with a short covering letter explaining what got you interested and why you think you will fit in.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Position Overview:


Logicworks, a fast-growing cloud computing and managed hosting firm located in New York, NY is seeking an AWS-Focused DevOps Engineer to join our team.


Responsibilities:


As a DevOps member of a Senior Engineering technical staff consisting of experts in many adjacent areas (Windows, Linux, VMWare, SQL, Storage), you will drive growth our Managed AWS service (mAWS) by building next generation managed AWS solutions for all manner of businesses. You will also contribute to our proprietary knowledge base of automation to ensure efficient scalability for future builds.


Logicworks provides a fast-paced, dynamic work environment where engineers work closely with specialists in all areas to provide unique yet scalable solutions for our clients. A typical project may be the onboarding of an existing AWS client, assessing their environment, recommending and executing changes and implementing automated deployment to improve scale and resiliency. You will also collaborate with other expert engineers and our R&D team to continue finding new areas that can be improved by bringing a DevOps mindset to other product offerings. You will be able to further your skills in adjacent areas by serve as an escalation point for builds, implementations, and support issues of our clients.

jobs.title: Senior Analyst, Insights & Analytics
jobs.content:
Senior Analysts have the same role as Analysts but with more experience and autonomy. They are part mathematician, part author and part mentor who are expected to provide media research and performance insights in support of the media/search teams. Three major facets to their role include:

  • Finding and sorting information quickly and efficiently
  • Presenting information in a manner that is both easy for a lay-person to understand and statistically sound
  • Helping others use data effectively by guiding them to ask the right questions

Responsibilities:

  • Assist senior directors (Media, Analytics etc) with various analytic projects for media and search departments as well as clients
  • Retrieve raw research data and synthesize it into usable forms for media team usage
  • Assist media team in running numerous insights reports, i.e. Response analyses, cost analysis
  • Help maintain a performance platform and provide on-going recommendations around media optimization (reallocation of media dollars across different media partners, tactics etc)
  • Assist in original research and the writing of reports
  • On-going client-facing responsibilities

Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience in similar/applicable position or marketing research-orientated degree
  • Strong analytical orientation
  • Good writing and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills)
  • Strong Excel spreadsheet skills (sorting data, pivot tables, advanced functions)
  • Additional desirable skills include web design/application coding experience, statistics background (SPSS/SAS training), experience with online research sources
  • Digital Media experience/background
  • Experience with Doubleclick DART, Atlas and Omniture
  • Basic statistical aptitude
  • Knowledge of media tools including MRI, Netratings, Comscore, Stradegy, Nielsen Monitor+ and Microsoft Access

About Us:

Neo@Ogilvy is the world’s leading digital and direct media agency, with more than 650 professionals in 39 offices across 32 countries. We provide a full range of digital and direct media services, including media strategy, planning and buying, search marketing, performance marketing, analytics and technology, mobile marketing, social media marketing, digital out-of-home marketing and others. Our mission is to be the best in class, full-service digital and direct global media network that delivers performance results to our clients’ 360 strategy.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
Web & IT Manager
jobs.content:
Position Title: Web & IT Manager

Reports To: Senior Web & IT Manager

Compensation: $50,000, depending on experience

Location: Negotiable: All Alliances Management team members work virtually

Term: Full-time

Dedication: Expected 40 hours/week

Travel: Unlikely, but 1-2 trips annually to client sites may be required

To Apply: Qualified candidates should send a resume and a customized introductory letter (which we really do read) to hr@alliancesmanagement.com.  Applications should be received no later than 15 October 2016.

BACKGROUND

Alliances Management is an association management and consulting company with professionals located throughout the United States and satellite offices in Europe and Asia.  We fulfill high-profile functions for international clients, including EMVCo and GlobalPlatform in the association space and eBay and Visa in the private sector.  We have grown tenfold since our inception in 2006 because of our unwavering commitment to excellence.  Our services include development of international programs, management of global events, financial management, and implementation of certification programs.

We are interested in hiring only candidates with extremely high standards and who believe that client satisfaction is not only essential in its own right, but also because it will bring long-term success to Alliances Management.

To learn more, visit www.alliancesmanagement.com.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

â¢    Website Design & Updates (50% of time) â Candidate will support Alliances Management clients by updating client websites, including text edits, addition or removal of documents, additions or removal of pages, and basic graphic updating.  This also includes management of email distribution lists and sending HTML-formatted emails.
â¢    Member & IT Support (25% of time) â Candidate will support clients by establishing new user accounts, onboarding new participants, updating passwords, and more.  Candidate will also be asked to provide basic-level IT support, including creating email accounts, establishing forwarding or aliases in various control panels, managing Companyâs online backup policy, and troubleshooting PCs as required.
â¢    Graphic Design (10% of time) â Candidate will be asked to modify existing graphics, format documents, and assist both company and client personnel with graphical requirements.  This may involve working with outside designers for more complex projects.
â¢    Strategic Projects (15% of time) â The Web & IT Manager will be responsible for implementing new Company policies, such as selection of collaboration software, selection of backup plans; making recommendations for future IT decisions; and producing documentation to summarize Company or client IT circumstances.

Requirements & Skills:

â¢    Proficiency with HTML and CSS
â¢    Familiar with using FTP clients
â¢    Adobe Dreamweaver (or similar HTML editor) knowledge required
â¢    Knowledge of Wordpress, including template customization, and the ability to learn custom CMSâs
â¢    Experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
â¢    Nice to have: Knowledge of PHP, MySQL, ASP, and Adobe InDesign
â¢    3+ yearsâ experience and success with web, design, and related responsibilities
â¢    Ability to work well in a âmatrixâ organization that requires answering to different managers and working with individuals across different parts of the company
â¢    Familiarity and experience working with business professionals from different cultural backgrounds
â¢    Extreme attention to detail
â¢    Positive attitude and a team playerâboth with managers and colleagues

To apply: In the body of your application, explain why you are the right candidate for the opportunity. Please be specific. Please also include salary history/expectations, any additional information you would like us to know, and any questions that you have.As Alliances Management is a virtual company, all employees work from home. The Web & IT Manager will do the same while employed by Alliances Management, based in Silicon Valley, California. In order to meet company requirements to manage client projects, the selected candidate will ordinarily need to work U.S. hours (8:00 a.m. â 5:00 p.m. U.S. Pacific Time); however, there will be times when it will be critical to work alternative hours in order to meet client expectations. In everything we do, we place our clientsâ needs first. Visit www.alliancesmanagement.com to learn more.

jobs.title: C# Lead Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for C# .NET Lead Developer to join our growing team. You will be working with a small team designing and implementing solutions for both web and mobile. The role will allow you to work on projects of all shapes and sizes for a wide range of clients.


This is a senior software role, leading a small but rapidly growing software team and you'll recognise that opportunity to shape the team and take your career to the next level.


Attributes



  • Enthusiasm – you love technology and making it work

  • Completer / Finisher – you finish what you start and love the feeling of getting it done

  • Curious – if you don’t know how it works, you find out

  • Positive – life is too short for grumbling

  • Focussed – you know where to put your time and energy

  • Accurate - you like to dot the i’s and cross the t’s


Key Duties



  • Specifying and creating software applications

  • Work with Technical Director and managers to gather requirements and plan projects

  • Produce detailed specifications, mock-ups and prototypes

  • Help improve and evolve all software development processes to optimise time, risk and cost

  • Mentor all team members on tools, technologies and processes

  • Manage software releases including release scheduling, release notes, deployment and release support.

  • Perform system support for critical system issues

  • Administration and maintenance of both development and production servers

jobs.content:

jobs.title: Creative UI / UX Web Designer Job, Manchester
JavaScript Developer - award-winning data visualization software
jobs.content:
We are an award winning start-up based in Cambridge (UK). We make KeyLines, an innovative browser-based visualization software toolkit, which lets organisations see and explore networks in their data.


Continued commercial success means we now need another experienced JavaScript developer to join our engineering team.


You will have worked in a software product-based environment and have a minimum of 2 to 3 years current experience of JavaScript development within a software product environment. You will be passionate and opinionated about software development and code quality. We manage our development in an agile manner with fortnightly sprints and daily stand-up meetings, with early and frequent releases. We maintain close relationships with the developers who use our code, so you should have good communication and interpersonal skills.


You will work on a variety of tasks including our core product code, data visualisation work, and occasional development for specific clients

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Embedded Software Engineer 
voor 32 tot 40 uur per week
locatie: De Lier (bij Delft)
 
Waarom bij Priva werken als Embedded Software Ontwikkelaar?



  • Ontwikkelen van (platform)software voor embedded devices in een hightech omgeving.

  • Werken in een breed spectrum, van IO tot front-end applicatie.

  • Inspelen op trends als Internet of Things, Big Data en de Cloud.

  • Software ontwikkeling in eigen beheer in een multidisciplinaire omgeving.

  • Werken in zelfsturende Scrum / Agile teams.

  • Werken bij een innovatief familiebedrijf.

  • Werken aan producten die bijdragen aan een duurzame wereld.

  • Aandacht voor groei en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

  • Een goede werksfeer met leuke collega´s.


Op de Campus van Priva (www.priva.nl) in het Westland werken ruim 300 medewerkers aan innovatieve producten en diensten voor de tuinbouw- en gebouwautomatisering. Hun duurzame oplossingen worden wereldwijd toegepast.

Priva heeft vestigingen in onder andere Duitsland, Groot-Brittannië, België, Scandinavië, Canada, Mexico en China. Bekijk deze film over strategie van Priva: http://www.meinyprins.com/new-visual-priva-identity.
 
Binnen de afdeling Hardware en Embedded Software wordt door 32 professionals in kleine teams de Embedded Software en Hardware ontwikkeld en onderhouden voor de diverse producten en het platvorm van Priva.
Ter versterking van een van de Embedded Software teams zoeken wij een gedreven en pragmatische ontwikkelaar die graag initiatief neemt. Door jouw manier van communiceren en je persoonlijkheid weet jij richting te geven aan softwareontwikkeling om samen met je collega's de teamdoelen te realiseren. 

Herken jij jezelf in het volgende profiel?



  • Afgeronde hbo- of universitaire opleiding richting Elektrotechniek, Technische informatica of Technische Computerkunde.

  • Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar werkervaring met Embedded (24/7) systemen, Linux is een pre.

  • Diepgaande kennis en bij voorkeur ervaring met C en C++.

  • Ervaring met (objectgeoriënteerd) ontwerpen van complexe software systemen en kennis van UML.

  • Kennis van Agile / Scrum manier van werken is een pre.

  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse (vereiste) en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift



De afdeling Research & Development 
Je werkt samen in een multidisciplinair Product Markt Team (PMT) Hardware en Embedded met 32 collega-professionals aan de ontwikkeling van het Platform van Priva.

Er zijn 146 collega’s werkzaam binnen de 8 Product Markt Teams (3 op Gebouwautomatisering, 3 op Tuinbouwautomatisering, 1 op Hardware en Embedded en 1 op Training en Documentation) in functies als Developer, Support Medewerker, Product Manager, Product Owner, Architect, Tester, Trainer en Management.

Alle PMT’s zijn marktgericht. Het hele team kan eigenaarschap nemen voor het bedienen van hun klantengroep. Per team is 1 persoon eindverantwoordelijk en deze rapporteert aan de CTO.

Bij Priva staat de mens centraal. Zij vertrouwen op talent en geven ruimte aan persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Priva vindt een prettige werksfeer belangrijk. Zij geloven dat hierin betere prestaties worden geleverd. Hier staat een marktconform salaris en secundair arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket tegenover. 
 
Meer informatie en/of sollicitatie
Hiervoor neem je rechtstreeks contact op met Dick Brons via telefoon 06 348 19 201 of dwb@bronsconsulting.nl. Het mogelijke eerste gesprek zal met Dick Brons zijn, bij Priva op kantoor in De Lier.
 
Acquisitie n.a.v. deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Embedded Software Engineer, Embedded Software Ontwikkelaar, Embedded Software Developer, Firmware Ontwikkelaar

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
***Position is actually located in London, UK but we would consider someone in the U.S.***



With nearly 20,000 organizational customers and millions of student users, Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company. Blackboard is shaping the future of education with big ideas that challenge conventional thinking and advance new models of learning. Every day we’re inspiring people to find new ways to learn, connect and drive change in the way education is delivered and experienced. Through technology and services we bring people closer to the knowledge they seek and to ways they can change their own education and the world for the better.
 
At Blackboard Collaborate™ we develop products that enable a more interactive learning experience for students, helping users instantly collaborate using virtual classrooms and meeting spaces. We are a driven, creative and energetic team that works in a flexible and agile fashion to deliver world class products to the education market.
 
As a Senior Software Engineer you will have the following responsibilities:



  • Work effectively in an Agile team to deliver quality products.

  • Develop and enhance media components that bring real-time audio and video capabilities to Blackboard products.

  • Break down large/complex problems and be involved in the process of designing and implementing solutions.

  • Stay on top of the latest technologies, tools, and techniques.

  • Shape the future of eLearning through innovation on the next generation of products.

  • Work with other developers to set standards and define best practices for coding and design. Participate in design and code reviews.

jobs.title: MS Dynamics Business Analyst
jobs.content:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our customers get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


We now have an opportunity for a lead Business Analyst to join the practice.


You will be  responsible for leading analysis and functional specification for  Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


Key Accountabilities:



  • The primary duties of the role is business analysis and functional specification for MS CRM implementation,   undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team

  • Lead relationship with customer SME and business users to capture functional and non-functional requirements  through techniques including workshops

  • Functional design and specification documentation

  • Undertake configuration of  MS CRM 2011  to 2016 solutions

  • Lead testing, data migration and training workstreams

  • Share responsibility with project  workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets   customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost



  • Business development



    • Supporting the MS CRM UK Competency Lead and Offshore Centre of Excellence Lead in defining vertical and   horizontal MS CRM offerings

    • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers

    • consulting with and reviewing offers with vertical teams

    • supporting pre-sales activity to close new business.

    • supporting  proposal efforts

jobs.title: MS Dynamics Solution Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our clients get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


As a Solution Architect in the Microsoft Dynamics CRM UK Practice you are responsible for leading architecture and design activities as well as guiding the development of Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals such as Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


 Responsibilities:


The primary duties of the role is solution architecture and technical design authority responsible for MS CRM implementation, undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team



  • Architect high quality solution to meet customers functional, non- functional and regulatory requirements

  • Overall technical design authority with responsibility for signing off technical deliverables

  • Share responsibility with project workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost


Business development:



  • Supporting the MS CRM UK Competency Lead and Offshore Centre of Excellence Lead in defining vertical and horizontal MS CRM offerings

  • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers

  • consulting with and reviewing offers with vertical teams

  • supporting pre-sales activity to close new business.

  • supporting  proposal efforts

jobs.title: Business Process Consultant
jobs.content:
Centre Operations to join the Business Process Services Consulting practice within Cognizant for one of the major Healthcare Clients in the UK.


Cognizant Business Process Services help enterprises step-change faster without massive organizational upheaval—by simultaneously being more innovative and efficient. We help accelerate the evolution of a business, without the need for revolution by delving deeply into customer experience, business process design and operating model change. The business unit helps organizations move from 'doing' digital to 'being’ digital more effectively.


In this role you will support the objectives of one of our Health Care Clients which aims at centralizing all its back office operations into a shared services CoE. A successful candidate will be expected to provide conceptual solutions after analysing and assessing the as-is state and the associated business problems/needs, with consideration of associated risks, cost and timescales, becoming a subject-matter expert of the Health Care Contact Centre operations business processes and its functional/non-functional requirements.  


You will work closely with the Client teams in advisory and consulting capacity responsible for process diagnostics, management and governance. You will elaborate market-led requirements into clear and complete User Stories, ensuring clear communication of those findings to the Client stakeholders and enabling the kick-off of solution design phase.

jobs.title: Temenos Product Specialist
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s Banking and Financial Services practice encompasses consumer lending, commercial finance, leasing insurance, cards, payments, banking, investment banking, wealth management and transaction processing. It is the company’s largest industry segment, serving leading financial institutions in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. These include 9 of the top 10 European banks and 16 of the top 20 North American financial institutions. The practice leverages its deep domain and consulting expertise to provide solutions across the entire financial services spectrum, and enables our clients to manage business transformation challenges, drive revenue and cost optimisation, create new capabilities, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, capitalize on new business opportunities, and drive efficiency, effectiveness, innovation and virtualisation.


Our global partnership with TEMENOS showcases the expertise and experience of two of the strongest players in banking technology. By integrating Cognizant’s implementation and systems integration services with TEMENOS market leading core banking software, customers of both companies can gain a strong competitive advantage and improved banking processes. Working as a product consultant on Temenos you will be providing solutions.

jobs.title: UI Architect
jobs.content:
Today’s organizations need to think, act and be digital at scale to serve customers in the unprecedented ways they expect. 


Digital has to become nothing more and nothing less than the way our clients do business throughout their business. We’re past the days when a successful center of excellence or initiative impressed customers and partners, when dabbling in digital was enough.


It’s time to go beyond doing pilot projects to being digital.


To take an enterprise-wide approach to digital technology that unlocks the full capabilities of your organization and improves experiences for all your employees and customers dramatically. That doesn’t mean rejecting existing infrastructure wholesale in search of the latest trend, but helping our clients evolve into a more powerful, progressive version of the great company their already are.


Job Summary:


The User Interface Architect is responsible for working with clients in our digital practice to create great, compelling interfaces that optimise digital whilst delivering great user experience. 


The day to day role will  provide exposure to analyse various web frameworks, UI architecture and provide suitable UI solutions. 


Hands on development opportunity in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript & Various JavaScript frameworks.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Web Architect role doing hands on in Web technologies in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript, & various JavaScript frameworks. 



  • Will be providing inputs at web application Architecture level. 



  • Will assess different web frameworks, compare them and provide appropriate suggestions for best fit.

  • Will research in latest web UI technologies in market and focus oriented to provide best solutions in the area.



  •  Will provide web framework solutions and guide team members on the same.

jobs.title: Environment Automation Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s Infrastructure Services Practice provides end-to-end solutions covering architecture, design, implementation, management and on-going support across the entire enterprise technology infrastructure.


Our services include a spectrum of management, consulting and systems integration services to help our clients maximize value in their infrastructure resources, while optimizing infrastructure performance and cost.


The Environment Automation Architect will undertake and own software automation development & deployment for key accounts within the UK/I Infrastructure Services Practice


 Key Responsibilities:



  • Extensive development and deployment with Python, Chef, Puppet, Java, C++, HTMP5, Linux, TCP, Storage, Compute

  • Manage the large scale software development & deployment 

  • Handle end to end  project management, team management & client  management delivery

  • Participate in development, transition and technical documentation

  • Handle various teams and facilitate cross-functional requirements

  • Take responsibility for communication and documentation

  • Mentor the managers & team members from Cognizant to ensure that they are delivering a professional, high quality, high value & responsive service experience to the client

jobs.title: PEGA Lead Systems Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s PEGA Lead System Architects are responsible for mentoring development teams and delivering world-class platforms for our customers on PEGA.   In this role they bring certification and deep expertise using PRPC maximizing the use of OOTB functionality to deliver solutions that have minimal coding and ensuring high performance delivery.


Responsibilities:



  • Participate in architecture and design discussions and review

  • Monitor the daily activities of the team referring to the project plan

  • Resolve technical issues at offshore and resolve issues and ad hoc requests

  • Report weekly project status to Project Manager and provide input for management status review meetings

  • Participate in the Architecture sessions to provide inputs on system Architecture from Pega perspective

  • Ensure compliance with Pega implementation guard rails

  • Own and deliver High Level Design document

  • Define Reuse Scope and Path

  • Establish Development & Deployment Best Practices

  • Mentor Pega Technical Resources

  • Offshore co-ordination and provide inputs to the Offshore team to prepare Low Level Design and build the application

  • Gather and  analyze interface details and provide it to offshore for interface design

  • Conduct code review and provide feedback to build team

  • Participate in QA and UAT Defect Triage

  • Provide QA and UAT Support

  • Participate in Design and code Review with the customer Architects

  • Provide Implementation support in different environments

  • Provide resolution on technical issues

  • Co-ordinate between Onsite and offshore teams

jobs.title: Test Data Manager
jobs.content:
With the growth of smart phones, tablets and new operating systems requiring constant updates daily, testing and QA are more critical than ever before.


Our Quality Engineering & Assurance group partners with you to bolster development initiatives, providing reliable support across a range of hardware and software, testing infrastructure, and testing products that ensure test coverage and drive product quality.

Summary of Department Focus:


Cognizant BFS testing practice is a 4500-member unit that has skills varying from core application testing, Test programme Management to test consulting. Cognizant is the preferred testing partner for top 3 of the UK Banks. The selected candidate will be part of fast growing and dynamic BFS testing team in UK.

Summary of Job Purpose:


Cognizant's Banking and Financial Services testing practice are looking to recruit a Test Data Manager based in Skelmersdale, Manchester.

The Test Data Manager is accountable for planning delivery of test data to meet test data requirements; leading the team tasked with sourcing the data


Defining the strategy for the management of test data across multiple environments; formalising and documenting the process for loading; updating, and maintaining data across systems; leading on resolution of defects relating to test data.

Defining test data management strategy for large, complex programmes

Defining Enterprise Test Data Strategy/Policy covering Data Archival, Data Refresh, Data source database identification, Data Sub-setting, Data Generation, Data Masking etc.


Providing process expertise and support through quick resolution of issues related to test data

Liaising with test and deployment leads to ensure delivery of data is factored into plans

Defining requirements acceptance criteria and Handover checklists for Test Data Delivery

Defining roles and responsibilities for creation of requirements and delivery of data to meet them
Lead a team of test data analysts from across different technology


Mentor and guide test data team and bring ideas to implement industry leading practices on test data management

Defining E2E process & workflow from data requests to provisioning for the client


Role focus on leading a central test data management team for the client within their test environment practice


Strong relationship with Application Development & Maintenance, Testing, Environment, Infrastructure and Service Management teams


Responsible for managing the data from Source to Target test regions through the complete Test Data lifecycle

jobs.title: Technology Consultant
jobs.content:
GTO provides technology leadership, transformation and innovation services to Cognizant clients. The business unit includes a number of advanced technology laboratories which enable clients to create first of a kind solutions which use emerging technologies. It also has a technology transformation delivery capability. 


In this role you will represent the Cognizant Global Technology Office (GTO) on client engagements and you will take responsibility for shaping, leading and delivering added-value through technology consultancy and through guiding delivery engagements.


You will have proven capability in providing technical leadership, delivering high quality technology advice, creativity and insight; ensuring project success through timely and accurate production of agreed deliverables; with a strong stakeholder management focus and to the benefit of the reputation of GTO.


You will be able to relate business problems to the technology domain and communicate how technology provides business solutions. You should be confident of your ability to perform in complex client engagements when support can be limited. You will be enthusiastic to join an expanding and ambitious team of similarly high calibre, successful technology consultants, and to contribute to our worldwide growth. 


We offer fantastic opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies with some of the fastest moving, well recognised brands in the world, across all industries.

jobs.title: Mulesoft Architect
jobs.content:
Consumer technology expectations are rapidly infiltrating the enterprise landscape. Our applications development and maintenance solutions drive efficiency and effectiveness and help our customers build adaptable platforms for the new social mobile enterprise.


Cognizant's Enterprise Application Services  practice provides high quality Service Orientated Architecture integration solutions (Oracle Service Bus, Oracle SOA Suite, BPEL, Oracle Business Rules, ESB) to leading corporations spanning various domains to address their complex integration needs across a variety of geographies; increasing the capabilities of their organization by allowing applications to assume new roles in the business.


We have an exciting role for an expert level Mulesoft Architect to join our EAS team.


This is a role with a global reach, aimed at enhancing the business unit’s Mulesoft footprint in this and other geographies. This role produces design artefacts and templates, develops and tests the code, supports QA, executes / supports the Change and Release processes and provides production operational support as needed.  In addition to assisting with the expansion of internal technical capabilities by mentoring the team

jobs.title: DevOps Architect
jobs.content:
Businesses today must move at the speed of digital. Traditional software development often can’t keep up. DevOps helps companies accelerate software development and improve software quality. In the past, software was often “thrown over the wall” to infrastructure and operations for deployment and support. Resolving issues required numerous rounds of iterations between multiple groups. With DevOps, software developers, infrastructure administrators, quality assurance and operations professionals collaborate early and often to anticipate potential problems and proactively incorporate feedback throughout the development cycle using an Enterprise DevOps Platform.


Cognizant has extensive experience in DevOps and leverages this expertise to provide customers with comprehensive DevOps services spanning strategy, planning, execution and managed services. Leveraging our DevOps Assessment Framework, Cognizant delivers strategies and solutions that help clients maximize the benefits of their DevOps investment.


We have an opportunity for a DevOps architect to join the team and have real responsibility for development and design of our DevOps architecture. You will be building solutions using DevOps tools such as Chef, Puppet and Jenkins, and working closely with projects to ensure delivery.

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Your mission:
> Designing and implementing Chatbots for the E-Sport industry (League of Legends, DOTA 2, Overwatch, CS:GO)
> Working together with the team of the Lolsumo App to retrieve and provide data
> Maintaining the production environment
> Deploying and continuously improving the running services

jobs.title: Developer Needed For Cyber Security Team
jobs.content:
This position is open to anyone living in the UK - we support remote home working and/or working from co-working hubs. We currently have spaces in London, Bristol, Gloucester and Liverpool - but always keen to open more!


We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation.


Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.


Responsibilities


Primary responsibilities:



  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery

  • Work with the team to get things done

  • Agree and deliver on the sprint commitment

  • Design and implementation of secure software components

  • Adherence to the source control model, design, and coding standards

  • Participate in the iterative user needs, analysis, and design phases

  • Ensure that all code is fully tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality

  • Participate in the peer review process


Secondary responsibilities include:



  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle

  • Participating in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations

  • Supporting the test team where automation is necessary

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you ever wondered why our healthcare system is so complicated? How can an industry so large and important fail to evolve while every other sector sprints forward with the aid of technology? We have asked ourselves these questions and are working to be part of the answer. We want to reshape the way patients and doctors communicate to improve health outcomes and improve patient quality of life. Being a product-driven company at heart, we believe clinical rigor mixed with technology and strong user-centered design has the potential to transform healthcare. Weâre going up against some of the largest healthcare technology companies in the business and winning due to our focus on clinical workflow and patient engagement.

Interested? Our team is looking to add a QA Engineer to lead the testing initiatives for our robust and scalable product and platform.

__A typical work week will be:__

* Daily testing of new features and bug fixes.
* Managing bug identification, documentation and resolution processes.
* Creating test plans and testing strategies for new features.
* Adding, updating and maintaining automated tests (in Selenium).
* Communicating with Sales and Account Management teams on high priority bugs that happen on production.
* Managing the release process

__Required skills:__

* Experience with Java and Selenium
* Knowledge of writing tests
* Nice to haves:
* Experience with Cucumber
* Knowledge of Github and Git
* Good communication skills
* Attention to detail

While we have a nice office, we see the benefits of working wherever you are most productive. Weâre flexible, whether you want to be remote part of the time or all of the time.

A competitive salary, health insurance, profit sharing and flexible work schedules are standard issue. Beginning every day with the knowledge that what youâre doing has a real impact on peopleâs health is priceless.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you ever wondered why our healthcare system is so complicated? How can an industry so large and important fail to evolve while every other sector sprints forward with the aid of technology? We have asked ourselves these questions and are working to be part of the answer. We want to reshape the way patients and doctors communicate to improve health outcomes and improve patient quality of life. Being a product-driven company at heart, we believe clinical rigor mixed with technology and strong user-centered design has the potential to transform healthcare. We’re going up against some of the largest healthcare technology companies in the business and winning due to our focus on clinical workflow and patient engagement.

Interested? Our team is looking to add a DevOps Engineer to manage the infrastructure of our robust and scalable platform.

Required skills:

  • Experience administering Ubuntu servers
  • Knowledge of configuration management software (Puppet, Chef)
  • Database administration experience (PostgreSQL)
  • Experience managing monitoring and system analytics tools
  • Infrastructure development on AWS (EC2, S3, PostgreSQL, Redshift, VPC)
  • Comfort with frequent releases
  • Exposure to microservice-based architectures

Nice to haves:

  • Integrations with health information systems (Epic, Athena, Meditec) via API, HL7 or other interfaces
  • Awareness of HIPAA compliance standards

While we have a nice office, we see the benefits of working wherever you are most productive. We’re flexible, whether you want to be remote part of the time or all of the time.

A competitive salary, health insurance, profit sharing and flexible work schedules are standard issue. Beginning every day with the knowledge that what you’re doing has a real impact on people’s health is priceless.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Have you ever wondered why our healthcare system is so complicated? How can an industry so large and important fail to evolve while every other sector sprints forward with the aid of technology? We have asked ourselves these questions and are working to be part of the answer. We want to reshape the way patients and doctors communicate to improve health outcomes and improve patient quality of life. Being a product-driven company at heart, we believe clinical rigor mixed with technology and strong user-centered design has the potential to transform healthcare. We’re going up against some of the largest healthcare technology companies in the business and winning due to our focus on clinical workflow and patient engagement.

Interested? Our team is looking to add a Senior Software Engineer to help enhance our robust and scalable product and platform. Day-to-day responsibilities include building new features, fixing bugs, troubleshooting acute issues, and mentoring junior members of the team. You'll also collaborate with product strategy to help flesh out new features, refine feature scope and identify roadblocks to feature completion.

Required skills:

  • Experience in building complex products (preferably in PHP) that have had to scale
  • Familiar with unit, integration and behavioral styles of testing
  • Solid experience in at least one of the following: building micro services, high-use APIs, domain driven design
  • Experience developing security-sensitive software (where PCI or HIPAA requirements had to be met)
  • Highly comfortable with git, PostgreSQL, Ubuntu (linux)

Nice to haves:

  • Understanding of relational database design patterns
  • Experience with AWS or comparable cloud-computing platform
  • Experience interfacing with health information systems

While we have a nice office, we see the benefits of working wherever you are most productive. We’re flexible, whether you want to be remote part of the time or all of the time.

A competitive salary, health insurance, profit sharing and flexible work schedules are standard issue. Beginning every day with the knowledge that what you’re doing has a real impact on people’s health is priceless.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack (React/Node) Developer
jobs.content:
Looking for an experienced and versatile full-stack developer to support our team. We need someone with experience building Universal React apps (Redux/Flux/Reflux). Other common technologies we use include Webpack, Express, and sometimes Docker.

Should be within six hours of our timezone (Pacific Time) and be a great communicator in Slack and on Hangouts. Our clients include international brands and leading ad agencies, so attention to detail is critical.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Node / Angular)
jobs.content:
The Role

We are looking for a full stack developer to assist with a Node.js project. The position is remote and 5 days per week. Our head office is based in London, UK and you will be expected to overlap with 9-5 (GMT+1) working hours for at least 6 hours a day.

  • Solid experience with Node.js and Angular.js is required
  • Comfortable with complex server side design
  • Experience building SPAs and working with APIs in javascript
  • Native level English

The project involves working alongside our development team to rewrite a Python project using Node.js.

We prefer to hire developers who are language agnostic, autonomous, and who embrace testing new approaches to solve problems. Additional front end knowledge is a bonus.

Our daily tools include Slack, Github, Jira, and Trello.

Our managerial structure is very flat and we admire people who take initiative, make their own decisions and implement them clearly. We put customer experience and satisfaction first and really believe in delivering a service that is cutting edge.

About 200 Creative

We assemble teams that can design, build, implement, and maintain software solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are based in London, UK and have a global network of developers.

Projects are incredibly varied – The overarching theme involves putting great minds together to build completely bespoke software that outperforms legacy systems. We manage the end-to-end process, right from helping the client to architect the system through to the build and ongoing maintenance.

Responsibilities

As a full-stack developer, your responsibilities will involve:

  • Build, operate and maintain software solutions based on industry best practices with consideration of a client’s business requirements, time schedule and budget
  • Offer guidance and consultation about various potential solutions
  • Assist in the comparison of proposed solutions
  • Written guidance and documentation of software solutions

What we offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Option to work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • A minimal approach to meetings

Decision Deadline

The deadline for applications is the 26th September 2016 and you will be notified on that date if you have been invited to interview. We will conduct interviews via a Google Hangout.

IMPORTANT!

Are you representing a team of developers? Please do not apply. We are not looking to outsource this position to any limited company.

Are you a recruiter? Please do not apply. 200 Creative do not accept applications from recruiters and will not pay any recruitment fees associated with any applications that might be received in relation to this job listing.

Direct individual applications only please.

jobs.title: Contract: System Administrator
jobs.content:
We are a startup in the education space working from Barcelona and about 8 other locations. We plan to be successful and need an administrator/DevOps that helps us to scale.

We are currently working with MongoDB, Redis, Nginx, LINUX, Amazon AWS, Git, IBM Watson and a few dozen of APIs. Our developers use CoffeeScript for Meteor, Swift for iOS, Java and C++ for Android.

You job would be to plan and maintain a scalable hosting architecture, to standardize and manage environments for development, stage and production, help with performance optimizations, monitoring, load and content distribution, test automization, failover, backup and security. We are moving quickly, you would work directly together with the CTO.

Knowing Meteor and it's special treatment of the Oplog would be a plus.

jobs.title: JAVA Developer Verkeer & Vervoer
jobs.content:
Java Developer Verkeer en Vervoer

Wil jij jouw Java en programmeer ervaring inzetten bij dé specialist in technische automatisering in de sector verkeer en vervoer? Waarbij je dagelijks werkt aan complexe applicaties met als doel om een beter en veiliger OV in Nederland te creëren? Kom dan werken als Java Developer bij InTraffic!

Jouw rol als Java Developer
Binnen onze complexe IT-omgeving van verkeer en vervoer spelen vele interessante projecten. Hierbij kun je denken aan migraties van legacy systemen naar een nieuwe omgeving of het koppelen en ontsluiten van real time reisinformatie. Allemaal technisch uitdagende projecten waarbij jouw code een bijdrage levert aan een veilig OV in Nederland.

InTraffic is ingericht als een projectenorganisatie. Hierdoor krijg jij de mogelijkheid om aan afwisselende projecten te werken voor verschillende opdrachtgevers binnen het domein Verkeer & Vervoer. Onze klanten stellen hoge eisen aan onze software. We verwachten daarom meer van je dan alleen het goed kunnen ontwerpen en ontwikkelen met Java. Een natuurlijke drang om het beste uit jezelf en je SCRUM-team te halen. Een kritische en nieuwsgierige kijk op zaken vinden we belangrijk en je ziet uitdagingen in situaties waarin wordt afgeweken van de gebaande paden.

Je herkent jezelf in de volgende criteria:



  • Relevante afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding;

  • Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in het programmeren met Java en/of JEE binnen een technische omgeving;

  • De ontwikkelaar in jou heeft een sterk gevoel voor kwaliteit en je ontwerpt graag degelijke en betrouwbare software;

  • Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van opensource tools en technieken en ervaring met 1 of meerdere databasesystemen;

  • Als persoon ben je nieuwsgierig, heb je affiniteit met onze branche en ben je communicatief vaardig.



Note: full proficiency in Dutch is mandatory

Wat biedt InTraffic
Binnen een groeiend bedrijf met inspirerende opdrachten en een hele prettige werksfeer bieden we je de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden:



  • Een jaarcontract, maar altijd met de intentie tot een vast dienstverband

  • Marktconform salaris met een vaste 13e maand

  • 30 vakantiedagen

  • Een persoonlijk ontwikkel- en boekenbudget

  • Mogelijkheid tot flexwerken

  • Flexibel mobiliteitsbudget op maat



Je werkt voornamelijk vanuit ons kantoor in Nieuwegein, nabij Utrecht, met tram- en bushalte voor de deur, of soms gedetacheerd bij een klant in de regio midden Nederland.

InTraffic; dé IT-specialist in Verkeer en Vervoer
InTraffic realiseert en onderhoudt complexe informatie- en besturingssystemen voor verkeer en vervoer. In nauwe samenwerking met klanten en partners werken onze professionals met trots aan inspirerende IT-projecten. Persoonlijke groei openheid en respect zijn vanzelfsprekend.
De ondersteuning die wij bieden bestrijkt de volledige software lifecycle: innovatie en advies, softwareontwikkeling, integratie, testen, beheer en onderhoud.

Wat andere IT-specialisten vertellen over het werken bij InTraffic
“Het werk is leuk, de sfeer is goed en het domein van verkeer en vervoer spreekt mij erg aan. Werken bij InTraffic geeft mij een kijkje achter de schermen van OV-vervoerders” Jeroen Admiraal, Technisch Specialist

Ben jij de Java Developer die wij zoeken?
Herken jij jezelf in bovenstaand profiel en wil jij ons team versterken? Solliciteren kan snel door op de 'Solliciteer' button te klikken.

Heb je vragen, bel dan gerust met Frank van den Bogaart, recruiter, op 088 345 5000.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Utrecht, Java ontwikkelaar, Software developer.

jobs.title: Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Skoobe is currently looking for a talented software engineer with a true passion for building great software in a small engineering-driven team. Your focus will be the development of our Android mobile application in our office in Munich, Germany.


Key responsabilities:



  • Work on our best-rated mobile applications as part of our development team

  • Ensure a high quality up-to-date user experience for our customers by doing fast iterations and incorporating learnings and feedback quickly

  • Keep an eye on current developments in the mobile ecosystems

  • Work closely together with our user interface designer, product manager and your backend colleagues


What´s included?



  • Competitive salary

  • Full health/dental insurance plan

  • 25 vacation days plus 12 Bavarian holidays

  • Relocation assistance

  • German language class for international applicants

jobs.title: Senior Javascript Engineer
jobs.content:
Help us revolutionize E-commerce by building real-time 3D customization tools with a world class team of creative, smart and passionate people in the heart of Berlin!


mycs is changing the way we buy things online. Our vision is to revolutionize E-commerce. All our products are sold using photorealistic, real-time 3D customization tools. In the past, we have built Massivkonzept, the leading online shop for customized furniture. mycs builds on this experience and is currently building a team in Berlin, focusing on building cutting edge technology and improving the E-commerce customer experience.


We are looking for a enthusiastic


Senior JavaScript Developers (AngularJS/Node.js) (m/f)


As one of our Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS



  • You design and implement efficient and reusable software and web-applications for our Ecommerce platform with its demanding real-time 3D customization tools

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You identify and address performance issues

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, Kanban, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://de.mycs.com/career

jobs.title: Want a great career? We are recruiting Senior Digital Developers, Apply now!
jobs.content:
A fantastic opportunity for a highly creative and innovative Senior Digital Developer to join our team.


We are looking for a talented multi skilled digital developer who is passionate about new technology and the buzz of a dynamic, fast-paced working environment. They must have extensive experience and be easily adaptable to different programming languages and IDEs. This is an opportunity to join an exciting and innovative creative business within Atkins. Our in-house Creative Design team, based in key locations throughout the UK, consists of 50+ talented designers, developers and visualisers who provide a professional visual communication service to its 18,000 employees throughout the UK and worldwide. The ideal candidate should possess superior technical knowledge and development skills. They will be able to work with designers to translate creative user interfaces into functional and well-built solutions. The candidate should be constantly be looking to innovate by being a natural problem solver with a passion for new technologies. We have a strong team ethic and are looking for like-minded people who will support the business but also challenge and push us in new and exciting directions. Experience of work winning and business development is a must as the candidate will have a key role is growing and diversifying the team.
