jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Hello, future addition to Customer.io! Weâre looking forward to getting to know you better, but you probably want to know what youâre getting yourself into. You can check out our careers page, or read on.

At Customer.io, our mission is to help businesses talk like people. Today, we do this with messaging software that allows businesses with large user-bases to send targeted, more relevant communication at scale. Our customers include Trello, Shutterstock, Handy, and Watsi.

A day in the life of a Technical Support Engineer
A Technical Support Engineer at Customer.io helps new and existing customers get up and running in our product, diagnose tricky situations in the product, and achieve their business goals. Our customers are core to everything we do (itâs in our name!) and a Technical Support Engineer has contact with more customers than anyone else in the company.

While support tickets may take most of your day, youâll also work on internal and external documentation and have regular touch points with our Product and Customer Success teams to discuss feature requests, usability issues and user scenarios. Youâll bring your passion for customers and their problems to advocate for product improvements and provide insight that will help us make sure we build the right thing.

Technical Support Engineers develop deep product, systems and customer knowledge. In the long run there are opportunities to apply this knowledge to automate processes, create internal tools or assist our Customer Success and Sales team when technical needs arise. We have many new features to build and ideas to implement, so there will be plenty of exciting challenges ahead.

Tools We Use
Today our Technical Support is powered by Help Scout for tickets, JIRA for bug tracking and Zapier to help automate some of our support processes. We also use some internally built command line tools for problem diagnosis. 

Although, we mostly interact with each other through Basecamp and Slack and value focused work, weâre not afraid to jump on a Screenhero pairing session or a video call to clarify customer scenarios or share tips on how to troubleshoot issues better.

Weâre the right match for you if
  • You love technical problem solving
  • You enjoy helping others with your technical knowledge and take pride in your work.
  • You see every support ticket as an opportunity to improve the customer experience.
  • You take ownership of delivering results and get satisfaction from getting things done.
  • Youâre passionate about learning new things.
  • Youâre not afraid to ask questions if youâre confused about how something works.
  • You understand written communication is not always perfect and assume the best intentions during interactions with customers and your team. Empathy is one of your strongest attributes.
What we look for:
  • At least 2 years customer support experience.
  • Experience working remotely (itâs not your first time holding a full-time or part-time remote job).
  • Comfortable troubleshooting HTML & CSS
  • Basic programming skills and knowledge of the core concepts (Boolean logic, using APIs, control structures,  etc).If you know Javascript - even better!
  • Experience working with or supporting email marketing/ business communication tools preferred.
  • Located in the United States/ Canada or willing to work US Eastern hours.
Why should you work with Customer.io?
We want to enable you to do the best work of your professional life, and this is how we aim to do that:

Salary: This role has a starting salary of $70,000 per year.
Equity: Youâll own a piece of the company. It's not a get-rich-quick deal, but if you stay around for a while, we're planning to be a long-lasting company, and your piece of it may be a nice bonus.
Big impact: Our team is small, but growing quickly. The work you do will materially impact how successful we are as a company, both with our product and our culture. 

Great tools: Everyone in the company has a budget for a great computer, motorized standing desk, Steelcase Leap office chair, external monitor, and anything else you'd like to get your job done.
Health benefits: We pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental and vision.
Retreats: We want everyone in our company to connect in person whenever possible, so we get everyone together once a year. We've had retreats in Barcelona, Romania, and Hunter Mountain, NY.
Vacation: Rest and recuperation are important. We offer unlimited paid time off with a two week minimum per year.
Diversity at Customer.io

At Customer.io, weâre committed to building a diverse environment, and encourage minority applicants. So far, we have team members in Scotland, Germany, Canada, and all over the US. Our CEO and CTO grew up in Singapore and Arkansas respectively, but met in New York City. Our company culture is always evolving; people from different backgrounds bring valued perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture we foster.

Customer.io provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Customer.io complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Basically, we follow the law, but also like you for who you are!

Intrigued? Talk to us!

To apply: Apply through our jobs site: http://grnh.se/yn5stv, and make sure you tell us why youâre interested in the position! Weâve added a few questions that will also help us understand how you think.

jobs.title: Full-stack Rails Developer
jobs.content:
TL;DR: W-2 Full-time Rails position developing a product you will be proud of with a team that will help you thrive anywhere you want in the U.S. 

What is Kolau

Kolau is a SaaS that is building the marketing of tomorrow - and itâs doing it today. 

96% of all businesses have 0-9 employees and Kolauâs is their solution to rank in the 1st page of Google. Why? They have no time to do it, knowledge to do it right or money to pay marketing agencies, thus Kolau. Simple, quick, effortless, Kolau.

Weâre a distributed team, working remotely in the United States and overseas. The engineering team works from the U.S.

Our backend tools are fairly standard - Rails, Postgres, Redis, Rspec, Sidekiq, AWS & Heroku.

What you would be working on? 

With Kolau, we are building a platform that makes it easier for anybody with a website and without any time or marketing knowledge to have it ranking on the 1st page of the search results. Kolau is not just software, though. We have an amazing tech support team that is available in case users need some extra assistance and are as much a part of the Kolau product, success and experience as the platform itself.

Whom are we looking for?

  • Rails developer with a strong sense of commitment and reliability
  • Strong background in Ruby on Rails - ideally 3+ years
  • Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • A developer who is passionate about simple and intuitive solutions
  • Exerience with SaaS development and API development preferred
  • Sound knowledge of SQL and relational databases

Kolau Perks

  • Competitive salary: Competitive compensation package based on experience and location.
  • Wellness: Health insurance and gym membership coverage.
  • Opportunity: Ground floor opportunity to shape the direction of the company
  • Getaways: Company retreat around the world 1x year - Barcelona, anyone?
  • Tech: Brand new Mac Pro and $250 stipend for anything that helps you be more productive
  • Continuing Education: $250 for anything youâd like to learn. Also, we ship a new book monthly within your category of interest!

To apply: Please apply here: https://kolau-carrers.workable.com/jobs/334286Impress us with your involvement in the development community, GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, blog, or anything else that shows us who you are and why you want to work in Kolau.

jobs.title: Sr. Salesforce Business Analyst
jobs.content:
The Phase One Team is seeking a Sr. SFDC Business Analyst to lead requirements management, customer management, and acceptance criteria definition on a major federal government project.

 Responsibilities

  • Facilitate requirements workshops, documenting detailed functional, technical, reporting & data requirements
  • Gather, create and document current and future business process flows.
  • Conduct analysis of systems specifications and use analysis / diagramming tools to represent business / technical processes.
  • Responsible for carrying out business, testing and training requirements gathering; BPR leads, workflow analysis, gap analysis, user stories, test case development and functional design.  Offers analysis throughout all phases of the project lifecycle.
  • Tests salesforce configuration and setup, test case development, performance and load testing, End to End testing, and functional/regression testing. 
  • Provide support to Salesforce users in sales and service teams, and act as the primary point of contact for end-user support.
  • Engage with business stakeholders to gather/analyze requirements and map them to solutions that leverage salesforce functionality.
  • Demonstrate Salesforce capabilities to solve business problems by implementing Proof of Value pilots and producing the supporting documentation.
  • Migrate meta data between salesforce environments using change sets and other tools such as Snapshot as needed.
  • Collaborate with end-users to create and maintain training materials.
  • Manage relationships with stakeholders to achieve project goals
  • Maintain collaborative relationships with external vendors to achieve project goals, where necessary.
  • Participate in the evolution of team best practices, standards and policies
  • Stay current with the periodic Salesforce releases and leverage the updates applicable to the ORG.
  • Support all Salesforce releases and ensure system uptime as per the SLA.
  • Be part of a fast paced agile scrum team and participate in planning, documentation, execution, testing, and launch of projects.

 

Requirements

  • 3 years of general Business Analysis.
  • Experience configuring various salesforce modules including but not limited to case management, campaign management, workflows, profiles, roles, sharing rules and reports.
  • Scrum or Agile methodology experience highly desirable
  • com Certifications are a nice to have.
  • Salesforce Adoption experience is a nice to have.
  • Proven track record in leading initiatives and managing small projects.
  • Competency in gathering and documenting business requirements.
  • Proficiency in Excel for data manipulation and complex custom reports.
  • Demonstrate some understanding of VisualForce, HTML, Javascript and CSS.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
  • Experience conducting stakeholder interviews and facilitating stakeholder workshops
  • Client friendliness with the ability to build and maintain trusting and value added client relationships
  • Ability to work independently and in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, with minimal supervision
  • Must be located in Washington, DC metro area and able to work on-site at client location in SE Washington DC
  • Must be able to obtain a U.S. Federal government client badge and be able to pass a government background investigation
  • Project management or scrum management experience preferred 
  • Client ownership/client engagement experience preferred
  • Comfortable working within a defined budget and coordinating efforts with other teams

 

 

Company Profile

Since 1997, Phase One has supported leading private and public sector clients with their technical solution planning and implementation needs. As specialists in the use of technology to enable missions and businesses, Phase One has world-class capabilities in Agile Development, Infrastructure as a Service, and the use of modern Platform as a Service technologies to build solutions with mind-blowing speed and precision. Phase One also has a full lifecycle CyberSecurity offering, giving clients the strategy, implementation, and operations support to meet their critical security needs.

We hire people with talent from a spectrum of backgrounds. This spectrum of talents allows our teams to provide clients with unique and innovative solutions to meet the most complex challenges; whether they are related to people, processes, or technology.

Phase One Consulting Group is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer regardless of a person's race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, military status, sex, gender expression or identity, or sexual orientation. Click here to review the US Department of Labor’s EEO is The Law notice and here to review the US Department of Labor’s EEO is The Law supplemental notice.

  #LI-TB1

jobs.title: Rails Dev (fight cancer, improve young adult health, integrate everything)
jobs.content:
We are looking for a developer to help us build excellent web-based applications and mobile apps. In return, we want to help you put the right mix of the right work into the Big Picture of your life.

We work with great clients on fun projects. A few examples of current work include:
  • Building an interface for a causal inference model built by leading bioinformatics researchers to provide personalized identification of cancer drivers.
  • Working with a world-class clinical care team to build an app / messaging system to help guide young adults to good health using a machine learning-based recommender system.
  • Launching an e-commerce integration product (flowlink.io) that allows online retailers to easily automate many of their most tedious tasks.
NuRelm provides a wide range of experience, plenty of room for professional growth, a fun workplace, and an environment everyone on the team is valued. We are looking for a smart person who loves the Web, loves to learn, and enjoys working on a variety of technologies and projects.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Very comfortable with Rails, MySQL, Git (2 to 5 years min).
  • Experienced building and consuming RESTful APIs.
  • Experienced working with and on Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3/SASS in the Rails environment.
  • Habits that include test-driven development and an agile project approach
  • Experienced assembling projects from the ground up, and the eye for architecture and planning that goes with that.
  • A North American time zone and strong English communication skills (we have a local team in Pittsburgh, but also work with remote developers).
  • Please, no recruiters or firms offering subcontracting.

BONUS POINTS
  • Experienced with Sinatra, MongoDB, React JS, AWS.
  • Familiarity with MVC and prototyping.
  • Experienced with working remotely.
  • Know your way around Docker and typical stacks such as Rails / Unicorn / Nginx.
  • Familiar and willing to do an occasional project with PHP.

A FEW BENEFITS
  • Excellent medical, vision, and dental insurance
  • Retirement plan with employer matching
  • New hires start with 3 weeks of vacation
  • Competitive compensation
  • A fun, compassionate, smart, and diverse team

To apply: Please note that we are firm on the requirements from above that we are not looking for recruiters or firms offering subcontracting, and that we are seeking applicants with a North American time zone.To apply, please submit a brief cover letter and a resume to humanresources at nurelm.com.

jobs.title: Director Of Traffic Operations
jobs.content:
At Twilio our customer’s traffic is our business.  Maintaining the Twilio quality expectation for both voice and messaging takes a lot of work. This role leads the global Traffic Operations team responsible for managing Twilio’s customers traffic to our carrier partners around the globe.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and grow a globally distributed team of passionate people & provide support and guidance that enables the team to self-organize and achieve sustained high velocity and predictability.  

  • Own, operate and maintain Twilio’s traffic operations.  Employ metric-driven data to monitor, operate and scale our global traffic profile ensuring consistent quality & deliverability of our customers’ traffic.

  • Institute distributed systems best practices, automation, and a software-first mindset throughout the team.

  • You will lead the team in incident management and the dialogue with our carriers to build resiliency.

  • Collaborate on roadmaps with other teams and stakeholders to drive direction and priorities, both strategic and tactical.

  • Provide leadership for the team & be a thought leader on traffic management.

  • Define tooling and automation business requirements for metric-based traffic management.

  • Guide employee career development by providing coaching and mentoring to junior members while coaching senior contributors to maximize their potential.  Write performance evaluations, collaborate with employees on their objectives and provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans.  

  • As a member of the Engineering Management team, foster leadership principles and behaviors throughout the organization to groom the next generation of leaders.

Our developers can live and work anywhere in the United States or Canada. This is a full-time salaried position.

  • Self-starter who gets things done

  • Attention to detail


We look forward to receiving your application.

jobs.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
About Muzooka:


Muzooka is a set of web based tools integrated with Facebook for both artists and live music venues. Muzooka has been featured amongst the likes of TechCrunch, Betakit, Billboard and MTV. Muzooka is currently focused on expanding their platform that connects the live music industry.


Muzooka values teamwork, creativity and optimism. We foster a culture of learning and development where we all strive to improve and innovate together. Muzooka offers flexible work schedules, competitive salaries, options pool and the opportunity to work on a product that will change the state of the music industry.


Job Description:


In this role you will lead our backend development and build Muzooka's API to drive the success of our web and mobile applications. You will also get to contribute on the front-end using cutting edge tools. You'll work closely with our front-end development team to ensure we are building a maintainable code base and minimizing technical debt. Our designer and product manager will coordinate with you on a daily basis to plan features for the API. You'll have the opportunity to wear multiple hats and play a key role in product development.


Skills Needed:



  • Foundation in Javascript

  • Familiarity with AWS deployment

  • Proficient with mySQL

  • Experience with Node.js

  • Experience with a JS framework like React or Ember

  • Experience with Git workflow

  • General understanding of front-end development 


What else we are looking for:



  • You're a good programmer and have a drive to create clean, reliable and maintainable software

  • You know what a good API looks like

  • You're a strong communicator; explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you

  • You can pivot directions quickly when needed

  • You have a desire to iterate constantly

  • You have a passion for constant learning

  • You're hands on and like to be involved in all areas of a company

  • You have a positive attitude and are always willing to lend a hand

  • You love working in a fast-paced, start-up environment

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1 bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.

Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Senior Front-End Engineer (f/m)


Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Are you interested in building software used by millions of customers? Do you like writing performant, high quality code at a rapid pace? If you answered yes to these questions, you could be just the person we’re looking for to join our team at Home24.

We are looking for a  great Senior Frontend Engineer who is passionate about developing customer-facing front end solutions that will deliver a great user experience - whether you’re on your smartphone, tablet or home computer. In joining our team you will get the opportunity to work on some of the most interesting and challenging problems we can offer. This position is full-time and based in our cool office in Berlin.


Responsibilities



  • Build beautiful, fast,efficient and reusable front-end solutions

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate emerging technologies

  • Working with product managers and UX designers to implement the next generation of the Home24 e-commerce experience

  • Use RESTful APIs for communication with our backend services

  • Work in a small agile team collaborating with designers and other engineers

  • Identify and adopt best practices for software and front-end engineering

  • Make demos for the whole company to share achievements


What we can offer you



  • Opportunity to use state of the art front end development tools

  • Become a part of a highly motivated world class team of technology professionals

  • An open culture to learn, share new ideas, solve hard problems and opportunity to demonstrate your creativity to make a real difference

  • Opportunities for advancement, independence and the autonomy to take on responsibility

  • Benefits including relocation support, employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and much more

  • If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, get in touch. Send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, etc.), a code sample as well as your expected salary and possible start date.



Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.


Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:


Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer (f/m)


Responsibilities



  • Ensure our global network infrastructure fulfills our goals of availability, scalability and performance

  • Design, implement, support, maintain and enhance enterprise grade network, Firewall, IPS and monitoring solutions for future growth and projects

  • Proactive monitoring and maintenance of the infrastructure to prevent potential outages (NOC)

  • Analysis and troubleshooting of incidents across the whole stack incl. root cause analysis

  • Automate and improve network configuration deployment and change management

  • Implement robust security measures with well-designed security-concepts

  • Research on new technologies to improve performance and availability of our mission critical infrastructure

  • Create and update network and monitoring documentation


Requirements



  • 5+ years of experience in designing, operating, monitoring and troubleshooting an enterprise grade HA network environment incl. Firewall management (HP, Cisco, WatchGuard)

  • 5+ years of experience in managing monitoring solutions (Nagios, check_MK, OMD)

  • Deep understanding of network protocols, topologies and diagnostics across the whole OSI model

  • Strong experience with VPN protocols and solutions (IPSEC, DMVPN, SSL-VPN, OpenVPN)

  • Hands on experience in managing a Linux server environment

  • Experience with Amazon Web services (esp. VPC, EC2, CloudFormation, CloudWatch) is a plus

  • Proven organization, problem solving, and analytical skills

  • Certifications in Cisco CCNP , Juniper JNCIP/SP , CCISP or other data communication certifications

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, also natural sciences possible


What we offer you



  • High-end computers (tower/laptop) with SSD hard disk, 16G of memory and 4 Xeon 3,X Ghz + 2x 24 inch screens

  • Skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us

  • Opportunities for advancement – independence and the opportunity to take on responsibility

  • A highly motivated team of senior system engineers

  • Openness to new ideas and creativity

  • Benefits as employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and more


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date.


Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Analytics Team at Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a developer. Join our team of engineers and and help us curate the data generated by the world's largest collaborative project: Wikipedia.


Summary


We are the Analytics Team at Wikimedia Foundation - engineers organizing data generated by the world's largest collaborative project and one of the largest websites in the world.  We protect privacy, share data, build APIs for the community, and help our product teams understand what to focus on.


We use open source tools as much as possible, and always open source our own work(https://gerrit.wikimedia.org).  Python, Java, Scala and Javascript make up most of our code, but we value using the right tool for the job.  Our world is vast and can be complicated, so we value communication, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn more than certificates.


We’d like you to do these things:   



  • Work and communicate effectively within a small team of five distributed across 3 time zones

  • Assist developers and community members in identifying and resolving issues with the software and configuration of Wikimedia's analytics infrastructure

  • Work on complete features to be used internally or externally by the foundation or the community

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HLT builds apps using modern web and mobile technologies, such as Objective-C, Swift, Java and Ruby on Rails. We operate as a highly collaborative team organized around an agile framework. As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get the opportunity to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most elegant and valuable educational products to life. You should be comfortable with the above-mentioned technologies and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Designing & developing Objective-C and/or Swift applications

  • Developing and improving all aspects of our applications (development, testing, deployment, architecture)

  • Writing client-side apps that make use of RESTful APIs

  • Writing elegant and maintainable code; a feature isn't done until it's been tested

  • Writing automated unit tests and UI tests

  • Providing technical support of applications when issues occur

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Hey there… we’ve got a spot for someone who can talk to computers. I mean… REALLY and TRULY speak their language(s), and work with them. Thus, further bridging the gap between humankind and computers; so that united we can create amazing, beautiful and well-built user experiences.

If you possess this gift, we’re hoping you’ll join us.

The H&H Way

We work pretty damn hard to be the best . We pride ourselves on our team members who day in and day out develop creative, logical and well designed solutions for our clients. We strive to maintain a great work culture and are always pushing the limits of our work.

  • Got ideas? Let’s hear ‘em!
  • Wanna innovate? Let’s do it together!
  • Want to expand your knowledge? Let’s learn from one another, or learn together!
  • Want to get out of the studio and work remote? Do your thang!

We have a variety of clients with a variety of needs, so you won’t be doing the same thing day in and day out. It’s chill here, even though we get our hustle on. No big “corporate” pressure here. We have a culture and lifestyle that we live by. Design, technology and innovation is all around us, waiting to be shared. We love what we do

Now, let’s get to the point: We’re looking for a developer with full-stack experience, however, strength in front-end web development is expected. A strong grasp and experience withhandling data, problem-solving and modern frameworks is a must.

Personal/Professional Qualities:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-motivated and creative with a strong sense of accountability
  • Proven debugging, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to work within and hit fixed deadlines

Technical Requirements:

  • Experience with building HTML, CSS, JavaScript web experiences
  • Familiar with modern JS frameworks ( jQuery, Backbone, Kraken.js, Ampersand.js etc… ) with a desire and ability to learn new technologies
  • Familiar with CSS preprocessors: Less, Sass

Bonus:

jobs.title: NoSQL Database Engineer
jobs.content:
The way we do business


We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. Our flavour of agile has been heavily influenced by XP and Kanban, and if something isn’t working, we change it.
Our work delivers value to both the business and our customers, our teams are cross-discipline: business analysts and the user experience team work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, whilst our frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.


We generally follow a mix of agile and lean practices with an overall philosophy towards continuous delivery. We’ll rely on each and everyone´s expertise to adapt and improve these processes to serve the team, project and company as best fits their current contexts.
Although we don’t face the same level of stress you’d find in most projects around scope, schedule and cost, keeping the project on track is still important to us and wherever possible we’ll keep projects small, fast and healthy.


The team supports large number of databases in a rapidly evolving and dynamic environment.
You will have an opportunity to work on the database technologies such as Cassandra, Couchbase, ElasticSearch, Solr, MarkLogic, MongoDB, Redis, Stardog, etc.
You will use existing and create new automation tools, will improve them to manage a large number of servers.
You will be working closely with other Database Engineers who specialise in various other database technologies and database infrastructure management tools and frameworks.


In detail you would be responsible for:



  • Automating management of new and existing databases to ensure that processes are repeatable and scalable.

  • Participating in maintenance, upgrades and migrations.

  • Reviewing and planning hardware capacity to ensure database systems are responsive and stable.

  • Taking an active role in supporting and in finding the root cause of operational issues and prevent them from reoccurring

  • Visiting other offices and collaborate with the platform engineering, development and other teams

jobs.title: Senior Data Architect
jobs.content:
The Data Platform, part of KAI (Knowledge, Analysis and Intelligence), within HMRC has the responsibility for developing and implementing the Department’s strategy for acquisition, management and use of data enabling the Department to achieve its customer-centred, data-driven future by building insight across customers, products and activities. It is part of an ambitious change programme across a broad landscape, of specialist and line of business stakeholders. It draws together over £250m of projects and programmes into a coherent delivery vehicle.

These projects all have a data theme and cover IT, data architecture, business change and modern analytical practices.

The current dossier of projects includes an initiative to build a strategic data store and implement new analytical practices to the organisation. This is then supplemented with activities to draw in additional sources of data, including from 3rd parties. The organisation is progressing strategy to transform itself from product centric practices to customer centric ones, and has other initiatives to join up customer data sources and use data mastering to provide the organisation with a single authoritative view of all customers. Building on these enabling technologies we will recruit additional professional analysis and ensure that systems across HMRC integrate to provide both powerful analytical tools and customer management views to the desktop.

jobs.content:
Why weâre hiring a Freelance Content Writer...

Simple: Weâre growing.

The UpTrending team has an immediate need for an exceptional Content Writer who learns fast and is passionate about content marketing, technology and the digital marketing space. Our team specializes in helping startups and high-growth companies build their digital brand, and we need someone who can represent and share that expertise with the world.

What makes this the right role for you?
If you are an amazing storyteller and talented influencer with strong research skills, then read on.
Our ideal candidate understands how to leverage content to engage our customers and enhance our brand through tone, content formatting and proper positioning. They also have a strong understanding of digital marketing and technology trends, particularly within startup environments.
We are looking for someone to concept, research and write blog posts, POVs, white papers and a range of other short-form and long-form content in support of our internal agency marketing efforts. This content will be shared on relevant marketing channels including our blog, social channels, email and leveraged directly by our sales team.

Location
This position is 100% remote -- our writer may work at the U.S.-based location of his or her choosing.

To thrive in this role, you must meet the following qualifications:

  • Regular, continuous awareness of digital marketing trends and relevant news
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively

Previous experience writing digital content for agencies or startups is strongly preferred.

jobs.title: Ninja UX Digital Product Designer (Freelance / Part-Time)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Raleigh, NC USA
URL: www.gearstream.com

Our Mission:

We are a company revolutionizing digital work-life in large traditional companies. We turn industrial dinosaurs into digital ninja's. We make dilbert companies more like Apple and Google. How? Super powers maybe :-)

Our Challenge to You as a UX Digital Design Ninja

We're seeking a ninja UX digital product designer to help us take our secrets and unleash them in the form of an entirely new agile performance and innovation management system for large Enterprise.

Your experience will include both modern Web/Mobile product design (no boring Enterprise apps here) and, *SOME* early experience and insight into Conversational UI's and ChatBots. The entire application will NOT be Conversational UI, but somje of the most innovative experiences we're designing rely on ths form of interaction. Additoinally CHAT (like Slack) will also play a HUGE role in the app.

The Current State of our Product

We are currently STUCK. That's right STUCK. We have months of conceptual wireframes and fantastic ideas. What we need next is a hard nosed, super creative, genious design problem solver to get us UN-STUCK.

What we've Acomplished So Far

We have a basic set of wireframes and user flows (not very exciting) as well as tons of fantastic, super creative conceptual Wireframes and interactions designed for Mobile.

What we Need

We someone that is uber smart, savvy, and fast at assimilating tons of ideas and previous design work who can then help us knit this all together in a compleeling, comprehensive set of user experiences that kick butt!

The Deliverables

Ultimately what we need (and fast) are both well designed and documented user flows, interactions, and ultimatley HIGH RESOLUTION wireframes / style guides for developers to use in building out our MVP.

Your Portfolio Please

Please include with your email a link to your online portfolio and a description of any recent web/mobile product design projects you're most proud of and why.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

  • You will work directly with the Customer to design and implement solutions based on business and technical requirements

  • Debug, troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues reported by customers

  • Partner with Sales, Product and Engineering to understand customer challenges, develop and implement creative solutions

  • Proactively work with customers to understand their needs and give them a path to achieving their goals using current versions and transitioning to new versions of the product

All teams at Rocana care about developing customer empathy, people over technology, consensus over competition, team success over personal, allowing failure and supporting success, listening before talking, open decision making, diversity, and inclusiveness.


You:

  • Expertise at the linux command line and able to write code and scripts

  • Have shell scripting and high-level language experience (we like java a lot)

  • Are a good listener, passionate about puzzles, and not afraid to dive into a customer problem to help solve it

  • Strong organizational skills, setting priorities, and delivering results on time with high quality

  • Have a strong passion for quality and attention to detail


Bonus points if you have familiarity with:



  • Domain expertise in IT operations/DevOps, system monitoring, or log management software

  • Expertise in logging systems such as Syslog, Rsyslog, Windows Event Viewer

  • Strong software programming skills in Java or similar language


We:



  • Are a distributed company, and as such require self-driven, high output people

  • Care about creating a company, culture, product we all love

  • Focus on how to help customers be successful and on what we achieve as a team

  • Know that if you are happy and engaged, you’ll be/do your best

  • Want to help you achieve your ambitions, so we can achieve ours

  • Use titles to reflect responsibility, not status

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Nulab, Inc., we are proud of ourselves for handcrafting tools that bring creativity and fun back to collaborating with others. We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer to help our Backlog product team build the next generation of tools for further collaboration.


Our Backlog app is an online project management tool that lets users promote communication and bring in “fun” to work with its features; to-do management, wiki, file sharing, version control, and charts.


Under the hood, Backlog's software stack is built on Java, JavaScript, Scala, Swift, Kotlin, MySQL and AWS. Since ten years have passed from Backlog's launch, we are planning its major update by improving and reforming software architecture and its user interface.


As a Senior Software Engineer in the Backlog team, you will face interesting and challenging tasks to take our software to the next level of scale and sustainability.


What you will do:



  • Design, implement, and comprehensively test new features in a small, agile team environment. 

  • Assist the operations team with troubleshooting operational issues.

  • Share your passion for technology, lead yourself and others, and constantly seek to improve yourself, the product, and the codebase. 


Qualifications: 



  • Java engineering expert with 3+ years of experience building full-stack web applications

  • Strong communication skills (ability to make the complex into something simple and understandable) 

  • Ability to work effectively, both in person and with a remote, distributed team.

  • Proficient in Scala.

  • You must be able to speak English


Recommended: 



  • Familiarity with modern JavaScript APIs and frameworks (e.g. jQuery,Knockout)

  • Native speaker of Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, or Taiwanese


Bonus:



  • Knowledge of Linux/Unix

  • Experience in building a server infrastructure

  • Experience with JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin, or Swift.

  • Willing to contribute actively to the open source community

  • Ability to present in a technological conference.

jobs.title: DevOps System Engineer
jobs.content:
SmartTrade is a fast growing Fin-Tech-Company in Berlin. Our technologies and services are pure B2B products. Our customers are banks, insurance companies and financial exchanges.


Our architecture needs to be a highly available and provide consistent performance, with the challenge of customers generating diverse sets of workloads depending on their own data structure and usage patterns.


We manage a deep modern stack starting from real time CDN integrations at the outer level to internal layers of HTTP traffic, routing and caching, several services that all together compose our public APIs, a message bus collecting all the events happening on the platform with a set of consumers processing these events.


We deploy our infrastructure on the AWS cloud and we also use other several CDN and infrastructure services provider for global real-time content distribution.



  • You are responsible for the conception and development of the infrastructure for large-scale IT projects

  • You enjoy the challenge of rock solid uptime and consistent performance in a frame of continuous delivery and diversity of workloads,

  • You enjoy researching and curating key metrics that expose anomalies and trends before systems deviate from sane behavior.

  • You ensure sustainable availability, performance, and scalability of the infrastructure across multiple continents and regions

  • You are managing our infrastructure, addressing security concerns, managing large scale software rollouts, configuration management of the software stack

  • You are supporting development with test and staging environments, automated testing environments, and virtualization

  • With the help of your ambition and curiosity you are able to handle upcoming challenges and tasks


We provide:



  • Competitive salary

  • Responsibility and Impact: Financial Institutions are facing massive changes through regulation and digitalization. Help us to lead them through the transformation process and be part of the solution.

  • Pick your own equipment to get the best out of your working days.

Our Tel Aviv Engineering team is developing products across all of Facebook stack. As an engineer in our team you will work on products that affect the lives of billions using variety of technologies including large scale systems, big data problems and complex networking technologies. We are looking for a 'full stack' engineer who is able to move quickly between iOS, Android, low level networking, backend, kernel development, and much more. If you're experienced with various technologies, a fast learner and have a “get things done” mentality, we'd love to hear from you!


Responsibilities



  • Identify issues and implement solutions to complex problems in large scale backend infrastructure and mobile platforms

  • Analyze & solve difficult problems across the stack

  • Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build high scale backend services

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Systems
jobs.content:
A person in this role will build the systems that allow us to ingest, sanitise, and normalise diverse datasets into meaningful structured data and connections within the social graph. If you're excited by the idea of building out a richly connected knowledge graph and augmenting it with services that allow us to create great product experiences built on top of data, you might be the person we're looking for.


Responsibilities



  • Build infrastructure that enables us to scale our knowledge graph and quickly expand into new domains

  • Work with product teams to deliver great experiences built on top of data

  • Monitor and reduce duplicate entities across the graph (and web)

  • Increase the amount of metadata we have about each entities and the connections between them

  • Improve graph quality by building systems that select and surface the best available data

  • Build tools that allow us to understand and track the quality of the graph over time

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer: World's most widely-used security testing software
jobs.content:
For nearly a decade, we have worked at the cutting edge of the web security industry, and our suite of tools is well established as the de facto standard toolkit used by web security professionals.


Our suite of tools, known as Burp Suite, helps security testers, IT professionals and developers (just like you!) write, deploy and maintain secure web applications. Our product is used by more than 22,000 individuals, in 6,000 organisations, in 100 countries.


The team behind Burp Suite is growing steadily, and we are currently looking for outstanding Java developers to join our core product team.


What will you be doing?


We are looking for developers, who are able to work closely with other high achievers on a highly collaborative team, to help architect and implement new editions of our product suite. We are fanatical about the quality of our software and, therefore, would love to meet candidates who are able to help drive quality and excellence into everything that we build!


Essential attributes:



  • Understanding of Java APIs for networking, threading, reflection, and user interface (Swing / JavaFX).



  • A thorough understanding of Agile/XP/TDD methodologies for collaborative development, with the ability to demonstrate a strong commitment to implementing these practices consistently on a day-to-day basis.



  • Ability to quickly understand a large existing codebase, begin applying incremental changes, and identify opportunities for code refactoring.


Why join PortSwigger?


We are genuinely Agile: we employ rigorous TDD; we pair-program on a daily basis; we work off a single code branch that is always release-ready; we have regular team retrospectives and knowledge-sharing sessions.


We have rapid release cycles with updated versions of our software automatically pushed to our users, so you will quickly see your code deployed to a huge global audience.


We offer a healthy, high-tech working environment. All developers work on the latest Mac Pros, with dual monitors, sitting-standing desks, and (if they are so inclined) walking treadmills!

jobs.title: IOS Software Developer integrator
jobs.content:
We need one iOS developer with test experience, to convert and deploy an iOS App and Web App for iPad, iPhone and Web App based on Linux Apache.


It is a contract position, based in Catalunya, Northern Spain.

The employer is a UK company.


The position is available for immediate start subject to comprehensive interview and technical test.


Trustportal is a technology which allows the secure sharing of data between customers and firms. We have moved from the prototyping and proof-of-concept stages with a number of large customers and now need to roll out a production-ready version of our product.


We need a capable front-end developer to help make this happen.


You will be working closely with the existing technical team, including the CTO. You will be in a position to, and be expected to, contribute to technical discussions and decision-making on architecture, implementation, testing and issue management.


We enjoy an egalitarian, collegiate working environment. The only hierarchy is ability.



If you are capable and wish to expand your skills while proving yourself in a delivery-focussed environment, this is the position for you.

All work is conducted in English, so you will be expected to be fairly fluent. However, the CTO is keen to practice his Catalan and Spanish when appropriate.


Position Details


This is a 6-month (with probationary initial period) contract for a UK-based firm.


The remuneration on offer is commensurate with proven ability and experience. It will be competitive and based on UK norms.


Location: Catalunya, Northern Spain.


Initially working at the CTO’s (large) home office in Alt Emporda (15 mins from Vilafant AVE train station).


Later, once an office has been located in Barcelona, the work will be based there.



Once competence and knowledge of the project has been demonstrated there may be opportunities to occasionally work remotely if desired. However, when explicitly asked to attend the office this is a requirement.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer with PHP / Laravel focus for Cloud-HR Startup in Munich
jobs.content:
Join our team as one of the first 10 developers and take an active role in shaping our engineering culture and the future of our platform. You will be responsible for the improvement of the current application and the migration to a new tech stack and architecture. Personio’s roadmap for the next months is feature-rich and would give you an opportunity to play out your dev skills in various newly developed areas of the application, such as advanced reporting, external API development and information extraction from documents.


In a nutshell:



  • Feature development driven by customer feedback

  • Improvement of performance and reliability of our system, support and maintenance

  • Participation in daily scrum activities and code reviews

  • Assistance in moving to a microservice architecture

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Frontend Developer (m/f)
Full-time
Location: Berlin


About MediDate


At MediDate, our mission is to build the lifestyle surgery experience of the future. We are Europe’s leading platform for premium lifestyle surgery treatments. We offer access to high quality eye, body and teeth treatments from the best doctors at attractive prices and guide our patients along the way. MediDate launched in early 2015 and is growing quickly. We are supported by some of the most prestigious investors in Europe.


Become a part of our team and help us shape the global future of lifestyle surgery!


For our Berlin team, we are currently looking for a Frontend Developer (m/f).


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with design and online marketing to create the next generation of the MediDate web experience

  • Performance consideration and optimization is part of your every step

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Identify and adopt best practices for frontend engineering


Skills and experiences



  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript and web technologies (HTML5/CSS3); at least 3 years of experience in building web applications

  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for the UI

  • Practical knowledge and experience in PHP and Wordpress CMS

  • Practical knowledge and experience in jQuery

  • You are passionate about mobile first thinking and development (responsive / adaptive / touch experience)


We offer



  • International work and life experience in the center of Berlin

  • The possibility to start your international career with an extremely steep learning curve

  • A collegial, open-minded team with great members and a continuous exchange that will support you in your professional development

  • Challenging and diverse work with a lot of responsibility

  • Start-Up atmosphere and spirit

  • A highly attractive work place with a motivating and dynamic environment and flat hierarchies

  • German language courses, discount on gym membership, team events, free drinks and more


Become a part of our success story! Please send us your application to Jasna Kranar via jobs@medidate.de (Please note that we can only consider applicants who hold a visa)

jobs.title: We are not building a monolithic Enterprise Java app
jobs.content:
Sky Betting and Gaming is a pure online business with a mobile first ethos that brings the excitement of sports betting, casino games, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the leisure betting and gaming market. Close relationships with Sky Sports provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real Sky experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.


We live up to our values: Multi-disciplined teams with local decision-making means you can work without boundaries, we are truly collaborative across the business. Process is kept to a minimum, examples are: no timesheets, project codes, product owners not project managers, no yearly performance review, so you can really focus on delivery. You will be recognised for your contribution and rewarded appropriately. You will be empowered to define your own development through our Tech Ninja fund. Our staff use this to go to conferences or buy additional equipment.


What do we expect from you?


We are expanding our in-house Java capability this year in Bet Tribe, and we are looking to hire top quality, enthusiastic engineers from relevant backgrounds to work in our lean squads.


Join one of the most exciting tech teams in Leeds as a Software Engineer working with the latest front and backend technologies on the Skybet.com sports betting platform. 


No previous experience in sports betting? No problem – we have many experts to learn from, and the technical excellence you’ll bring is what we value. Salary and benefits packages reflect the high standard in our tech teams, with excellent training and development opportunities for all engineers.


You will be self-motivated and willing to contribute to design at all levels, listening and learning from the talented people around you. We believe we have a strong culture and we want you to be a part of it.


Reporting to the Lead Software Engineer, you will:



  • Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, application quality, and agile processes

  • Deliver first-class products, which are secure, well tested, performant, and help provide an engaging customer experience

  • Play a proactive part in owning the technical systems your team works with; taking responsibility for monitoring, measuring performance and addressing technical issues when required, not just in office hours (on-call allowance with this role)

jobs.title: Cloud Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for a few great Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to join us in running a platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


Watch this short video from the engineers at Pivotal!


 
You
 
You have a passion for large distributed systems, next generation provisioning and orchestration tools, and wringing everything you can get out of an IaaS. You are a pathological automator. You might never have held the title SRE; you might have been a senior admin, a release engineer, or just the person who knows how to run everything. You are systematic in making changes; you don’t just patch and poke.
 
Above all, you love running large-scale systems and you know you can’t do it alone. You’d rather work on an integrated team with SREs, release engineers, and programmers than alone in a cubicle. You judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of your customers.
 
Us
 
Cloud Foundry is an open source project co-developed with Pivotal Labs, a leader in the field of agile software development. We are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We test drive code, automate all our regression tests, and continuously integrate. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We are committed to building systems that work without heroics.
 
We recognize that agile is not just for software development. Our cloud operations group is discovering new ways to operate systems using agile principles and practices such as pairing and test-driven development.
 
We work at a sustainable pace. Our days are intense, but we also make sure people have time off to relax, recharge, and refocus.
 
Where
 
We are setting up a Cloud Foundry engineering team in our office in Dogpatch Labs, the CHQ Building, Dublin 1 (right beside the red Luas line and Connolly dart station)  To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.


Desired Skills/ Experience:



  • Senior System Administrator on the SAGE scale

  • Strong background with CentOS and/or Ubuntu

  • Experience running Internet facing or SLA’d auto-deployed environments

  • Background automating AWS, Openstack or VMware

  • Solid source code control management skills, particularly with a distributed SCM like Git

  • Can follow a stack traces back to code and come up with a root cause

  • Trouble-shooting in very complex distributed environments

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language

  • Desire to work in a “learning organization”

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.



Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter to tell us why Cloud Foundry is a good fit for you, and why you are a good fit for Cloud Foundry.

jobs.title: Senior Python Developer
jobs.content:
For our latest project we are building a new government data collection platform using microservices architecture. 


We believe in making data open and reusable, and we put our products go in front of users as early as possible.


We believe and follow the GDS design principles:


1. Start with needs
2. Do less
3. Design with data
4. Do the hard work to make it simple
5. Iterate. Then iterate again.
6. This is for everyone
7. Understand context
8. Build digital services, not websites
9. Be consistent, not uniform
10. Make things open: it makes things better


Our teams build products at a high velocity (Discovery, Alpha, Beta, Live) so we expect you to be comfortable with coding efficiently to meet user need.

The book Re-Work (see chapter titles at bottom of page) is also a great reference tool for the way we like to go about our business.

If you have a knack for producing better results with less code, are humble, and constantly learning new technologies - then you are the kind of person we like to work with.

jobs.title: .Net developer
jobs.content:
.Net developer (C#) bij Kampert Nauta in Oss

Ben jij net begonnen aan je carrière of toe aan een tweede stap? Wil je bij een bedrijf werken met veel vrijheid en slimme oplossingen maken voor tastbare projecten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Jouw functie
Als .Net ontwikkelaar werk je zelfstandig aan projecten in een gezellig team, waarbij je altijd een collega om hulp kunt vragen. We maken nieuwe applicaties en passen applicaties aan naar de wensen van de klant. Je programmeert al onze applicaties in ASP.NET en C# en gebruikt daarnaast Javascript. Je krijgt ook alle vrijheid om nieuwe oplossingen uit te denken of hoe je met een nieuwe code de performance nog meer kan verbeteren.

Je werkt in een mix van zeer ervaren en minder ervaren ontwikkelaars. De complexiteit aan verschillende systemen en koppelingen maakt het werk uitdagend. We hebben natuurlijk te maken met regels, maar het allerbelangrijkst is het dat de applicaties voldoen aan de verwachtingen van onze klant. Je kunt je volledig focussen op je code. Binnen het team vinden we de sfeer heel belangrijk, zo vliegt er wel eens een grapje over en weer en doen we op zijn tijd ook leuke dingen buiten werktijd. Kortom, een werkomgeving die jou zeker zal uitdagen en inspireren.

Als jij wordt uitgedaagd door bovenstaande functieomschrijving, maken we graag kennis met jou!

Jouw profiel



  • ICT-opleiding op hbo- / wo-niveau.

  • Ervaring met C# en ASP.NET (enthousiaste beginners helpen we graag).

  • Ervaring met werken volgens codestandaarden.

  • Kennis van javascript en entity frameworks (andere frameworks als MVC kan ook).

  • Flexibel, oplossingsgericht, communicatief sterk en proactief.

  • Je kunt goed in teamverband werken en bent in staat om zelfstandig je werk te kunnen doen.



Wie zijn wij?
Bij ons kunnen klanten terecht met al hun grafische vraagstukken! We drukken flyers, folders, posters, visitekaartjes en nog veel meer. Daarnaast denken we mee over slimme marketingtools. Deze worden door onze ICT-afdeling geprogrammeerd. Met onze innovatieve aanpak en intelligente oplossingen mogen we werken voor zowel (inter)nationale A-merken, als het kleinere MKB, maar ook voor consumenten bij bijvoorbeeld Hipdesign.nl. Je kunt dan vanuit huis je eigen kaart maken en zonder dat iemand van de drukkerij ook maar iets hoeft te doen belanden, via een geautomatiseerd proces, de kaartjes op hun deurmat. Onze geschiedenis gaat dan wel ruim 120 jaar terug, we blijven koploper op het snijvlak van ICT, print en media. Eigentijdse marketing en communicatie vragen om slimme, snelle en flexibele productieoplossingen.

Wij bieden



  • Flexibele werktijden en vrijheid in je werkwijze.

  • Marktconform salaris en goede secundaire voorwaarden.

  • Leuke collega’s en een werksfeer waarbij je je op je gemak zult voelen.

  • Maar bovenal: een uitdagende functie in een plezierige en unieke werkomgeving.



Solliciteren
Word jij uitgedaagd door deze functie? Solliciteer dan via het online sollicitatieformulier.

Kijk voor meer informatie op onze website kampertnauta.nl. Voor extra informatie kun je contact op nemen met Miranda van Miert, recruiter a.i., telefoon: 06-18446160 of m.vanmiert@kampertnauta.nl. (Gebruik dit e-mailadres alleen voor informatie, sollicitaties ontvangen wij graag via het online sollicitatieformulier.) 

Past de geschetste functie niet bij jou, maar ken je iemand die perfect in het geschetste profiel past? Stuur deze vacature dan door.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you know what Additive Manufacturing(AM), high quality 3D printing, will bring about in the next few decades?


At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.


Our mission is to print “Any (industrial) part, Anywhere” in the world.


It is about transforming the way Manufacturing is understood around the world and radically innovate the supply chain management bringing it to almost on-demand.


Our solution leads to less scrap material (waste) in the production of parts, having a significant positive impact to our environment.


Imagine the amount of parts in machines, domestic appliances, cars and everything surrounding you. This is our potential market.


By what we do, we bridge two worlds coming together: the old - traditional supply chain and ditto manufacturing; and the new - a digitized, optimized supply chain that has AM as integrated part of it.



To make it happen we need to build a ton of cool features, adopting technologies such as Machine Learning, Blockchain and a strong SOA architecture able to match the highest standards in quality, security and scalability.


What kind of professional are we looking for?


There are a few skills you should master, but don’t be afraid though. We strongly believe it is your character that determines whether you are a good fit for our team or not. Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.

jobs.content:

At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.

Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an individual who can combine strong web development skills in the context of big data and an interest in genomics. He/she will be involved in all aspects of development of our online platforms and user interfaces, which allow access to large amounts of data and analysis results in order to solve real client needs.


In this role, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, testing and quality assurance of existing and new functionalities of our online platforms. You will interface with the existing development team, as well as our clients, advisors and collaborators.


We offer excellent terms, a flexible work environment and we will provide training as needed. We also consider internships.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content: Do you want to push the boundaries of data science and define the next stage of the field? This is where you come in: We want you to innovate our algorithms and better grok the data, leveraging every bit of our data and pioneer cutting-edge analysis to make it happen. Your workflow will be well oiled by our data, which is clean and information-dense. You will be autonomous from end-to-end where you get to do the whole stack without having to wait on others. You will discuss and share mathematical and programmatic challenges amongst your stellar peers. We foster an environment to make things happen, keep you constantly challenged and learn new things everyday In this position you will be responsible for envisioning and executing a multi-year strategy and proactively working with departments across the company. You will design and implement the vision, technology landscape and infrastructure. A strong partnership will be required with the IT team to implement algorithms and features. Therefore, we are looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated Data Scientist who will contribute to and influence the direction of this vision. To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner and have excellent software development skills. You must also be a great communicator and excel at working in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment. There is no shortage of opportunities to shape the future of our product.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
Based in Oxford, you will join our software development team to create tools to enable clients to access our services/data remotely. You will develop innovative applications that are key products of our company.


In particular, you will be responsible for improving and expanding the interface for EOS – Aurora’s leading web-based low-latency data application used by the world’s largest energy companies. You will also develop a web interface for our economic models.


The successful applicant will combine technical strength with a strong track record of performance in team-orientated environments.


The successful candidate will work in a creative, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. They will enjoy autonomy, and the opportunity to develop applications that will influence major decisions in the energy sector.

jobs.name: Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH

jobs.title: Software Engineer / Developer
jobs.company: Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH
jobs.content:
The way we do business

We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. Our flavour of agile has been heavily influenced by XP and Kanban, and if something isn’t working, we change it.
Our work delivers value to both the business and our customers, our teams are cross-discipline: business analysts and the user experience team work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, whilst our frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.

We generally follow a mix of agile and lean practices with an overall philosophy towards continuous delivery. We’ll rely on each and everyone´s expertise to adapt and improve these processes to serve the team, project and company as best fits their current contexts.
Although we don’t face the same level of stress you’d find in most projects around scope, schedule and cost, keeping the project on track is still important to us and wherever possible we’ll keep projects small, fast and healthy.

jobs.title: QA Analyst
jobs.company: Springer Science + Business Media Deutschland GmbH
jobs.content:
Springer Nature is seeking talented QA Analysts to join the Digital Systems group within our scientific & scholarly publishing business. These people will join teams responsible for building the next generation of applications used across many parts of our business, including identity management and digital publishing platforms.


You love testing. You can demonstrate a number of years’ experience testing complex web applications on teams that build software collaboratively. You have a strong test mind-set, are context-driven, and have the courage to question what others might unwittingly take as tacit assumptions. You have the technical skills to automate tests, the communication skills to collaborate with your team, and the creative hands-on exploratory testing skills to ensure that the whole system is exercised.


You’re used to working in iterative, collaborative agile development environments and know exactly how you fit into that kind of team. You spend the time to build good relationships, especially with developers and Product Owners. You take an active part in team discussions and ceremonies, as well as the broader company community. You also like to get your head down and focus on the nitty-gritty detail of the system in front of you.


Your goal is delivery. Writing comprehensive automated tests is great, but you know that eliciting a clear set of robust requirements and acceptance criteria up-front is vital to your team’s success. To that end, you set high value on the “Three Amigos” conversation. You‘ve experienced the pain of troubleshooting automated tests for applications in production and know the impact that not building things right first time has on customers, end-users, and the business.

jobs.title: Software developer  Patient Data Management
jobs.content:
Nowadays, patient treatment involves many different stages. From admitting a patient, to preliminary consultations in offices or meeting rooms through to treatment in the operating theatre, different information is required at the right place at the right time.


In order to cover more and more complex medical scenarios, a software infrastructure on separate systems is required which allows the coordination of separate software components and the processing of necessary steps and calculations in a suitable order. In addition to this, the synchronization and networking of many hospital systems is vital - between Brainlab systems as well as with systems from other manufacturers, for example with PACS or hospital information systems.


As a member of our project team, you are responsible for developing this infrastructure to manage software applications and the increasing amount of data which is part of this complex and broad field. You work as part of our team responsible for "Brainlab Operating System" and thereby create a solid base upon which our other developer teams can run their applications. Through these tasks, we ensure a uniform software environment and user experience for all Brainlab systems, both local and cloud applications.


Together with a team of software developers, project engineers and project managers, you will be making an important contribution to intelligent workflow control, intuitive interfaces and intelligent data management, which optimize the working processes used when treating patients.

jobs.title: Brand Designer
jobs.content: Azimo is hiring a Brand Designer in London

jobs.title: Product (UX/UI) Designer
jobs.content: Azimo is hiring a Product (UX/UI) Designer in London

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Travis CI is looking for an Enterprise Development and Support Engineer in
US and EU timezones.


Travis CI Enterprise is one of our main products, essentially Travis CI
packaged up as a Docker container. It is being installed and run inside our
customer's private networks.


As a support engineer, you will work closely with our Travis CI Enterprise
customers, helping them to be more successful with Travis CI over time. You'll
learn about their successes and challenges, understand their interests, and
share their feedback.


You will also help to solve support cases, often opened by customer system
administrators, using your technical skills and coordinating responses from
our infrastructure and development teams. Tickets can include investigation of
network or configuration issues, debugging application errors, discussing
feature requests, and others. Doing so you will work with our engineering teams
to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve
customer-facing resources.


As a development engineer, you will work on our applications and integrate
them to work in the context of Travis CI Enterprise. You will add new features,
improve our build tooling and automation, and the overall system.


Benefits


You can work from anywhere you want. You do not have to come to Berlin, but
we're happy to fly you in to meet with the team whenever you want.

You choose your own working hours. We're flexible in how you work and where you
work. We have families, and we encourage you to spend plenty of time with
yours.

You take a minimum of 25 days paid leave per year, plus personal days off.

We chip in for your health insurance. As a German company, we generally split
about 50/50 between employer and employee, no matter where you are.

We offer paid parental leave to all of our employees, no matter if legally
required.

A Kindle book allowance so you can take time off and read.

You visit conferences. We will pay for travel and tickets.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Wil jij ook werken met Open Data? Be part of the vibe!



Het DataLab is voor het DataPunt op zoek naar een ervaren en gedreven



Frontend Developer


Met een passie voor de stad Amsterdam, voor innovatie, Open Source en voor Open Data.




Werken bij het Datapunt van de Gemeente Amsterdam betekent; “elke dag met veel energie en plezier werken aan data gedreven oplossingen in een inspirerende werkomgeving, met de meest innovatieve technologieën, voor een groeiende en bruisende stad”.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
You are passionate about software, laser-focused and self-motivated. In this position, you will work together with our lead Front End Developer and Core Platform Engineers through numerous stages of the product development cycle.


Are you the perfect fit for Appway?



  • JavaScript is your passion and creating code with a strong focus on architecture is what you like most

  • You like to work as part of a scrum team, you are a problem solver and you will apply your skills to support Appway’s customer needs

  • You enjoy finding ways to feed intelligence back into the products and tasks you work on, as well as with your colleagues


Main Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate closely with Appway’s user interaction and graphic designers, as well as other programmers.

  • Transform Photoshop mockups into a living breathing web applications

  • Writing clear, obvious, and maintainable code.

  • Help us to take Appway to the next level by improving its desktop quality user interface using standards-based HTML, JavaScript and CSS.


Skills & Requirements



  • Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.

  • 5+ years of experience and demonstrable proficiency in JavaScript, CSS and HTML5

  • Strong computer science fundamentals: object oriented programming, design patterns and algorithms.

  • Experience in the following:

  • The Java programming language
