jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Product Marketing Manager (Remote) 

Weâre looking for a product focused marketer, who cares deeply about understanding our customers, our product and our business and can expertly communicate our (big!) vision to the world.

QWILR
At Qwilr, we make it easy for anyone to create their documents as stunning web pages.

By combining the best of the web with the familiar ease of document creation tools, we have created a better way for businesses to communicate. Qwilr Pages are beautiful, intelligent, interactive, data rich, & secure - and they are also incredibly quick and easy to create.

Qwilr lets the world to move from the archaic 1980s paradigm of PDF, Powerpoint & Word to the power & beauty of the web - because the web can do so much more than a file can.

PRODUCT MARKETING AT QWILR

  • Work with the founders to develop positioning and messaging that helps potential customers understand the benefits and vision of Qwilr.
  • Formulate and execute go-to-market activities ranging from feature launches, case studies, templates, onboarding guides, educational materials and more to help our users & customers get the most out of Qwilr.
  • Work directly with product management, sales and engineering to increase adoption of our features; help shape demos and videos that showcase Qwilrâs capabilities.
  • Produce articles and content for our blog, and other related content opportunities.
  • Influence product development, based on market demand as well as customer feedback.
  • Manage our marketing site.

OUR TEAM ALL

  • Move fast and execute every day.
  • Love developing creative solutions in a team, as much as going solo on a challenging project from beginning to end.
  • Are eager to understand and work with our users.
  • Are across both the big picture and the devilish details.
  • Know in their bones that software and the web can make the ways that businesses build, use, share & reuse documents at least 10x better.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2+ years of experience in marketing SaaS products, platforms, or services.
  • Extremely clear communicator with great copy writing and editing skills.  

BONUS POINTS

  • You have done your own thing before - be it a blog, an adventure or a startup
  • Design skills
  • Technical Skills - especially around HTML & CSS
  • Video Skills
  • Deep knowledge of Sales & Marketing Collateral (Proposals, Quotes, Pitch Decks, etc)
  • Understand how SaaS works - CAC, LTV, Churn, ARPU, etc

PERKS

  • Competitive salary with meaningful equity
  • Work directly with the founders in a role that will impact the future of our company
  • Budget for continued learning and A+ office supplies
  • Four weeks paid leave
  • Contributions to your 401(k) or equivalent 
  • An annual trip out to Sydney, Australia to meet the team
  • An excellent team environment in a fast growing company

To apply: Send a thoughtful cover letter and your CV (or LinkedIn) to careers@qwilr.com

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
ShopStorm is looking for a Customer Success Specialist to join our fully distributed team. Youâll be responsible for supporting a growing set of Shopify apps which help power thousands of online stores.

The Role

Youâll be the primary point of contact for our customers, helping them with problems, and answering questions. As part of a small team, you'll likely get your hands dirty with a little bit of everything. Here are some things you may do on a given day:

  • Serve as the key point person for ShopStormâs customers
  • Help customers by troubleshooting problems and answering questions
  • Install and modify code on customersâ Shopify stores
  • Author technical documentation and blog posts to help our customers help themselves
  • Help our engineering/product leads identify existing pain points and prioritize feature releases
  • Implement processes to improve support and customer satisfaction
  • Monitor social media channels and online forums for opportunities to enhance our brand
  • Assist with marketing and partnership efforts

About You

You have that unique combination of technical aptitude and empathy for the user. Youâre comfortable with code but prefer to be customer-facing. Youâre self-driven with a sense of urgency and draw satisfaction from going above and beyond to provide solutions. Youâre an excellent communicator and have the ability to thrive in a distributed environment. Perhaps most importantly, you have a willingness to learn.

About Us

ShopStorm is a small team focused on creating high-quality Shopify apps with exceptional customer service. All types and size of merchants, from the smallest 1-person online shop to large, multinational eCommerce powerhouses rely on our apps to help their businesses.

Our team is part of SkyVerge, an eCommerce software company that builds tools for tens of thousands of merchants across many different platforms. Weâre a distributed company with an even gender split that spans 4 US states and 5 countries. We believe in open communication, respect each otherâs diversity of thought, and often find that a well-timed GIF or emoji is the best way to communicate. ðµ

The Requirements

To succeed in this position you will have:

  • Solid understanding of HTML / CSS
  • Native-level fluency in English
  • Fantastic written communication and interpersonal skills
  • An endless curiosity for our products and our users
  • Ability to thrive in a remote environment (along with a reliable internet connection)
  • Availability for 1-2 team trips / year

The Bootcamp

This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible. We know your work will speak for itself through delighted customers and well-written documentation and blog posts. However, fit with our team and culture is important.

Every new team member completes a 60-day Bootcamp as a contractor before becoming a salaried employee. Already have a full-time position? Donât worry. Weâre flexible with hours and schedule during the bootcamp period.

The Benefits

Some of the benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary with performance incentives
  • 15 days of paid time-off per year
  • Generous holiday policy including two company holidays: SkyVerge Day in March, Founders Day in June ð
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance (reimbursements for comparable care for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • Retirement plan with company match
  • Home office or co-working allowance
  • Hardware and software allowance (we'll set you up with the tools you need to be productive)
  • Personal development allowance to help you learn and grow (e.g. books, courses, conferences)
  • A Kindle to help you keep learning!

TL, DR: Join our team and influence thousands of online stores. Excited? Us too. Apply now!

SkyVerge believes and supports workplace diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

To apply: Apply here: https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/330658

jobs.title: WebGL 3D JavaScript
jobs.content:
Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.


In this role, you'll build a web-based 3D tool that ingests LiDAR point cloud files, and allows users to draw cuboids around objects within those point clouds. Agents will be able to navigate around clouds (rotate, pan, zoom) and assign labels to the cuboids they make.


Cuboid coordinates & associated labels should be easily importable & exportable via JSON. The solution will integrate with our existing workspace tools. While you'll be the sole developer on the 3D project, you'll be able to lean on an engineering team of 6 full-time engineers for help with platform integration. Expansion of existing open source or proprietary tools is welcome - you'll need to decide & make a case for any tools before starting.


This position is ideal for a senior developer with experience in JavaScript, WebGL, (ideally) point cloud manipulation, and an interest in social good. Samasource has elevated over 30,000 underprivileged workers & their dependents out of poverty. With your help, this tool will allow us to help many more.


While we're based in San Francisco, we're very happy to consider remote applications from anyone willing to work on (roughly) US Pacific timezones.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
jobs.content:
Your impact

As a dedicated Site Reliability Engineer you will help us define the best practices, tools and automation to ensure our fast growing SaaS provides best in class high availability while increasing engineering velocity. Your work will empower more than 7,000 businesses around the world to deliver a great customer support experience. This is a critical role that will influence every engineer in the company and directly impact our customer's satisfaction. No matter how elegant our product is, it means little if customers can't always access our site with great performance.

ABOUT THE ROLE
  • We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to build sophisticated continuous delivery and test automation to keep our AWS-based services highly available and fast while increasing the engineering team's velocity.
  • Help Scout engineering is 24 full time engineers organized into 6 teams. You will be a member of a small team with one engineer focused on continuous delivery (CD) pipelines, and 3 engineers focused on our AWS infrastructure and operations. Working with your team, you will partner with our feature delivery teams to build any automation they need to improve site reliability and velocity.
  • You will be responsible for working on our three biggest site reliability priorities: four 9s high availability, continuous delivery and test automation. You will own the implementation and roadmap planning for improvements to our automation, tools and tests to support these priorities. The majority of your time will be spent building or implementing continuous delivery, test and self-healing automation and supporting tools. You will be a key internal champion for any and all changes to make our production environments more resilient, scalable, and performant.
  • Your potential projects will include expanding our CI pipeline across all teams, testing and implementing auto-scaling groups, expanding our test automation (smoke, stress, chaos monkey, etc), and enhancing the velocity of our CI pipeline (parallel tasks, containers, etc).
  • This is not a primary on-call position. However you should expect to be called upon if services you own such as CD pipelines or test automation fail and primary on-call team members can't resolve the issue.
  • Our 100% remote engineering team spends most of their time in Slack and Github. Engineers can focus for long stretches with typically only 2 scheduled meetings a week (one with your team and one with your manager). Engineers write their own automated unit and integration tests, and use our CI pipeline to release code to production several times a day. You can read more about our culture and how our remote team stays agile at https://www.helpscout.net/blog/agile-remote-teams/

REQUIREMENTS

About You
  • You love building test automation that finds site reliability problems before they hit production while allowing software engineering teams to continuously deliver new capabilities.
  • You have worked extensively with a wide range of Amazon Web Services (EC2, ELB, EBS, RDS, VPCs, CloudFormation, etc) and are familiar with the benefits and challenges of their offerings. You know how to design systems for failure and how to autoscale and recover systems on AWS to ensure high availability.
  • You are well-versed in modern system orchestration, configuration management, and application deployment tooling and practices.
  • You have designed continuous delivery and test automation for SaaS projects supporting tens of thousands of simultaneous active users, so you have a good sense of what the road ahead looks like and what we could be doing better.
  • You have a deep understanding of what it takes to run web services at scale and have a solid understanding of Linux systems internals and networking; from kernel to shell, system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
  • You love to dig into the details and automate manual processes whenever possible. You're comfortable with tools providing operational insights, log searching, and stats analysis.
  • A big part of being great at your job revolves around being very organized and communicative. Itâs clear from your experience that you have those characteristics.
  • Youâve got a strong engineering background and have done a little of everything. Itâs clear you are a curious person that prefers to get stuff done rather than delegate.

ABOUT US

  • Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video conferencing.
  • Weâre a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the customer experience, no exceptions.
  • Our company is growing quickly and has aspirations of helping millions of people around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and require you to excel in every aspect of the position. Itâs hard work, but the people weâre looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
  • This is not the typical startup ârocket shipâ. Weâll never compromise customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life balance is an important priority.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. Weâll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If youâre based outside the US, youâll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). Weâll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: https://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/171036

jobs.title: Web Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
Web Systems Administrator

Join our Winning Team as a Web Administrator

The Web Administrator will be responsible for building and maintaing systems to facilitate, enhance and improve CARFAX's SEO strategy.

 The CARFAX Culture

Our culture offers the unique blend of a high achieving, high-energy workforce in a casual, laid back setting.  Our employee focused culture has been recognized and earned CARFAX the honor of being named as one of the “Great Places to Work” 7 times in a row by Washingtonian magazine and additionally by the Washington Post, and nationally by Glassdoor!  Are you ready to join a winning team, be inspired daily, and have a blast while doing it? If so, take a detour from your daily grind and apply today!

As a Web Administrator you will:

  • Support/Administer/Maintain existing web systems including cafax.com
  • Support Joomla, Wordpress, Zoomdata, FTP, and Webfocus systems including development, test, and beta, environments
  • Architect/Build/Maintain new web systems
  • Support and participate in Data Center 2.0 initiatives
  • Be a part of a team that provides 24/7 on call and after hour support

What we’re looking for: 

  • 5+ years of systems administration or related systems experience required
  • Skills in administrating Linux and virtual (VMware and OVM) systems
  • Skills in administering CMS Systems such as Joomla
  • Skills in Java
  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Proficiency in keeping up with technology and hardware advances
  • Ability to function well in stressful and reactive situations
  • Basic knowledge of Active Directory and DNS
  • Skills and/or knowledge designing and implementing Highly Available systems

About CARFAX

You may know CARFAX as the company that has provided trusted vehicle information reports for over 30 years but we are so much more! CARFAX is on a mission to help millions of people shop, buy, own and sell used cars with more confidence.  To do this we are constantly expanding our offerings, and stretching into new areas in order to provide needed, trusted assistance to consumers at all points of the car buying, ownership, and selling lifecycle. At CARFAX we invest in the growth of our employees and offer rewarding, creative, fast-paced work, as well as many other opportunities to challenge you in your career.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
jobs.content:
Established in 1984 and headquartered in Henderson, Nevada, Aldec is an industry leader in Electronic Design Verification.  

We are seeking a remote, contract Digital Marketing Specialist to join our fast-moving marketing team to implement online marketing activities as directed by the Marketing Manager and Technical Marketing team to achieve business goals.  The right candidate will posses the ability to take initiative, anticipate needs and complete projects with minimal supervision.

Duties:
* Website Content: Leverage knowledge of current SEO and web design practices to update website content (pages, press releases, events, articles, etc.) as directed.  Must have proven experience maintaining visually appealing websites that attract and convert. 
* Email Campaigns: Implement email campaigns as directed by the Marketing Manager and Technical Marketing team and provide insight to management through analytics and reporting.
* Adwords: Implement and monitor Google Adwords and remarketing campaigns.
* Graphics: Ability to create and resize graphics as required. 
* Misc: Joining a small marketing team requires flexibility. Daily tasks might also include research, preparing materials for events, etc.

Experience and Requirements:
* 3+ years Digital Content Marketing experience.
* Intermediate HTML/CSS skills with knowledge of best SEO practices.
* Strong written communication skills.
* Proven project management abilities.
* Experience with Google Adwords and Google Analytics.
* Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator/InDesign skills
* Marketing Automation experience a plus.

Compensation: $30-35 per hour DOE. Additional bonus package after 90 days. 

Candidate to work remotely an average of 30 hours per week and must be available by phone or email for at least 4 hours during the US office workday (8am-5pm Pacific Time Zone). This is a contract position that does not include 401K, health benefits, or sick/vacation pay. 

To apply: Please email resume to jobs@aldec.com. Please include cover letter with links to previously managed sites.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering - Software
jobs.content:
About us:
At Siempo we believe technology should be simple and mindful. We realized that we were constantly distracted and feeling over-connected by our smartphones. We couldnât find solutions we believed in, so we decided to build something new.

Siempo is a mindful phone with a focused feature-set of calling, texting, notes, calendar and Wi-Fi tethering. The natural language UX is designed to help minimize distractions and the focus feature helps you shield against distractions and do more of what you love.

Previously known as Minium(http://minium.co), we have iterated on the product direction over the past year and are thrilled to launch our new brand and a crowdfunding campaign this fall.

Weâre now looking for someone to drive our software team and deliver a beautiful, inspiring experience; someone excited about reshaping the way we interact with technology and playing a significant role in the early stages of a hardware-enabled software startup. We hope this person is you.

Weâre a small team based in Oakland and Chicago who are passionate about mindfulness, work-life balance and technology. Weâre focused on getting things done. Both as a company and as co-workers we value transparency and collaboration. We believe work should be fun and care as much about the culture as the product.

About you:
You speak Android OS fluently and are experienced with hardware projects. Youâve worked with independent design houses and/or ODMs, ideally in Asia. We imagine that you have brought up an OS on a new device, or developed a hardware/software product from scratch and taken it to mass market production. You know what it takes to work in a startup, youâre self-motivated and know how to lead a distributed team.

To apply: If this sounds like a fun challenge, please apply at http://siempo.co/apply.htmlYou may submit any supporting files that speak to who you are as a person and why you would be a good fit for this position. Resumes/CVs are great, but weâre also interested in anything that goes beyond such as past work or projects, GitHub account, or your personal blog.We read every application and look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Entry Mid level Front end Web Developer
jobs.content:
JS full-time dev


We're looking for someone who likes to take ownership of a project, and see it through to completion, with or without supervision. Our stack is really new (about 2 months old) and focuses on a predictable, functional, reliable frontend… React + Observables + redux-like-stores + angular in an iframe for legacy support + native app that renders webpages as video and delivers them to Facebook (and other video services) + ruby-on-rails api backend (all json).

The right candidate would be excited about being our first dev hire. There’s currently only 4 full-time founders (+ 2 part-time employees). Our product helps big brands like NBC, BuzzFeed, the New York Times, Reuters, Nasdaq, TED talks, and more broadcast high quality video to Facebook Live. We've grown really fast and can continue to do so with the right technical talent. We think this is a great fit for someone who thinks they could be great with the right mentorship. (We have one of the guys who built a js video player for one of the biggest companies in the world.)

We’re previously funded by Y Combinator, and some angel investors. At this time, we do not expect to raise further funding. We’re currently profitable, and expect this to be our only company we work at for the next 50 years. We will not be selling the company unless some insane whatsapp like thing happened. We're building a forever biz, not a flip. We'd love for our perfect employee to be excited about small companies and startups, and we'd expect the right candidate to use us as a learning experience to maybe make the next step into a senior developer role.

We value diverse applicant pools, so if you're part of an under-represented population in tech, we hope you'll apply. Specifically we'd love to see more women and people of color apply.

We value people’s home lives. We work hard but some of the founders work 4-day weeks. Other coworkers are encouraged to do this schedule if it works for them. We also value remote work, and have cofounders in Finland and Pakistan, which should emphasize our preference for results over face time for the sake of facetime.

To apply email hiring@vidpresso.com with a quick bio including: What you’ve built, what you like to build, what you wish you could build.

jobs.title: Angular and Node.js Senior Application Engineer
jobs.content:
A Stealthy Startup is looking for asenior software engineer to join a distributed team and make significant contributions to designing, building and leading efforts to greenfield our application to market.  We are focused on delivering low-cost, highly scale-able, high performing, easy-to-use data analytics, intelligence and business orchestration tools rooted in distilling down hard answers to big questions from mountains of data and presenting it in a way that is accessible and actionable for users.

Software Engineer
  Now that you have an overview of the company's mission, letâs talk a little about the specific opportunity.  We are looking to add to a team of hard core engineers who are as passionate as we are about building great applications using modern technologies as design pattern as we are.  We are a team of aces who are greenfielding a lot of this now so if you are the right candidate for this role, greenfielding this part of the application with us should be something that excites you, not something that makes you want to crawl under your desk.  We are looking for intelligent, diligent hard working individual(s) who not only are technical powerhouses and self-starters, but also come armed with superior communication skills, ability to fill in the blanks when you encounter one and are interested in taking on big challenges and succeeding.  Make no mistake, this is a multidisciplinary software development role in a small company with big aspirations, your technical skills will be challenged.  If youâre detail-oriented, then we probably love you already.  If you are hungry to take on big challenges and ready to make an impact with your engineering and simultaneously hone your skills on the latest technologies along the way; then youâve definitely come to the right place.
If youâre right for us...

Youâre good at:
  • Developing enterprise-grade software in a fast moving environment
  • Working in a results oriented culture that uses modern, sprint based collaboration tools ( Short  and productive sprints aided with tools like Trello, Slack and Google Hangouts )
  • Skills and passion for developing lightning fast, scalable applications that solve real-world business problems in modern technologies like Node JS, JavaScript, Angular JS, etc.  In case you are wondering, this is a hard core full stack engineering opportunity, not âdeveloping a websiteâ.
  • The understanding of team strategies and team objectives
  • The motivation to learn and constantly improve process and tools
  • The people skills required to work with us on a fluid and dynamic environment
  • Working in MVC environments
  • Building software that runs fast and scales giving the user the best possible experience
  • Building software without bugs [ your software never has bugs, right? :) ]
  • Logic and solving puzzles
  • Empathizing with users who actually use the software
  • Working in a distributed team

You Have
  • The appetite to greenfield with us as we go on this journey
  • The performance track record to confidently take pride in your work
  • The chops to never back away from a challenge, technical or otherwise
  • The vision to build things right the first time
  • The ability to pick out the syntax problem in the next section
  • An overlap of at least 4 hours with the Eastern Standard Time work-day
  • Speak/write/communicate/comprehend/joke fluently in English...although many of us are multi-lingual, we use English to communicate.

We have
  • Vision, experience and dedication
  • A team of aces to work with
  • A culture of excellence, results and accountability
  • A stack with the latest open source technologies ( Angular JS, Node JS specifically Sails JS for an enterprise-grade MVC design pattern but with support for the type of modern apps we are looking to build (eg. data-driven APIâs with a scalable service-oriented architecture).
  • An open mind for new ideas of methodologies
  • Cloud based, Linux open source environment (eg. think Ubuntu on AWS) and the Amazon stack and services to help us develop and scale quickly.
  • Flexible work schedule, distributed work opportunities and flexible work location benefits

A Day in the life ( at our current stage )
  • We do a daily development stand-up and review our Trello board to review:
  • What is completed
  • What is tracking on-time
  • What is tracking red
  • When will it be green
  • Are you blocked by anything? --What do you need from anyone in this room to continue
  • What you should be working on next
  • Discuss any larger architecture decisions
  • Ask what can we do to improve our [ process, communication, application, architecture ]
  • Communicate and collaborate and be a real team
  • Exchange a Meme and laugh once in awhile...okay, probably more than once in awhile

To apply: Send your resume/CV and cover note explaining why you are the right candidate for this opportunity to recruiting@rekener.com

So we're going fully native and we're putting together the best mobile team in the country to do it.


If you're a die-hard iOS or Android developer, this is your dream job: No legacy code, and the freedom and resources to do the best work of your career.


What We Expect:

  • Willing to learn. You must have an open mind, be able to pick things up quickly and enjoy working with passionate people.

  • Fundamentally, this position is for a senior developer role, so we want to see that you've made some beautiful apps that you're proud of.


Ideally we'd also expect you to be familiar with the list below, but the main thing is your portfolio. Show us with the stuff you've done. Definite bonus points for putting together something using our API (http://developer.teamwork.com) - doesn't matter how small. 


What we we're not looking for:


 Ninjas. (Although if you want to do some martial arts in your free time that's fine too.)

jobs.title: Senior .NET Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a Senior Developer with experience to join our Development team in Dublin. You should have 'strong drive' and be able and willing to work in an agile, modern and fast moving environment.


What is the position


A successful candidate will be a team player who can take responsibility for building, delivering, testing and deploying new core projects through to production. You will take ownership of new products and features such as:



  • Helping to build out our microservices architecture.

  • Developing new strategies to improve search system responsivieness and performance

  • Refining our backoffice systems which service and manage hotel reservations


Our environment


We don’t hire based on experience with a handful of tools. Instead, we want smart, capable, and experienced people who can learn our tools quickly (and suggest new ones!). Prior experience with our stack or similar is however is a bonus. Here’s what we use:


Microsoft technology on server side frontend and middle tiers (.NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC, SQL Server).


JSON based public and internal services.


PubSub and Queue based processes for cache reloading and long running tasks.


Git source control.


SeleniumJS testing framework.


Continuous Integration with integrated testing allowing us to deploy to live, with confidence, multiple times a day.


Although most of our core logic is written in C#, in Roomex we use the right tool for the job when it makes sense.


We have lots of exciting challenges which need to be solved.


We value our people...


Salaries are generous with good holidays.


Interested?


Roomex is growing fast and launching into new markets. We're looking for people who are interested in rolling up their sleeves and getting stuck in to building some amazing software which we believe will transform the corporate travel industry. If this sounds like the kind of challenge you are interested in then please get in touch.

jobs.title: Test Engineer - Oslo, Norway - Global Health Platform
jobs.content:
Are you interested in improving a platform used globally to improve health care for the underprivileged? Do you enjoy breaking software and finding bugs? Are you excited about continuous delivery pipelines? We are seeking a test engineer who is passionate about building high-quality products.


DHIS 2 is a web-based, open source data platform used by governments and NGOs in 60+ countries to improve access and use of information within health, education, sanitation, nutrition and disaster relief. The platform has become a global standard within international development with huge impact on the way health systems are being managed.


As part of our team you will be working on automated testing. You will write scripts to automate testing and build tools to help developers test their code. You will use your knowledge to improve our software design, engineering practice and testability. You will be part of the core developer team and have a great influence on the quality of the end product.


At DHIS 2 we ship code at a rapid pace which makes us dependent on a comprehensive suite of tests. You ensure that we can deliver new features quickly without breaking existing ones. You will be developing tests for our Web APIs and our front end web apps which will be integrated in our continuous delivery pipeline.


We offer highly competitive salary levels and flexible working hours. The position is based in Oslo, Norway. Remote working location can be discussed.


Responsibilities



  • Lead our testing efforts from planning to delivery

  • Write automated test scripts for our Web API and our front end apps

  • Improve our continuous delivery pipeline by integrating comprehensive tests

  • Create and maintain test plans

  • Develop internal software testing tools

  • Drive adoption of unit testing and test driven methodologies

About WalletHub

WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington,D.C.. Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned usseveral prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financialservices website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one ofthe products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seekinghardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance andmake a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.

More specifically, we are harnessing the power of dataanalytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financialadvisor, whose services weâre offering to everyone for free. The WalletHubbrain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of thetime with three unique features:

  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifiesimprovement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHubâs savingsbrain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringingyou only the best deals.
  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isnâtas scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you ofimportant credit-report changes.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHubis the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full creditreports that are updated on a daily basis absentof user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logsin. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yettheyâre still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a muchlarger puzzle.

jobs.title: Direct Response Copywriter For Professional Services (B2B LeadGen)
jobs.content:
Our company helps small professional service firms, such as lawyers or accountants, generate new business through direct response marketing and advertising. We manage campaigns both online and offline.

We need a conversion-minded copywriter to help create new campaigns for our current and incoming clients.

This is a contract position with the potential to grow into permanent full-time employment. All work will be done remotely, and we are seeking candidates with previous remote work experience.

You must have previous experience writing and optimizing direct-response campaigns. We work with online landing pages, email autoresponders, and direct-mail formats.

Most of our projects start from scratch.  A typical client's business has grown to a 10-30 employee firm over many years prior to partnering with Tall Cube.  Most of these firms have grown from word of mouth alone and are now looking to scale.

Our focus, and what we're looking for in your previous experience, is developing lead-generation campaigns using a methodology rooted in rapid testing. We don't value being right or wrong on the first try. Instead, we look to prove meaningful optimization over time.

Tall Cubeâs work culture is one where âgood and fastâ receives more praise than âperfect next yearâ. You will be expected to write drafts quickly. At the same time, we wonât expect copy written during a rapid-testing schedule to rival Shakespeare.

However, there is a time and place for painstaking detail during deep optimization efforts on well-established campaigns.

You'll work with our team to write, test, compare your copyâs performance across numerous creative variations.

You'll be responsible for:
Writing and editing direct-response copy in line with client strategy
Developing converting lead-generation landing pages
Writing autoresponder email copy for professional clients
Drafting and improving physical direct-mail copy
Maintaining a professional client relationship

We are particularly interested in someone with:
Direct-response marketing experience
Experience advertising across several mediums
Previous results with lead-generation and/or B2B campaigns
Strong understanding of media buying
Previous experience optimizing and scaling existing campaigns

Thank you for your interest in our copywriting position.

To apply: If you would like to apply, please send your resume in an email with the subject "Tall Cube Copywriter" to team@tallcube.com.In your message, please include answers to the following questions:1) Do you have a online portfolio or resume? If so, please provide a URL.2) Briefly describe your experience as a copywriter. What products or services have you promoted? In which medium have you performed best?3) Have you had an experience where the approach your client most desired was opposite from the approach that best converted? If so, how did you handle the situation?4) Tell us about a piece of copy that inspires you. What makes it special?

As Java Developer you develop and implement application software within project timelines and Roche quality and documentation standards. You contribute to the core business and informatics processes and solutions within a given area of domain. You apply your knowledge of systems and tools and problem solving skills to support our processes and solutions. You are doing now what patients need next.


Your Java Developer tasks include implementing and monitoring system performance using defined standards and resolving or escalating problems for resolution when appropriate. You participate in the execution and documentation of system testing. You work within an international team of experts. You have a chance to exchange your knowledge and experience within our internal Java Community of Practice. You are expected to maintain and continuously develop your knowledge within the domain.

jobs.title: Head of Engineering
jobs.content:
As the Head of Engineering (m/f) for one of our companies, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.


You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.


About the position:



  • You are responsible for the development and supervision of a team consisting of developers, testers and system experts and will be interfacing with a product counterpart.

  • You find and hire talented people to build up great teams.

  • You lead the development of multiple high-traffic sites and mobile apps.

  • You learn from and share knowledge with other Rocket ventures worldwide.

  • With your deep knowledge, you are able to solve complex problems and support your team in a hands-on manner.

  • You are in charge of code quality and architecture.

  • You manage projects, timelines and releases.

jobs.title: Polyglot Software Engineer to work on a cutting edge Big Data Platform
jobs.content:
Qubit’s platform consumes and enriches billions of events a day, and serves out millions of personalisations to some of the biggest properties on the Internet. Our platform provides the backbone on which all of Qubit’s rich SaaS products are built.


ARE YOU…


Passionate about software engineering? Do you like hardcore programming in a wide range of languages or are willing to learn to do so? Do Big Data problems keep you up at night? Are you looking to get your hands dirty with some of the hottest technologies in the industry right now? Then look no further and apply for this position.


Experimental? You are happy to embrace new technologies and tools that help us solve the hard problems intrinsic to a rapidly growing, disruptive technology such as ours. The current version of the platform leverages the following: Kafka, Hadoop, Storm, Spark, Dataflow, HBase, BigTable, BigQuery, Hive, Redshift, Redis, Java, Scala, Python, Go, Clojure, Avro, Protobuf, et al. We love open source and so should you.


YOU WILL BE…


Helping us engineer and maintain a low-latency, high-throughput platform that is responsible for capturing, validating, enriching, storing, and serving billions of data points a day.


This entails full-stack engineering from writing real-time processing applications to scaling up our distributed data storage solutions and from tuning JVMs to working with globally distributed infrastructure. Stable, deterministic, well-documented, fully-tested, scalable, and concurrent are some of the keywords that will apply to your code.


What the team has worked on recently:



  • Brought down our end-to-end processing SLA from the order of hours to minutes.

  • Productionised a Javascript and Clojure service under Nashorn in a distributed big data engine (crazy? we know).

  • Upgraded our data ingestion and processing pipeline to support validation and evolution of our clients’ data fabric.

  • Implemented systems for web-scale data lookup and temporal count distinct operations.


Oh, and we get early access to technology before anyone else in the industry. We are also agile with scrums and stand ups but we still maintain the chaos inherent to a dynamic engineering environment: we build and fix stuff as rapidly as we break and scale it.


What you’ll need:


In addition to a zest for problem solving, an ideal candidate should possess the following skills:



  • Experience with at least one programming language (even if it’s esoteric).

  • A degree in Computer Science/Mathematics/Engineering or a related field or equivalent industry experience.

  • “Never say never” approach to challenges.

  • Ability to take up new technologies with ease.

  • Excited by the prospects of working in an engineering team that spans three continents, multiple timezones, and endless enthusiasm.

  • Willing to embrace Qubit’s values: “Voice it. Own it. Do it.”

  • Up for telling the world the Truth About Data


Plenty of perks


As well as the opportunity to solve complex problems, we like to look after our fellow Qubyte, so you'll get:



  • Generous equity options and performance centric bonuses.

  • Acknowledgment and recognition for your performance and skills via the ability to climb up the engineering ladder.

  • Top of the line medical and dental insurance.

  • Free onsite yoga and meditation classes.

  • A competitive office where we play foosball, football, scrabble, go-karting… you name it, we’ll play and ace it.

  • A fridge fully stocked with healthy snacks and the ultimate espresso machine for both your “cookie” and “Java” fixes (puns intended).


At Qubit, we champion diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace difference with open arms and see it as a huge benefit to our community. We are dedicated to equal opportunity regardless of  race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. If you have a disability or need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

jobs.title: Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a full-time integrations engineer: a hybrid between support and development and part of the Customer Success team.


You’ll ensure users have a top-notch trial experience and customers are successful with Geckoboard. You won’t let a bug in the app or a missing integration get in the way of that.


You’ll become the go-to person our customers count on by combining your love of technology with your love of helping people.


You'll be passionate about working as part of a team, and learning from others.


You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.

jobs.title: Java developer
jobs.content:
Business programming with existing large-scale software system




  • Support system analysis




  • Estimate efforts




  • Refactor software / apply appropriate design patterns




  • Execute developer tests,




  • Work on several code branches




  • Review system configuration prior to release launches




  • Fix bugs during release launch and consolidation phase




  • Work on the software through the whole life cycle

jobs.title: Frontend Developer - Javascript
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Frontend Developer to take the responsibility of transforming the job done by the UX & Design teams into functional Frontends. Your job will be directly impacting the customer experience of our products that can be used by millions of people. 


Javascript is your main skill and AngularJS is your weapon. Are you ready to start this mission? 


This position is based in Scytl Headquarters in Barcelona


How can you help us?


Your responsibilities as a Frontend Developer will be the following:
 



  • Specialization in Javascript (AngularJS) development.

  • Build up front ends for the different modules of our products.

  • Testing for browsers and OS compatibility.

  • Work together with Backend Developers and QA to make the things happen.


Job Advantages:



  • International working environment. 

  • Creative and results focused team.

  • Opportunity to be part of the worldwide leader in its market.

  • Great office in Barcelona center.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to participate in the development of bespoke built and scalable electoral modernization portfolio products and solutions to keep Innovating Democracy Worldwide. If you are a strong Software Engineer with an excellent knowledge of the Java stack who also finds the joy working with Javascript (AngularJS) to perform some tasks in the frontend when needed (or you have the interest to learn it), this is position is specially made for you.


This position is based in Scytl Headquarters in Barcelona.



How can you help us?


Your responsibilities as a Software Engineer will be the following:
 



  • Development and optimization of reliable and secure applications used by millions of people.

  • Participation in the analysis and architectural design of a mission critical software.

  • Participation in the delivery of projects Worldwide. Some sporadic short-term trips may be required.

  • Contribution to a team of an outstanding engineering team willing to collaborate and to share knowledge with you.


Job Advantages:



  • International working environment.

  • Creative and results focused team.

  • Opportunity to be part of the worldwide leader in its market.

  • Good offices in Barcelona city centre.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer JavaScript
jobs.content:
Are you an A-player, passionate about building great software and looking to work in a fast-growing, people-focused company creating market-leading software products?


Your major responsibilities:


You will:



  • design and develop new code and maintain existing code;

  • write and maintain unit tests and integration tests;

  • help maintain and further develop our automated continuous delivery tools;

  • be a member of one of our SCRUM development teams and participate in all regular SCRUM meetings plus our Product Backlog refinement meetings.



Your profile



  • Engineering and writing great software is your number 1 passion;

  • And of course you do so using the latest technology and sound Software Engineering concepts;

  • You feel comfortable with the full range of tasks, from architecture to testing and devops;

  • You believe that Agile is the only way to develop software;

  • You have a pro-active attitude; you are always looking for tasks to pick up and ways to help colleagues. You like to dive into new topics and work on a wide variety of subjects. You love working in a team;

  • You are a quick-starter and quick-learner, able to add value on a short notice: we need you to come up to speed very quickly because we need to rapidly accelerate our output;

  • You are efficient, structured and organized. You dislike repetitive work and are always looking for ways to work smarter and automate recurring tasks;

  • You are comfortable with speaking and writing in English;

  • You are living in Europe and if applicable you are able to relocate quickly.


You have a master degree or comparable education in a relevant subject. You have a minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in a development job.

jobs.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Hexagon is a leading global provider of integrated design, measurement and visualisation technologies. Hexagon supplies advanced measurement systems to industries worldwide, these include the building, machine and aerospace industries.


Hexagon Mining is part of the global Hexagon group. Hexagon Mining unites industry leaders MineSight, Devex Mining, Leica Geosystems Mining and SAFEmine. Together they seamlessly link mine planning, design, fleet and production management, optimization, and collision avoidance software for a comprehensive flow of data across all operations.


To strengthen our international and interdisciplinary Safety Development Team, based in Baar (Switzerland), we are looking for an enthusiastic and dedicated Embedded Systems Engineer whose main tasks are:



  • Evaluate RTOS platforms for the next generation collision warning system

  • Develop low-level drivers for integrating new sensors

  • Design and implement low-bandwidth, long-range communication protocols

  • Architecture, design and development of our next generation collision warning and avoidance solution

  • Close collaboration with Support Tools development and Server team

  • Assist the product introduction team with product validation in remote locations

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining web applications that integrate RESTful web services with distributed cloud computing.


Listed below are the skills we need to complement our existing core team, and the technologies we use in each area. The more experienced you are, the broader we would expect your skill set to be. We are, however, also prepared to accept applications from junior candidates. We are committed to our staff’s continued professional development, and expect to help you to keep your skills current with both internal and external training. It goes without saying that we want our staff to reflect the full diversity of society, though at present it is sadly skewed in some respects.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate Quality Assurance specialist to join our development  team. You will be responsible for setting up and maintaining QA processes and performing automated and manual testing in an agile development team.


The team use a range of technologies including Python, GitHub, AWS, Ansible and JIRA.


A passion for agile testing and a drive to build efficient test systems is key.


What will you be doing?


You will joining a team developers with varied skills in web development, systems development, devops and quality assurance.  The role will report to the CTO.


Your primary role will be to build a process that ensures product quality is built in at the earliest possible stage of development and ensures quality of each product release. You will also act as a mentor / coach to other team members.


Your Profile


As mid/senior engineer, we expect you to be an experienced tester, with a track record of designing, building, delivering QA systems in a multi-server environment.  It will be an advantage if you have additional experience of leading a team of test engineers.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for passionate dev ops with strong Python experience. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining and deploying web applications that integrate RESTful web services with distributed cloud computing.


The devops team use a range of technologies including Python 3.5, Ansible, Jenkins, Docker, AWS, GitHub and Jira.


A passion for new technologies and a drive to find simple and reliable ways to solve complex problems is key.


What will you be doing?


You will be the primary person responsible for Dev Ops, joining a team of developers with varied skills in web development, systems development, devops and quality assurance.


Your primary role will be to ensure the smooth deployment of releases and the maintaince of those releases in the production environment. You will contribute to architecture and technical design of our back-end and of the ecosystem as a whole and to the creation and maintenance of platform documentation.


Your Profile


As mid/senior engineer, we expect you to be an experienced coder and technical designer, with a track record of building, testing, deploying and maintaining multi-server, scalable systems.

jobs.title: Ambitious Web/ Software Developer
jobs.content: Are you an experienced .Net Software/ Web Developer who loves to work on a variety of projects with different technologies? If you have a thirst for knowledge, a passion for problem-solving and a desire to be working on a varied portfolio of projects and clients then you’ll fit in well.

jobs.content:

jobs.title: IT-Projektmanager
jobs.content:
Ihre Tätigkeiten an Bord:


Als IT-Projektmanager (m/w) bei uns definieren, steuern und vertreten Sie externe IT-Projekte. Unsere Projekte beziehen sich auf die Einführung und Erweiterung unserer Software beim Kunden. Der inhaltliche Fokus liegt auf Redaktionssystemen und PLM.


Als Bindeglied zwischen Software und Kunde managen Sie unsere IT-Projekte – beginnend mit Unterstützung bei der Akquisition, über die Erstellung von Konzepten und Kalkulationen bis zur Realisierung und Inbetriebnahme als zentraler Ansprechpartner.


Gemeinsam mit einem Projektteam haben Sie stets die Umsetzung einer optimalen Kunden­lösung im definierten Zeit- und Budgetrahmen zum Ziel. Die Projektarbeit erfolgt in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und Partnern. Die Arbeiten sind regelmäßig auch vor Ort auszuführen. Unsere Kunden sind hauptsächlich in Deutschland und Skandinavien ansässig.

jobs.title: Softwarearchitekt
jobs.content:
Ihre Tätigkeiten an Bord:


Als Softwarearchitekt (m/w) sind Sie an der Erstellung innovativer Lösungen auf Basis der PLM-Plattform Teamcenter beteiligt. Sie gestalten Kundenlösungen oder unser Standard­produkt TechPub Studio und verantworten Analyse, Spezifikation, Entwurf und Umsetzung der Softwarelösung.


Sie sind eingebunden in ein starkes Team, das sich kompetent um die Anforderungen seiner Kunden kümmert und stets die Umsetzung einer optimalen Kundenlösung anstrebt. Je nach Projekt wird das Softwaresystem durch Konfiguration, Einrichtung und Programmierung angepasst, mit anderen Systemen verbunden und kundenspezifisch erweitert.


Sie begleiten unser Projektteam bis zum erfolgreichen Echtbetrieb und realisieren auch hochkomplexe Softwareprojekte über mehrere Standorte und Landesgrenzen hinweg. Die Arbeiten sind teilweise vor Ort auszuführen. Unsere Kunden sind hauptsächlich in Deutschland und Skandinavien ansässig.

jobs.title: Tech Lead - Scala
jobs.content:
As a Tech Lead you’ll have the opportunity to build applications from the ground up, have code ownership and eventually open-source impressive contributions. We are a giant in the making, who will double in size this year.


We are looking for Tech Leads/ Senior Software Engineers who wants to push limits of product innovation using the latest advancements in functional programming; working closely with product managers, designers and other cross-functional team members.


Coders who take on the challenge of working with a sense of urgency and can rapidly iterate on product/platform features. Not forgetting a sense of humor and desire to continuously learn.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
At Auth0 we care about shipping developer joy while providing zero-friction solutions to make identity easy and secure. If you are passionate about creating amazing user experiences and crafting sustainable components, we are looking for you!


We believe quality software is best built iteratively, with end-to-end ownership of projects, focus on user needs, and right tools. At the moment, across our different projects, we use: React, Redux, Stylus, CSS Modules, Gulp, Webpack, and others, and we routinely evaluate improvements to our stack.


If you feel you want to be part of the challenge of helping developers secure their applications, we are looking for frontend engineers to join our team to work on:



  • Dashboard: Auth0’s Management UI to integrate, secure, and configure your applications

  • Lock: Auth0’s web widget to allow drop-in authentication to any web application.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with fellow team members on prioritization, specifications, and progress

  • Create secure, performant, cross-platform browser applications and widgets

  • Evaluate new technologies & techniques to improve overall practices

  • Craft well-documented, reusable, and testable code

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Role Summary:


Our multi-award winning SMS marketing platform is trusted by brands including Volkswagen, Surfers Against Sewage and Uber; and our API allows our customers to integrate SMS with Eventbrite, Zendesk and Zapier as well as many others, allowing customers to add their own integrations.


We are looking for someone who will be involved in the development of all aspects of our powerful web application, including automating the provision of our infrastructure, designing database models, building APIs and server code (primarily in PHP), as well as writing front-end HTML, CSS and JavaScript.


The role offers excellent opportunities for growth, so our ideal candidate will always be seeking to improve their knowledge and skills, and we’ll support that by sending you to conferences and providing access to relevant training.  We are a distributed agile team operating on 2-week sprints with a strong focus on testing, so the ideal candidate has great communication skills and takes ownership of code and development. 


You will report directly to FireText’s Chief Technology Officer and company directors and we are happy for you to be based at either of our offices, Reigate, Surrey or Penryn, Cornwall; remote working (UK based) may be considered for the right candidate too.


The role will involve some travel to our office locations.


If you're a graduate or an engineer with web development experience looking to further your skills, apply now!


Example Duties: 



  • Development of new features, and maintenance of existing applications

  • Work with the team to design, program, and deliver software solutions using a variety of technologies and programming languages

  • Troubleshoot and fix operational issues as they arise

  • Continuous improvement of the systems and codebase

  • Ad-hoc internal support of operations

jobs.name: the cutting edge of big data

jobs.title: Fullstack JavaScript Engineer
jobs.company: the cutting edge of big data
jobs.content:
Senior Javascript Engineer


At Qubit, the frontend team is focused on building well engineered, beautiful products with JavaScript. Our products provide an intuitive way for marketers to modify their website, understand and target user segments and measure the impact of their changes.


ARE YOU…


A team player? We are an opinionated team looking for like minded people. Are you excited by the prospect of solving complex challenges on an interesting technology stack?


Independant thinker? We like to hire engineers that thrive in a world of ambiguity. We want people that can be given hard problems and can go off and find the best technical solution.


Experimental? We are constantly experimenting with new technologies, right now some technologies that we really like are:



  • React, Flux and Redux

  • ES 2015/16

  • Git(hub)

  • Node.js

  • SuitCSS

  • Docker & Mesos

  • Make

  • Webpack

  • Mocha & Karma


Passionate about open source? Sharing is caring after all. We always contribute back to the open source community. Qubit's array of open source projects include:



  • react-test-tree: Simple and concise React component testing.

  • cherrytree: A flexible client-side router.

  • marty: A Javascript library for state management in React applications.

  • bamboo: HAProxy auto configuration and auto service discovery for Mesos Marathon.


You'll be responsible for:



  • Writing Javascript that will be run in hundreds of millions of browsers every day.

  • Building end-to-end products with Javascript (Node.js, React).

  • Understanding business problems and translating them into technical solutions.

  • Instrumenting, testing and deploying your code to production (We like to deploy multiple times a day).

  • Working closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications.

  • Working closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale our applications.

jobs.title: PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
Mobile Solutions at Bilfinger Maintenance is looking for a web developer to join our existing team. As the successful candidate you will:



  • develop web applications in small project groups with flat hierarchies and an open communication culture.

  • work on a variety of larger and smaller projects, delivering our customers the web applications they need and also want.

  • be responsible for your application as a whole.

  • contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, choice of technologies / frameworks and overall application quality.

  • get in touch with customers from time to time.

  • have a great time with a small team of ten, supporting each other in times of volatile requirements and tight schedules.

jobs.title: UNITY GAME PROGRAMMER ­ MOBILE
jobs.content:
Bee Square is expanding! We are building our programming team and we are looking for a client­side Unity Programmer for mobile platforms. The ideal candidate will have deep experience with game development with a strong computer science background.


Is this you:
Professional, passionate about games, problem solving, proactive, team worker, rigorous and detail oriented. You are smart, willing to learn more, creative and practical at the same time.


This could be you from now on:
Working with an international and high profile team.
Flexible working­time.
Free commodities (coffee, tea, juices, fresh fruit, cakes) and Sodexo meal card Play area (consoles, free coin­ops).

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer/Lead Developer growing into CTO
jobs.content:
We are looking for a CTO or Lead Engineer that is ambitious enough to spearhead new tech businesses in Asia that will help the underdogs, be better, faster and take down goliaths. You will start a tech team from scratch(you may bring your current team onboard), working on the programming efforts, setting the tech stack, coaching future tech talents, right up to designing their workstations and environment that the team will be working in, such as bringing back cubicles! (if you can get on board by 31st August).


We are a 50 odd year old family business in Singapore that specializes in air pollution control and have seen various economic cycles. We have transformed ourselves as a humble coffee machine roaster manufacturer in a small shophouse during the 1960s, to a well known and trusted environmental technology company in Asia.


Till date, most(or we dare say 90%) of the traditional coffee that Singaporeans drink are still roasted on our machines. This includes the 3 in 1 coffees. Our heritage is deep. You, as our CTO will be spearheading the transformation for the future together with the team. You will have the backing and support from the current business to enable your success.   


As our CTO, you will work together with the new generation of professionals in the family business to start new businesses in areas not limited to Fintech, Insurtech, Ai, Big Data, Analytics and IoT where the CTO and tech team will have shared equity in these new business. After completing the initial projects, the CTO and tech team can work together to propose your new businesses, which we can support or help find investors.  


Leading by example, you are able to inspire others and coach others to grow stronger and to seek continuous improvement, meeting the demands where teamwork, responsibility and integrity are maintained despite the challenges. You will be able to communicate and present effectively, internally and externally as you will be the face of our technology. 


Apart from writing high-quality, self-documenting code using test-driven development techniques, you will be required to produce budgets and expense controls for the tech department, hire and retain top tech talents who share our common purpose. 


Remuneration & benefits
The position includes a market-based salary, milestone bonus for the first year, insurance, health benefits and allowances for travel. You will have the freedom to define the dress code, work hours, select tools and systems. You will be a major influence on the team culture. 


If you need to relocate, we will provide the assistance to get the required work permit for you and advising you on good places to stay in Singapore. You will be family as time goes by. Did we say we that age is only a number? 


Questions?
Feel free to have a chat over hangout/skype/whatsapp/wechat to discuss more!

jobs.title: Senior Linux Software Engineer
jobs.content:
In order to support our continuous development on the Air Traffic market, we are looking for a degree educated engineer with aerospace, informatics, mathematics or physics degree and with Linux software development, maintenance and support experience for the preparation and configuration of Air Traffic Control related software systems on operating system level.


The position is full-time at our customer DFS in Langen, Germany.  


Responsibilities/Duties


As Linux Software Engineer you are developing components of the Linux operating system hosting the new ATC System software currently being developed at the German Air Navigation Service Provider DFS in Langen. In close contact with the customer you are discussing requirements and solutions to fit the installation and configuration needs of the new ATC System.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.content:
• Design, develop and maintain our platform

  • Dedicate yourself to build a well-tested and scalable web application

  • Planning, implementing and maintaining the API

  • Customizing the system in order to meet the business needs of the company

  • Assisting with deployment and provisioning activities

  • Support the development of our infrastructure in AWS

  • Work in a small but super talented team of developers and support from day 0 the growth of our product

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer for Omics Data Integration and Management
jobs.content:
The Berlin Institute of Health (BIH) is a joint venture of the Charite University Medicine and the Max Delbrueck Center for Molecular Medicine for interdisciplinary translational system medicine.
The BIH bioinformatics core unit is looking for a highly-motivated, detail-oriented individual. As a Senior Software Engineer for Omics Data Integration and Management, you will be responsible for designing and developing data management, integration, processing, and delivery systems for large-scale scientific data in the fields of genomics, proteomics and metabolomics. In this position, you will drive the course of innovation while creating production quality software.
Working in the BIH bioinformatics core unit gives you the opportunity to support world-class scientific facilities in their interesting projects (e.g., genetic, cancer and Alzheimer disease) and help to create patient benefit from research results.


Job duties include:



  • Collaborate with other team member, users, and stakeholders to analyze requirements and define specifications

  • Prototype, design, develop, deploy, document, and extend production-quality, fault-tolerant, high-performance software

  • Provide input on usability and testability, support selection of technologies and tools

  • Perform root-cause analysis on problems, recommend solutions and improvements

  • Provide reliable estimates for projects



Position Requirements:



  • MS degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or other related field required, at least 3 years post degree work or research experience;

  • Demonstrated ability to create high quality, readable, and documented code

  • In-depth understanding of software design, construction, testing and maintenance; experience with tools for static and dynamic program analysis is a strong plus

  • Excellent programming skills in Python and/or Java and interaction with RDBMS required; experience with Spring, Tomcat, PostgreSQL, Django is a plus

  • General understanding of web front-end programming (HTML, CSS, JS) required; exposure to frameworks/libraries like Bootstrap, jQuery a plus

  • Ability to extend and troubleshoot existing software systems required; experience in distributed teams and contribution to open source software projects is a plus

  • Experience with micro service architecture, development, and deployment is a plus

  • Ability to work independently to deliver quality, tested code

  • Team-oriented with excellent communication skills in English

  • Willingness to keep on learning



Salaries are set according to TVöD Bund Ost up to level 13. Appointments are made for an initial period of two years with possibility of extension. Please send your application to cubi@bihealth.de.


The MDC is an equal opportunity employer and supports gender equality.

jobs.title: Junior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're young (3 years of activity, average age 28 years old), but we've achieved explosive growth: the apps that we’ve invented, developed, and published have been downloaded more than 40 million times, and millions of people use them every week. If you're incredibly talented, ambitious, hard-working, and you never settle for second spot, Bending Spoons is your dream company. Join our mission: becoming the #1 app creators in the world. We promise it's going to be the ride of a lifetime.


What’s in store for you:



  • Work on big products. Every time you push your code, or come up with a new feature for one of our apps, that change will get in the hands of millions of people. Your work matters big time. [Our apps have been downloaded tens of millions of times.]

  • Work with the best and brightest. We're extremely selective and it's going to be tough for you to get in. The upside is that you'll be surrounded with the most talented and passionate people you'll ever meet. [Less than 1% of applicants make it through our selection.]

  • Work with the latest technologies and tools. Python, Objective-C (planning our transition to Swift), Node.js,  reactJS, MongoDB, and Redis are only some of the languages, frameworks, and technologies we use every day, Alfred and Slack our favorite tools. [Obsolete technologies and crappy tools are banned here.]

  • Learn and grow. Acquire a rare and sought-after blend of technical mastery and product vision. Understand what users will pay for, and how to give it to them in the fastest way possible. [Be involved in product development from day one.]


Despite our early success, there's still a long way to go to fulfil our über ambitious mission. Be an early member of a legendary team.


Learn more about Bending Spoons and apply directly on our website.

jobs.title: Experienced C++ Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

jobs.title: PHP Developer for Designsoftware
jobs.content:
We have tons of ideas of great new features of our PhotobookDesign Suite software. Do you have a few more ideas to add to the list and of course want turn these ideas into real features? Then become part of  our family of talented, international developers and designers. 


What you can expect



  • an international work environment

  • loads of fun in the team working amongst friends

  • the ability to convert your own ideas into new features of our software

  • a high degree of responsibility and autonomous working

  • exciting projects of international clients



What we offer



  • usage of newest technologies and development environments

  • your individual choice to develop on MAC OS or Windows

  • an individual startup office in the centre of Munich

  • plenty of relax and activity opportunities (fitness studio in-house) as well as teamevents

  • flexible working hours and home-office

  • attractive salary

  • muesli, softdrinks, finest coffee and more

  • relocation and visa support

jobs.title: Sales Agent - $14/hr + Commission & Bonus
jobs.content:
NationRep is currently hiring Work at Home Sales Agents. You job will be to pre-qualify customers interested in solar and/or mortgage refinancing. We are looking for CLOSERS that want to make lots of money! 

We are growing and need to fill spots as soon as possible! This is an outbound cold calling position (B2C). We need dedicated, hard-working sales agents who are go-getters!

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Dial and make outbound calls to transfer to clients 
Qualify prospects and transfer them to client 
Ensure customers meet certain criteria
Input information into CRM system
Provide excellent customer service 
Add customers to DNC list as requested
Handle escalated calls 

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Energetic, tenacious, confident, persuasive sales skills
Excellent verbal and written skills
Excellent problem solving skills
Ability to learn policy and procedures
Detail-oriented
Ability to work independently without supervision
Willing to work flexible hours
Must be able to handle rejection
High school diploma 

REQUIRED EQUIPMENT:
Working Computer
High-speed cable connected internet
Wired noise cancelling headset

BENEFITS:
-Competitive compensation (hourly base plus commission and bonuses). We pay more than most call centers! $14/hr + Commission & Bonus
-Lucrative exponential commission structure
-Additional daily bonus prizes for top producers
-$200 referral bonus for person who refers new hire
-Potential supervisory positions available for top performing agents!

Full-time shifts available for immediate start: M-F 10AM-7PM PST (Pacific Standard Time)
Add on Saturday Shift 10AM-5PM PST 

Website: www.NationRep.com ;

Please submit your resume for immediate consideration.

To apply: Send a resume to recruiting@nationrep.com
